**Volume 1 of *The Complete Canon of Daoist Doctrines and Rituals*** – *The Ritual of the Original Command of Life by Master Guangting Du*

**Morning Dao Ritual: The Original Command of Life**
The ritual proceedings commence as the altar is ascended in proper form.
The assembled lectors recite the scriptures, each paying homage to their respective teachers in accordance with the Dao.
The High Master (高功) proclaims the protective incantations of the Dao.

The Azure Yang (青阳) radiates its luminous reflection,
Illuminating the sun and returning the spirit.
The Divine Tiger repels malevolence,
The flying celestial beings scatter their bells.
It crushes deceit and extinguishes falsehoods,
Binding all demons in their forms.
The Nine Mysteries (九微) return to the Dao,
The Eight Auras (八威) subdue the vital essence (精).
The Thousand Authentic Ones (千真) verify the records,
The Three Primordials (三元) purify the heavens.

To the left, the Yellow Whistle (啸中黄) invokes,
To the right, the Six Ding (六丁) are summoned.
Seven rotations, eight harmonies,
Circulating the Heavenly Scriptures (天经).

The sacred Dao resounds majestically,
The Great Dao/Way (大道) is set in motion.
Auspicious clouds flow forth,
Converging the radiance of the Yellow Court (黄庭),
In harmony with the Dao/Way’s true essence.

The assembled lectors recite again,
Striking the ritual drum (法鼓) twenty-four times.

The High Master lights the incense burner (发炉).
We invoke the Supreme Three Heavens (三天), the Primordial Origin of the Three Qi (三炁), the Most High Dao Lord (太上道君), and the Most High Old Lord (太上老君), calling forth from within our bodies the thirty-five officials of the Three Five (三五), the left and right envoys, the left and right incense bearers, the courier dragons and mounted officers, the attendants of golden boys and silver girls who scatter words and flowers, and the thirty-six direct symbols of the Five Emperors (五帝), the thirty-six direct-day incense officials (直日香官), and all others who have emerged.

Those who have emerged are clad in solemn and resplendent attire,
Their headgear and sashes adorned with trailing plumes,
Opening the Mystic Altar (玄坛) and summoning the local deities and spirits of the domain (方域神真).

We now present our morning court,
Ascend the altar to perform the Dao Ritual,
And humbly recite our intentions—
Our sincere aspirations are recorded in the heavens,
And we pray that the Most High Ten-Directions True Dao (十方至真道) and the Primordial Qi (一炁) of the Dao,
The luminous treasure of the Venerable Dao (灵宝瑞光),
May descend and flow into our bodies,
So that our efforts may swiftly reach the Most High Dao of the Supreme Extremity (太上无极大道),
The Three Pure Ones (三清) and the Uppermost Saints (上圣),
The Heavenly Sovereign of Jade (昊天玉皇上帝),
The Grand Sovereign of the Purple Cluster (紫微北极大帝),
The Celestial Lord of the Central Dipper (斗中之尊),
The Great Sovereign of the Dipper (天皇大帝),
The Great Lord of the Dipper (斗中之主),
The Purple Cluster Great Sovereign (紫微大帝),
The Northern Dipper High Sovereign (北斗高上玉皇尊帝君),
The Celestial Lord of the Great Constellation (太微玉帝),
The Northern Dipper High Marshal (北斗太尉) of the Yang Brightness and the Greedy Star (阳明贪狼玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Supreme Steward (上宰) of the Yin Essence and the Giant Gate Star (阴精巨门玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Grand Administrator (司空) of the True Person and the Storehouse Star (禄存玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Wandering Attendant (游擎) of the Mystic Darkness and the Literary Music Star (文曲玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Lord of the Dipper (斗君) of the Red Primordial and the Chaste Star (丹元廉贞玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper High Officer (太常) of the Northern Extremity and the Military Music Star (武曲玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Heavenly Sovereign (上帝) of the Celestial Gate and the Star of the Broken Army (天关破军玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Celestial Lord (玉帝) of the Mystic Clarity and the Outer Auxiliary Star (洞明外辅玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper True Sovereign (帝真) of the Hidden Primordial and the Inner Auxiliary Star (隐元内弼玉晨君),
The Dipper’s Celestial Enforcer (天罡) of the Ten-Thousand Authentic and the Commander of the Deluge Star (奎光帝君),
The Nine Sovereigns of the Northern Dipper (北斗九皇夫人),
The Nine Yin Inner Consorts (九阴内妃),
The Three Platforms and the Five Constellations (三台华盖星君),
The Three Officials and Five Emperors (三官五帝),
The Nine Departments and Four Divisions (九府四司),
The Daoist Virtues of the Dipper (斗中道德诸君),
The Saintly Host of the Unbridled (无鞅圣众),
The Sixty Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches of the Original Command Stars (六十甲子本命星君),
The Great Daoist Master of the Mystic (玄中大法师),
The Great Daoist Masters of the Three Heavens (三天大法师),
The True Persons of the Precious (宝上真人),
The Two Immortal Envoys (二仙使者),
The Nine Palace Officials and Attendants (九宫官属),
And all true spirits (一切真灵).

We have heard that the Great Dao/Way, once divided,
The Primordial Essence (元精) began its operation,
The heavens and earth hung their symbols,
And yin and yang nurtured the spirit.

At its inception, humanity was born,
First emerging among all living beings,
The divine essence coalesced in the Supreme Extremity (太极),
The vital qi condensed in the Heavy Darkness (重玄).
All owe their nurturing to the sacred Dao,
And share in the transformation of the natural world.

We, by fortune, have been granted this life,
And now partake in the human order.
As the Three Mystic Caverns (三洞) open their light
And the Five Sacred Scriptures (五文) unfold their profundity,
We have glimpsed the Mystic Darkness (玄微) through the jade cases and phoenix tablets,
And explored the hidden depths with the phoenix scrolls and dragon chapters.

Yet, though we abide in the world and follow its customs,
As time passes, we have not yet ascended to absorb the clouds and stars of the ten directions,
Nor grasped the divine mists of the celestial valleys.

Only by performing our duties to assist the Original Command (功佐命),
Expanding the Dao and transforming the age (弘道化时),
May we fulfill the Mystic Teachings (玄科),
And hope to manifest the subtle effects (微效).
Moreover, we now present this petition in accordance with the sacred edict—
How dare we not humbly report it?

**Proclamation of the Petition**
As the words of the petition are spoken,
With sincere and earnest devotion.

Today, on the day of my birth and the Original Command of my life,
I devoutly surrender to the Dao,
And solemnly establish this Daoist hall,
To pray for blessings from the Nine Heavens (九天),
And to extend longevity to this very day.
With reverence, I light the incense and focus my thoughts on the true spirits (真灵).

I follow the ten-directional rites of the Azure Court (十华朝会之仪),
And the three-realm incense-burning format (三境焚香之格).

I pray that the Primordial Sovereign (元尊) may descend to inspect,
And that the Ten-Thousand Saints (万圣) may shine their light,
Commanding the Five Emperors (五帝) to gather at the Jade Palace (玉宫),
And summoning all true spirits (群真) to the Eight Extremes (八极).

I open the Red Primordial rank (丹秩) of the Southern Celestial Chant,
And increase blessings and longevity;
I inscribe the Azure script (青文) of the Eastern Dipper,
And flow its auspiciousness to bestow fortune upon all.

Now, in this morning Dao Ritual,
I request the ritual assembly (法众) to take this first pinch of incense and ascend.

All join in offering the incense,
Reaching the Jade Purity Palace (玉清宫),
And pervading the sacred realm of the Jade Purity (玉清圣境),
Forming the Azure Pavilion (华盖),
To venerate the Great Primordial Lord of the Dao (大罗元始尊).

I pray that this incense smoke,
Ascending directly to the heavens,
May venerate the Supreme True Daoist Treasure (无上至真道宝).

We, the disciples,
Surrender our bodies, our spirits, our lives,
And first prostrate ourselves to the ground.

We rely upon the Most High Three Sovereigns (太上三尊),
The Ten-Directions Saints (十方众圣),
And pray that with this pinch of incense’s merit,
The blessings may extend to the spirits of the ancestral temple and the state (社稷尊灵),
The sacred ancestors of the peach (宗桃先圣),
Our spirits may coalesce in the heavens above,
And the blessings descend to the mortal realm (降福人间).
May the Emperor’s longevity mountain endure forever,
The Dipper’s Extremity (辰极) align with the Azure Court (齐华),
And the sun and moon hang suspended to illuminate the ten directions,
The Primordial Harmony (元和) flow to bring peace to the four seas.

May the Empress and the Crown Prince,
Receive eternal blessings of radiant light;
May the civil and military officials,
Spread the imperial designs across the vast ages.

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the Dao’s Sovereign (道尊) and the Great Saints of the True Dao (大圣众至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the eternal heavens,
And harmonize with the Dao’s true essence.

Now, in this morning court,
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao Ritual,
We request the ritual assembly (法众) to take this second pinch of incense and ascend.

---

Now, the incense of **Universal Harmony** (眾和香),
Ascends to the **Supreme Purity Palace** (至上清宮),
Permeating all realms of the **Supreme Purity True Dao** (遍上清真境),
Forming a **Treasure Canopy** (成寶蓋),
To offer **nourishment** (供養) to the **Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord** (玉晨大道君).

May this incense smoke,
Ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer **nourishment** to the **Supreme, Most True Scripture Treasures** (無上至真經寶).

We, the subjects, surrender our **bodies** (皈身),
**spirits** (皈神),
And **lives** (皈命),
Prostrating our heads and bodies to the earth.

We humbly rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Saints** (十方眾聖),
May the **merits of this pinch of incense** (是捻香功德),
Flow back to bless the **vegetarian master** (斋主某),
With **Eight Cassias** (八桂) of equal years,
And **Five Mountains** (五山) of equal blessings.

May the **Ten Thousand Immortals** (萬仙) descend with their **auspices** (降佑),
And take the **Golden Elixir** (饵金液) to **calm our spirits** (安神);
May the **Host of Saints** (群聖) return their **radiant light** (回光),
And open the **Jade Scriptures** (開玉書) to bestow **auspicious blessings** (注祿).

The **Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors** (九玄七祖),
Ascend in glory to the **Vermilion Mound** (超景朱陵),
And the **Five Clans and Six Relatives** (五族六親),
Are inscribed upon the **Crimson Tablets** (列名丹簡).

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the **Scripture Sovereign** (經尊) and the **Great Saints of the True Dao** (大聖眾至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the **eternal heavens** (永保長存),
And harmonize with the **Dao’s true essence** (和與道合真).

---

With the incense of **Universal Harmony** (眾和香),
Ascending to the **Great Purity Palace** (至太清宮),
Permeating all **Great Purity Daoist Realms** (遍太清仙境),
Forming a **Cloud Canopy** (成雲蓋),
To offer **nourishment** to the **Five Spirits’ Mysterious Elder Lord** (五靈玄老君).

May this incense smoke,
Ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer **nourishment** to the **Supreme, Most True Master Treasures** (無上至真師寶).

We, the subjects, surrender our **bodies** (皈身),
**spirits** (皈神),
And **lives** (皈命),
Prostrating our heads and bodies to the earth.

We humbly rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Saints** (十方眾聖),
May the **merits of this pinch of incense** (是捻香功德),
Flow back to bless the **entirety of Heaven and Earth** (天地之內),
And **universally extend** (普及) to all **living beings** (群生),
With **Nine Nights of Illumination** (九夜開光),
And **Three Realms of Clarity** (三淵朗晏),
To stir the **flying and sinking** (飛沉), **moving and growing** (動植),
All may prosper and fulfill their **nature and destiny** (生成).

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the **Master Sovereign** (師尊) and the **Great Saints of the True Dao** (大聖眾至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the **eternal prosperity** (永保利亨),
And harmonize with the **Dao’s true essence** (和與道合真).

**Repentance** (忏方),
**Commanding demons** (命魔),
Three **invocations** (三啟),
Three **salutations** (三禮).

Again, we **recite the sacred ranks** (重稱法位).
The **officiating subjects** (具位臣某),
With the **assembled officials** (與臨坛官眾等),
Solemnly and sincerely **present our invocation** (上启),
To the **Three Pure Ones, Highest Saints** (三清上聖),
The **Ten Extremes of Highest Truth** (十極高真),
The **Celestial Bureau of Immortals** (斗府神仙),

Like the otter offering fish to its gods,

Like the sunflower turning to the sun,

Below, he expiates the One Hundred and Six Earthly Disasters [百六之灾].

Serenity within and without.

Enjoying the fullness of the Five Auspicious Blessings [五福],

In perfect accord with the *Yì* [《易》];

Conforming to the words of the Daoist Scriptures [仙经].

The *jiào* master, though unworthy of life’s blessing,

Like the eternal pines and cypress;
May his calamities be stilled and never arise,
Like the fragrant orchids and sweetgrass.

May music be played.」

We strictly adhere to the **Sacred Scriptures** [*宝箓*],
And solemnly invoke the **Pure Field** [*清场*].

Praying that the **Ten Days** [*十日*] may align in harmony,
And that **auspicious dew** [*嘉泽*] may descend in abundance;
So that the **Three Springs** [*三春*] may be fully nourished,
And that the fields of the people may be universally moistened.

In **summer**, dark clouds bind in **active suspension** [*活套*],
So that the **Three Crops** [*三农*] may be fully nourished,
And that the **highest plants** [*亢苗*] may be universally refreshed;
In **autumn**, dark clouds bind in **active suspension**,
So that the **Nine Harvests** [*九秋*] may be fully nourished,
And that all may rejoice in a bountiful year.

Praying for snow,
That the **Six Celestial Outpourings** [*六出*] may send the **flying snowflakes** [*飞霙*],
And that **auspicious moisture** [*嘉润*] may descend in abundance;
So that the **Three Ascents** [*三登*] may harmonize in omens,
And that we may preemptively celebrate a year of prosperity.

All beings, whether **sentient** or **insentient** [*动植*],
Are entirely indebted to the **Transformative Power** [*造化*] for their creation and sustenance.

Disasters sink into the **Nine Earths** [*九地*],
Fortunes rise from the **Ten Directions** [*十方*].

We, your subjects, with **sincere hearts** [*志心*],
Bow in **reverent homage** [*稽首*],
And offer **gratitude** [*礼谢*] to the **Supreme Celestial Treasures** [*无上虚皇至真三宝*].

**Chanting the Three Invocations** [*吟三启*],
**Declaring the True Text** [*宣真文*],
With **three rites** [*三礼*] **raised**,
And **proclaiming the Law’s rank** [*称法位*].

We, your subjects of **all ranks** [*具位*], including the **Altar Officials** [*合坛官众*] and myself,
With **unified sincerity** [*同诚*],
Respectfully submit our petitions to:
The **Supreme Great Three Pure Ones** [*大罗无上三清*],
The **Supreme Jade Emperor of the Highest Heaven** [*太上昊天玉皇*],
The **Nine Grades of Highest Virtue** [*九品高真*],
The **Ten Directions of Supreme Sages** [*十方上圣*],
All **Heavens and Earths** [*诸天诸地*],
The **True Scriptures and True Masters** [*真经真师*],
The **Perfect Celestial Symbol** [*圆穹上象*],
The **Heavenly Treasury of Spirits** [*天府列真*],
The **Earthly Abodes and Mountain Shrines** [*厚地洞宫、岳渎主宰*],
The **Emperor of the Eastern Tree** [*扶桑大帝*],
The **Divine Lord of the Bright Valley** [*旸谷神君*],
The **Dragon King of the Abyssal Depths** [*洞渊龙王*],
The **Water Emperor of the Nine Rivers** [*九江水帝*],
The **Twelve River Sources** [*十二河源*],
Those who **stir clouds and bring rain**, **Thunderers and Wind Lords** [*兴云致雨、雷电风伯*],
The **spirits of all temples** [*诸庙神祇*],
The **City Deities and Community Lords** [*城隍社令*],
The **Three Realms** in response,
All **True Spirits**.

We have heard that:
The **Round Celestial** [*圆清*] dwells in **Purity** [*宅粹*],
And the **Square Earthly** [*方厚*] stores **Essence** [*储精*];
All are governed by the **spirits**,
And the **Transformative Power** holds the **total authority** [*总权衡*].

Though there may be **auspicious or inauspicious** [*吉凶*] **categories** [*有类*],
Fortunes and calamities are **never partial** [*无私*].

Thus, the **Divine Mandates** [*冲科*] preserve the **rites of petition** [*请祷之文*],
And the **True Teachings** [*真教*] elucidate the **patterns of expiation** [*襘禳之范*],
Attaining **sincerity** in worship,
And **responsive harmony** in sensation.

Now, for the present realm,
We humbly submit that **sweet rains and auspicious snow** have failed to arrive on time,
And that the **Sun Prince’s** excess is a **precious concern** [*珍*],
Not to be lightly dismissed.
With **fasting devotion** [*斋庄*] fully observed,
We look upward to the **Highest Virtue**,
And downward to the **Red Scriptures** [*丹款*].

Humbly praying,
That the **prolonged darkness** [*重阴*] may follow its proper course,
And that **abundant dews** [*霈泽*] may arrive in due season,
So that the **crops and grains** may flourish and be plentiful,
And that the **people and soldiers** may attain **prosperity and ease** [*康乐*].

We, your subjects, have long followed the **Master’s instructions** [*师训*],
And early donned the **True Talismans** [*真符*].
All incense petitions are logically beyond reproach,
Yet, when we receive the **Divine Edicts** [*词旨*],
How dare we not report them,
And solemnly present our **Altar words and vows** [*启坛词诚*] **for proclamation** [*宣奏*]?

**Proclaiming the Petition** [*宣词*].

As per the **Divine Edicts**,
With **utmost devotion** fully observed,
We now **propagate the Transformation** [*宣化*] to **follow the currents** [*承流*],
Thus **lengthening the lives** of the people and **aiding the world** [*长民辅世*].

Should any **single thing** lose its **proper place** [*有失其所*],
Then how could our **great fears** [*大惧*] find rest?
We fear that **punishments may be unjust**,
And that the people may rise in **grievance and lamentation** [*怨嗟*].

Or should the **Four Cardinal Directions** [*抚宇*] be disordered,
And **affairs** become **troubled and chaotic** [*乖方*],
With **accumulated guilt and regret** [*烦扰积悔*],
The longer this persists,
The more the **proper sequence of time** [*时序*] may be delayed.

Thus, we purify the **Sacred Field** [*灵场*] with incense,
And **reverently consult** the **Sacred Texts** [*稽参宝典*],
With **pious introspection** [*虔省躬*],
And **humble self-blame** [*引咎*],
Praying that **fortunes** may be turned and **blessings** bestowed upon the people.

We look upward to the **Highest Virtue of the Three Realms** [*三境高真*],
And the **Supreme Sages of the Nine Heavens** [*九天上圣*],
Begging forgiveness for our past actions,
And permission to **renew ourselves** [*自新*],
Adjusting and rectifying **Yin** and **Yang**,
Balancing the **celestial decrees** [*律令*]—
So that the **good fields** [*良畴*] may be nourished,
And that the **many crops** may grow in harmony,
That the **prefectures and counties** may be secure,
And that the **people and soldiers** may attain **prosperity and ease**.

We, your subjects, **reverently follow** the **fasting laws** [*斋法*],
And **diligently report** our petitions at every opportunity.
Hoping that our **sincere intentions** may be **responsively harmonized**,
And that the **auspicious blessings** [*庬休*] may swiftly arrive,
That our **shadows** may follow and **echoes** may respond,
And that our **wishes** may be fulfilled and **rites completed**.

At **dawn’s first light** [*明旦*],
With **pious sincerity** [*虔诚*] and **lawful conduct** [*依法行道*],
We continue to report our petitions.

**Issuing our Vows** [*发愿*].

**Raising the rites** [*举*],
And **concentrating our spirits** [*存神*] while burning incense.
The **Highest Functionary** [*高功*] restores the **incense brazier**.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers** [*香官使者*],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Officials** [*左右龙虎君*],
And the **attendant spirits of incense** [*侍香诸灵官*],
Shall now command that,
Wherever we have previously **invoked the altar** and **performed the rites** [*启坛行科*],
There will naturally arise **golden elixir and azure jade** [*金液丹碧*],
**Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** [*芝英百灵*],
And **all spirits** will gather in assembly,
At this **incense brazier** before us.

Now, we pray that the **Ten Directions’ celestial youths and jade maidens** [*十方仙童玉女*],
May **attend** the **fragrant vapors** [*兰烟*],
And **transmit** our **previously offered sincerity** [*所启之诚*],
Swiftly reaching the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless** [*至真无极大道*] **and the Highest Heaven’s Golden Gates, Jade Emperor** [*昊天至尊金阙玉皇上帝御前*].

The radiance of the sun and moon shines forth on all sides,
The thunderous roar of winds and peals resounds with solemn awe.
In harmony with the four seasons, the symbols of change are aligned,
And the hundred virtues descend, bestowing blessings and auspicious signs.

Only through virtue does one draw near,
And sincerity alone is the path to grace.

Now, certain officials humbly submit:
For the disorder of yin and yang, for winds and rains,
For rain and snow that fail in their proper times,
Lest they harm the fields and bring sorrow to the people,
We reflect upon our own lack of virtue and fear the calamities
That may befall those who disregard the sacred.

Thus, we dare to offer earnest prayers and devout supplications,
Hoping for favorable responses and to receive the boundless blessings of the Dao.
We request the assembly of all present to join in this initial offering of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend high into the heavens,
To honor the Ten Directions’ Supreme Dao/Way Treasure, the Celestial Sovereign.

With reverence, we dedicate our bodies, our spirits, and our lives,
Prostrating ourselves to the earth,
That through this incense offering’s merit,
We may bless the current Emperor, the august Sovereign.

Humbly we pray:
May the celestial favor be everlasting,
And the sacred calendar flourish in prosperity.
May the foundation of His rule endure for ten thousand years,
And His noble lineage thrive through a hundred generations.
May the five winds and ten rains never fail,
Bringing perfect harmony to all.
May the four quarters and myriad lands together receive
The enlightening transformation of His grace.

Now, we offer incense again,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Dao/Way Treasure,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

With this incense offering’s merit,
We pray for the protection and tranquility of the prefectural magistrate
And extend it to all his subordinates.

Humbly we pray:
May the wondrous Dao/Way solidify in its blessings,
And the most exalted deities aid in virtue.
May gentle winds stretch far and wide,
And the banners of the celestial realm rest in solemn order—
A sign of the utmost benevolence.
May sweet rains fall in due season,
And every hundred miles resound with praise of the harmonizing Dao,
As though the music of the *qing* [1] were heard.

May officials be united in harmony,
And the people’s afflictions all be lifted—
No disasters from yin and yang’s disorder,
And abundant harvests for the farmer’s hopeful prayers.

Now, we offer incense once more,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Celestial Sage,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

With this incense offering’s merit,
We pray for the protection and blessings of these people,
And extend them to all within our borders.

Humbly we pray:
May the imperial radiance descend like a torch,
And the Dao’s yin [2] embrace all with its grace.
May all within the realm bow in obedience,
And the three calamities [3] be extirpated from every village.
May the rains and snows be ever timely,
And the seals of the land suffer no injury from drought or flood.
May the grains abound in harvest,
And every household rejoice with the blessings of filled granaries.

Now, we offer incense once more,
And humbly rely upon the Supreme Virtue of the Celestial Sage,
The Great Sage of All-Pervading Truth.
After attaining the Dao, may we preserve the heavens’ eternal existence,
And align ourselves with the Dao’s true essence.

We chant the directions,
We repent the directions,
We command the demons.

We raise our voices in supplication for rain.
The Dao unites with the primal *qi*,
And yin and yang nurture all beings.
The people below have committed many transgressions.
The Supreme Dao bestows the decree of punishment.
With earnest hearts and diligent morning repentance,
We sincerely regret our sins and seek forgiveness in the unseen.

May it be granted to shower rain and snow,
And to moisten all that is without feeling.

We bow three times.
We again solemnly proclaim the sacred titles.

The undersigned officials, along with the assembled congregation,
With sincere hearts, jointly petition:
The Supreme Great Three Celestial Deities of the Great Dao,
The Most High Heavenly Jade Emperor, the Celestial Sovereign,
The Nine Grades of High Perfection,
The Ten Directions’ Supreme Sages,
All Celestial Deities and Celestial Lords,
The True Scriptures and True Masters,
The Round Dome’s lofty symbols,
The arrayed constellations and stars,
The boundless earth and cavernous palaces,
The sovereigns of mountains and marshes,
The Water Realm’s deep abysses,
The summoners of clouds and bestowers of rain,
The City Deities and all mighty spirits.

We hear that the Round Dome’s mysteries are profound and silent,
And the divine transformations hidden in speechless grace.
The Great Dao is vast and unfathomable,
And its primal functions operate beyond mortal control.

The shifting of yin and yang in contraction and expansion,
The subtle movements of heaven and earth—
When pestilential *qi* invades according to season,
Then drought arises without fail.

There are no reverent rites to uphold,
Nor sincere petitions to extend.
Yet with utmost sincerity, the celestial grace descends in splendor,
And with profound devotion, the divine responds in mercy.

Now, we—your humble servants—
Humbly confess our long neglect of sweet rains,
Lest fertile fields be harmed,
Lest the year’s harvest be imperiled.
No auspicious dew has fallen,
And we, bound by duty to this land and its people,
Have vainly sought relief in prayer,
Ever trembling in fear and self-reproach.

Perhaps there are officials who fail to heed imperial decrees,
Or judges who err in meting out justice—
These accumulated transgressions
Have brought no peace.

Thus, we purify the jade altar,
Adorn it with sacred offerings,
And humbly bow in repentance,
Hoping to turn misfortune into blessing.

We pray to the lofty immortals of the jade palace,
To the supreme sages of the celestial capital,
To the true sovereigns of the ten directions,
To the mighty spirits of the three realms—
May they awaken their divine hearts,
Extend their mercy below,
Drive away the dark void of the abyss,
And command the cloud-bearers to harness the wind.

Let abundant sweet dew descend,
Let misty nourishment permeate the land.
Let heavenly rain pour forth,
Let blessed moisture drench the earth.
Across the vast thousand-li expanse,
May hidden plagues be dispelled;
Through every field of the ten thousand homes,
May all reap the hope of bountiful harvest.

Above, we honor the Heavenly Venerable’s boundless compassion,
Below, we align with our servants’ earnest supplications—
Thus, we humbly present this petition.

*(The ritual is now complete.)*
Twelve wishes are fulfilled.
The high priest restores the incense burner.
The incense officers and messengers,
The Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
And the attendant spirit officials—
At the place where we formerly ascended the altar at dawn to practice the Dao,
Gold-liquid elixir and jade-green herbs shall spontaneously arise,
With mushrooms and hundred-spirits’ blessings,
As the assembled immortals gather before this incense burner.

May the celestial boys and girls of the ten directions
Attend to the fragrant mists,
And swiftly convey our humble petitions
Directly to the Supreme Dao of the Boundless Primordial,
To the Three Pure Ones of Highest Holiness,
To the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Court.

*(The ritual bell is struck, and the hymn is chanted.)*
Exit the hall, and lead to the Six-Curtain Pavilion.

The Dao is indeed the primordial ancestor of the Great Unity—who can fathom its divine mystery?
Humans dwell within the dual forces of yin and yang, yet alone possess the refined essence.

Though the Nine Schools differ in doctrine, all partake of the harmonious Five Phases.

This humble ritual official, entrusted with the keys of mystical power,

and drifts through this transient world, vainly consuming years in vain.

Now, I wish to respond to the call of the enlightened age,
to repay the sincerity of past days.
Yet I fear my karmic obstacles are profound, my blessings meager—
reverently offering pure and solemn rites,
earnestly opening the altar of purification,
relying on the wondrous patterns to present my sincerity,
through incense and smoke, to convey my earnestness.

I humbly pray that the Nine Celestial Worthies look down with favor,
that the assembled saints radiate their light,
that they take pity with boundless compassion,
and open the path of great forgiveness.

As for this ritual official, from countless past lives,
down to this present incarnation,
unaware of the True Way, ignorant of scriptures and precepts,
indulging in licentious desires, abandoning righteousness for wrong,
with accumulated sins too numerous to count—
my ancestors are already condemned, my descendants suffer calamity.

Now, having entered the gate of repentance,
I seek the path of renewal.
May those not yet pardoned be pardoned,
those not yet absolved be absolved—

heeding my sincere desire to return to the Way,
transforming my fate of decline into one of joy,
fulfilling my lifelong aspiration for the crimson cassia’s high rank;
may I, like the aged yellow crane, share in the prosperity of this flourishing age.

May blessings be evenly bestowed upon all beings,
may the radiance of grace extend to the eight extremes—
above, illuminating the Heavenly Sovereign’s boundless mercy,
below, fulfilling the devotion of these humble servants.

With deepest reverence, I present this petition.

We humbly revere the Sovereign of Seven Bends, the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,
Who penetrates the subtleties of the Dao, delving deep into the Sacred Realm.
For seven score and three generations as a Confucian sage,
Spanning countless centuries through the ages of Han and Cloud,
Illuminating the brilliance of words and deeds,
Standing resolute as frost and thunder—
Slicing through demons in an instant,
Shaking the winds and thunder with but a breath.
His benevolence flows like rivers, his grace permeates all;
He rescues the Shù people from the jaws of wolves,
Restoring the Black Thread’s land to the domain of longevity.
Yet the ignorant remain blind, the foolish unaware.

Though the Shù Mountains were carved and stones inscribed,
Their virtue cannot be fully recorded;
Though the Mín River’s waters were drained to ink the deeds,
Their glory cannot be fully written.

How could the Most True, in responding to the common,
Appear as but a fleeting dream of half a night,
Or fulfill a single plea in the blink of an eye?

This is called the Dao’s exalted height—never abandoning humanity,
And virtue’s grandeur—yet claiming no ownership of it.

Uniting essence and function in perfect accord.

We revere the Sovereign of Seven Bends, the Master of Offerings and True Virtue,
Who walks with Heaven as his companion,
Holds the ancient Dao,
And receives the Mandate from the Most High,
Commanding the vast principles of the lower realm.

It reveals the Great Compassion’s courage;
When the rain-soaked paths burn with fire,
It shows the attainment of One’s radiant spirit.

Now, we in awe of your virtue and might,

Displaying the boundless wonders of your workings;
May all desires be fulfilled,
Aligning with Heaven’s heart to bestow blessings.

No age exists without relying on worthy talent,
No talent thrives without the age’s support—
Thus, the principle of mutual benefit dictates

Spreading joy among all beings,

Only the august Sovereigns of the Three Realms and the ranked Saints of the Ten Directions are vast beyond the rivers and seas, lofty beyond the mountains and peaks—yet their blessings endure through the unbroken lineage of their descendants, and their virtue is revered by all virtuous folk.

The **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name] of modest virtue, though unaware of his own merit, has accumulated good deeds that now shine forth. At the outset, he sought the harmony of his descendants; at the end, he prayed that this son might be forever preserved. Together, they align their forms with the Nine Qi and share their fate with the Three Primordials. The **Born Gods** respond in reverence as they do in song, and the **Minister of Fate** obeys with respect as he does with deference. They examine the month of birth and expand the functions of life, harmonizing the Six Qi at the Great Balance and opening the Eight Desolations into the Domain of Longevity. Thus may they attain enduring blessings and maintain a solemn, reverent heart.

In accordance with the Daoist rites, I now invoke the True Vehicles, praying for the prosperity of my descendants from the Sacred Axis and offering sincere devotion to the Jade Void. As the first wishes are uttered and the grand rites commence, I give thanks to Heaven and Earth for their creative grace and pray for the longevity and prosperity of my descendants. The humble servants, with utmost reverence, prostrate themselves twice and present incense. Pure tea is offered in tribute. Flowers are scattered.

With sincere hearts, we now address the **Natural Three Pure Ones of the Void**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, and the ranked Saints of the Three Realms and Ten Directions.

The humble servant hears that the **Work of Transformation** secretly moves within the floating, dreamlike realms of the **Dharma Realm**, while the **Great Dao** remains hidden yet reveals its virtue of nurturing life. It divides the Three Talents to establish order and distributes the Nine Qi to form all things. All people under heaven are born through the nurturing of their parents, yet their essence connects to the **Jade Purity**, and their spirits are transformed by the **Primordial Origin** as it sows its essence and moves its spirit, universally delivering all beings.

Thus, reflecting inward, one finds that one’s fate is decreed by Heaven. Since the **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], took his wife, no child has been born. Fearful of failing to uphold the ancestral rites and grieving that the line of sacrifice may not continue, he now humbly appeals to the High Saints, guiding and welcoming their blessings. With sincere devotion, he follows the ritual precepts and invokes the sacred altar.

Now, as incense is burned, I turn my body, my spirit, and my fate toward the **Boundless Dao of the Ten Directions**, wishing to dedicate these merits to all beings, seen and unseen. May the Three Realms shine their light, and all spirits guard and protect. May they perceive this sincere red heart and illuminate it, and may the winds of the **Celestial Chariot** descend to attend. May my petition be inscribed in the Imperial heart, and may my descendants flourish eternally. The divine response shall be conveyed to the **Supreme True Boundless Dao** on high.

**Chanting the Square**, **Repentance**, **Three Invocations**, **Three Offerings**. The **True Scriptures** are proclaimed. The **Law Positions** are solemnly repeated. The humble servants, [Name] and the assembled officials of the altar, with sincere hearts, now address:

The **Supreme Boundless Dao**, the **Sovereigns of the Three Realms**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, the **Great Sovereign Emperor of the Hook-and-Line**, the **Great Sovereign Emperor of the Purple Forbidden Enclosure and Northern Pole**, the **Earthly Sovereign Empress Who Follows Heaven’s Law**, the **Nine Sovereign Emperors of the Divine Constellations**, the **Celestial Sovereign Emperors**, the **Celestial Sovereign Emperors of All Realms**, and all **True Spirits** who respond to invocation.

The humble servant hears that in the **Primordial Ancestral Eon**, the **Origin** gave birth to all heavens; when the **Two Complements** emerged from the womb, the vast oceans and lands were established. The seven orifices were carved from **Chaos**, and the five sacred marks were planted by the **Divine**. When the winds return, they fan the **Azure Palace** with empty song; when the mists gather, they pierce the **Purple Void** with lush brilliance. Distinguishing life and classifying beings, they open the way for all things and fulfill their functions; observing footsteps and omens, they reveal the lessons of blessing the virtuous and punishing the licentious. All transformations of things dare not ignore this heartfelt devotion.

The **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], has cultivated the cause of countless eons and the Daoic nourishment of the Three Primordials. Reflecting on the aged without children—called "lonely"—he laments the plight of the common folk, yet knows that Heaven’s greatest virtue is to give life. Thus, he follows the ancient teachings and devotes himself to incense and offerings, humbly beseeching mercy.

Though unworthy, the humble servants have been entrusted with this ritual office and now reverently perform the **Taoist Rites**. To preserve the living and restore the extinct is to rely upon Heaven’s might; to benefit all beings and nurture life is to spread the Dao’s transformations. With sincere hearts, we dare not fail to report this, and with true devotion, we now proclaim our petition.

The words are examined in detail, and the utmost sincerity is revealed. We humbly pray for Heaven’s attentive ear and its gracious, far-reaching blessings. We consider the officials of the Nine Heavens and the ministers of the Three Realms—those who record crimes and deeds, who always present their petitions in order. Both seen and unseen shall rely upon this, with nothing great or small omitted.

Now, the **Taoist Official of the Ritual Hall**, [Name], has purified his spirit and devoutly observed the fasts, modeling himself after Heaven and Earth. He has erected the star altar, offered water and flowers, and taken refuge in the Dao’s treasures. He recites the **Sacred Chapters** at noon and in the pure night, presenting cloud-inscriptions to the heavens. The **Upper Saints** descend, and our highest wishes are extended. Incense is burned to demonstrate sincerity, spread throughout the Ten Directions; lamps are lit to continue their glow, illuminating the Nine Nights.

In accordance with the fast’s precepts, we now host the invocation and report it to the **Supreme Three Honored Ones**, the **Ten-Directional Saints**, the **Great True Master of the Mysterious**, the **Supervising Master of the Fast**, the **Most Sacred Treasures of the Lingbao**, and the officials of the Three Realms. May they descend to inspect and review what has been presented.

We pray that the **Attendant Spirits of the Scripture**, the **Supervising Officials of the Ministry of Punishments**, and the **True Officials of the Lands and Districts** may cooperate in heart and strength, encircling and guarding, sweeping away external forces, purifying the altar, subduing demons and spirits, and annihilating malevolent influences. Thus may we attain peace of mind and stillness of spirit, with divine responses clearly communicated. When the rites are complete, we shall continue to report, and the fast shall be fulfilled without obstruction.

On the following morning, the Dao will be enacted, and further reports shall be made. This is now declared.

**The Twelve Vows** are recited. The incense burner is relit. The **Incense Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Dragon and Tiger Lords**, and the **Attending Spirits of the Incense** shall now cause the place where the humble servant has invoked the Dao to naturally produce **golden elixir and jade-green herbs**, **hundreds of sacred plants**, and the gathering of all True Ones before this incense burner.

The **Twelve Vows** are fulfilled. The incense burner is reignited.

The **Incense Officials and Messengers**, the **Left and Right Dragon and Tiger Lords**, and the **Attending Spirits of the Incense** shall now cause the place where the humble servant has invoked the Dao to naturally produce **golden elixir and jade-green herbs**, **hundreds of sacred plants**, and the gathering of all True Ones before this incense burner.

Though it may be recorded without seeing its form,
And though its name be unknown, it is called **Dao**.

Thus, the **Yang** abides in **Great Xia**,
Nurturing and fostering all things as its duty.
The **Heavenly Ancestor** encompasses all beings,
And embraces and covers all without distinction.

All things, great and small, are entirely entrusted to its cultivation.
Without words, it is understood;
The four seasons proceed, and all things are born.
No malevolent *qi* can prevail—
The five grains ripen, and the myriad people flourish.
The **transformative work** depends upon it,
And blessings are bestowed in due measure.

The **Temple Official** [Name], having long cultivated virtuous roots,
Has now heard the **True Dao**.
Reflecting upon himself and acknowledging faults,
How dare he not reverently fear the **Celestial Above**,
And observe the precepts while fasting in devotion,
Hoping to appease the **Childless**,
That I, the humble servant, may present this plea,
And seek the **Sage’s return and reliance**,
With sincere words at dawn,
Dutifully declaring my intent.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As stated in the petition, the sincerity is profound and earnest.
With reverence, I await the **Celestial’s gracious hearing**,
And humbly beg for **merciful indulgence**.
I pray for the **greatest of blessings**,
That my **long-lasting prayers** may be granted.

I have heard that the *Yijing* speaks of the **Great Ultimate**,
From which the **Two Principles** arise.
Great is the **Primordial of Heaven**,
The origin of all things.
All who dwell beneath Heaven and tread upon Earth
Naturally balance **Yin and Yang**.
Those who receive the **Great Dao** attain a nature of **Purity and Harmony**;
Those who receive but little manifest as **soaring and crawling creatures**.
Thus, no thing fails to be nourished by **dew and rain**,
And all sentient beings emerge from **molding and refining**.

All who rely upon this **transformative birth**—
How dare we forget to return and align with it?
Though the **sunflower’s heart** be distant,
Its sincerity still turns toward the **Sun**;
Though the **otter’s sacrifice** be humble,
It still performs rites to **Heaven**.
How much more so for those in **humanity’s path**,
Residing in this **transitional age**—
With offerings and prayers,
We must be **precise and singular** in devotion.

The **Temple Official** [Name], in fasting and ceremonial attire,
Choosing this auspicious day,
Reverently obeys the **Celestial Above**,
And solemnly serves the **Most High Emperor**.
Hoping the **hundred spirits** will come to witness,
I pray that **one prayer may yield a son**,
Fulfilling my supplication,
And glorifying the **transformative power**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **first incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Dao Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To bless the **Current Emperor of China**.
May he and his **descendants for a hundred generations** live **ten thousand years**,
With **royal lineage secure** and **Heaven’s decree fulfilled**.
Following **Jiang Yuan’s** footsteps in **military virtue**,
Nurturing the people as **Di Xin** did;
Exceeding **Di Jian’s** prayers to Heaven,
And receiving the **auspicious phoenix**.
Enhancing the **prosperity of the ancestral halls**,
And fulfilling the **blessings of longevity**,
May this grace extend to the **Temple Official**,
And flow to his **future descendants**.

Thus, the **ancestral halls** shall flourish like **sage and bamboo**;
**Sincerity in harmony with Heaven** shall bring **auspicious cranes and harmonious offspring**.
Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Dao’s Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve Heaven’s eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **second incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Scriptural Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To the **Spirits of the State and Ancestral Temples, the Revered and Sacred Forefathers**.

May the **clan and ancestral halls** be **cared for with compassion**,
And the **ancestral temples** maintained in **solemn reverence**.
Though the **ancestors above** may be distant,
Their blessings extend as **nine autumns of longevity**;
The **glory of the lineage** shall align with **Heaven’s decree**,
And **match the Emperor’s virtue without partiality**.
Descending to the **Temple Official**,
May **ancestral grace** be bestowed upon his **forebears**,
And may he **joyfully ascend to the Imperial Abode**,
His praises **resounding in the Celestial Court**;
His **sorrowful incense** shall **shine in the divine *qi***,
And his **humble offerings** shall **bring blessings to the living**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Scriptural Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **third incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Master Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To **all distant and near, encompassing the dim and the luminous**.

May the **three luminaries** move in **harmonious order**,
And the **four seas** unite in **civilization**;
May **floods and droughts** be forever **dissipated**,
And **wars and punishments** **cease**.
Let there be **five days of wind and ten days of rain**,
Without fear of **broken branches or shattered earth**;
Let there be **ten thousand granaries and ten thousand chests**,
With **ease in tilling and reaping**.
May **one household’s blessings** extend to **all under Heaven**,
And all **share in the happiness of Hua Xu**,
Ascending to the **Mystic and Wondrous**.

Even the **calf of the plow-ox** shall bear **fine horns and multiply**;
The **old clam** shall **radiate brilliance**, its **pearls fully formed**.
Grace shall be **equally bestowed upon all living things**,
Each fulfilling its **natural destiny**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Master Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **permanently prosper and flourish**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

**Chant the Square**, **Confess the Square**, **Three Invocations**, **Three Rites**.
Reaffirm the **Law’s station**.
The **officiating servants** [Names],
With **sincere hearts**, now **humbly present our petition** to:
The **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I have heard that when **disaster strikes**, one should **fear and reflect**,
And **great virtue** shall **descend in guidance**.
Seeing **goodness**, one must **follow its path**,
As the **Teachings of Righteousness** instruct.
**Heaven is supreme**—
**Repentance must come first**.
When **sacrificial rains return** and **winds reverse**,
**Bright Virtue** is **manifested**.
When **Mars retreats**,
It **aligns with virtuous speech**.
Though it may lack **sound or scent to trace**,
Its response is **as certain as the echo of a hollow vessel**.

「Then how much more so for wicked men who fast and bathe in purification,
Yet still may **manifest reverence** before the **Supreme Emperor**;
For the **Noble Ones** who fear and reflect in **self-cultivation**,
May also **preside over sacrifices** as the eldest sons.

Not only do they transform calamity into auspicious fortune,
But they turn hearts back toward the **Dao/Way**.
This **Dao/Way** is the **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I, **a Daoist Official**, humbly reflect:
Since my **past lives** until this present birth,
My **mind-monkeys** have galloped wild,
My **heart-demons** have raged unrestrained,
Shaming **Heaven and Earth**,
Defaming **sages and teachers**,
Disobeying my **two parents**,
Severing ties with my **nine clans**.
I have **forgotten filial piety**, neglected rites—
Sometimes **not venerating** my **ancestors**;
Or **abandoning children**, **destroying fetuses**,
Long ago **inflicting harm** upon my own **kin**.

With **treacherous deceit**, I **offend superiors**,
Conceal the **virtuous**, harm the **able**,
Gleefully **corrupt** without restraint,
**Hoarding grain** while ignoring the people’s suffering.
If **profit** lies at the **tip of a needle**,
I **privately covet** **honor and wealth** in **land monopolies**;
I **rejoice in disaster**, **delight in others’ ruin**,
**Arbitrarily severing** the **sacrifices of rival sects**;
**Exploiting orphans**, **ravaging graves**,
**Cunningly expanding** my own **fields and gardens**.

I **lack compassion**—
My deeds are those of the **tyrant and oppressor**.

Or I **burn mountains**, **exhaust marshes**,
**Boil silkworms**, **overturn nests**,
**Wrongfully harming** **all living beings**,
Yet **unfulfilled** my **past karmic debts**,
**Bringing ruin upon myself**,
And thus **offending the Divine**.

Or as a **subject**, I **fail in loyalty**,
**Condemning men to death** under false pretenses.
I **exhaust the people**, **disturb the masses**,
Becoming the **chief of calamity** in an age;
I **hold office without merit**, **feasting idly**,
**Wasting Heaven’s work** among the **hundred officials**.
I **fell the sacred cows** of **Mount Niu**,
**Piercing the vast net** of **Heaven’s justice**.

All my actions—
**None know their limits**,
And if one **engages in such deeds**,
**None shall escape ruin**,
Leading to **licentious partners** in my home,
And **extinction of my lineage**,
**Lacking virtue and greatness**,
My **clan shall fall**.

These are the **precepts of the sages**,
And **Heaven’s will** is **dreadful indeed**.
Thus, I **preserve sincerity**, **purify myself**,
**Rectify my past**, **cultivate my future**,
With **vigilant devotion** all day long,
And **trepidation** in my smallest thoughts,
**Confessing my karmic sins**,
And **humbly beseeching mercy**.

I pray that the **vast and august Heaven**,
The **magnificent Sovereign Emperor**,
May **unleash the great virtue of life-giving**,
And **bestow boundless compassion**,
So that **all may renew their hearts**,
And **this humble clan** alone **may be spared**,
Its **lineage preserved**, its **rites upheld**.
**Nurturing and sustaining life**,
May we **raise noble offspring** like **lan and jade** in the courtyard;
**To inherit and continue**,
May we **learn the arts** of **archery and metallurgy**,
Like **Ji and You**—
So that the **Eight Dragons of the Xun Clan** may **not shame**,
Nor the **Three Phoenixes of Hedong** **be dishonored**,
And may we **receive Heaven’s favor**,
**Emulate the virtuous descendants** of the **Empress**.

My **earnest prayers** are **offered day and night**,
And **prolific blessings** depend **on moral cultivation**.
The **lonely one in Zhao** became a **feudal lord for ten generations**,
And the **meritorious in Liang** was a **prime minister for eight**;
Some **advised their rulers** and **earned descendants** like **Zang and Sun**,
Others **accumulated hidden virtue** and **were trusted** like **the Bing Clan**.

Though **publicly renowned** like **Zhang Tang and Yang Shen**,
Even if **one or two** were counted,
Though **a thousand or ten thousand** were named,
**None would be exhaustive**—
These are the **hundred auspicious signs** of **doing good**,
And **Heaven’s aid** comes **from a single virtue**.

If **one perseveres in difficulty** afterward,
**Dragged by past deeds**,
Yet **reviews ancient precedents**,
**Heaven’s warnings** remain clear.

The **Han Marquis** who **broke the law**—
His **clan perished** in **four or five generations**, leaving **no survivors**.
**Yu Xu** who **harbored many grudges**—
His **lineage died out** in **twenty years**, **not passing a single mouth**.

Some **schemed treacherously** and **overthrew their rulers**,
Others **plotted to destroy** the **Three Dynasties** and **ruin their clans**.
Even if **one receives the jade seal** and **falls into disgrace**,
**Evil retribution** shall **still be incurred**;
If **one marries first** and **buries their parents last**,
**How can auspicious fortune** be **guaranteed**?

Yet **Heaven’s condemnation** is **plainly evident**,
Even if **other virtues** exist, **none can redeem** it.
If **one sees their faults** and **reflects inwardly**,
They shall **return to righteousness**—
**No greater joy** than this.

I, **a humble petitioner**, dare **not defy Heaven’s might**,
But **submit to the creative transformation**,
And **pledge from this day forward**,
Until **future lives**,
To **rectify my errors** and **renew my heart**,
And thus **invite auspicious fortune** and **gather blessings**.

**Life and its beginnings** rely **on the interplay of Heaven and Earth**,
**Form and completion** owe **their debt to Heaven and Earth**.
**Early signs of good fortune** descend,
**To comfort all beneath**,
And **to reveal Heaven’s great mercy**,
While **below**, my **sincere submission** is **fulfilled**—
Thus, I **humbly present** this **petition**.

**Twelve Vows** are **restored**.
The **Incense Official and Messengers**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals**,
And the **Attendant Spirits of Incense**,
Shall **command** that at my **former sites of Daoist practice**,
**Golden elixir and emerald dew**,

Repaying the **radiant virtue of the Fire Deity** [报离明之盛德],
Inviting **Daoist companions** [道侣] to gather,
Strictly adhering to the **auspicious timing** [冲科],
Formally establishing the **ritual altar** [坛场],
And earnestly summoning the **celestial winds and chariots** [飙驭].

**Humbly praying** [伏愿],
That the **Imperial Chariot** [帝车] **arrives swiftly** [接轸],
From the **Tiger Pass and the Celestial Gates** [虎关阊阖];
That the **Star Chariot** [星驭] **moves in harmony** [交骖],
Descending from the **Lion’s Tail and the Hooked Array** [豹尾勾陈].

The **sacrificial wine** [涧苹] is offered,
And the **libations** [浻酌] are made in solemnity [有严].

With **deepest reverence and longing** [无任瞻望激切屏营之至],
I twice bow and gaze toward the clouds,
To **reverently welcome the Celestial Procession** [奉迎仙驾].

**Descending the Sage** [降圣],
**Offering tea** [献茶],
First **presenting** [初献], then **scattering flowers** [散花].

I now **solemnly and sincerely** [谨虔诚] **report to** [上启],
The **Supreme Three Pure Ones** [太上三清],
The **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault** [玉帝],
The **Jade Sovereign of the Supreme Heaven** [昊天玉皇],
And the **Three Realms’ responsive spirits** [三界应感],
All **true and genuine essences** [一切真灵].

I have heard that the **Great Sun** [太阳] **divides its light** [分景],
This is the **Star of Yinghuò** [荧惑之星];
The **Virtue of Fire** [离德] **declares its essence** [宣精],
It is also called the **Son of the Vermilion Sovereign** [赤帝之子].

It **ascends eighty myriads of li** [八十万里] **and radiates colors** [腾彩],
And **spans over a hundred days** [一百余日] **to complete its celestial cycle** [周天].

Wherever it **remains or departs** [居留],
It **certainly shapes calamities or blessings** [必形灾福].
When it **disturbs the natural order** [乱常],
It serves as a **warning against corrupt governance** [以戒昏政];
When it **follows its appointed course** [循度],
It **clearly marks the passage of time** [以表明时].

When it **converges with the Five Stars** [同五星聚],
The world **unifies in harmony** [而天下咸归];
When it **aligns with the Four Stars** [与四星合],
The **rulers receive congratulations** [而王者受庆].

Should **chaos and disorder arise** [亡乱],
And **virtue be lost** [失德],
Then its **fluctuations** [盈缩] **become erratic** [无常].

Gazing upward at the **Celestial Patterns of Heaven** [乾文],
The **divine records of calamities** [灾数] **are preserved** [皇存].

When it **converges with the Year Star** [合岁星], there will be **famine** [则饥馑];
When it **aligns with the Great White Star** [合太白], there will be **upheaval and migration** [则播迁];
When it **unites with the Earth Star** [与土合], governance **becomes increasingly misaligned** [则政益乖];
When it **joins with the Star of the Hour** [与辰合], the **armies fare poorly** [则兵不利];
When the **moon eclipses its mansion** [月蚀其宫], there will be **war and strife** [则为战乱];
When the **heart of the star deviates from its course** [心孛其度], there will be **conflagration and burning** [则主燎焚].

Only by **cultivating virtue** [修德] can such calamities be **warded off** [可禳],
And by **self-reflection and reverence** [省躬而知畏].

Though **celestial cycles and omens** [运数] **concern the fate of nations** [关於国论],
**Calamities and auspices** [灾祥] are **indeed bound to the people’s lives** [寔系於民生].

The **Dao Master** [醮主] of humble name, deeply concerned by accumulated karma inviting calamity, humbly composed this supplication and petitioned for divine favor. With reverence, I dare to unfold my sincere words before the **Celestial Assembly** [法席], and now solemnly proclaim them.

**Proclamation of the Supplication:**

As the words declare, my sincerity is profound and earnest.

The Dao Master, born in this age of wondrous transformation, has long revered the **True Wind** [真风]. Now, at the height of summer’s heat, the **Mars** [荧惑] traverses its degree. Though I have always relied upon **virtue** [德], my heart has long held **awe and reverence** [祇畏]. Yet when disasters arise, I must invoke the **preemptive rites of warding** [预禳之典].

I recite the **secret incantations of the Precious Scripture** [宝经], reveal the **true characters of the Cloud Sigil** [云篆], and present the **wondrous patterns** [妙范] in full array, with all rites meticulously observed. **Heaven and humanity interact**, relying upon the **sublime essence** [精祲] to incline in devotion; the **ritual implements are abundant**, and the **fragrant offerings ascend in splendor** [馨香之昭格].

With the **multitudes of the True Ones** [众真] in attendance, I gaze upon the **Celestial Sovereign’s lofty seat** [上帝之端居], my single mind devoted in reverence, as the **hundred spirits converge**.

I humbly pray that the **Dragon Banner and Phoenix Canopy** [龙旗凤葆] may open **auspicious blessings** [休祥] upon the lower realms, and that the **Sun’s Chariot and Radiant Clouds** [日毂霞车] may amplify the **sublime might of the Celestial Officials** [炎官之威烈].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this petition for grace, now present the **first offering of wine**.

**Scatter flowers.**

I have heard that **diligence in ending as one begins** [谨终如始] is the foundation of human conduct, and that **fearing calamity while turning to virtue** [惧灾向善] is the natural order. Life’s formation depends upon **Heaven and Earth** [乾坤], and all motion and stillness are governed by **Water and Fire** [水火].

**Yin and Yang** [阴阳] form the cosmic framework, overseeing **spirit and vital essence** [魂魄]. In winter, they govern affairs through the **Hour Star** [伺辰], and in summer, they wield authority through **Mars** [荧惑].

Now, in this ninth month of summer, the **Three Stars** [三星] appear in the twilight. How could one not recognize that the **cyclical records of the ancient sages** [阏伯之纪时] align with the **procession of Zhurong** [祝融之行度]?

The Dao Official, reflecting upon my mundane existence and my place among humanity, kindles fire by day and lights the **Dao’s lamp** [烛道] by night. Though my actions depend upon **human flame**, I may yet fall prey to **celestial disaster** [天灾].

The **impartial virtue** [无私之德] is boundless, yet common folk ever fear their **transgressions** [有过之民]. With utmost sincerity, I purify my **community altar** [祓社], heeding the **exhaustive rites of Zheng Xia** [郑侨之尽礼], yet I lack the **insight of the Fire Official’s omens** [裨灶之知天].

I now unfold the **secret scriptures** [秘典] once more, bearing my wishes before the **Lofty True Ones** [高真], hoping the **Heart Star** [心星] may retreat and restore the **Celestial Degrees** [天度] in the **high vault** [高穹], nurturing the **abundance of all things** [万物之丰成], so that all beings may **cross safely** [群生之共济].

May we **roast or boil our offerings** [可燔可炙] without fear of **poisonous winds** [扇毒之虞], and may we dwell and reside **without dread of shifting flames** [徙薪之虑].

Now, the **lotus lamps** [莲灯] flicker toward extinction, yet the **glowing sun’s remnants** [赫曜日之余光] persist. The **precious sigils** [宝篆] are fading, dissolving into the **light mist of floating clouds** [浮云之轻霭]. The **thousand True Ones** have gathered, and the **three offerings** [三献] have concluded.

The **Dragon returns to the Vermilion Celestial Heights** [丹霄], and the **Phoenix attendants** [鸾仗] prepare to withdraw to the **Crimson Palace** [绛阙]. Fearful of further presumption, I dare not linger beneath the **imminent celestial威**.

I further pray for **boundless compassion** [洪慈] to descend, granting **forgiveness and mercy** [宽贷].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this final petition, now present the **concluding offering of wine**.

**Scatter flowers.**

**Reaffirm the Dao’s station.**

The humble servant of lowly rank, **Dao Official** [醮官], now humbly reiterates this supplication to the **Nine Pure Ones, Supreme Saints** [九清上圣], and the **True Spirits of the Three Realms** [三界真灵].

Your servants have solemnly performed the **ritual of the sacred censer** [祭爟之仪] to purify the **original calamity** [燎原之厄].

To the **Supreme Saint of the Jade Capital** [玉京上圣], who receives the **auspicious radiance** [迂景] upon the **Purple Altar** [紫坛], and to the **Stars of the Southern Pole** [南极众星], who also incline their light upon the **embroidered seat** [黼座], we have already exhausted the **flowing wine offerings** [流霞之献] and now ascend the **bright candles’ glow** [明烛之辉].

Again, we pour out our **earnest prayers** [沥恳] before the **Heavenly Hosts** [诸天], beseeching the **cessation of calamity** [弭灾] from the **Celestial Symbols** [上象]. Having already unfolded the rites at **Mars’ degree** [荧惑之度], we now extend our **sincerity to the Variable Star** [变化之星].

Only the **residual light of the Law** [执法之余光] disperses the **flaming essence** [炎精] to demonstrate **divine retribution** [示罚].

The **Dawn Star** [析旦] grows strong in **sovereign governance** [君道], and **Zhaoming** [昭明] presides over **war and mourning** [兵丧]. **Chiyou’s banner** [蚩尤如旗] signals the **sovereign’s campaigns** [王者之征伐], while **Tian Chan** [天搀如剑] foretells the **slaying by generals** [将帅之杀伤]. **Si Wei** [司危] serves to **pacify discord** [平乖争], and the **Red Comet** [赤彗] wields **authority over extermination** [掌诛灭]. These are all **phenomena linked to the Sun** [附日而有象], yet there are also those **associated with the Moon** [因月而垂芒], such as the **Heavenly Obscuration** [天阴晋若] and the **Celestial Official’s Outbreak** [天惑官张].

The **Red Comet’s strange hues** [赤若异彩] and the **Heavenly Chui’s anomalous forms** [天崔殊形]—all are **officials of calamity** [灾厄之官], each with their **mandate of oversight** [照临之分].

When they descend, they become the **Wind Lord** [风伯]; when they manifest as deities, they are called the **Fire Spirits** [火精].

Their **flames and forces** [势焰] surge in tandem, their **portents and marvels** [光怪] intertwine. I pray that, under the **Celestial Sovereign’s Dao-essence** [天尊之道炁], the **residual might of the Fire Virtue** [火德之余威] may be fully harnessed.

May the **nation’s path be unburdened** [国步无艰], lest **martial might be unleashed upon the multitudes** [扬威於多垒]; may the **realm rejoice in prosperity** [邦家有庆], so that the **four classes may pursue their labors in harmony** [乐业於四民].

May there be no **small conflagrations consuming stables** [焚厩之小栽], nor **premonitory warnings of bandits on the roads** [表道之先警]. May the **summer rains arrive in season**, so that **epidemic miasmas** [沴气] do not arise, and may **Yin and Yang harmonize**, yielding **abundant harvests year after year** [年谷屡丰].

Yet I still fear the **Five Stars’ transgressions** [五星凌犯] and the **comets’逆流**, for if they appear in the **eastern quadrant of the Azure Dragon’s seven mansions** [青龙七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Green Emperor** [青帝真文] for **dissolution and warding** [解禳].

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Red Comet逆流** in the **southern quadrant of the Vermilion Bird’s seven mansions** [朱雀七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Red Emperor** [赤帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the White Comet逆流** in the **western quadrant of the White Tiger’s seven mansions** [白虎七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the White Emperor** [白帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Black Comet逆流** in the **northern quadrant of the Dark Tortoise’s seven mansions** [玄武七宿分野], I beseech the **True Characters of the Black Emperor** [黑帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

If the **Five Stars transgress and the Yellow Comet逆流** in the **central region of the Hooked Array’s Three Enclosures and the Imperial Seat of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars** [勾陈三垣帝座北斗七元星君], I beseech the **True Characters of the Yellow Emperor** [黄帝真文] for **dissolution and warding**.

May the **Emperor and Sovereign reign for ten thousand years** [帝主万年], their **lineage enduring a hundred generations** [本支百世]. May the **celestial patterns remain in order** [天文有序], and the **earthly cycles endure** [地纪常容]. May the **nation grow wealthy and families prosperous** [国富家康], the **times harmonious and the people flourishing** [时和俗阜].

Only then shall the **Dao Official and his household** [醮官某家等] find **spiritual peace and bodily ease** [神安体裕], their **fortunes extended and longevity assured** [益算延龄], their **blessings and merits renewed** [福禄维新], with **no return of misfortune** [凶衰不作], their **kinfolk thriving and their dwellings serene** [眷属亨泰，所止肃清], their **towns and villages at rest** [井邑静安], and their **regions in tranquility** [方隅宁谧].

All petitions shall be **fully granted** [悉荷保全], extending **universal protection to all living beings** [普及生灵], so that all may **equally share in divine favor** [均叨庇佑].

Your servants, overwhelmed by this **final gratitude** [祈谢之至], now **bow before the Celestial Throne** [拜首天阶] and humbly present this **concluding offering**.

**Reignite the incense brazier.**

**Incense Officials and Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the Attendant Spirit Officials of the Incense**, now command that at the site where this **Dao Rite** [设醮] was established, **golden elixirs and jade-green herbs** [金液丹碧], **mushrooms and hundred-spirits’ blessings** [芝英百灵] shall naturally manifest. The **multitudes of True Ones** shall converge at this **incense and flame altar** [香火炉前].

Now let the Ten-Direction Daoist youth and maiden attendants,
attend to the fragrant incense vapors,
and swiftly transmit our humble petitions
to the **Supreme Ultimate Great Dao of the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Court** [至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Conclude the offering, transform the wealth.**

**Dawn of Purity**

We, Your servants, with utmost sincerity, **submit to the command of the Great Fire Star Exorcist True Lord of the Southern Realm** [南方大圣火星执法真君],
the attendant spirit officials and celestial ministers,
the star court deities and all spirit officials.

We, Your servants and followers, humbly hear that **the Celestial Sovereign’s will is unfathomable** [上帝匪忱],
and that **the Dao does not discriminate in its judgments** [道无私於降鉴].
**The Highly Pure respond to sincerity** [高真应感],
and **the divine is moved by genuine devotion** [诚自格於灵承].

Thus, we lay bare our sincere hearts,
and **supplicate the august creation** [仰干洪造].

We observe that **the stars align with their seasons** [纬星应候],
and that **Mars governs the vermilion brightness** [祀关伯於朱明].
The **celestial luminaries mark their positions** [列曜奠方],
and **Zhùróng is paired with the quail’s peak** [配祝融於鹑首].

In silence, they govern the celestial order,
and **hold supreme authority over transformation** [优持造化之权].
Their **manifestations are timely** [其伏见有时],
and their **auspicious or inauspicious signs are clear** [其吉凶有兆].
The heavens act without disorder,
and their responses are without favoritism.
If one harbors **reverence for the stern and the awe-inspiring** [严知畏之心],
then **uncommon blessings shall descend** [必降殊常之祉].

We, the Daoists of such-and-such lineage, are fortunate to dwell in an era of enduring peace,
and to **partake in the harmonious unity of the age** [膺保合之和].
The **Five Phases’ transformations** [化被五行]
and the **Six Ministries’ governance** [政修六府]
are in perfect order.

The **Fire Officials**, who **consume the heart and the pearl** [食心食珠],
and the **Fire Rectifiers**, who **take willow and sassafras** [取柳取槐],
adhere to the **four-seasonal laws** [法有四时之变].

The **qi and symbols harmonize in sequence** [象气交顺],
and **sincere devotion communicates with the divine** [精诚感通].
The **celestial alignment is auspicious** [运合升明],
and **no disasters or calamities arise** [祥无灾燀].

The **sounds echo the Flame Emperor’s order** [音阐炎帝之纪],
**upright and unerring** [充正而不乖];
the **origin of the Great Yin** [太阴之原]
**neither exceeds nor falls short** [无过与不及].

From the capital to the remotest lands,
**fire rituals are meticulously performed** [火焚具修],
and **seasonal offerings are duly made** [时令咸举].
Families fear **displaced hearths** [徙薪之虑],
and people suffer from **burning afflictions** [烂额之伤].

Thus, we **devote ourselves to the Golden Precepts** [刻意金科],
and **knock at the Jade Throne with sincere hearts** [叩心玉陛].
We present **elaborate pure offerings** [设苹繁之净供],
and **offer humble sincerity** [荐豺獭之微诚].
With **wholehearted devotion**, we submit to the command of:
the **Upper True Dao Lord of the Crimson Heavenly Realm** [南方离位丹天赤皇上真道君],
the **Fire Virtue Exorcist True Lord** [火德执法真君],
the **Lord of the Manifesting Dawn Star** [析变析旦昭明星君],
the **Lord of the Deceptive Star, Chiyou** [蚩尤司诡星君],
the **Lord of the Crimson Comet Star** [天搀赤彗星君],
the **Lord of the Dark Quail Star** [天阴晋若星君],
the **Lord of the Celestial Disruptive Star** [官张天惑星君],
the **Lord of the Crimson Ruinous Star** [赤若天崔星君],
and **all deities and spirits within the Great Fire Constellation**.

We humbly pray that the **Dao’s vision illuminate and protect** [道眼照临，灵威覆护],
that **the wandering star be guided along its path** [耀荧惑以循轨],
and that **the backflowing star bring blessings** [弭回禄而降休].
May **auspicious signs gather across ten thousand li** [千里储祥],
and **ten thousand households receive divine favor** [万家蒙佑].

May the people **live in peace and prosperity** [人民平泰],
free from **water, drought, pestilence, or famine** [无扎瘥水旱之殃];
may the **celestial patterns harmonize** [气运协和],
and **dispel the ominous brilliance of the sun’s variations** [消伏明赫曦之变].

Then shall the **lands be tranquil** [方隅宁静],
and the **residences secure** [居止镇安].
All shall **depend on the Dao’s shelter** [咸依道荫].

After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

**Midday**

We, Your servants, humbly hear of the **crimson flames of the divine crossbow** [赤熛神弩],
and the **fierce might of Zhùróng** [祝融烈威].

**On High, You govern authority** [在天司权],
with roles as **either sovereign or minister** [有或君或相之职];
**on Earth, You oversee the flow of seasons** [在国出纳],
with the **times of spring and autumn** [有季春季秋之时].
Above, You **purify the radiant emotions of the Sun’s warmth** [上则洁阳燧感格之情],
and below, You **enforce the strict prohibitions of the Metal Bell** [下则严木铎修行之禁].
When **dikes fail or are lost** [堤防或失], Your **stern punishment descends from Heaven** [厉降自天];
when **mercy is extended or delayed** [延发有加], none **escape Your grace** [幸免无地].
We fear the **habit of reckless ignorance** [大惧昏顽之俗],
and the **unrepentant hearts that defy sacred prohibitions** [罔悛僭戒之心].
For Heaven **detests excess** [天恶其盈],
and the **Ghosts observe and impose retribution** [鬼瞰而罚].
May we **forever cease from burning ruin** [永惟焦头烂额而遏绝],
and instead **purify our thoughts and wash our hearts** [涤虑洗心而祷祠],
so that **repentance arises at the first stir** [悔悟一萌],
and **Your mercy shines like the depths of a mirror** [昭回渊鉴].
We, Your servants, **devote our lives to the Dao’s shelter** [捐躯道荫],
and **bow in reverence to Your True Benevolence** [稽首真慈].
Though we are **mere creatures like wolves or jackals** [豺獭报微],
we **dare not neglect Your inspection** [敢图省察];
though we are **humble as ants or crickets** [蝼蚁诚至],
we **all earnestly seek Your complete hearing** [咸冀彻闻].
We pray that **Your sacred radiance ascends to the celestial hour** [惟灵辉上次之辰],
and **Your divine chariot descends to the mortal realm** [与仙驭下游之分].
May You **relieve Your wrath and bestow hidden blessings** [望蠲威命],
so that **our homes are serene and our wells tranquil** [阴锡庬休，里闬清宁，井闾澄泰],
with **no fears of calamity** [不虞自息] and **no unintended offenses** [非意罔干].
In **wars and fires** [兵火灾伤], we **measure the perils of destruction** [寻度危亡之厄];
in **eclipses and winds and rains** [晦明风雨], we **rely on Your auspicious favor** [更叨利顺之功].
How could we **not submit in devotion** [敢不皈依] to repay Your **nurturing of all** [以酬化育]?

With **sincere hearts**, we **submit to the command of the South**:
**the True Sovereign of the Crimson Heaven** [南方离位丹天赤皇上真],
**the Dao-Master of the Fire Virtue** [道主火德荧惑星执法真君],
**the Celestial Spirits born of the Sun’s essence and Moon’s breath** [精炁所变传日旁月彗孛异星星君],
**and the divine officials among the stars** [星中神仙诸灵官].
May You **extend compassion to the world below** [垂慈人世],
**take pity on the common and lowly** [悯察凡庸],
**descend to the dusty realm** [俯降尘寰],
**oversee our earnest sincerity** [监斯诚悃],
**pour forth Your blessings and grant forgiveness** [流恩赐福，赦罪释愆],
**extinguishing the flames that spread like wildfire** [绝焰焰之燎原],
and **banishing the deceitful whispers of calamity** [无嘻嘻之妖语].
May **no birds cry at the sacrificial grounds of Mò** [鸟不鸣於亳社],
so that **our households may dwell in peace** [家以靖安];
may **no stars appear ominous in the Great Hour** [星无孛於大辰],
so that **all may prosper in health** [人皆康阜].
May **the crows and magpies vanish** [鷝鴭消去],
**preventing baseless disasters** [预禳无妄之灾];
and may **the quails rest content** [鹑首居饮],
**reaping the joy of great fortune** [终获大来之庆].
After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

**Quiet Night**

We, Your servants, humbly hear of the **Crimson Heaven’s Vermilion Palace** [丹天绛府],
which **holds dominion over life and death without favor** [掌生录以无私];
and the **Jade Palace of the South** [离位朱宫],
which **spreads the Sun’s radiant might** [布阳威而有赫].
You **emanate Your luminous essence to dispel darkness** [运灵芒而烛暗],
and **vigorously dispense Your pure *qi*** [腾正气以流辉].
All who dwell beneath Your light
**may follow and submit in reverence** [得遵皈仰].

Now, we, Your servants,
**present humble offerings of wild plants and clay** [择芹捧块],
and **bare our hearts and livers at the Vermilion Terrace** [露肝胆於朱陵].
With **pure intentions and tranquil hearts** [洁志清心],
we **invoke the clouds and mists at the Crimson Palace** [降云霞於赤府].
With **sincere devotion**, we **submit to the command of the South**:
**the Great Sage of Fire Virtue** [南方大圣火德上真荧惑星真君],
**the True Person among the stars** [星中真人],
**the Great God among the stars** [星中大神],
**the Celestial Spirits of the Star Palace** [星宫神仙],
**and the divine officials** [诸灵官].

We **earnestly pray that the Earth’s threefold return** [地回三舍]
**confirms the brilliance of past decrees** [验彰前典之中];
and that **the Dao’s praise ascends to the Nine Heavens** [道赞一人，珠贯九霄之上].
May Your **sacred insight turn back** [回圣鉴],
and **long observe our crimson sincerity** [久察丹诚].
May You **ascend upon the red mists and clouds** [蹑丹霞红雾以上流],
and **descend in the radiant crimson carriage** [拥绯饰明舆而下降].
May You **accept our earnest devotion** [纳斯垦悃],
and **grant us extraordinary blessings** [锡以殊祥],
**removing the disasters that plague our bodies** [祛身罹命偶之灾],
and **clearing the faults that arise from our words and deeds** [除口发心为之过].

May **the wild grasses and humble huts** [草茅生聚]
**enjoy the cooling of summer’s heat** [度暑景以清凉];
and may **the earthen and wooden dwellings** [土木形骸]
**align with the sequence of the Primordial Yang** [计元阳之气序].
May **every household be free from fear of flying embers** [比屋免飞烟之恐],
and **every connected roof unalarmed by fierce flames** [连甍无烈焰之惊].
May **all creatures alike** [普及群生]
**depend on the Great Transformation** [同依大化].

After attaining the Dao,
one **ascends to the Formless** [升入无形],
and **harmonizes with the True Dao** [和与道合真].

The North Emperor’s mandate—
wind and fire dare not resist.

I reap the highest merit,

boundless as Heaven,

**West:**
Seven *qi* of White Heaven, the Great White’s essence flows.

preserving the divine and securing my form.

ascending to the Purple Court.

**North:**

The Primordial *qi*’s Yang-essence flares with crimson smoke.
Piercing all under Heaven, reaching my disciples’ forms.
A hundred evils crushed, ten thousand ghosts slain.

all under Heaven obeys.
