Stars one to four are the **Pivot Stars** (魁魁, the first four stars of the Big Dipper),
And the **Raven’s Eye Stars** (璇玑, the third and fourth stars of the Big Dipper).
Stars five to seven are the **Ladle Stars** (杓杓, the last three stars of the Big Dipper),
And the **Jade Balance Star** (玉衡, the central star of the Big Dipper).

All aspects of **human life**—**fortune, longevity, and fate** (福禄寿命),
As well as **affiliated beings, slaves, and servants** (眷属奴婢),
Are governed by the stars of the Dipper (斗中主之).

According to the **Most High Laozi’s** (太上老君) words:
**The five components of human nature and life** (凡人性命五体),
Are all under the dominion of the **native star officials** (本命星官之所主掌).
The **native star generals and officials** (本命神将、本宿星官),
Constantly **bestow their auspicious shade** (垂荫佑),
**Oversee human life** (主持人命),
And **ensure the preservation of one’s Heaven-bestowed years** (使保天年).

The **True Saints of the Native Star** (本命真圣),
Each year descend **six times** (每岁六度) to the mortal realm.
The day of descent is the **critical period of one’s native star** (本命限期),
When one may **plant various incense and flowers, fresh seasonal fruits** (种种香花、时新五果),
**Model oneself after Heaven and Earth** (法天像地),
And **invite Daoist priests of the Orthodox Unity School** (请正一道士);
Either at **temples and observatories** (宫观),
Or within **domestic settings** (家庭),
To **establish ritual halls and perform expiatory rites** (修斋设醮),
And **invite and pray to the Northern Dipper’s Three Officials and Five Emperors** (启祝北斗三官五帝、九府四司),
Presenting **two petitions: one for bestowing blessings, the other for dispelling calamities** (荐福消灾二奏章恳愿),
And **fulfilling merits according to one’s capacity** (随力建功),
To **conduct the ritual affairs** (请行法事).
The **merits and virtues** (功德) are profound and weighty;
Their full extent cannot be enumerated (不可具陈).

For those whose **native star’s critical period** (本命限期) is approaching,
Yet who **do not know** (自身不知),
And **do not set up ritual halls or perform incense rites** (不设醮筵，不修香火),
Unable to **inform and pray to the Northern Dipper** (不能投告北斗),
Or **thank the True Sovereigns** (醮谢真君),
Nor to **recite and transmit the True Scripture** (转真经),
And **acknowledge the name of their native star’s True Sovereign** (认本命真君名号),
This is **reckless disregard for life and ignorance of one’s roots** (轻生迷本),
**Disdaining the human body** (不媿人身),
**Causing Heaven’s officials to strip one’s fortune** (天司夺禄),
**Reduce one’s lifespan and subtract one’s years** (减算除年),
And **result in many untimely deaths** (致多夭丧).

After **expressing gratitude to the native star** (身谢之后),
One falls into the **three abysses** (三涂, the three lower realms),
And **drifts through the six paths** (漂诸六趣, the six realms of rebirth),
A state deeply **worthy of lamentation and sorrow** (深可悲哀),
**Self-inflicted suffering** (自致斯苦).

Today, as disciple **某** (某) establishes this ritual,
We reflect upon the **day of our native star’s descent** (本命之日),
The **beginning of receiving our form from *qi*** (禀气受形之始),
And the **source of our transformation and birth** (化生之本).

The **Daoist teachings on the Great Cavern of the One** (道家大洞帝一之法),
All emphasize **cultivating and refining the spirit** (练神),
**Gathering *qi* to preserve life** (结气保命),
On the **day of one’s native star** (皆以本命之日).

The **method of generating the True and transmitting it to others** (生真诵度人之法),
Also requires **cultivating and preserving the soul-spirit** (行持魂神),
**Purifying and rectifying the ten thousand *qi*** (澄正万炁),
So that one may **long retain the roots of one’s native star** (长存则知本命之根本),
And **never pass over this day in vain** (不可虚过).

Today, all gathered in this **Daoist ritual hall** (道场),
Should know that **Heaven’s command is most weighty** (天命至重),
And **cannot be lightly prayed for** (不可轻祷).
Though we **wear the badge of the Most High Perfection** (佩至真),
And **participate in the Great Dao’s cultivation** (参修大法),
Our **bodies dwell amidst the five impurities** (处身五浊),
And our **traces are stained by the six dusts** (染迹六尘),
Yet even in **presenting our petitions** (启奏之间),
There may be **obstacles and hindrances** (不无窒碍).

First, we must **purify our spirits and calm our thoughts** (澄神静虑),
**Devoutly uphold the precepts** (仰奉戒约),
**Keep our bodies and minds clean and tranquil** (清静身心),
And **strictly follow the Dao’s instructions** (上遵法训).

The **Heavenly Venerable Ones** (天尊) say:
**When establishing ritual halls and practicing the Dao** (修斋行道),
All must **single-heartedly uphold the Ten Precepts** (一心请奉十戒),
**Receiving them clearly and never forgetting** (谛受勿忘),
**Focused and silently reciting them** (专精默念),
**Thinking naturally without movement** (动思自然),
**Avoiding all杂想** (勿怀杂想),
**Lest they disturb and confuse the form and spirit** (扰乱形神).

Those who can do so **must attentively listen** (能如是者，咸当谛听).

The **first precept** (第一戒) is:
**Do not dare to be arrogant or disrespectful toward the Holy True Ones** (不得傲忽圣真).
**Always maintain reverence and awe** (常怀恭敬),
**Facing upward to the Venerable Ones’ images** (仰对尊像),
**As the True Ones manifest their transformed bodies** (真应化身),
**When the heart arises with sincerity and devotion** (心起精虔),
**Offering and supplying them without deficiency** (供养无阙).

The **Celestial True Great Spirit** (天真大神),
**Descends from the void** (浮空而来),
**With focused and concentrated reverence** (专怀注想),
**Shall surely be granted communion** (必获降接).

The **second precept** (第二戒) is:
**Do not dare to slight or belittle the scriptures** (不得轻慢经文).
**Always hold them in deep faith and respect** (常怀信重),
For the **Three Caverns and Great Vehicle** (三洞大乘)
**Unfold the path for the foolish and lost** (开导愚迷),
**And awaken boundless Dao-intentions in all beings** (能发众生无量道意).
**In copying, reciting, or reading them** (传写读诵),
**With single-hearted contemplation** (一心玩味),
**From delusion to awakening** (从迷起悟),
**From awakening to true realization** (从悟成真),
**One shall surely attain the Dao-fruit** (必证道果).

The **third precept** (第三戒) is:
**Do not dare to defame or slander the Dao-gates** (不得诽谤法门).
**Always cherish and protect them** (常怀爱护),
**Teaching and guiding all beings** (教化众生),
**That each may take refuge** (令各归依),
**And widely gain deliverance** (广获受度),
**To uphold and flourish the True Teaching** (绍隆正教),
**To proclaim the Dao and clarify the law** (洪道明法),
**To rescue the living and the dead** (济度存亡),
**To aid the realm in transforming its people** (助国化人),
**With merit enduring through eternal kalpas** (功垂永劫).

The **fourth precept** (第四戒) is:
**Do not dare to pollute the Dao-field** (不得触秽道场).
**Always maintain purity and refinement** (常怀精洁),
With **fragrant baths and ritual cleansing** (香汤沐浴),
**Only then approaching the Mysterious Hall** (始近玄坛).
**Do not use kitchen fires to burn incense** (不得以灶火焚香),
**Nor impure wood to prepare food** (秽柴造食),
**And lamps, candles, or vessels must never be stained with grease or filth** (灯烛器皿，无染脂垢).
**Do not consume or take meat from the five kinds** (食啖荤肉，无来取祸).
**Women in the midst of their celestial period** (妇人天癸未绝者),
**Must not ascend the platform** (不得升阶).
**Those with foul or unclean bodies** (身有臭秽),
**Shall not be summoned by the assembly** (不在呼使).
**Chickens, dogs, and all manner of fowl and beasts** (鸡犬及一切禽畜),
**Must not be permitted near the Dao-field** (不得相近).

The **fifth precept** (第五戒) is:
**Do not dare to indulge or neglect the body and heart** (不得放纵身心).
**Always maintain solemn caution** (常怀畏谨),
**Not raising the voice in the hall** (不得临坛高声),
**Nor shouting, cursing, or scolding** (呼骂叱喝),
**Nor speaking or laughing lightly before the Holy Images** (及对圣像，语笑轻忽),
**Nor indulging in excessive sleep** (及贪睡眠),
**Nor drinking at improper times** (非时饮酒).
**When splendid colors pass before** (华色过前),
**Do not glance or peer sideways** (不得角眼斜视).
**Bow with utmost humility** (鞠躬小心),
**As though facing one’s sovereign or parents** (如对君父).

The **sixth precept** (第六戒) is:
**Do not dare to compete or contend for wealth and gain** (不得争竞财利).
**Always practice modesty and restraint** (常怀廉逊),
**For those who give and those who receive** (施者受者),
**Neither flatter nor resent** (勿谄勿怨).
**Let all rejoice and widely establish merit and virtue** (令各欢喜，广建功德),
**That blessings may pervade all beings in the dust-mote worlds** (禄力溥沾，尘沙世界).

The **seventh precept** (第七戒) is:
**Do not dare to diminish or neglect the Dao-affairs** (不得减省法事).
**Always be diligent and earnest** (常怀勤恪),
**In practicing the Dao and reciting scriptures** (行道诵经),
**Burning incense and making offerings of repentance** (烧香礼忏),
**That merit and virtue may be fulfilled** (使功德满足).
**The Ten Extremes and Highest Truths** (十极高真),
**All shall be attained in perception and hearing** (尽得见闻),
**Karmic debts forever dissolved** (冤债永消),
**And no encounter with roving demons** (横魔不值).
**Humans and heavens shall reap their fruits** (人天获果),
**And the hidden and manifest alike shall be blessed** (幽显蒙恩).
**Let the world’s dull and sentient beings** (使世间蠢动，一切含识),
**Forever enter the Dao-gates** (永入法门),
**And never fall into the bitter realms of suffering** (不沉苦趣).

The **eighth precept** (第八戒) is:
**Do not dare to falter or abandon the Dao-heart** (不得退转道心).
**Always hold it firm and unyielding** (常怀坚固),
**Lest from petty grievances** (勿因小嫌),
**One’s sincerity be diminished** (便减诚意).
**Take the supreme vow** (发增上愿),
**With zealous devotion and exalted reverence** (精进崇奉),
**That the Celestial True Ones may rejoice** (天真欢悦),
**And one’s name be listed among the Upper Clarity** (列名上清).
**The Nine Ancestors shall ascend in succession** (九祖超升),
**One’s self shall attain the Dao** (己身证道),
**And blessings for all beings shall be boundless** (见存眷属，福田无量).

The **ninth precept** (第九戒) is:
**Do not dare to err or misrecite the scriptural verses** (不得错误章奏).
**Always verify and correct them** (常怀审订),
For **great causes are hard to encounter** (大缘难遇),
And **great virtues are hard to complete** (大善难成).
**If one acts rashly or recklessly** (若卤莽灭裂),
**Without careful examination or comparison** (不加参对),
Then **even beneath the Three Heavens’ gates** (则三天门下),
**One may be rejected** (有所遣却),
**One’s aspirations unfulfilled** (志愿不伸),
**One’s efforts in vain** (事属徒劳),
**And blessings unattained** (福力未沾).
**Instead, one shall first incur blame** (先获咎戾),
**And deeply tremble in fear** (深可震惧).

The **tenth precept** (第十戒) is:
**Do not dare to disturb the form and spirit** (不得扰乱形神).
**Always maintain singular focus** (常怀专一),
**Lest the emotions of joy, anger, sorrow, and delight** (喜怒哀乐),
**Take root in the heart** (不萌於心).
**Strive to attain clarity and purity** (务致清明),
**And exhaust all efforts within one’s power** (尽其在己).
**Widely take the great vow** (广发大愿),
**To follow the Dao and cultivate true virtue** (奉道修真),
**That those who first attain the Dao** (愿先得道者),
**May in turn guide and liberate all others** (次第开度).

**The above Ten Precepts** (已上十戒),
**Can all uphold them faithfully?** (众等能持否?)
The **Celestial Venerable Ones** (天尊言) say:

In **practicing the Dao and observing the fasts** (修斋行道),
**The Four Heavenly Emperors and all Celestial True Ones** (四天帝王，与诸天真),
**Shall descend upon flying clouds in jade palanquins** (皆驾飞云缘軿，八景玉舆),
**With attendants of jade maidens** (侍从玉女),
**Holding flower banners** (手执花旛),
**Leading and following in procession** (前导后从).
**Lions and white cranes shall chant in melodious voices** (狮子白鹤，啸歌嗈嗈).
**Incense shall be burned and flowers scattered** (烧香散花),
**As they descend from the void** (浮空而来).

In **worship and Dao-practice** (瞻礼行道),
**Listening to the law’s resonant voice** (观听法音),
**The Ten Precepts shall first be granted** (当先授十戒),
**Then the Dao shall be practiced** (然后行道),
**With a heart at peace and silent** (夷心静默),
**And concentrated thoughts of non-duality** (专想不二).
**Midday shall not be tasted** (过中不味),
**And inner and outer shall be empty and pure** (内外清虚).
**All heavens shall oversee** (诸天监观),
**And myriad spirits shall guard in attendance** (万灵侍卫),
**Lest one grow arrogant** (不得自慢),
**And invite disaster and calamity** (以招祸灾).
**In all movements, maintain grace and propriety** (进退雍容),
**Never departing from ritual decorum** (不离仪格).
**The Celestial True Ones shall rejoice** (天真欢悦),
**And one’s name shall be listed among the Upper Clarity** (列名上清).

**Offer the precepts and dedicate their merit** (奉戒回向).

**Declaring the Sacred Warding Talismans**
The Five Stars arrayed in radiance, illuminating the five directions.
The Water Star repels calamity, the Woodly Virtue brings prosperity.
The Wandering Star dispels disaster, the Great White Star wards off soldiers.
The Stationary Star holds firm, benefiting the family and state.
Names inscribed on jade tablets, characters recorded in the Celestial Palace.

Riding the gusts and scattering brilliance, soaring through the boundless void.
Moving unseen in the dark, wandering and feasting across the ten directions.
Five clouds float as a canopy, summoning spirits and capturing winds.
Commanding myriad souls, guarding the Dao’s true and authentic essence,
And the Celestial Master of the Way, in harmony with the Dao’s primordial essence.

**Striking the Law Drum Twenty-Four Times**

Invoked are the Three Sovereigns of the Supreme Three Heavens—**Heavenly Primordial Origin (玄元始)**, **Heavenly Primordial Essence (始三炁)**, and **Heavenly Primordial Virtue (无上三天)**—
**The Supreme Dao Lord (太上道君)**, **The Supreme Lao Lord (太上老君)**,
And the **North Dipper Longevity-Sustaining Celestial Emperor (北斗延生尊帝)**,
Who summon forth the **Three Five Officials of the Middle (三五功曹)**—
Subordinates, left and right attendants, incense-bearers,
Postal dragon couriers, bridesmaids of the **Golden Boy (金童)**,
**Jade Girl messengers (玉女)** who convey words and scatter flowers,
**Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans (五帝直符)**, **Direct Day Incense Officials (直日香官)**,
And the **Thirty-Six (合三十六人)** in full array.

Those who emerge are clad in solemn, resplendent robes,
With headgear and sashes trailing streamers,
Opening the **Mysterious Dao Hall’s (玄坛)** earthly and territorial spirits,
And the **authentic deities of the domain (方域神真)**.

I, the humble servant, now practice the Dao in quiet night,
And earnestly present this invocation to enter the sacred intent.
With all sincerity and devotion, my pleas are already recorded and heard,
May the **Supreme Dao’s Ten-Directional True Essence (十方至真道炁)** descend,
And the **Luminous Treasure of Auspicious Light (灵宝瑞光)** flow into my being,
So that my invocation may swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao (无极大道)**,
Before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme (昊天玉皇上帝)**.

**Requesting the invocation of the Law’s station.**

The assembled servants, [name] and others,
With utmost sincerity and reverence, now invoke:
The **Emperor of the Natural Void and Primordial Origin (虚无自然元始天尊)**,
The **Supreme Dao Lord (太上大道君)**,
The **Supreme Lao Lord (太上老君)**,
The **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme (昊天玉皇上帝)**,
The **Nine Celestial Sovereigns of the Upper Truth (九皇上真)**,
The **Ten-Directional True Saints Who Have Attained the Dao (十方已得道大圣)**,
All **Honorable Lords and Masters (众至真，诸君丈人)**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments of Supreme Scriptures and the Great Law of the Mysterious Middle (三十六部尊经玄中大法师)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Rounded Concavity (圆穹玄象)**,
The **Luminaries of the Sun and Moon, Stars and Dipper (日月星辰)**,
The **North Dipper Celestial Emperor (北斗尊帝)**,
The **Seven Primordial Stars of Auxiliary Support (七元辅弼星君)**,
The **Great Emperor of the Southern Pole (南极大帝)**,
The **Honorable Lord Marshal (丈人司马)**,
The **Six Departments of Celestial Officials (六司星君)**,
The **Native Star of My Fate (本命元辰)**,
The **Peaked Mountains and Encompassing Seas of the Perfected Realms (洞天海岳)**,
The **Three Realms’ Official Retainers (三界官属)**,
And **All Authentic Spirits (一切真灵)**.

We, the humble servants, now dedicate [name] as a disciple,
Who, in this hour, falls under the **Native Star of My Fate (本命所属)** and the **North Dipper’s [specific star] Celestial Official (北斗某星君)**.
Last night, we established a **flower-decked altar (华坛)**,
And solemnly prepared a **Luminous Treasure of Auspicious Light for Longevity and Blessings (延生注禄灵宝清醮)**.
We command the humble servants to perform this **month’s day and hour’s (月日时)** fasting and ritual,
To **offer blessings and dispel calamities (荐福消灾)**,
To **present petitions with earnest wishes (奏章恳愿)**,
To **augment longevity and fortune (增延福寿)**,
And to **rescue and guide the living and the departed (济度存亡)**.

I, the humble servant, consider that my disciple [name]’s life is bound to the mortal realm,
And their fate originates from the **Celestial Bureau (天府)**.
If we do not **perform the expiatory rites (醮)** and thank the **True Lords (真君)**,
Or **recite the scriptures and practice the Dao (转经行道)**,
Then the **Celestial Records of fate (天曹命历)** lack means to extend their calculations,
And the **Underworld’s register of sins (阴司罪簿)** lacks means to erase their names.

We, the humble servants, now earnestly and sincerely beseech,
And humbly pray for the **Heavenly Grace (天恩)** to wash away and forgive,
All the **innumerable sins from eons past (亿劫以来)**,
Even unto this very day, of the **three karmas and six senses (三业六根)**;
Or when the **soul and spirit are ensnared (魂神被系)**,
And **calamities strike like a bell (祸患来锺)**;
Or when **grave illnesses persist without cure (重病不痊)**,
And **malevolent spirits prevail in harm (邪妖克害)**;

Or when **tomb disputes summon the dead (冢讼征呼)**,
Or when the **departed return to haunt (先亡复连)**,
Or when **Heaven itself sends reproach (上天谴责)**,
Or when **ghosts below bring false accusations (下鬼诉诬)**—
All these woes we now beseech to sever,
That our bodies may be cleansed and tranquil,
Our petitions heard by the **Celestial Bureaus (天司)**,
And our fate aligned with **True Grace (真恩)**.

May we grant our disciple [Name] within his allotted lifespan
To **lengthen his years and fulfill his virtue (增绿增寿)**,
That he may **stand in merit, aid living beings (立功济物)**,
And when his **virtue is complete (功满德就)**,
Serve before the **Imperial Dao of Boundless Mystery (帝宸无极道)**.

**Repentance (忏悔)**.
**Reaffirmation of the Dao’s rank (重称法位)**.

We, the humble servants, in utmost sincerity,
Prostrate before the **Primordial Sovereign of Natural Void (虚无自然元始天尊)**,
The **Supreme Dao Lord (太上大道君)**,
The **Supreme Venerable Lord (太上老君)**,
The **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault (昊天玉皇上帝)**,
The **Nine Sovereigns of Truth (九皇上真)**,
The **Ten Directions’ Perfected Saints (十方已得道大圣)**,
The **众至真 (Crowd of Ultimate Truths)**,
The **Honored Masters (诸君丈人)**,
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of Mysterious Great Law (三十六部尊经玄中大法师)**,
The **Celestial Vault’s Rotating Symbols—Emperors of Sun, Moon, Stars, and the Northern Dipper (圆穹玄象、日月星辰、北斗尊帝)**,
The **Seven Celestial Ministers of the Five Elements (七元辅弼星君)**,
The **Southern Pole Emperor (南极大帝)**,
The **Honored Marshal (丈人司马)**,
The **Six Celestial Bureaus’ Star Lords (六司星君)**,
The **Native Star of Fate (本命元辰)**,
The **Immortal Peaks and Sacred Isles (洞天海岳)**,
The **Three Realms’ Officials (三界官属)**,
And **all True Spirits (一切真灵)**.

We humbly hear that the **Zen Patriarchs expounded teachings (禅黎演教)**,
Opening the gate to **ward off calamities and deliver from peril (开禳灾度厄)**;
That the **Jade Bureau transmitted scriptures (玉局传经)**,
Holding the **method to erase death and prolong life (有削死延生之法)**.

Thus, we follow the **ritual canons (遵依科教)**,
Establishing the **fasting altar (开建斋坛)**,
Inviting **Heaven’s blessings (迎集天祺)**,
Cleansing the **sand of time (被除时沙)**,
Extending **luminous fortune (上延景贶)**,
And **preventing lingering misfortunes (以弭余迍)**.

From the outset of our petition,
We declare the fast’s beginning,
To **propagate the Dao’s transformation (宣行於道化)**,
To **broadly benefit all (洪济於斯人)**,
To **prolong life eternally (延永命於无穷)**,
And to **fulfill sincerity with response (达至诚於有感)**.

Moreover, receiving this edict,
How dare we not report it above?

**Proclamation of the Petition:**
As the words are clear and our devotion sincere,

The **First Precept (第一戒)** is this:
One must not **place faith in false Dao (邪道)**,
Or **invoke demonic rites (祷祭魔法)** and **beg for extra blessings (谄求余福)**,
Letting oneself fall into **confusion and delusion (昏迷沉乱)**.
One must always **aspire to purity of body and mind (清净身心)**,
And **take refuge in the Great Dao (归依大道)**.

The **Second Precept (第二戒)** is this:
One must not **be disloyal or unfilial (不忠不孝)**,
Or **act unjustly or without compassion (不义不仁)**.
One must always **serve one’s superiors with reverence and diligence (恭勤事上)**,
And **treat others with kindness (慈爱接物)**,
Never forgetting the **Dao’s teachings (道训)**.

The **Third Precept (第三戒)** is this:
One must always **remember one’s ancestors and parents (累世父母)**,
And the **departed relatives (过去亲萝)**,
Who were **wrongfully killed by the Six Heavenly Demons (六天魔鬼)**,
Or **died before their time (未尽天年)**,
Or **were slain by violence (横被伤杀)**.
One must **return to orthodox teaching (归投正教)**,
And **rescue their tormented spirits (拔济幽魂)**,
So that **both the living and the dead (幽明存亡)**,
And **all beings (均)**,
May **share in the blessings (沾利泽)**.

The **Fourth Precept (第四戒)** is this:
On days when the **True Lord descends (真君降日)**,
One must not **include taboo characters (犯讳字)** within **memorial petitions (章奏)**.
Nor must one **offer early prayers for begging (烧奏早钱)**,
Or **burn incense with oil lamps and paper (油灯油纸)**,
For **all offerings must be made with proper reverence (焚热所奏)**.

The **Fifth Precept (第五戒)** is this:
On days when the **True Lord descends (真君降日)**,
One must not **consume pungent meats or flesh (食荤辛杂肉)**,
Nor **black carp (黑鲤鱼)**, **cloud-platform greens (云台菜)**, **barbarian’s wild horse (胡婪马)**, **toothed amaranth (齿苋)**, **garlic (大蒜)**, or **seven-star fish (七星鱼)**.
Nor must one **allow their breath and qi to come near these things (气息相近)**.

The **Sixth Precept (第六戒)** is this:
Women who have not yet reached **fifty years of age (五旬)**,
Must not **be allowed near the divine seat (近神座)**.
Nor must **servants or attendants (童仆)** whose **bodies emit foul qi (气息臭秽)**,
Be permitted to **approach the altar (诣前)**.
One must always **purify oneself (务蠲洁)**,
To **honor the True Lord above (以奉上真)**.

The **Seventh Precept (第七戒)** is this:
When **offering petitions to the True Lord’s spirit (奏对真灵)**,
One must not **face north while spitting or weeping (北向涕唾)**,
Nor **urinate or defile oneself uncleanly (旋溺不洁)**.

The *Yilong* [驿龙] couriers and mounted officers,
The golden youths and jade maidens of incense attendance,
The maidens who transmit words and scatter flowers,
The Five *Di* [帝]’s straight seals,
The *Zhiri* [直日] incense officials,
And the thirty-six in total, arrayed in procession.

**Procession Departure**
Those who depart must wear solemn attire and fine robes,
Their caps and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons,
Opening the *Xuan Tan* [玄坛] to the land spirits and domain deities.
I now, on this morning of the Pure Day, conduct the ritual,
And solemnly present this as my proclamation of intent.
My heartfelt petitions have been recorded and heard—
I wish to receive the *Taishang* [太上] Ten Directions’ *Zhidao* [至真] Dao *Qi* [炁],
The *Lingbao* [灵宝] radiance and auspicious light descending,
Flowing into my own body,
So that my words may swiftly reach and directly govern
The *Taishang* [太上] *Wujing* [无极] Great Dao,
And the *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven.

**Invocation of the Sacred Assembly**
I, [Disciple’s Name], along with the assembled officials of the platform,
Solemnly present our united sincerity:
To the *Taishang* [太上] *Wujing* [无极] Great Dao,
The *Yuan Shi* [元始] Heavenly Venerable,
The *Taishang* [太上] Great Dao *Jun* [君],
The *Taishang* [太上] Lao *Jun* [君],
The *Taishang* [太上] *Hao Tian* [昊天] *Yuhuang* [玉皇] Emperor of Heaven,
The Nine *Huang* [皇] Venerables,
The Ten Directions’ *Wujing* [无极],
The *Taishang* [太上] *Lingbao* [灵宝] Heavenly Venerable,
The *Yidao* [已道] Great Saints,
The myriad *Zhidao* [至真] and all Noble Ones,
The thirty-six divisions of sacred scriptures and profound *Zhong* [中] *Dafa* [大法],
The *Beiji* [北极] *Yousheng* [佑圣] *Zhenwu* [真武] *Lingying* [灵应] True *Jun* [君],
The responsive deities of the Three Realms,
And all True spirits.

I have heard that yin and yang alternate in succession,
And that the north alone bears the *Taiyin* [太阴] Dao *Qi* [炁];
That water and fire wax and wane in their own vigor,
Yet only the True *Jun* [君] embodies the essence of water’s position.
He governs the *Kan* [坎] officials of administration,
Assists the *Chenji* [宸极] in cosmic functions,
And completes the beginning and end of all things—
Overseeing the unfolding and contraction of transformative forces.
He aids the Emperor of Heaven in his *Taojin* [陶钧] crafting,
And encompasses the vital mechanisms of all spirits.

Sometimes he soars within the vast heavens,
Sometimes he lingers in the Five *Qi* [炁] realms,
His banner raised as the seas and mountains tremble,
His sword *Qi* [炁] surging as clouds and thunder resound.
The *Qin* [祆] mists are swept away by lightning,
His commands carried forth by the wind’s swift flight.
All who turn to him in reverence
Shall receive his manifest blessings.

I have purified the *Dantan* [坛度] platform,
And await the wind’s final descent.
With earnest devotion, I humbly receive his grace,
And stand in awe of the spirit’s transformative power.

Having received the sacred words,
How dare I not present them above?
**Proclamation of Words**
The words are carefully examined,
Their sincerity clearly seen.
Without relying on his luminous might,
How could I attain the *Jian* [戬] *Gu* [谷]?
I pray to be offered the *Pingfan* [苹蘩]’s sacred guidance,
So that I may follow Heaven and Earth’s benevolent will.

From the layered heavens, his auspicious *Qi* [炁] descends,
A shower of *De* [德] *Zi* [泽];
Through all the realms, his spirit winds fan forth,
Broadly spreading waves of mercy.
No spirit shall dare to offend,
Nor shall any ghost accuse!

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these first three strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Palace of Supreme Clarity, nourishing the manifested body of the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage, the Golden Gate Lord Lao, and the Three Pure Ones, the Jade Emperor of the Highest Sovereignty.

I humbly pray that the Great Dao may descend its benevolence in splendor, crowning the ranks of the Perfected with its auspicious grace, so that frontier beacons may shine brightly, blades may fall silent, and in court there be no ministers who deceive the sovereign or betray the state, while throughout the lands officials may govern with love for the people and loyalty to the realm. May there be no more bandits or rebellions, and may all enjoy the peace of *Shengping*.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Great Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these next two strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Northern Pole Bureau of Eternal Rites, nourishing the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage’s subordinate, the Star Lord of the Martial Chord, and the assembly of the Northern Pole Saints.

I humbly pray that you manifest your wondrous responses to spread far and wide, shining your sacred radiance afar, so that the officiant, this humble one’s ninth-generation ancestor seven generations back, may not be delayed at the nether gates. May my living father, now departed, be freed from all guilt. May the burdens of past-life enmity be severed, and the cries of ancestral lawsuits in the underworld be silenced. May the spirits of malevolent demons be bound, and the ghosts of the Six Peaks be beheaded. May the vast *Hongfan* qi be restored, and this people be eternally protected.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Great Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

At this pure dawn of the Dao’s practice, I respectfully invite the assembly of the Law to take these final three strands of incense and offer them upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the Divine Seat, nourishing the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage.

I humbly pray that you embody the Golden Gate’s resplendent might, serving as the primordial minister of the Jade Capital, patrolling with decisive authority, cutting off all inauspicious omens, so that the officiant, this humble one of the *Kan* mansion, may be freed from perilous calamities and endowed with the enlightened nature of Water’s virtue. May he, who has long studied the Cloud Research Scriptures with profound mastery and unmatched eloquence, swiftly ascend to the honors of officialdom, then stride upon the lofty path of prosperity. May he who lacks such study possess a firm Daoist root and a keen, luminous nature, so that in all his comings and goings, no external evils may cling to him, and in his rest and nourishment, no temporal illnesses may afflict him. May disasters melt away like ice, and blessings grow ever longer as the sun. May he who holds office flourish in his career, distinguished by his lofty virtue, swiftly receiving the honor of promotion to perilous posts, ascending to the favor of the exalted, so that the seas may look to his statesmanship and all officials may revere his weighty bearing.

Now, having offered this incense, I take refuge in the Virtue of the Teacher-Sage, the Perfected Assembly of the Most True. After attaining the Dao, I shall ascend to the Formless and harmonize with the True and the Way.

With renewed reverence, the humble official, this one, along with the assembled officiants, sincerely presents this petition to the Supreme Without Extremes, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Supreme Dao Lord, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Supreme Jade Emperor of the Highest Sovereignty, the Nine Sovereigns, the Ten Directions Without Extremes, the Supreme Spirit-Treasury Heavenly Venerable, the Perfected Saints who have attained the Dao, the Assembly of the Most True, all Revered Lords and Masters, the Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures and the Mystic Great Master of the Central Dao, the Northern Pole Auxiliary Saint, the Venerable and Responsive True Martial Sage, the Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits, and all True Essences.

I have heard that the mist of the Immortals drifts through the layered stages, granting those of worthy virtue the chariot of timely ascent; that the sacred grounds are opened with pure offerings, where the solemn rites are arranged in strict order. I have exhausted my humble devotion, relying on the divine presence to scrutinize me.

Yet, reflecting deeply, this humble officiant’s grasp of the Dao is shallow, his birth fraught with hardship, and he has recklessly burdened the workings of Transformation without benefiting the enlightened age. Navigating the world’s paths, he has endured countless perils, his name obscured by dust. He has always feared becoming one who toils diligently at the start but grows slack at the end, or who walks the world with many faults and few merits, or whose lifespan is not long, or whose foundation is not deep.

On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when the Supreme One expounds the Scriptures, and on the third day of the third month, when the Venerable Sage descends, my rites of offering have been deficient, and I have truly fallen into dread. In the years *Jiazi* and *Gengshen*, my prayers were sparse; to the Seven Elements and Four Saints, my reverence was delayed. I have dwelled in filth as my norm, partaken of meat and spice without restraint, approached the dying and the dead, and followed worldly customs, observing evil winds. Some have sought fleeting honors, indulging recklessly and bringing ruin upon their ancestors; others, relying on a single family’s wealth, have grown arrogant and licentious, incurring guilt before the underworld officials. There have been those who, without law, coveted wealth, or who, violating the Dao, sought advancement through improper means.

All these transgressions I now abandon, hoping to restore the divine favor. I humbly pray that you condescend to examine my sincerity, broadly extending the shelter of the Dao, so that this officiant’s household may flourish, with blessings and longevity ever increasing, his descendants multiplying and thriving, his spouse and he aging together in harmony, his granaries ever full and his gold and silk ever abundant. May he forever dispel unforeseen disasters and eternally preserve boundless life.

This disciple, this humble official, reflects once more: righteousness and heresy cannot coexist, and good and evil cannot walk together. Because the teachings of virtue have declined in the age, the ghosts of night have grown rampant. Those who revere the Dao are few, while those who believe in heresy are many. Due to the greed of the common folk, desiring sudden wealth for their households, they fawn upon wasteful spirits, plundering their neighbors, gorging on blood in their starving bellies, and displaying monstrous transformations in the night. Some hurl tiles and stones from emptiness, while others, taking advantage of the dark, steal wealth. Some mock the spirits of the dead, and often the deceitful nature of ghosts is exposed.

This disciple, this humble official, further reflects: some harm the young and innocent, while at times they manifest as terrifying seizures and convulsions. Others blow upon the mouth to create sounds and call out people’s names, or knock upon doors and pound on gates to disturb their dwellings. Some scatter filth in chaotic disorder, while others linger around food trays, feasting without restraint. Some send false dreams in sleep to deceive, or summon the departed to wreak havok. Others display wealth to win favor, or set fires to cause alarm.

Indeed, these most vile **Xie Dao** (邪道) heresies thrive in the mortal world. Without fail, I shall uncover all secrets, and I pray to ride upon the **Liuhuo Bell** (流火之铃) to strike. No crime shall go unpunished, and I shall spare no retribution, even if it be as vast as the **Great Heaven’s** (巨天) execution.

I shall carry out the **Taishang’s** (太上) command and uphold the **Zhenjun’s** (真君) authority. Let no land dare to withhold its offerings—first, I shall dispatch the **Yin soldiers** (阴兵) to slay and behead.

I shall cut off the hundred heresies’ (百邪) rampant harm and deliver all beings to safety and peace. With the **Magu** (魔精) spirits extinguished and the **Huosi** (火死) flames reduced to ash, disasters shall vanish like clouds dispersing and mists scattering.

May all hearts reverently pray, and may this humble offering be their refuge. Above, I honor the **Heavenly Sovereign’s** (天尊) boundless compassionate grace; below, I align with my officials’ sincere devotion. I respectfully submit this petition.

**The Twelve Vows** (十二願).
**Reverently Rekindle the Furnace** (复炉).
Respectfully, I command the **Fragrant Officials and Messengers** (香官使者), the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals** (左右龍虎君), and the **Attendant Spirits of Incense** (侍香諸靈官): they shall cause this humble official’s offerings, made at the dawn of each clear day, to spontaneously produce **Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** (金液丹碧), **Herbs and Spirits of a Hundred Kinds** (芝英百靈), and gather all the **Perfected Ones** (衆真) at this furnace of incense.

May the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens** (十方仙童玉女) attend to the fragrant vapors and swiftly convey this humble official’s petition to the **Supreme Ultimate Great Dao’s** (無極大道) and the **Celestial Jade Emperor’s** (昊天玉皇上帝) presence.

**Exit the Hall and Proclaim** (出堂頌).
**Exit the Door** (出戸).

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume Sixty-Six**
*Three Caverns Scripture and Talisman: Disciple’s Vows of Aspiration*
**The Grand Ritual of True Martial’s Responsive Virtue (真武灵应大醮仪)**

**At the Hour of Wu (临午行道):**
The ritual ascends the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
The **Sacred Guards’ Incantations** (卫灵咒) are proclaimed:

**To the Northern Void, the Dark and Mysterious Lord (玄天杳杳神君):**
With myriad transformations, the **Mysterious Tortoise’s Perfected Spirit** (玄武灵真) unfurls—
Ascending the heavens, overturning the earth, driving thunder and dispersing clouds.
With legions numbering ten thousand, sweeping away the miasma of demons.
**Thunder Lords** attend, **Jade Maidens** command—
Ghosts and spirits cower, dragons and tigers flee in haste.
The Five Peaks tremble, all spirits obey.
The **Celestial Bell and War Drum** resound, traversing heaven and earth.
Hunting rogue ghosts, shattering demonic souls,
Expelling evil and aiding the righteous—
The **Dao-qi** ever ascends, harmonizing with the True.
**The Law-Drum is struck twenty-four times.**

**The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin-qi (三炁),**
The **Most High Dao Lord (太上道君),**
The **Most High Laozi (太上老君),**
Summon forth from within this humble servant:
The **Three Five Functionaries (三五功曹),**
The **Left and Right Officials and Messengers (左右官使者),**
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers (左右捧香),**
The **Relay Dragon Cavalry Clerks (驿龙骑吏),**
The **Attendant Golden Boys (侍香金童),**
The **Speech-Bearing, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens (传言散花玉女),**
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans (五帝直符),**
The **Direct-Day Incense Officials (直日香官)—**
A total of **Thirty-Six** emerge.

Those who depart are adorned in solemn, radiant attire,
Their headgear and sashes trailing ribbons.
They open the **Void Altar’s Land and Domain Spirits (玄坛土地),**
The **Territorial Deities and Perfected Ones (方域神真).**

At this hour of Wu, as the ritual commences,
This humble servant respectfully petitions to declare intent:
With sincerity unshaken, already recorded and reported,
May the **Most High’s Ten Directions’ Perfected Dao-qi (十方至真道炁),**
The **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light (灵宝瑞光),**
Descend and flow into this humble servant’s body,
That what is petitioned may swiftly reach the presence of
The **Most High’s Supreme Ultimate Dao (無極大道)**
And the **Celestial Jade Emperor (昊天玉皇上帝).**

**The Law-Position is invoked.**
This humble servant of such-and-such rank, together with the assembled officials,
Solemnly and sincerely petition above:
To the **Most High’s Supreme Ultimate Dao (無極大道),**
The **Primordial Heavenly Venerable (元始天尊),**
The **Most High Dao Lord (太上大道君),**
The **Most High Laozi (太上老君),**
The **Most High Celestial Jade Emperor (太上昊天玉皇上帝),**
The **Nine Sovereigns Most Exalted (九皇上尊),**
The **Ten Directions’ Supreme Ultimate (十方無極),**
The **Most High Sacred Treasure Heavenly Venerable (太上灵宝天尊),**
The **Already Dao-Realized Great Saints (已得道大圣),**
The **All-Perfected Spirits (衆至真),**
The **All Noble Lords (諸君丈人),**
The **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scripture Masters of the Mysterious Middle (三十六部尊经玄中大法师),**
The **North Pole’s Auxiliary Saint, True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord (北极佑圣真武灵应真君),**
The **Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits (三界应感),**
And **All True Spirits (一切真灵).**

This humble servant has heard:
That which sustains life and origins,
All things derive from the **Two Principles (二仪).**
With **righteousness and wisdom (有义有知),**
Humans are the most enlightened of all creatures.
The **Nine Heavens unite in virtue (九天合德),**
The **Three Caverns manifest form (三洞化形).**
The **Three Myriad Six Thousand spirits** all come to guard and assist,
The **Three Hundred Sixty bones and joints** are all harmoniously connected.

Yet, through **obstinate delusion and false paths**, the True is obscured;
Through **deep-rooted malevolence**, goodness is blotted out.
When the **cycles of yin and yang are exhausted,**
And the **eons of great and small calamities conclude,**
Demons proliferate, cutting short humanity’s allotted span;
Seeking false blessings, all fall into **perverted, foolish ignorance.**
They do not reflect upon their **original nature**—
Following **evil paths**, they suffer **confusion and chaos,**
Lacking **loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness.**
Though not yet their destined time of death,
They are struck down by the **Six Heavens’ injuries and killings;**
Sudden loss of life brings forth **the grievances of the multitudes.**
The young and old do not fulfill their natural years,
Their souls drift, bereft in the mortal realm.
Thus, the **impure qi** swirls in tangled knots,
While the **True One’s form** finds no refuge.

To alleviate the **lower realm’s suffering and distress,**
We rely upon the **True Martial’s Divine Lord (真武神君).**
Severing demonic essences, rescuing lost souls,
We wield the **Compassionate Sovereign’s might,**
Commanding **ten thousand armies,**
To slay demons and exterminate evil—
Thus the **Four Quarters are purified,**
The **Three Lights shine pristine,**
The **True Law flourishes,**
The **Evil qi dissipates,**
Restoring **peace to the world,**
Dissolving the **people’s doubts,**
Bringing **eternal tranquility to all nations,**
Silencing the **Nine Abysses’ accusations.**
The **Divine Function’s grace** extends,
Reliance upon it spans **ten thousand eons.**

The **Ritual Disciple**, though unworthy, has long partaken of the **True Shade (真荫),**
Yet dwells in the dusty world.
Ever contemplating **auspicious deeds of virtue,**
Dedicated to the **rites of the True.**
As a humble grass-and-thatch mortal,
Only harboring **loyal devotion;**
As a fleeting ant’s life,
Ever grateful for **the river’s flow of grace.**
Drowned in the years of neglect,
Unable to repay this light—
Thus, at this **auspicious hour of the Holy Dew’s birth (诞圣涓吉辰),**
A **Ritual of Welcoming Auspiciousness (迎祥之醮)** is specially established.
With **Daoist companions**, we humbly thank the **Northern Spirit (北灵),**
Revering the **Supreme Symbol’s Exalted One (上象之尊),**
Daring not to neglect the **Square Enclosure’s petition (方函之奏).**
Though the **sincere words may follow ancient forms,**
The **divine principles defy full comprehension—**
Our **devout supplications** arise from **precise intent.**
May the **whirlwind’s swift passage** pause,
And the **Heavenly Sovereign** look down upon this **crimson sincerity.**
This disciple’s **green petition** shall be duly presented.

**The Petition is Proclaimed:**
As the words declare, the sincerity is profound and devoted.
Gazing back upon the **Five Clouds’ Seat,**
Where **Hundred Harmonies’ smoke ascends,**
The **Heavenly Emperor and Perfected Ones** gather,
As at the **Upper Primordial Hall (上元之殿);**
The **Northern Capital’s Sovereign** leads,
Advancing toward the **Eight Scenic Palaces (八景之宫).**
The **Lofty Pavilion stands solemn in the void,**
The **Celestial Music drifts ethereal in the Azure Void (碧落),**
The **Perfected Ones attend in ranks,**
The **Demons bind their forms in submission—**
How dare we not **exert utmost sincerity,**
**Reverently prostrate in devotion,**
Hoping to receive the **Heavenly Sovereign’s favor,**
That **the family and nation may prosper.**

At this hour of Wu, as the ritual commences,
We request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **first incense-twist,**
That this **incense-smoke may ascend directly to the Pure Clarity Palace (太清宫),**
Offering to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord’s manifested form (真武灵应真君所化之身),**
To the **Golden Threshold’s Laozi (金阙老君),**
To the **Three Pure Ones Most Holy (三清上圣),**
And the **Jade Emperor (玉皇上帝).**

This humble servant **surrenders body, spirit, and fate,**
And with this **incense-twist’s merit,**
We pray for the **Current Emperor’s blessings:**
May his **virtue spread across the Eight Seas,**
His **lifespan equal the Two Principles (二仪).**
Like the **glory of sun and moon,**
Illuminating without end;
May his **boundless virtue encompass heaven and earth,**
Covering all beneath the vault of heaven.

The hundred affairs are in order, the three borders at peace,
A thousand spears laid aside, all bearing children return home.
The year’s bows and hooks are hung away,
Mountain paths open of their own accord.
Ice-silk divine beasts cross the seas to our gates.
All living things move with vitality, all ascend to benevolent longevity.

Now, we burn incense to return and take refuge in the **Dao-Honored Great Saints’ Most Authentic Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend into the Formless,
Harmonizing with the True and merging with the Way.

With today’s midday ritual, we request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **second incense-twist**,
That this incense-smoke may ascend directly to the **Northern Pole’s Eternal Office (北极太常府)**,
To offer to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord’s subordinate, the Martial Chord Star Lord (武曲星君)**,
And the **Northern Pole’s Sacred Assembly**.
We surrender body, spirit, and fate,
And with this incense-twist’s merit,
We dedicate to the **certain household of the Dao’s transmission**—
Nine generations of divine rites,
A hundred million ancestral spirits,
Freed from endless night, ascending to behold the radiant light.
Shining in the **Court of the Vermilion Dan**,
Ascending to the **Palace of Piercing Brightness**,
With celestial robes gleaming in splendor,
Our names inscribed in the **Immortal Registers**,
Bestowing blessings upon descendants,
Partaking in the **True Celestial Realm**.

Now, we burn incense to return and take refuge in the **Sutra-Honored Great Saints’ Most Authentic Virtue**.
After attaining the Dao, we ascend into the Formless,
Harmonizing with the True and merging with the Way.

With today’s midday ritual, we request the **Law-Assembled** to kindle the **third incense-twist**,
That this incense-smoke may ascend directly to the **Divine Seat**,
To offer to the **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord**.
We surrender body, spirit, and fate,
And with this incense-twist’s merit,
We dedicate to the **certain household of the Dao’s transmission**—
Six kinships and nine clans,
All relations bound by fate,
All attaining auspicious connections,
Ever under the Dao’s protection,
Secretly dispelling guilt and calamity,
Silently resolving disasters and entanglements,
Debts and lawsuits settled in harmony,
Grudges and enmities reconciled.
Wicked men and malevolent ghosts lack schemes to harm;
Dark omens and black talismans avoid their doomed influence.

The **Divine Seat’s True Martial** bestows protection and auspiciousness in all actions.
With today’s incense-burning, we humbly dedicate ourselves to the **Law-Assembled**’s **True Martial’s Responsive Perfected Lord**—
The **Virtue/Power of the Supreme True**,
Which, after attaining the **Dao/Way**, ascends to the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao/Way’s True Essence**.

We repeat the **Law’s sacred rank** in earnest.
**Official Certain** and the **Assembled Officials of the Ritual Platform**, with sincere devotion, jointly petition:
The **Supreme Way of the Limitless**, the **Heavenly Sovereign of Primordial Beginnings**,
The **Supreme Lord of the Great Dao**, the **Supreme Sage of the Lao**,
The **Supreme Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heavenly Sovereign**,
The **Nine Sovereigns Above**,
The **Ten Directions of the Limitless**,
The **Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure**,
The **Perfected Saints of the Dao** who have already attained the **Dao/Way**,
The **Assembled True Martial of the Supreme Law**,
All **Responsive Perfected Lords**,
And the **True Spirits of the Three Realms**.

We, the **Officials**, have heard of the **Responsive Perfected Lord’s** miraculous birth and deeds,
And we beseech guidance from the **Wondrous Practices**;
We, the **Officials**, have heard of the **Wicked Qis** stirring up calamities,
And we pray to sever and remove the **Malevolent Spirits** that once relied on the **Responsive Perfected Lord’s** **威神** (awe-inspiring spirit).

In the **endless age**, we fear the **proliferation of disasters**,
As the **host of demons** grows ever more rampant.
They dare to raise **noxious qi**,
Disturbing the **virtuous folk**;
They seek to **purge and cleanse**,
Yet only deepen the **suppressed grief** of the people.

The **Officials** humbly reflect:
Beneath the **urban settlements and suburbs**, the **malevolent spirits** take refuge;
Between the **mountains, rivers, forests, and valleys**, the **precise souls** dwell.
Some cling to **thin groves and sparse clusters**,
Others roam freely in the **sandy shallows**.
With **wind howling and rain shrieking**, they raise **grievous cries** across the **four wilds**;
When **clouds gather and moonlight wanes**, they emit **phosphorescent flames** in the **midnight hours**.
If one encounters these **wicked ones**, one’s **true life** will surely be harmed.
Some fall into **ravines and gullies**,
Others meet **blades and axes** at the **sharp edge**.
Some **leap into fire or wade through rivers**, acting in **madness or epilepsy**;
Others **endure bitterness and swallow acidity**, forever haunted by **fear and dread**.

The **Officials** deeply dread that all **living beings of the world** may suffer such torments,
And we earnestly hope the **Perfected Lords** will not betray their **vows**,
But **unfurl their numinous might**,
Driving these **malevolent demons** back to **emptiness and stillness**,

**Obtaining the True Wind’s grace** [得被真风],
**Clad in the True Texts of the Three Caverns** [披三洞之真文],
**And bearing the Jade Inspectors of the Nine Pure** [奉九清之玉检].
Morning and evening, **I rise in purity and retire in vigilance** [晨兴蠲洁，夕惕修持],
For since **receiving the Dao** [受道之初],
I have **pledged to cultivate virtue as my foundation** [约以建功为本].

Again, **I solemnly present my humble petitions** [再肃威仪於清夜，恭陈凡悃於紫宸],
**Gazing upon the True Dao’s Essence** [瞻望真斿],
**Guiding and welcoming the Auspicious Scenery** [导迎景贶],
**To pray for divine oversight** [将祈监盻],
**And offer my pure and precise ritual** [用副斋精],
**With sincere Daoist words** [行道词诚],
**Devotedly presented for proclamation** [谨当宣奏].

**Proclaim the words** [宣词].
**Carefully examine the language and perceive the sincerity** [谛详词语，灼见诚情].
**Trusting in the Dao’s True Compassion** [谅叶真慈],
**It will surely be attended to by the Holy Oversight** [必关圣监].

**I, [Certain Daoist of the Orthodox Unity]**, **have encountered this fortunate era** [叨逢景运],
**And obtained the reverence of the True Lineage** [获仰真宗].
I **owe the vast grace of the Sacred Master** [荷圣主之洪恩],
**And have entered the Daoist path** [出家入道];
I **have received the compassionate blessings of the Celestial Lord** [沐天尊之慈泽],
**And have purified my resolve to cultivate** [洁志修行].
I **wear the Sacred Texts** [佩受灵文],
**And have studied the Mysterious Teachings** [禀修玄教],
Yet **I have not yet attained the subtle perfection of the Dao** [未造冲玄之妙],
**And my practice has fallen short** [有亏习炼之功].
**My faults are evident** [罪目易彰],
**And the fields of merit are hard to construct** [福田难构].
**Through sincere devotion, I present my doubts** [用专诚而荐疑],
**Hoping to be guided by my transgressions** [庶引咎以自新],
**And solemnly purify the altar and ritual space** [恭祓坛场，精严醮席].

**Following the Three Caverns’ format of burning and cultivating** [法三洞焚修之格],
**And observing the Ten Directions’ rituals of morning and evening** [披十华朝会之仪],
**I recite the sacred sounds** [演畅法音],
**And expound upon the vast rituals** [敷扬大范].
**All Heavens attend in unison** [莫不诸天齐到],
**The Five Emperors speak in order** [五帝列言],
**And the merits of my devotion are recorded and rewarded** [赏录功勤],
**With the promise of swift response** [克期通感].

**With this evening Dao practice** [以今落景行道],
I **request the assembled ritual spirits** [请法众等] to **take this first offering of incense** [运兹初捻上香].
I pray that this **incense smoke** [香烟]—
**Ascends directly to the heavens** [腾空径上]—
To **offer homage to the Nine Grades of High Worthies** [供养九品高真],
And the **Ten Directions’ Most Holy** [十方上圣].

I and the **multitude of officials** [臣等] **return my body, my spirit, and my life** [皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits** [以是功德]—
To **bless the current Emperor** [上祝今上皇帝].

**Humbly praying** [伏愿]:
That the **Heaven of Yao** [尧天] **may spread its vast coverage** [广覆],
And the **Sun of Shun** [舜日] **may increase its brilliance** [增明].
That **life may be preserved, its foundation unshaken** [保生延不拔之基],
And the **Five Sacred Mountains may be fortified** [五山巩固];
That **the Lord of Life may grant boundless longevity** [司命益无疆之寿],
And **my lifespan may stretch across countless eons** [历劫绵长].
That the **nation may be secure and its people prosperous** [国安民丰],
**Rejoicing in the era of great peace** [欣乐乎太平之世];
That **I may be loyal and my children filial** [臣忠子孝],
**And we may foster harmony in the years of abundance** [敦睦乎大有之年].
That **wild beasts may be subdued and evil paths avoided** [懈豸触邪],
And **the crooked may be bent while the treacherous are struck** [屈轶指佞].
That **auspicious clouds may appear and celestial omens manifest** [庆云呈瑞，景曜示祥].
That the **Heavenly Might may shake the herds of dogs and sheep** [天威振犬羊之群],
And the **Five Armies may be at peace** [五兵战戢];
That the **Earthly Realm may restore the breadth of its boundaries** [土宇复关河之广],
And the **Nine Territories may share the same script** [九域同文].

**This incense-burning ritual** [今故烧香] **is performed in reverence for the Dao Lord’s Most Holy and True Worthies** [自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I **ascend to the realm of Non-Action** [升入无为],
And **harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence** [和与道合真].

**With this evening Dao practice** [以今落景行道],
I **request the assembled ritual spirits** [请法众等] to **take this second offering of incense** [运兹二捻上香].
I pray that this **incense smoke** [香烟]—
**Ascends directly to the heavens** [腾空径上]—
To **offer homage to the Nine Grades of High Worthies** [供养九品高真],
And the **Ten Directions’ Most Holy** [十方上圣].

I and the **multitude of officials** [臣等] **return my body, my spirit, and my life** [皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits** [以是功德]—
To **flow back to my Daoist household** [归流道士某家],
Where the **Nine Mysteries may dissolve my ignorance** [九玄滞识],
And the **Seven Ancestors’ Sacred Rituals** [七祖神仪]—
**All may accept the boundless grace** [咸承浩荡之恩],
And **together attain the fruit of effortless transcendence** [并证逍遥之果].

**The Vermilion Terrace and Crimson Gate** [丹台绛阙]—
**I may serve the Jade Sovereign** [景侍玉皇],
And the **Cloud Palaces and Mist Pavilions** [霞殿云房]—
**I may attend the Celestial Emperor’s court** [亲朝大帝].
I may **listen to the Celestial Balance’s harmony and find self-realization** [听天钧而自得],
**And chant the Great Cavern’s scriptures to forget worldly cares** [吟大洞以忘机].
**Grace extends without end** [惠被无涯],
**And blessings are bestowed upon future generations** [福资来裔].」

「The Three Teachers and Four Companions,
All ascend the **Celestial Stages** [仙阶];
The Nine Nights and Three Paths,
All attain the **Daoist fruits** [道果].

Now I burn incense,
**To take refuge in the Sutra-Honored Great Saints** [经尊大圣], **seeking the Perfect Virtue of the Most Authentic Ones** [众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I rise into the **Formless** [无形],
And **harmony aligns with the True Dao** [和与道合真].
With my present **falling into the luminous Dao** [落景行道],
I **invite the Law-Bearing Assembly** [请法众等] to carry this **three-pinched incense** [三捻上香],
**May these incense fumes ascend directly to the heavens** [愿此香烟，腾空径上],
**To venerate the Nine Grades of Supreme Celestial Ones** [供养九品上仙], **and the Most Venerable Saints of the Ten Directions** [十方上圣].
**We devote our bodies, spirits, and lives** [臣等皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits**
[以是功德]—
**To flow back into Daoist Certain One’s life** [归流道士某身中].
**Humbly wishing the Dao-nature be perfectly illuminated** [伏愿道性圆明], **and the Sacred Heart be revealed**.
**May our actions meet no obstacles** [行运不逢於坎坷], **and our appearance remain forever youthful** [相貌长新];
**May our years forever avoid calamity and decline** [流年永绝於凶衰], **and the spirits and gods shield and bless us** [鬼神荫佑].
**May joy and anger not linger within our hearts** [喜怒不留於胸臆],
And **our vital essence be steadfast within the elixir field** [精神内固於丹田].
**Nurturing vastness like spring’s renewal** [养浩如春],
**May we dwell in this world with a youthful, immortalized body** [住世生身之难老];
**With an empty heart attuned to the Dao** [虚心契道],
**May we transcend the mundane and enter the sacred, enduring forever** [超凡入圣以长存].

Now I burn incense,
**To take refuge in the Teacher-Honored Great Saints** [师尊大圣], **seeking the Perfect Virtue of the Most Authentic Ones** [众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I rise into the **Formless** [无形],
And **harmony aligns with the True Dao** [和与道合真].
**Repentance** [忏方], **subduing the demon of life** [命魔], **walking the void** [步虚]—
**Three reverences** [三礼].
**Repeatedly proclaiming the sacred ranks** [重称法位].
**The assembled officials and I**, in solemn sincerity, **now make this offering**:
[具位臣某与合坛众官等，谨重诚上启]
To **Primordial Heavenly Lord of Natural Voidness** [虚无自然元始天尊],
**Supreme Daoist Lord** [太上大道君],
**Supreme Old Lord** [太上老君],
**Celestial Jade Emperor of Highest Heaven** [昊天玉皇上帝],
**Gouchen, the Heavenly Sovereign Emperor** [勾陈天皇大帝],
**Purple Microdipper Emperor of the Northern Pole** [北极紫微上帝],
**Empress Hou Tu, the Earthly Sovereign who Upholds the Dao and Follows the Law** [承天效法后土皇地祇],
**Heavenly Lord of the Three Treasures of Daoist Scripture** [道经师三宝天尊],
**The Most Authentic Ones who span the highest vault** [上穷圆盖之高真],
**And the sovereigns who rule the four cardinal directions** [下极方舆之主宰],
**The arrayed deities of the ritual feast** [醮筵列圣],
**And all true spirits** [一切真灵].
**Reverently beholding their boundless compassion** [恭望洪慈],
And **their penetrating insight and clear discernment** [洞回昭鉴].
**We humbly hear that the primordial chaos is vast and boundless** [臣等伏闻混沦荡荡],
**Ever-changing yet without measure, and it alone is the first principle** [变通莫得而为先].」

「The radiant **Mángjué** [芒角] stars mark the moment when the primordial chaos was opened and the **Pì** [辟] was thus distinguished.
The **Huángrén** [皇人] transmitted this through the **Great Brahman** [大梵], and the **later sages** [后圣] compiled it in the **divine diagrams** [灵图].
The grand symbol was established, and the vast source was first distinguished.
When **scattered**, it illuminates the **Three Manifestations** [开明三景]; when **settled below**, it spreads the **Five Classics** [下镇则敷落五篇].
The **imperial edicts** [典诰] flow abundantly, and the **profound mysteries** [渊微] are widely disseminated—
All deities respectfully listen, and all beings derive their blessings.
We, the humble disciples, born with utmost stupidity,
Devoted to the **highest learning** [上学],
Following the **mysterious teachings** [玄教],
And confronting the **Supreme Truths** [上真],
Have since receiving our **Daoist precepts** [命] striven to cultivate our bodies,
Ever adorning ourselves and diligently practicing our studies.
Though we have **roughly grasped** [粗识] the **golden scriptures and jade decrees** [金文玉札] from the **fishing nets and hoofprints** [筌蹄],
We have never **glimpsed** [莫窥] the **sacred realms and celestial stages** [圣域仙阶].

Only through **sincere faith and unwavering trust** [坚诚信信],
Do we hope to **attain divine communion** [冀获感通],
For **the True Pattern** [真格] will be revealed,
And the **august spirits** [尊灵] will surely descend.

A **Daoist practitioner** [道士] of humble station,
Residing in the **Daoist domain** [道域],
Seeking shelter under the **celestial truths** [霄真],
Yet unable to **sever ties with the dusty world** [谢绝於尘寰],
Still **entangled in worldly snares** [沉迷於世网].
Though we **recite scriptures and bear precepts** [参经佩戒],
Our resolve is **insufficiently driven** [虽加策励之心];
Though we **practice secret virtues and hidden merits** [密行阴功],
Our strength remains **lacking in advancement** [尚缺进修之力].
Our **natural aptitude** [机灵] is **obscured** [素昧],
And we have yet to **attain all virtues** [众善弗臻].
Our **habitual tendencies** [习气] are not yet **cleansed** [未除],
And we are **constantly entangled in karmic causes** [诸缘常染].

We have **delved into the minute practices** [细行] of the **Eight Hundred Schools** [八百],
Yet **no guiding principle** [未见指归] has been revealed;
We have **assembled the full array of ritual decorum** [威仪备列] of the **Three Thousand Precepts** [三千],
Yet **no true diligence** [曾无精进] has been achieved.
Our **karmic roots** [业根] are **deeply entrenched** [深固],
And the **fruition of the Dao** [道果] is **difficult to attain** [难成].
We have not yet **entered the gate of enlightenment** [未登悟解之门],
Lest we **fall into the obstructions of worldly toil** [恐堕尘劳之障].

Now, we **prostrate ourselves at the feet of the Most High** [首体投地],
Morning and evening **reporting to Heaven** [晨夕告天],
Examining the **clear precepts** [稽按明科],
And **earnestly presenting the pure ritual feast** [严陈净醮].
We **open the jade scripture** [经开玉笈],
And **establish the golden ritual** [像礼金容].
The **celestial harmonies** [灵音] resound within the **emptiness of the cosmos** [振空洞之章],
And the **common folk** [黎土] gather the **jewels of the assembly** [集宝珠之众].

The **fragrance** [香] is conveyed through the **seven stations** [七驿],
Reaching the **sincere devotion** [达诚悃] of the **Heavenly Sovereign** [虚皇];
The **lamps** [灯] shine brightly in the **Nine Celestial Regions** [九微],
Dispelling the **darkness and obscurity** [破幽昏] of the **nightly abyss** [夜壑].
We **fulfill our aspirations for profound cultivation** [曲尽黑修之志],
And **do not neglect our morning praises** [不违朝赞之勤].
To **harmonize with the True Spirits** [格真灵],
And **achieve resonance with the Radiant Responses** [克谐昭应],
All deities attend as **guardians** [万神侍卫],
And the **Three Realms** [三界] observe as **sentinels** [监观].
We **petition the Mysterious Capital** [奏简玄都],
And **address the Red Celestial Throne** [列言丹陛].

Humbly awaiting the **imperial decree** [勅] descending to the **Three Realms** [三界],
We **universally proclaim to all heavens** [普告诸天],
Seeking **blessings and benevolent flow** [降福流恩],
And **prolonging life while safeguarding existence** [延生保命].
May **wisdom penetrate and profound enlightenment endure** [智通玄悟],
And **eternally dispel our ignorance** [永息昏迷].
May **rich rewards and long lifespan** [厚禄遐龄] be ours,
And may we **always dwell under the protection of the Law** [常居法荫].
May **harmony and peace dissolve grievances and debts** [和平冤咎],
And **dissipate calamities and misfortunes** [消解灾凶].
May the **Five Phases** [五行] suffer **no destructive or oppressive calamities** [无刑克之殃],
And the **Three Manifestations** [三景] cease **illuminating the gatherings of misfortune** [息照临之会].

May we **resolve the celestial afflictions** [上解] of the **Lunar Lodges and Solar Stations** [璇玑天文宿曜十二分次之厄],
And **dispel the terrestrial disasters** [下解] of the **mountains, rivers, and cosmic divisions** [山川岳渎九宫八卦分野之灾].
May **ancient sins and accumulated offenses** [夙罪积愆],
**Deep calamities and heavy retributions** [深殃重衅],
**Past grievances and debts incurred** [前冤往债],
And **wrongful killings and unintended injuries** [故杀误伤],
As well as the **endless transgressions of the Three Karmas and Six Emotions** [三业六情],
All be **expiated from this day forth** [自今忏谢],
And **universally cleansed** [咸乞荡除].

Our **uppermost aspiration** [上愿] is that the **Imperial Dao** [帝道] may **forever be secure and flourishing** [永安洪基益茂],
And that the **Three Lights** [三光] may **shine brightly** [朗照],
While the **Four Seasons** [四序] are **harmoniously regulated** [均调].
May it **encompass the vast seas of Shùn** [包舜海以涵濡],
And **broaden the radiant light of Yáo** [广尧曦而照烛].
May the **Five Winds and Ten Rains** [五风十雨]
**Ever nourish the abundance of all things** [常滋物产之丰];
And may the **Eight Grains and Nine Silkworms** [八谷九蚕]
**Greatly benefit the hopes of farmers** [大足农民之望].

May the **qi** [气] be **without errant influence** [无缪盭],
And the **Year of the Hare** [岁兔] be **free from calamitous mists** [灾氛].
May this **extend to all living beings** [普及群生],
And **benefit the Nine Realms** [旁资九有].
May we **fulfill the Daoist path of inheritance** [成承道果],
And **all attain the True Vehicle** [俱契真乘].
Thus, we **acknowledge the Most High’s compassionate transformation** [上明天尊大慈之化],
And **align with the disciple’s sincere repentance** [下副弟子谢罪之诚].
We **respectfully submit this prayer** [谨启以闻].

**Twelve Aspirations** [十二愿] **completed.**
**Returning to the furnace** [复炉].

We **solemnly gather** [谨摄] the **fragrance officers and envoys** [香官使者],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** [左右龙虎君],
And the **attendant spirits of incense** [侍香诸灵官].
They shall **guide us to the places of our past transgressions** [当令臣向来落景行道之所],
Where **golden nectar and azure jade** [自然生金液丹碧],
**Mushrooms and herbs of a hundred spirits** [芝英百灵],
And **all True Ones** [众真] will **converge in assembly** [交会],
At this **incense and fire furnace** [在此香火炉前].

May we **wish that the Ten Directions of Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女]
**Attend to the fragrant vapors** [接侍兰烟],
And **transmit our sincere prayers** [传臣向来所启之诚]
**Swiftly to the Supreme Dao of the Boundless Ultimate** [径御至真无极大道]—
Before the **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Clarity** [昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Exiting the hall to chant** [出堂颂].
**Exiting the door** [出户].」

**Striking the Daoist drum twenty-four times** [《鸣法鼓二十四通》].

The **Supreme Three Heavens** [《无上三天》], **Primordial Heavenly Sovereign of the Mysterious Three** [《玄元始三炁》],
**The Most High Dao Lord** [《太上道君》],
**The Most High Old Lord** [《太上老君》],
Now **summon forth** from my body:

The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** [《左右龙虎君》],
The **Left and Right Attendants of Incense** [《左右捧香》],
The **Waystation Dragon and Mounted Officials** [《驿龙骑吏》],
The **Incense-Serving Golden Boys** [《侍香金童》],
The **Jade Maidens who Scatter Flowers and Transmit Messages** [《传言散花玉女》],
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** [《五帝直符》],
The **Incense Officials who Guide the True Sun** [《直日香官》],

Those who **exit** shall **don formal attire and display their rank**, **headdress and trailing ribbons** [《出者严装显服，冠带垂缨》],

**Solemnly offering my sincere prayers** [《谨奉为入意》].
All my **true and earnest sentiments** [《诸情悃》] have been **recorded and respectfully presented** [《已录奉闻》].
I pray that the **Supreme True Daoists of the Ten Directions** [《十方至真道炁》],
**The Sacred Treasures and Auspicious Light** [《灵宝瑞光》],
May **descend and flow into my body** [《下降，流入臣身中》],
So that my **prayers may swiftly reach** the **Most High Dao of the Boundless Ultimate** [《太上无极大道》],
And the **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Clarity** [《昊天玉皇上帝》] before.

**Requesting the invocation of the Daoist ranks** [《请称法位》].
I, **a humble servant of such-and-such rank** [《具位臣某》], together with the **assembled officials of the Ritual Platform** [《与合坛众官等》],
**Solemnly and sincerely present our prayers** [《谨同诚上启》],
To the **Three Pure Ones and Most Sacred** [《三清上圣》],

**Eastward Repentance for the Sin of Not Knowing the Dao**

We, the humble Daoists bearing talismans, humbly hear that wood arises from the Three [Heavenly Stems], taking form beneath Heaven and Earth; the Sovereign emerges from *Zhen* [Thunder], nurturing all things in *Tun-Meng* [Difficulty and Obscurity]. The Azure Dragon governs the first key of the year, the Big Dipper marks the beginning of celestial passage, and the Minor Yang presides with boundless virtue beyond naming.

Now, we, the Daoists of such-and-such lineage, have long practiced purity in cultivation. In this lifetime, blessed by the Teacher’s grace, we have received transmission and uphold the teachings with reverence. Yet, we remain ashamed of our shallow roots and obstructed spiritual source.

Though we walk the Dao, we do not know it truly;
Though we nurture the form, we cannot forget it.
We move, yet cling to appearances.
Some boast in idle speech, self-satisfied;
Others hear the Dao yet grasp it faintly—now present, now absent.
Between wealth and poverty, we fail to equalize all things;
At the touch of joy, anger, likes, and dislikes, we burn with discord.

How then do we mingle with Heaven and humanity in the same path,
Realize the unity of birth and death,
Betray the Great Sage’s nurturing virtue,
Defy the Mysterious Teacher’s transformative precepts?
Thus, we are recorded in the Three Officials’ ledgers,
And our names are struck from the Five Emperors’ registers.

With deepest reverence, we now repent.
We humbly offer incense, flowers, and the rites of faith,
With sincere hearts turning to the East:
The **Supreme Soul of the Limitless, the Most High Treasure of Heaven**,
The **Nine-Qi Heavenly Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Court Immortals**,
And all **Spiritual Officials**.

We pray to the Most High Virtue, who cherishes life,
The Boundless Mercy that benefits all beings,
The Green Scriptures that pardon transgressions,
The Eastern Heavens that decree immortality—
Opening the heart to the Natural Void,
Granting the Dao of the Supreme One’s Embracing Truth.

Neither delayed nor hastened, it endures eternally;
Without gates or barriers, it permeates the Four Reaches.
Transforming the world, turning hearts toward the Dao,
Equalizing all under the Sage’s compassionate gaze.

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the Formless,
And harmonize with the True.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,

Bow to the Sovereign’s benevolent rule,
Hearing the people’s devotion and return.

Thus, we may bear the breath of purity,
And aid the Sage’s bright and virtuous way.

Yet, lingering in idle life, content with fleeting ease,
We lack the embrace of the Dao or cultivation of virtue to transform others,
Failing to restore the ancient simplicity or return to the uncarved,
Adorning worldly rites and seeking fame in mortal affairs,
Emptyly claiming the nation’s grace,
And presumptuously standing among the Daoist ranks.

Our names are not inscribed in the Southern Celestial Register,
And the Yin Mountains record our countless transgressions.

Only the Sage sits facing south to govern,
Only the nation’s great virtue commands Heaven’s mandate.
Having invoked the decree from the boundless sky,
We dare now submit our hearts to the stars’ appointed regions.

With utmost reverence, we offer incense, flowers, scriptures, and devotional rites,
And bow our sincerest vows to the **Southern** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Three Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Southern** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge that **virtue** thrives in Fire,
The Sage turns toward radiance,
Granting longevity and reverence to all people,
Rooting blessings across generations.

Next, we pray that we Daoists with talismans at our sides,
May find pardon in the **Six Ministries**,
And receive the **Three Breaths’** luminous grace.

In our **inner alchemy**, may we **cultivate** the **Heart** with **emptiness**,
And **nourish** the **Spirit** so that it remains ever tranquil.
In the **outer alchemy** of summer, may we **harness** the **Yin**,
And **restrain** the Fire within so that it does not scatter.

Thus, we may **embrace** the **One** and **guard** the **Middle**,

The **正** [upright] and **和** [harmonious] prevail,
The people return to the **兑说** [Joyful Teachings of the West].

First, it enforces **杀** [rigor and restraint] to aid the **Great Transformation**,
Later, it **静退** [withdraws in stillness] to manifest the **少阴** [Lesser Yin].

In accordance with Heaven and the people,
Firm within, yielding without.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,
Though lacking innate wisdom, we recognize the **大本** [Great Principles] of filial piety, fraternal duty, loyalty, and trust,

Our **virtue** rivals that of Heaven and Earth,
Our **grace** surpasses that of parents.

Yet, we fail to uphold the **禁戒** [precepts],
And neglect the **禀修** [cultivation] of the Dao.
The **Eight Festivals** do not advance our **表章** [manifestation of virtue],
And the **Five Sacrifices** are not performed with **严** [rigor].

And Heaven and Earth are just yet without favor.

Our own sins cannot be escaped,
And **不孝** [filial disobedience] has no pardon.

We now humbly confess our faults,
Sending our sincerity to the **七宝金门** [Golden Gate of the Seven Treasures],

We seek the **境** [domain] of the **上智** [Superior Sage] to repay our **恩** [grace],

And bow our sincerest vows to the **Western** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Seven Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Western** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge the **金光** [Golden Light] that illuminates below,
The **玉简** [Jade Tablets] that clearly return our deeds.
Our ancestors all receive blessings of **升迁** [promotion and ascent],
Our parents each gain **殊胜** [exceptional merit].

Next, we pray that we Daoists with talismans at our sides,
May receive the **Western** **Tortoise’s** transmission of the Dao,
And visit the **仙母** [Immortal Mother] to refine our **甲庚** [first and sixth heavenly stems].

May the **金虎** [Golden Tiger] dwell in **离** [the Fire position],
And we **交** [interact] with the **真龙** [Authentic Dragon] to enter **戊己** [the Earth position].

Without **暴** [excessively] depleting our **气** [vitality],
May our **真元** [True Essence] be **守** [preserved],
And without **劳** [overworking] our **神** [Spirit],
May our **寿命** [lifespan] be **无期** [boundless].

Free from **魔试** [demonic temptations],
Our **心源** [source of the heart] may be **自定** [self-stabilized].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

The **阳** [Yang] lies dormant within,

The **辰** [stellar positions] reside in their places,
And the **众星** [multitudes of stars] bow in reverence,
The **枢机** [pivotal mechanisms] of transformation,
The **主宰** [lords] who govern all living beings.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,
Though lacking innate wisdom, we follow the Master’s guidance.
From the **训提** [early instruction],
We know the **大本** [Great Principles] of filial piety, fraternal duty, loyalty, and trust,
And through **传度** [transmission],
We are directed toward the **真乘** [True Vehicle] of the Natural Void and purity.

Our **德** [virtue] ascends to the heights of Heaven and Earth,

We **负** [betray] the **抠衣授道** [Master’s humble teaching],
And **违** [violate] the **歃血引盟** [oath of blood and covenant].

We **泄** [leak] the **机微** [subtle secrets] to the **尘世** [mundane world],
And **传** [reveal] the **道** [Dao] to those **非人** [unworthy].

Even when **遇祸** [facing calamity] and **招殃** [inviting retribution],
We still **怨师** [blame the Master] and **咎道** [accuse the Dao],
Fearing our **罪书** [record of sins] in the **九府** [Nine Palaces],
And dreading our **身谢** [life’s termination] at the hands of the **三官** [Three Officials].

We believe that to **迎师** [invite the Master] is to face north in **尊崇** [reverence],
Thus, we confess our faults and plead with the **坎宫** [Kan Palace of the North].

With utmost reverence, we offer incense, flowers, scriptures, and devotional rites,
And bow our sincerest vows to the **Northern** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Five Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Northern** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge that the **北辰** [Northern Dipper] holds the **仙名** [names of the Immortals],
And the **壁宿** [Wall Constellations] oversee the **道术** [arts of the Dao].

The **宗师** [Master] transmits the Dao,
And **永隆** [eternally upholds] the **弘教** [great teaching].
Through **保举** [recommendation] and **监盟** [oversight of covenants],
They **益务** [further strive] to **成人之美** [fulfill the potential of others].

Without a **师** [Master], there is no **度** [transmission],
And even the **有翼** [winged] must **飞** [soar].
All together we aspire to the **功行** [meritorious deeds],
And share in the **升仙** [ascension to immortality] **果** [realization].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

And harmonize with the **True**.

Ren, yi, li, zhi arose alongside great falsehood;

The officials of the Black Registers and the Yin Valley

*The Ritual of Ascension and Divine Transformation at the Upper Clarity Dao/Way Hall of the Transcended Immortals*
This ritual employs the **Yellow Arrow** (黄箓) to cultivate the True Dao of the Ten Precepts (十戒),
and the **Hosted Initiation** (明真宿启) to perform the rites—
the ancient rites of the Five Refining (五炼) for generating the sacred body (生尸).

The **Hosted Initiation** (宿启) is thus the means
to invoke the souls of those who have been **transcended and drawn forth** (迁拔),
or **extinguished and liberated** (灭度).

Master Wanfu (万福天师) composed *The Ritual for Fellow Dao Seekers* (《同学行道仪》),
which mandates that from the onset of suffering to the final passing,
one must **confess and repent** (忏谢),
**rescue and draw forth** (救拔),
**alleviate calamities** (解灾),
and **regret past transgressions** (悔过).

Indeed, to **cultivate the Dao and ascend as an immortal** (修道升仙),
one must not rely on oneself alone—**a master is required to guide** (非师不度);
to **transcend the mundane and attain sainthood** (超凡证圣),
one must not act alone—**a fellow Dao seeker is essential** (非友不成).

A master is like **parental figures** (父母),
and fellow Dao seekers are like **brothers** (兄弟).
How can one, lacking **reverence and filial devotion** (不敬孝),
**friendship and love** (不友爱),
or **compliance and accord** (不承顺和悦),
follow their teachings?

When **masters and fellow Dao seekers** depart,
leaving kin and kindred behind,
dwelling in **mountains and forests** (栖庇山林),
with **flesh and bone distant** (骨肉远矣),
and **affection now sparse** (亲爱疏矣),
upon their **illness or decline** (修短有常),
when they **pass away** (奄从沦化),
one must **recite scriptures and perform Dao rites** (诵经行道),
**offer petitions and memorials** (拜章上表),
**confess sins and atone for faults** (忏罪谢愆),
and **assist in their transcendence and liberation** (以相迁度).

In matters of **life and death and Dao principles** (生死道义),
this is the foremost duty.

Should a **master or fellow Dao seeker perish** (沦没),

The rest shall follow in **ranked order** (依位次第),

Each shall **stand in their appointed rank** (各在依位),
and **fulfill their designated duties** (主其职司).

If the rites are to be **conducted as a Hosted Initiation** (宿启),
