**Recitation of the Precepts:**
The Dao/Way prioritizes fasting above all else.
In ancient times, sacrifices required fasting,
And fasting required adherence to precepts.
One first observed the precepts before fasting—
The so-called *"seven-day precepts and three-day fasting"*.

To disperse the fasting over seven days is called *precepts* [戒].
The *precepts* [戒] are what enable one to reverently follow the sacred standards,
To avoid transgressions and wrongdoings,
To strictly abide by the precepts and laws,
And to never stray from them.

To concentrate the fasting over three days is called *fasting* [斋].
The *fasting* [斋] is what enables one to purify the mind and spirit,
To clarify thoughts and intentions,
To focus one’s essence,
And to seek communion with the divine.

The *Zhōu Li* [周官] records the duties of the *Tàizǎi* [太宰, Grand Overseer],
Who, when sacrificing to the Five Emperors,
Supervised the oaths and precepts of all officials.
Ten days before the ritual, he led the attendants in divination
To determine the auspicious day for taking the precepts.

Moreover, the *Dà Sī Kòu* [大司寇, Grand Marshal of Punishments]
Oversaw the swearing of all officials,
And the precepts were observed by all clans.

The *Tàizǎi* [太宰], as the official in charge of governance,
Administered the precepts to emphasize their importance;
The *Dà Sī Kòu* [大司寇], as the official in charge of justice,
Presided over them to underscore their severity.

The *Lǐjì* [礼记] also states in *"Jiāo Tèshēng"* [郊特牲]:
On the day of divination for the *Jiāo* [郊, sacrificial field],
The king stood by the marsh,
Personally listening to the oaths and instructions,
And receiving counsel—
This was the essence of admonition.

Within the *Xiànmìng* [献命] gate,
The precepts were administered to all officials.
At the ancestral temple,
The precepts were administered to all people.

Thus, the ancients sought communion with the divine,
Strict in their precepts,
Serious in their fasting,
And so the heavenly spirits descended at the *yuánqiū* [圆丘, circular mound],
The earthly deities emerged at the *fāngzé* [方泽, square marsh],
And the ancestral ghosts were pleased at the ancestral temple.

Though these were the fasts of sacrifice,
They were not the *fast of the heart* [心斋].

In days past, *Yán Huí* [颜回] received teachings from his master,

His master did not yet permit him to practice the *fast of the heart* [心斋],
For he wished *Yán Huí* [颜回] to listen not with his ears,
But with his mind,
And not with his mind,
But with his *qi* [气].

*Qi* [气] is empty and receptive to all things,
And only when the Dao/Way gathers in this emptiness
Does emptiness become the *fast of the heart* [心斋].

The *Zhōu Yì* [周易] states:
"The sages use this to wash their hearts,
Retreating and concealing themselves in seclusion,
Fasting and observing precepts to manifest their divine virtue."

Thus, the worthy receive the Dao/Way from the sages,

Must practice the *fast of the heart* [心斋] to attain the Dao/Way.
Therefore, it is known that only after the ritual of sacrifice
Can one seek the *fast of the heart* [心斋],
And then the divine and the Dao/Way will be born within.

Later generations of Daoists established *jiǎo* [醮, expiatory rites] and called them *fasting* [斋],
For though the Five Classics record the fasts of sacrifice,
They differ in name but share the same essence,
And their purpose remains unified.

Weapons rest without conflict, prisons stand empty without punishment,
For **virtue’s power** (德) is vast in cherishing life,
And the realm attains **Ren’s eternal longevity** (仁寿).

The **Yellow Banner** advances southward,
With auspicious qi eternally descending upon **Fighter and Ox** (斗牛);
The **Green Sea** returns westward,
Where no wails disturb the **war spirits** (战鬼).

The **Five Auspicious Blessings** (五福) are bestowed upon the virtuous people,
And the **Great Peace** (泰治) endures for ten thousand years,
Preserving the boundless **imperial mandate** (无疆之历).

Now, we burn incense in devotion,
And **take refuge in the Supreme Sage’s most authentic virtue** (至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to **Non-Action** (无为),
And harmonize with the **True Dao** (道合真).

As it is said:
The **Pearl Mouth Gathering** (珠口) gathers the True,
And aligns the **halted light of sun and moon** (停景);
The **Cavernous Chapter** (洞章) emits a call,
And the mountains and rivers swallow the mist.

Through the **resonant clouds** (流响之云营),
The wandering celestial sages (游空之仙圣) are moved.

On this pure dawn,
We perform the **Celestial Assembly Rites** (朝元行道),
And request the **Law Assembly** (法众) to light the second incense strand.
May this fragrant smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To offer homage to the **Supreme True Realm’s Venerable** (上清真境灵宝天尊),
And the **Supreme Scripture Treasures** (无上经宝).

We, the subjects, **surrender body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
And dedicate these merits to the **Ritual Master** (醮主) and his household,
To the **Yearly Star Deity** (太岁尊神) presiding over this dwelling,
And to the **tabooed branches and stems** (支干禁忌),
The **door and gate officials** (门丞户尉),
The **monthly and daily calamities** (月煞日游),
So as to avert misfortune and offense,
And invite the blessings of peaceful abode,
Free from fear and resentment,
Each coming with reverence and delight,
Their thoughts pure and their words auspicious,
Listening to the **introduction of blessings** (介福).

Now, we burn incense in devotion,
And **take refuge in the Scripture Sage’s most authentic virtue** (至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to the **Formless** (无形),
And harmonize with the **True Dao** (道合真).

As it is said:
Reciting the **Nine-Heaven Scripture Treasures** (九天之宝章),
One attains the **Three Officials’ records** (三官之考算);
Studying the **Three Caverns’ doctrines** (三洞之科典),
One earns the protection of the **Hundred Spirits** (百灵之护持).
If one follows the **Great Pattern’s grandeur** (大范之巍巍),
One shall surely receive the **distant blessings** (遐福之简简).

On this pure dawn,
We perform the **Celestial Assembly Rites** (朝元行道),
And request the **Law Assembly** (法众) to light the third incense strand with mercy,
May this fragrant smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To offer homage to the **Supreme Clarity’s Celestial Realm’s Venerable** (太清仙境降生天尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Teacher Treasures** (十方师宝).

We, the subjects, **surrender body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
And dedicate these merits to the **Ritual Master** (醮主) and his household,
That their gates flourish and their clans prosper,
Their homes ever sing of **Peach Blossom’s joy** (桃夭),
And their children forever praise **the harvest’s abundance** (芣苢).

Calamities are swept away like mist dissolving into ice,
While blessings multiply like mountains halting the floods.
Auspiciousness grows ever grand.

Let those who **master scriptures and enter officialdom** (明经入仕) swiftly ascend to **high rank** (青紫);
Those who till the fields and labor at harvest (服田力穑) accumulate wealth in their granaries (倉箱).

The **rites of virtue and merit** (式彰善积) honor households where good deeds abound,
And such families need not fear **spectral scrutiny** (鬼瞰) of their halls.

Now, as we burn the incense,
We **surrender ourselves** (皈依) to the **Ritual Master’s Venerable Great Saints** (師尊大聖), seeking the **Perfect Virtue** (至真之德).
After attaining the **Dao/Way** (得道), we rise into the **formless** (升入無形),
And harmonize with the **Dao/Way’s True Essence** (和與道合真).

**Repentance and homage** (忏方) are offered—three invocations, three rites.
We, the **humble subjects of various ranks** (具位臣某等),
With **sincere devotion** (同誠上啟), now address:
The **Natural Void’s Golden Gate, Seven Treasures’ Celestial Sovereign** (虛無自然金闕七寶上帝),
The **Eastern Palace’s Preceptor, the Great Primordial Saving-Suffering Celestial Master** (東宮教主太乙救苦天尊),
The **Transmission Masters of successive generations** (傳經演教歷代師真),
The **Eastern Peak’s Celestial Equal of Benevolence, Venerable Holy Emperor** (東嶽泰山天齊仁聖帝),
The **Chaste and Illustrious Consort** (淑明皇后),
The **Noble Prince** (太子),
The **Noble Concubine** (貴妃),
And the **Luminous Spirit Official** (殿上炳靈公),
The **Spirit King of Western Qi** (西齊靈王),
The **martial and civil examiners beneath the peak** (嶽下文武考校),
All **clerks and officials** (一切曹僚),
The **Three Realms’ responsive spirits** (三界應感),
And all **true numinous beings** (一切真靈).

May they all **respond to our profound mercy** (咸望洪慈),
And **descend to reveal our sincere supplications** (俯昭丹懇).

We, the subjects, have heard:
That **mourners for the deceased** (哀死事亡) must cherish **firm resolve as if they still lived** (要笃如存之志);
And those who **tread frost and damp** (履霜濡露) will **always bear remembrance of the past** (必懷追往之心).

With **books filling the forests** (書籍滿林), one may **trace their former deeds by hand** (驗手容而可想);
With **ink and paper on the desk** (桮槎在案), one knows **their words still linger** (知口澤之猶存).

In their **living days**, we knew their **sickness, pain, and afflictions** (疾痛痾痒);
Now, in their **departed state**, how dare we **forget their bonds and torments** (拘滞沉迷)?

Though the **path divides the living and the dead** (路隔幽明),
Their **sufferings are hard to bear vicariously** (苦惱虽難於代受);
Yet **affection binds us**, and our **solemn offerings are for their deliverance** (情緣親愛，荐嚴專務於追修).

No spirit is **greater than the peak’s ancestral guardian** (神莫大於嶽宗),
Whose **authority oversees the spectral records** (權常司於鬼錄),
Ever discerning **deeds of merit and fault** (每察知於功過),
And **governing life and death** (式兼制於死生).

Deeply reflecting on the **departed souls** (往逝之魂),
We fear their **transgressions may not be absolved** (愆尤難免);
Lest they linger in the **realms of confinement** (拘囚之地),
With **no means of liberation** (解脱無由).

With **all our mortal sincerity** (用罄凡誠),
We **pray for benevolent pardon** (仰祈善貸),
To **cleanse their sins from the black register** (洗罪名於黑簿),
And **refine their mortal essence into the yellow flower** (煉生質於黃華),
Swiftly passing the **underworld gates** (速出泉關),
And **early ascending to the Dao’s shore** (早登道岸).

Above, we **acknowledge the Celestial Master’s vast mercy** (上明天尊大慈之澤),
Below, we **fulfill our subjects’ surrender of fate** (下副臣等皈命之誠),
And **submit our supplications** (謹啟以聞).

**Reignite the censer** (復爐).

**Exit the door** (出戸).

Divine radiance illuminates the night; all obscurity is dispelled.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their banners borne on the wind.
All living beings prosper; divine blessings pervade the land, harmonizing with the True Dao/Way.

May the **Supreme Dao/Way’s Ten Directions’ True *Qi*** and **Sacred Treasure Auspicious Light** descend upon us, flowing into our bodies,

The **Void-Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasures Celestial Sovereign**,

All officials and attendants,
The **Three Realms of Responsive Spirits**,
All **True Spirits and Sacred Beings**.

May they all behold the vast mercy and deign to reveal the crimson sincerity.

We have heard:
*"Sealing the golden mud"*—this duty remains with the sovereign;
*"The jade scroll’s transmission"*—this decree governs the order of humanity.
Above, it connects with the empty void of Heaven, thus called the **Celestial Realm of the Immortals**;
Below, it governs life and death, serving as the **Yin Officials’ registry**.

Yet we reflect upon the recently departed souls—
Their **black ledgers** of sins may yet remain unexpunged.
Though crimes are not yet recorded, their severity must be weighed in lightness and depth;
Though intentions seek severe punishment, they must be allowed room for **repentance in sorrow**.

All originate from the **Eastern Residence** to enlighten;
Even the **Chanting Officials of Reverence and Compliance**—
Follow the **Eastern Direction** in reciting their hymns.

We know the **Peak Emperor’s benevolence** does not reject the pleas of mortals.

The ritual officials, grieving the swift passage of life like a galloping steed—
Already separated from the living by the veil of death;
Fearful of the **unwholesome *qi* of the horse**, ever drawn to perilous paths—
In life, they violated the **Awakened Ones’ intentions**;
In death, they suffer boundless torment.
Falling into Hell, they must harbor pain and regret;
In the human world, they should strive for **posthumous rectification**.

Thus may they move the **Emperor’s heart**, or even turn his **wrathful *qi**—
The roots of karma and the nets of sin shall dissolve like mist and ice;
The fruits of virtue and fields of blessing shall unfold like clouds and rain.

The **Three Primordials** nurture their essence—
Now they hear the **Great Unity’s talisman-bearer**;
The **Eight Auspicious Scenes** manifest their spirits—
Again, they receive the **Emperor’s decree of rank**.

Now, with the **midnight watch** just struck and the **first hour’s tally** announced,
The **bright moon** hangs high, framing the boundless sky—
It is fitting to **present our grievances**,
To offer our **sincere fasting words**,
And solemnly **proclaim our petitions**.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As the words declare, with profound pity and sorrow—
We have heard:
*"Without the Primordial Sovereign’s talismans and decrees, one cannot ascend the stages of transcendence and elevation;

We must rely on the **Supreme Dao/Way** to rescue the lost souls,
Transforming the **artificial into the natural**, the **formed into the formless**,
Following the **Direct Path’s regulations** to present our petitions,
Hoping the **Celestial Chariot** may swiftly arrive,
Further revealing our **grief and sorrow**, and beseeching **compassionate mercy**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,

May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Pure Celestial Sacred Realm’s Primordial Sovereign** and the **Ten Directions’ Dao/Way Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **ritual official’s household**, all kin and dependents—
May those who have passed receive early elevation to the **Path of the Immortals**;
May the living enjoy longevity and blessings, reaching **venerable old age**.
With **snow-white hair and furrowed brows**, they shall stand as pillars, never faltering like the **distant crane**;
With **hunched backs and protruding teeth**, they shall lean on their staffs, as sturdy as the **sacred tortoise**.
The **Yellow Register** shall erase the records of death;
The **Green Flower** shall inscribe the ledgers of extended years.
The **Heavenly Bestowal** shall grant the **rare blessing of non-aging**,
And the **Great Sovereign’s lament** shall be silenced.

Now, we burn this incense in **sincere devotion to the Dao/Way’s Great Saints and True Virtues**.

After attaining the Dao/Way, one ascends to the **Formless**,
And harmonizes with the **True Dao/Way**.

We have heard:
*"The Jade Boy Attending the Immortals"*—
His divine origin first unfolded in the **embroidered brocade**;
*"The Great Saint of Longevity"*—
First rescued mortals from the **Eastern Quarter**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,
We request the assembled ritualists to take this **second incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Most High Pure Realm’s Sacred Treasure Sovereign** and the **Supreme Scriptural Treasures**.

May they swiftly ascend the **Golden Tablet’s path** to the **Jade Capital**,
Transcending the **Three Realms**, and be **commended by the Demon King**.

Ascend in name to the **Nine Palaces**,
And proceed to pay homage at the **Great Sovereign**.

Hasten to the **Dragon Gate** to receive the assembly,
And gain the **Bird Mother’s** guidance as a **Sacred Treasure Sovereign**,
No longer entangled in **grave disputes**,
Nor subject to the calamities of descendants.

Obtaining the Dao/Way thereafter,
We enter the **Formless Realm** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

And that **Ten Directions without limit** hold no greater merit than **saving beings**.

We request the ritual assembly to present this **third incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
And worship the **Supreme Pure Sacred Treasure Sovereign of the Celestial Realm** and the **Ten-Directional Teacher Treasures**.

And dedicate these merits to the **five surnames of the departed**,

Withered corpses and decayed bones,
Yet to leave the **land of darkness and stagnation**;
Wearing horns and bearing fur,

In the **dim underworld**, where **demons and spirits** lurk,
Squirming and writhing like **serpents and maggots**,

Clinging to **blood and qi** yet lacking awareness.
Some starve in **hunger and thirst**,
Falling into **ravines and ditches**;
Others perish in **warfare and conflict**,
Their bodies **rotting in grass and marshes**.

Cliffs and valleys, drowning in water or burning in flames,
Imprisoned in **jails and cages**,
Or dying by the **roadside**—
All suffer **harsh wrongs**,
Yet none encounter the **merit of commendation and guidance**,
Wandering the **Three Paths**, cycling through the **Six Realms of Rebirth**.

Humbly, we pray to **ride upon the Dao’s power**,
And **rely entirely on the True Compassion**.
To **abandon past ignorance** and avoid **falling into error**,
And to **meet tonight’s guidance**,
That all may swiftly **transcend and ascend**.

Freeing ourselves from **demonic spirits’** clutches,
Shedding our **traces in dust and sand**,

**Translation:**

---
**Responding to the Wood Virtue’s reign and upholding benevolence,**
Well able to lead as the first of spring’s seasons,
Where life’s origin begins.
**Indeed, the Mountain Emperor’s benevolence**
Stems from his love of life and hatred of slaughter as his purpose;
**He governs the celestial populace’s register,**
And records births and deaths as his merit.
**All these myriad beings, vast and orderly,**
Are all nurtured by the transformative *qi* of life.
**How could he bear to oppress those crying out in slaughter’s fields,**
Or wish to confine them in the dark prisons of the netherworld?
Yet because of the multitude’s ignorance and folly,
Their crimes are self-inflicted;
**Each follows base desires of love and hatred,**
And their greed knows no end.
**Indulging in licentiousness and deceit in myriad forms,**
**Giving free rein to cunning and guile in countless guises,**
If their crimes are not rectified, they must face judgment;
If the law is applied, they cannot escape punishment.
**Still, they hope for mercy’s tears to absolve their guilt,**
And pray for the prison’s records to be reconsidered.
**If they can reform, why not cease like the tillers of the field?**
**If they die in wrong, they will wail as ghosts in the thorny groves.**
**Thus, they seek pity and plead for life,**
Wishing to amend their faults and atone for their errors,
**Following the Dao’s Way as a bridge to law,**
**Conforming to the Dao’s teachings as a lamp of wisdom,**
**Seeking the Dao’s shelter as a protective cloud,**
**Relying on the Dao’s compassion as saving rain,**
**Hoping to bathe in the dew of mercy,**
**And swiftly rescue souls from the dark night.**
**With utmost reverence and sincerity, day after day,**
**Focusing on the Pure Clarity’s realm,**
**Praying for the descent of the Feathered Canopy’s grace;**
**Reciting the *Step-on-the-Void* hymns,**
**Aspiring to the paired clouds’ arrival.**
**Temporarily departing the Golden Gate,**
**First, the Nine Phoenixes harmonize in song;**
**Descending to the mortal feast,**
**Then, the Eight Cranes dance in flight.**
**The Holy Will communicates in an instant,**
**The True Ones come and go in a flash,**
**Surely granting human desires as Heaven approves,**
**Responding to the lower’s petitions and transmitting them above.**
**The servants, with utmost devotion,**
**Humbly welcome the Sacred Procession.**
**Descend, O Holy One!**
**First Offering, Scatter Flowers.**

**The servants, with utmost devotion,**
**Humbly address:**
**The Formless, Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Emperor of Heaven,**
**The Eastern Palace Patriarch, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Lord,**
**The Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral True Ones of Past Ages,**

**The servants hear:**
**The Five Peaks are established across the world,**
**Yet only Mount Tai stands as the foremost.**
**A hundred spirits converge at the Mountain’s Hall,**
**For it governs the fate of the people.**
**Not only does it reveal omens through divination,**
**But also manifests auspices through signs.**
**The Sample Stone stood upright,**
**And the grandson truly succeeded the Tang Dynasty;**
**The violent wind scattered it,**
**And the First Ancestor of Qin was ultimately overthrown by the Qin.**
**For kings, it foretells success or failure,**
**Yet for the common folk, it determines life and death.**
**Thus, in memory of the departed,**
**We do not exceed the common practice.**
**When moved by emotion, some act out of greed, jealousy, or delusion in anger;**
**When following desires, others indulge in depravity and extravagance.**
**The Three Karmas wield the axe of self-destruction,**
**And myriad sins brew the poison of ruin.**
**In their past lives, they fell into nets, traps, and pits without knowing;**
**Now in the underworld, they suffer chains, shackles, and torture.**
**Though their names and crimes are recorded,**
**And though they face punishment,**
**Yet the boundless virtue still hopes for pardon.**
**The Dao originates from benevolent forgiveness,**
**And the humble heart dares to seek renewal.**
**Thus, we rely on the Yellow Hat,**
**And solemnly present the Pure Rites.**
**Baring our hearts and pouring forth our sincerity,**
**We lay bare our words of repentance;**
**Stretching our necks and focusing our minds,**
**We earnestly hope for their arrival.**
**At the Jade Seal’s Enfeoffment Ground,**
**We envision the Sacred Procession ascending in the Cloud Chariot;**
**At the Stone Gate’s Descending Meditation Site,**
**We await the Void’s slow arrival in the Celestial Procession.**
**With reverence and devotion, we merge our spirits,**
**And hope for their arrival and blessings, abundant and vast.**
**Not offering humble baskets of bronze and pottery,**
**But presenting pure offerings of lotus and orchids.**
**The rites proceed with the First Offering,**
**And sincerity is fully expressed in its purity.**
**Though we are unworthy of the Holy Virtue’s fragrance,**
**We still present our heartfelt prayers.**
**May you perceive our sorrow today,**
**And swiftly free us from the suffering of the underworld’s gate.**
**The Pure Rites’ words are sincere,**
**And we solemnly declare them.**
**Declare the Words.**
**Carefully examining the language,**
**Clearly seeing the depths of our grief.**
**Why must we journey to Qufu’s capital**
**Before we turn toward you?**
**Why must we ascend to the Great Treasury’s hall**
**Before we fully rely on you?**
**Remembering the departed souls have a home,**
**It is the Mountain’s Spirit who governs them all.**
**Nourish their withered flesh and bones,**
**And grant them the tenfold merit of rebirth;**
**Endow them with life’s origin,**
**And open for them the mysteries of the Nine Heavens.**
**Provide them with the calculations of the Eastern Dipper,**
**And let them receive refinement in the Southern Palace.**
**Lamenting the dead and mourning the departed,**
**Though it is said that humans return to the earth;**
**Yet seeking rebirth and transformation,**
**We pray that Heaven grants them form once more.**

**Bow twice, heads touching the ground,**
**And humbly present the Second Offering.**
**Scatter Flowers.**

May merchants flock to the **Celestial Market’s** walls,
and officials ascend to the **Literary Luck’s** hall.

May farmers’ seeds take root with bountiful blessings,
and maidens’ silkworms thrive with plentiful harvests.
Further, may the **Star of Greed** vanish without trace,
and the **Heavenly Dog** turn its head in retreat.
Let the **ten-thousand-mile miasma of demons** be swept away by the **Celestial River’s** waters,
and the **myriad spirits** receive their rewards,
their **Dipper’s Handle** restored and reinforced.

Next, we pray for the purification of counties and districts,
for universal tranquility across all lands,
that no household suffer fire or flood,
and no region endure plague or pestilence.
May harmonious *qi* fill the land,
and the era of **Great Peace** be shared by all.
We humbly receive the **transformative decrees** of the divine,
and gratefully acknowledge the **renewed blessings** of salvation.
Above, we honor the **Divine Lord’s** boundless virtue,
and below, we fulfill the people’s reverent aspirations.

With utmost reverence, we submit this petition.
**Twelve Wishes fulfilled.**
The incense burner is now extinguished.

We solemnly charge the **Incense Officials, Dragon and Tiger Messengers, and Attendant Spirit Officials**—
let them now guide this servant’s past **Dao-practicing sites**,
where **golden elixirs, jade-green herbs, and hundred-spirited numinous plants** shall naturally arise.
May all the **Celestial Children and Jade Maidens** of the Ten Directions
attend to the orchid smoke,
and swiftly transmit this servant’s sincere entreaties
directly to the **Supreme, Boundless Dao, and before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign**.

**Exit the Hall in Praise.**
**Exit the Door.**

**The Complete Ritual Codes of the Daoist Gate, Volume Eighty-Six Complete**
**The Complete Ritual Codes of the Daoist Gate, Volume Eighty-Seven: The Grand Ritual of the *Lingbao* Venerable and Sacred**

**Ritual Procedures for Daoist Practice and Offerings**
The ritual platform ascends as usual.
Each pays homage to the Daoist Master in accordance with the prescribed rites.
The sacred incantations of the *Lingbao* are proclaimed.
The Five Stars array themselves in radiance, illuminating the Five Directions.
The Water Star repels calamities; the Woodly Virtue brings prosperity.
The Wandering Star dispels misfortune; the Great White Star wards off armies.
The Steadfast Star holds firm; the realm and family flourish in harmony.
Their names are inscribed upon the Jade Tablets; their words recorded in the Celestial Archives.
Riding the gusts, they scatter their blessings through the boundless expanse,
entering and exiting the unseen, feasting and wandering across the Ten Directions.
The Five Clouds rise as banners, summoning the gods and restraining the winds.
They command all ten thousand spirits,
guard the Daoist Sage with their sacred vigil,
and unite with the Dao in its perfect truth.

**Twenty-four Beats of the Ritual Drum are sounded.**
The incense burner is lit.

**Invocation of the Supreme Three Heavens and the Primordial Dao**
The **Supreme Primordial Origin of the Three Heavens** and the **Celestial Dao Lord**,
the **Supreme Old Lord**,
now call forth from this servant’s body the **Three Five Officials of Power**,
the **Left and Right Official Messengers**,
the **Left and Right Incense Bearers**,
the **Dragon and Tiger Couriers** and **Mounted Attendants**,
the **Golden Boys Attending Incense**,
and the **Jade Maidens Transmitting Words and Scattering Flowers**,
along with the **Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols**,
the **Incense Officials of the Direct Sun**,
and the **Thirty-Six Combined Attendants**—all now emerge.

**Those who depart are clad in solemn, resplendent robes,**
with **headgear and trailing ribbons**,
opening the **Mysterious Gate** to the **Land and Soil Deities** and the **Territorial Spirits**.

This servant, in the quiet of night, now practices the Dao.
With utmost sincerity, we present this petition to declare our intent,
and all our earnest supplications are already recorded and conveyed.
We pray that the **Supreme Dao of the Ten Directions**,
the **Sacred Light of the *Lingbao***,
may descend and flow into this servant’s body,
so that our words may swiftly reach the **Supreme Boundless Dao**,
before the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Golden Gate**.

**The Ritual Position is Invoked.**
This servant, along with the **Assembled Attendants of the Dao**,
now humbly and sincerely presents this petition
to the **Three Pure Ones of the Celestial Sovereign**,
the **Ten Supreme Dao Lords**,
the **Sun Emperor and Moon Empress**,
the **Southern Celestial and Northern Dipper**,
the **Three Officials and Five Emperors**,
the **Four Sacred Dao Immortals**,
and the **Lineage of Teachers and Saints** who have propagated the Dao and transmitted scriptures through the ages,
as well as the **Spirits of the Netherworld and Mountain Altars**,
the **Celestial Bureaus and Earthly Enclosures**,
the **Water Realm and Thunderous Commanders**,
the **City Deities and Benevolent Departments**,
and all **Responsive Spirits of the Local Realm**,
who all look upon this servant with **abundant compassion**,
and **piercingly reveal the sincerity of our prayers**.

We hear that the **Dao of Heaven is profound and mysterious**,
and **virtue alone is its support**.
The **Divine and Sacred** are upright,
and **depend upon humanity**.
With reverence, we purify our **common hearts**,
and **awaken the bright virtue** within.
The **spirits and numinous beings** are ever-present,
and their **refined essence** shall surely manifest.

We humbly consider the **Divine Positions**—
they **protect the realm and shelter the people**,
**eliminate harm and promote prosperity**,
their names inscribed in the **sacrificial records**,
and their brilliance as clear as the stars.
On this auspicious day of **dispelling ill fortune**,
we joyfully present our **fragrant incense offerings**,
and all beings share in the celebration,
while the myriad classes flourish in harmony.

We hope for a **favorable response to our petition**,
and that our **earnest efforts** may be slightly granted.

**The Sacred Descent is Invoked; the First Offering is Made; Flowers are Scattered.**
This servant, with all sincerity, now presents this petition
to the **Three Pure Ones of the Celestial Sovereign**,
the **Ten Supreme Dao Lords**,
the **Grand Ritual Assembly and Sacred Oaths**,
and all the **True Sovereigns**.

We pray that the **abundant compassion** may be **piercingly returned**,
and that the **clear divine insight** may be **fully revealed**.
We hear that the **Divine** is ever-ready to lend aid to humanity,
and **never abandons those without virtue**—
for the **Supreme Sage** does not dwell where there is no virtue,
and thus virtue is the means to attain the Sacred.

If we **seek the Sacred with our common nature**,
we may doubt its **remoteness and inaccessibility**.
But if the **Sacred responds to the common**,
it does so through **compassionate radiance**.

We humbly consider the **Divine Positions**—
with **one radiant spirit**, they descend to the earth.
To **sever demons and expel sins** is as easy as plucking wood;
to **assist the realm and prosper the state** is to **wield their mighty power with vigor**.

The auspicious hour is graciously met,
and repaying virtue is never forgotten.

With millet, rice, gourds, and flowers,
we humbly offer our reverent rites;
with wisdom and uprightness,
we await the **mysterious response** of the **hidden forces**.

Now we present our **sincere words**,
and solemnly declare them.
The **words are proclaimed**, the **secondary offering** is made,
and **flowers are scattered**.

The **words clearly announce**,
and their meaning is **fully understood** by the wise.

Now, your disciple, [name omitted], with **earnest and fervent prayer**,
has **fully expressed** the sincerity of his heart;
the **mighty spirit** is **unfathomable**,
like the **hope of a response** from a **deep valley**.

We humbly pray that, though the **Divine Presence** is above
and our **sincerity** lies beside,
you may **graciously respond** to the prayers of the **common and unworthy**,
and with **hearing that is keen** and **vision that is respectful**,
bestow upon us your **greatest mercies**.

We hear that the **Divine** is **self-illuminating**,
and that the **rites** record its **foreknowledge**;
to **wield virtue and bestow blessings**,
is the **foundation** of the **established Dao**.

Only through the **profound and reverent** nature of the **Divine**,
does this **small and humble light** arise.

Though the **Divine Insight** is vast and **piercingly clear**,
it is the **flowing radiance** of its **wise and enlightened** nature.

We humbly consider the **Divine Positions**—
the **celestial orbits** divide their **luminous brilliance**,
and the **mountains and peaks** display their **splendid essence**.
They are **both Sage and Divine**,
able to **establish Heaven** and **establish the Dao**,
with **mighty power** and **radiant spirit**,
and **auspicious titles** bestowed in praise.

Your disciple, with **firm resolve** and **earnest cultivation**,
offers **fragrant incense and pure libations** in reverence,
humbly hoping that the **Divine Essence** may be **present as ever**,
and **wondrous transformations** come to **gratify us**.
May they **oversee our rites** and **record our sincerity**,
listen to our **words** and **observe our deeds**.

The **Divine’s beloved children**,
their blessings are **endless for the people**.

All here are **devout and reverent**,
and humbly present their **final offering**.
**Flowers are scattered**.

Your disciple, with **renewed sincerity**, solemnly addresses the **Three Pure Ones**,
the **Ten Celestial Extremes** of the **Highest Truths**,
the **rites of expiation** and **binding oaths**,
and all **True Sovereigns**.

May they all **aspire to the mighty compassion**,
and **look down with clear discernment**.

We hear that **humanity** is the **heart of Heaven and Earth**,
and without it, Heaven and Earth would **lack their purpose**.
The **Divine** is the **source of yin and yang**,
and without it, yin and yang would **lose their efficacy**.

Heaven does not act without humanity,
and humanity does not **hold dominion** without Heaven.
When **Heaven and humanity interact harmoniously**,
then the **Three Talents** govern together;
when **Divine and ghosts align in accord**,
then **one virtue** is **deeply established**.

We humbly consider the **Divine Positions**—
they **consort with Heaven**,
hold the **ancient Dao**,
and receive the **favor of the Supreme Divinity**,
**guiding the threads of the lower realm**.

Our **revered state**, with **devout rites**,
honors those who **bring no calamity** with **temple titles**,
and bestows **auspicious names** upon those with **meritorious deeds**.

Thus, they may **support and protect** the **nation and its people**,
and **bring lasting peace** to the **community and its dwellers**.

Your disciple, under **Divine Grace**, has **many days**,
yet **repaying virtue** is **ever delayed**.
He **briefly extends** the **rite of humble offering**,
to **sincerely express** his **deepest gratitude**.

Now, with **threefold offerings complete**,
the **words are no longer repeated**,
praying that **great virtue** may **be inclusive**,
and **blessings** may **never fail** the **common folk**.

From this day forward,
**guilt** will be **revealed like dew** and **immediately forgiven**;
**blessings** will **flow like rivers**,
and **never cease** for those who **seek them from the east or west**.

The **Dao’s path** will be **smooth and unobstructed**,
families will be **secure and peaceful**,
and **official and private conflicts** will **all be eliminated**.
**Bandits and ferocious beasts** will **be kept at bay**,
and all who **dwell and move** will **long rely upon Divine Protection**.

Yet our **lowly sentiments** are **unworthy** of such **devout prayers**.

**Twelve Vows** are made.
The **incense burner is returned**.

The **humble** Daoist officials—**Incense Master** and attendants, the **Dragon-Tiger Lords** at left and right, and the **Attendants of the Incense**—
shall now command that **wherever I have previously established** the **sacrificial rites** and **practiced the Dao**,
there will **naturally arise** the **golden nectar** and **emerald elixir**,
the **herbs and spirits of myriad blessings**,
and the **multitude of worthies** will **gather and assemble**,
right here before this **Incense Altar**.

I now **solemnly vow** that the **celestial children and maidens** of the **ten directions**,
will **attend and receive** the **fragrant incense vapors**,
and **convey my sincere entreaties** as I have previously **offered**,
**swiftly reaching** the **Supreme Dao of the Boundless and Limitless**,
the **Heavenly Jade Emperor** and **Divine Sovereign** before the **Celestial Court**.

**Reciting the scriptures** upon leaving the hall,
**taking leave of the Master**.
**Escorting the Holy**,
**transforming wealth**.

**Complete** the **Daoist precepts and regulations**—
the **Comprehensive Collection of Daoist Doctrines and Rituals**, Volume **Eighty-Seven**, **concluded**.

chunks.original_text: 静夜都忏 卷八十六 灵宝崇神大醮仪 自然行道 卷八十七 灵宝崇神大醮仪 设醮行道 道门科范大全集卷之一 广成先生杜光庭删定 生日本命仪 清旦行道 法事升坛如式。 都讲举，各礼师存念如法。 高功宣卫灵咒。 青阳虚映，耀日回灵。 神虎辟邪，飞天流铃。 摧奸灭试，万魔束形。 九微回道，八威摄精。 千真校录，三元荡清。 左啸中黄，右策六丁。 七转八合，周旋天经。 圣化巍巍，大道兴行。 庆云流布，合景黄庭，和与道合真。 都讲举，鸣法鼓二十四通。 高功发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣等身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，各三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今早朝，升坛行道，谨奏为入意，其诸忱悃，己录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道一炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣等身中，令臣所 励启，速达径诣太上无极大道，三清上圣，昊天玉皇上帝，紫微北极大帝御前。 都讲举，请称法位。 具位臣姓某与合坛官众等，谨同诚上启，斗极祖师、洞真大道元始天尊，斗极宗师、洞玄大道太上道君，斗极真师、洞神大道太上老君，玉皇大天尊、玄穹高上帝，斗中之尊、天皇大帝，斗中之主、紫微大帝，北斗高上玉皇尊帝君，太微玉帝玄卿大帝君，北斗太尉阳明贪狼玉晨君，北斗上宰阴精巨门玉晨君，北斗司空真人禄存玉晨君，北斗游擎玄冥文曲玉晨君，北斗斗君丹元廉贞玉晨君，北斗太常北极武曲玉晨君，北斗上帝天关破军玉晨君，北斗玉帝洞明外辅玉晨君，北斗帝真隐元内弼玉晨君，斗中天罡万真节度奎光帝君，北斗九皇夫人，九阴内妃，三台华盖星君，三官五帝，九府四司，斗中道德诸君，无鞅圣众，六十甲子本命星君，玄中大法师，三天大法师，宝上真人，二仙使者，九宫官属，一切真灵。 臣闻大道既分，元精启运，天地垂象，阴阳孕灵。 厥初生人，首出群品，毓神太极，凝气重玄，咸资亭育之功，共禀自然之化。 臣等叨承福会，预品人伦。 属三洞开光，五文演奥，琅函玉笈，获睹玄微； 凤简龙章，备探幽赜。 而安身顺俗，荏苒光阴，未能吸景云昆，柄神霞壑。 惟立功佐命，弘道化时，以副玄科，冀申微效，况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，丹诚恳切。 今属某诞生本命之日，虔诚归命，崇启道场，将祈降福九天，延休兹日，肃恭香火，注念真灵。 披十华朝会之仪，法三境焚香之格。 所冀元尊降鉴，万圣垂光，敕五帝於玉宫，诏群真於八极。 开南昌之丹秩，增禄延年； 注东斗之青文，流祥介福。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香。 众和香，至玉清宫，遍玉清圣境，成华盖，供养大罗元始尊。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真道宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，上福社稷尊灵，宗桃先圣，凝神天上，降福人间，皇帝寿山增永，辰极齐华，悬日月而照万方，运元和而康四海。 后妃太子，贻景贶於无穷； 文武臣僚，播皇猷於浩劫。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，保天长存，和与道合真。 以今早朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香。

**Volume 86** – *Great Jiào Ritual for the Venerable Treasure of the Dao: Universal Repentance in the Quiet Night* – *Natural Dao Ritual*

**Volume 87** – *Great Jiào Ritual for the Venerable Treasure of the Dao: Established Dao Ritual*

**Volume 1 of *The Complete Canon of Daoist Doctrines and Rituals*** – *The Ritual of the Original Command of Life by Master Guangting Du*

**Morning Dao Ritual: The Original Command of Life**
The ritual proceedings commence as the altar is ascended in proper form.
The assembled lectors recite the scriptures, each paying homage to their respective teachers in accordance with the Dao.
The High Master (高功) proclaims the protective incantations of the Dao.

The Azure Yang (青阳) radiates its luminous reflection,
Illuminating the sun and returning the spirit.
The Divine Tiger repels malevolence,
The flying celestial beings scatter their bells.
It crushes deceit and extinguishes falsehoods,
Binding all demons in their forms.
The Nine Mysteries (九微) return to the Dao,
The Eight Auras (八威) subdue the vital essence (精).
The Thousand Authentic Ones (千真) verify the records,
The Three Primordials (三元) purify the heavens.

To the left, the Yellow Whistle (啸中黄) invokes,
To the right, the Six Ding (六丁) are summoned.
Seven rotations, eight harmonies,
Circulating the Heavenly Scriptures (天经).

The sacred Dao resounds majestically,
The Great Dao/Way (大道) is set in motion.
Auspicious clouds flow forth,
Converging the radiance of the Yellow Court (黄庭),
In harmony with the Dao/Way’s true essence.

The assembled lectors recite again,
Striking the ritual drum (法鼓) twenty-four times.

The High Master lights the incense burner (发炉).
We invoke the Supreme Three Heavens (三天), the Primordial Origin of the Three Qi (三炁), the Most High Dao Lord (太上道君), and the Most High Old Lord (太上老君), calling forth from within our bodies the thirty-five officials of the Three Five (三五), the left and right envoys, the left and right incense bearers, the courier dragons and mounted officers, the attendants of golden boys and silver girls who scatter words and flowers, and the thirty-six direct symbols of the Five Emperors (五帝), the thirty-six direct-day incense officials (直日香官), and all others who have emerged.

Those who have emerged are clad in solemn and resplendent attire,
Their headgear and sashes adorned with trailing plumes,
Opening the Mystic Altar (玄坛) and summoning the local deities and spirits of the domain (方域神真).

We now present our morning court,
Ascend the altar to perform the Dao Ritual,
And humbly recite our intentions—
Our sincere aspirations are recorded in the heavens,
And we pray that the Most High Ten-Directions True Dao (十方至真道) and the Primordial Qi (一炁) of the Dao,
The luminous treasure of the Venerable Dao (灵宝瑞光),
May descend and flow into our bodies,
So that our efforts may swiftly reach the Most High Dao of the Supreme Extremity (太上无极大道),
The Three Pure Ones (三清) and the Uppermost Saints (上圣),
The Heavenly Sovereign of Jade (昊天玉皇上帝),
The Grand Sovereign of the Purple Cluster (紫微北极大帝),
The Celestial Lord of the Central Dipper (斗中之尊),
The Great Sovereign of the Dipper (天皇大帝),
The Great Lord of the Dipper (斗中之主),
The Purple Cluster Great Sovereign (紫微大帝),
The Northern Dipper High Sovereign (北斗高上玉皇尊帝君),
The Celestial Lord of the Great Constellation (太微玉帝),
The Northern Dipper High Marshal (北斗太尉) of the Yang Brightness and the Greedy Star (阳明贪狼玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Supreme Steward (上宰) of the Yin Essence and the Giant Gate Star (阴精巨门玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Grand Administrator (司空) of the True Person and the Storehouse Star (禄存玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Wandering Attendant (游擎) of the Mystic Darkness and the Literary Music Star (文曲玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Lord of the Dipper (斗君) of the Red Primordial and the Chaste Star (丹元廉贞玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper High Officer (太常) of the Northern Extremity and the Military Music Star (武曲玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Heavenly Sovereign (上帝) of the Celestial Gate and the Star of the Broken Army (天关破军玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper Celestial Lord (玉帝) of the Mystic Clarity and the Outer Auxiliary Star (洞明外辅玉晨君),
The Northern Dipper True Sovereign (帝真) of the Hidden Primordial and the Inner Auxiliary Star (隐元内弼玉晨君),
The Dipper’s Celestial Enforcer (天罡) of the Ten-Thousand Authentic and the Commander of the Deluge Star (奎光帝君),
The Nine Sovereigns of the Northern Dipper (北斗九皇夫人),
The Nine Yin Inner Consorts (九阴内妃),
The Three Platforms and the Five Constellations (三台华盖星君),
The Three Officials and Five Emperors (三官五帝),
The Nine Departments and Four Divisions (九府四司),
The Daoist Virtues of the Dipper (斗中道德诸君),
The Saintly Host of the Unbridled (无鞅圣众),
The Sixty Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches of the Original Command Stars (六十甲子本命星君),
The Great Daoist Master of the Mystic (玄中大法师),
The Great Daoist Masters of the Three Heavens (三天大法师),
The True Persons of the Precious (宝上真人),
The Two Immortal Envoys (二仙使者),
The Nine Palace Officials and Attendants (九宫官属),
And all true spirits (一切真灵).

We have heard that the Great Dao/Way, once divided,
The Primordial Essence (元精) began its operation,
The heavens and earth hung their symbols,
And yin and yang nurtured the spirit.

At its inception, humanity was born,
First emerging among all living beings,
The divine essence coalesced in the Supreme Extremity (太极),
The vital qi condensed in the Heavy Darkness (重玄).
All owe their nurturing to the sacred Dao,
And share in the transformation of the natural world.

We, by fortune, have been granted this life,
And now partake in the human order.
As the Three Mystic Caverns (三洞) open their light
And the Five Sacred Scriptures (五文) unfold their profundity,
We have glimpsed the Mystic Darkness (玄微) through the jade cases and phoenix tablets,
And explored the hidden depths with the phoenix scrolls and dragon chapters.

Yet, though we abide in the world and follow its customs,
As time passes, we have not yet ascended to absorb the clouds and stars of the ten directions,
Nor grasped the divine mists of the celestial valleys.

Only by performing our duties to assist the Original Command (功佐命),
Expanding the Dao and transforming the age (弘道化时),
May we fulfill the Mystic Teachings (玄科),
And hope to manifest the subtle effects (微效).
Moreover, we now present this petition in accordance with the sacred edict—
How dare we not humbly report it?

**Proclamation of the Petition**
As the words of the petition are spoken,
With sincere and earnest devotion.

Today, on the day of my birth and the Original Command of my life,
I devoutly surrender to the Dao,
And solemnly establish this Daoist hall,
To pray for blessings from the Nine Heavens (九天),
And to extend longevity to this very day.
With reverence, I light the incense and focus my thoughts on the true spirits (真灵).

I follow the ten-directional rites of the Azure Court (十华朝会之仪),
And the three-realm incense-burning format (三境焚香之格).

I pray that the Primordial Sovereign (元尊) may descend to inspect,
And that the Ten-Thousand Saints (万圣) may shine their light,
Commanding the Five Emperors (五帝) to gather at the Jade Palace (玉宫),
And summoning all true spirits (群真) to the Eight Extremes (八极).

I open the Red Primordial rank (丹秩) of the Southern Celestial Chant,
And increase blessings and longevity;
I inscribe the Azure script (青文) of the Eastern Dipper,
And flow its auspiciousness to bestow fortune upon all.

Now, in this morning Dao Ritual,
I request the ritual assembly (法众) to take this first pinch of incense and ascend.

All join in offering the incense,
Reaching the Jade Purity Palace (玉清宫),
And pervading the sacred realm of the Jade Purity (玉清圣境),
Forming the Azure Pavilion (华盖),
To venerate the Great Primordial Lord of the Dao (大罗元始尊).

I pray that this incense smoke,
Ascending directly to the heavens,
May venerate the Supreme True Daoist Treasure (无上至真道宝).

We, the disciples,
Surrender our bodies, our spirits, our lives,
And first prostrate ourselves to the ground.

We rely upon the Most High Three Sovereigns (太上三尊),
The Ten-Directions Saints (十方众圣),
And pray that with this pinch of incense’s merit,
The blessings may extend to the spirits of the ancestral temple and the state (社稷尊灵),
The sacred ancestors of the peach (宗桃先圣),
Our spirits may coalesce in the heavens above,
And the blessings descend to the mortal realm (降福人间).
May the Emperor’s longevity mountain endure forever,
The Dipper’s Extremity (辰极) align with the Azure Court (齐华),
And the sun and moon hang suspended to illuminate the ten directions,
The Primordial Harmony (元和) flow to bring peace to the four seas.

May the Empress and the Crown Prince,
Receive eternal blessings of radiant light;
May the civil and military officials,
Spread the imperial designs across the vast ages.

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the Dao’s Sovereign (道尊) and the Great Saints of the True Dao (大圣众至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the eternal heavens,
And harmonize with the Dao’s true essence.

Now, in this morning court,
Ascending the altar to perform the Dao Ritual,
We request the ritual assembly (法众) to take this second pinch of incense and ascend.

chunks.original_text: 众和香，至上清宫，遍上清真境，成宝盖，供养玉晨大道君。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，归流斋主某，八桂齐年，五山等祚。 万仙降佑，饵金液以安神； 群圣回光，开玉书而注禄。 九玄七祖，超景朱陵，五族六亲，列名丹简。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保长存，和与道合真。 以今早朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香。 众和香，至太清宫，遍太清仙境，成云盖，供养五灵玄老君。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真师宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，归流天地之内，普及群生，九夜开光，三涂朗晏，飞沉动植，咸遂生成。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保利亨，和与道合真。 忏方，命魔，三启，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某，与临坛官众等，谨同诚上启，三清上圣，十极高真，斗府神仙，醮筵真宰，恭望洪慈，洞垂昭鉴。 臣等伏闻二炁凝和，三灵表质，承大道生成之化，鼓太虚陶铸之功。 由是千年为降圣之期，五百乃生贤之数。 莫不禀神妙运，分星辰日月之华； 纵德诞灵，结岳渎山川之秀。 故能功宣济物，道叶为时，恩被生灵，惠覃幽显。 当兹令序，宜启坛场，将拥洪休，仰祈玄圣，冀因虔祷，俾获感通。 按灵宝明科，披自然秘格，注心三境，皈命十天，灯分鹤焰之辉，香散龙烟之穗。 玉章飞韵，清磬流音，旁周寥廓之间，上达无何之外。 三尊演既，增年於玉历之中； 万圣流慈，延祚於瑶缄之上。 九丹自得，万善咸臻，长简帝心，永绥天禄。 皇帝瑶图克固，宝运遐昌，万国宅心，九围顺化，星辰合度，日月贞华。 海外寰中，俱洽无为之道； 天长地久，弘宣不宰之功。 庶类昭苏，群生蒙福，上穷三界，下及九阴，惠泽普沾，同臻寿域。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈向之诚。 谨启以闻。 知磬举，十二愿。 都讲举，存神烧香。 高功复炉。 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来早朝升坛行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、三清三境天尊、昊天玉皇上帝、紫微北极大帝御前。 知磬举，出堂颂。 出户，引至六幕堂。 道门科范大全集卷之一竟 道门科范大全集卷之二

Now, the incense of **Universal Harmony** (眾和香),
Ascends to the **Supreme Purity Palace** (至上清宮),
Permeating all realms of the **Supreme Purity True Dao** (遍上清真境),
Forming a **Treasure Canopy** (成寶蓋),
To offer **nourishment** (供養) to the **Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord** (玉晨大道君).

May this incense smoke,
Ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer **nourishment** to the **Supreme, Most True Scripture Treasures** (無上至真經寶).

We, the subjects, surrender our **bodies** (皈身),
**spirits** (皈神),
And **lives** (皈命),
Prostrating our heads and bodies to the earth.

We humbly rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Saints** (十方眾聖),
May the **merits of this pinch of incense** (是捻香功德),
Flow back to bless the **vegetarian master** (斋主某),
With **Eight Cassias** (八桂) of equal years,
And **Five Mountains** (五山) of equal blessings.

May the **Ten Thousand Immortals** (萬仙) descend with their **auspices** (降佑),
And take the **Golden Elixir** (饵金液) to **calm our spirits** (安神);
May the **Host of Saints** (群聖) return their **radiant light** (回光),
And open the **Jade Scriptures** (開玉書) to bestow **auspicious blessings** (注祿).

The **Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors** (九玄七祖),
Ascend in glory to the **Vermilion Mound** (超景朱陵),
And the **Five Clans and Six Relatives** (五族六親),
Are inscribed upon the **Crimson Tablets** (列名丹簡).

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the **Scripture Sovereign** (經尊) and the **Great Saints of the True Dao** (大聖眾至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the **eternal heavens** (永保長存),
And harmonize with the **Dao’s true essence** (和與道合真).

---

With the incense of **Universal Harmony** (眾和香),
Ascending to the **Great Purity Palace** (至太清宮),
Permeating all **Great Purity Daoist Realms** (遍太清仙境),
Forming a **Cloud Canopy** (成雲蓋),
To offer **nourishment** to the **Five Spirits’ Mysterious Elder Lord** (五靈玄老君).

May this incense smoke,
Ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer **nourishment** to the **Supreme, Most True Master Treasures** (無上至真師寶).

We, the subjects, surrender our **bodies** (皈身),
**spirits** (皈神),
And **lives** (皈命),
Prostrating our heads and bodies to the earth.

We humbly rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Saints** (十方眾聖),
May the **merits of this pinch of incense** (是捻香功德),
Flow back to bless the **entirety of Heaven and Earth** (天地之內),
And **universally extend** (普及) to all **living beings** (群生),
With **Nine Nights of Illumination** (九夜開光),
And **Three Realms of Clarity** (三淵朗晏),
To stir the **flying and sinking** (飛沉), **moving and growing** (動植),
All may prosper and fulfill their **nature and destiny** (生成).

Now, this incense-burning,
Is an act of surrender to the **Master Sovereign** (師尊) and the **Great Saints of the True Dao** (大聖眾至真之德).

After attaining the Dao,
We may preserve the **eternal prosperity** (永保利亨),
And harmonize with the **Dao’s true essence** (和與道合真).

**Repentance** (忏方),
**Commanding demons** (命魔),
Three **invocations** (三啟),
Three **salutations** (三禮).

Again, we **recite the sacred ranks** (重稱法位).
The **officiating subjects** (具位臣某),
With the **assembled officials** (與臨坛官眾等),
Solemnly and sincerely **present our invocation** (上启),
To the **Three Pure Ones, Highest Saints** (三清上聖),
The **Ten Extremes of Highest Truth** (十極高真),
The **Celestial Bureau of Immortals** (斗府神仙),
The **True Daoist Ritual Host** (醮筵真宰),
Respectfully **entreat their boundless compassion** (恭望洪慈),
And **pray for their penetrating insight** (洞垂昭鑑).

We, the subjects, have heard that the **Two Qi** (二炁) **converge in harmony** (凝和),
And the **Three Refined Essences** (三靈) **manifest in substance** (表質),
Receiving the **transformation of the Great Dao’s creation** (承大道生成之化),
And the **molding power of the Great Void’s furnace** (鼓太虚陶鑄之功).

Therefore, the **thousand-year cycle** (千年) is the **period of descending saints** (降聖之期),
And the **five-hundred-year span** (五百) is the **number of virtuous births** (生賢之數).
None fail to **embrace the divine essence’s wondrous operation** (禀神妙運),
And **share the splendor of stars, constellations, sun, and moon** (分星辰日月之華);
Or to **manifest virtue and spirit** (纵德诞灵),
And **form the essence of mountains, rivers, and valleys** (結岳渎山川之秀).

Thus, their **merits are proclaimed to benefit all things** (功宣濟物),
And the **Dao flourishes in its timely manifestation** (道葉為時),
Their **compassion extends to all living beings** (恩被生靈),
And their **blessings reach both the manifest and the hidden** (惠覃幽顯).

At this **auspicious order** (令序),
It is fitting to **commence the ritual platform** (宜啟坛場),
To **embrace the boundless blessings** (將拥洪休),
And **entreat the Mysterious Saints** (仰祈玄聖),
Hoping through **sincere prayer** (冀因虔禱),
To **obtain their responsive grace** (俾獲感通).

Following the **Spiritual Treasure’s Bright Methods** (按靈寶明科),
And **unveiling the Dao’s Natural Secrets** (披自然秘格),
We **inscribe the Three Realms of the Heart** (注心三境),
And **surrender to the Ten Heavens of Life** (皈命十天),
With the **lamps’ light like the crane’s flame** (灯分鹤焰之辉),
And the **incense’s smoke like the dragon’s tendrils** (香散龙烟之穗).

The **Jade Tablets** (玉章) **fly with melodious resonance** (飛韻),
And the **Pure Chimes** (清磬) **flow their sound** (流音),
Surrounding the **vast and boundless spaces** (旁周寥廓之間),
And ascending to the **limitless expanse** (上達無何之外).

When the **Three Sovereigns’ ritual is complete** (三尊演既),
We may **increase years within the Jade Calendar** (增年於玉曆之中);
And when the **Host of Saints’ compassion flows** (萬聖流慈),
We may **extend blessings upon the Jade Tablets** (延祚於瑤缄之上).

With the **Nine Elixirs attained** (九丹自得),
All **ten thousand blessings flourish** (萬善咸臻),
The **long tablets inscribed in the Imperial Heart** (長簡帝心),
And the **eternal protection of Heaven’s blessings** (永绥天祿).

May the **Emperor’s Jade Diagram be firmly established** (皇帝瑶圖克固),
And the **auspicious blessings of the Treasure Dao flourish distantly** (寶運遐昌),
May all **ten thousand nations dwell in harmony** (萬國宅心),
And the **Nine Enclosures** (九圍) **conform to the Dao’s transformation** (順化),
With the **stars and constellations aligned in their degrees** (星辰合度),
And the **sun and moon radiant in their purity** (日月貞華).

From the **outermost seas to the central realm** (海外寰中),
All **conform to the Dao of Non-Action** (俱洽無為之道);
And from the **eternal heavens to the enduring earth** (天長地久),
Their **proclaimed merits are unending** (弘宣不宰之功).

All **creatures awaken in clarity** (庶類昭蘇),
And **living beings universally receive blessings** (群生蒙福),
From the **highest Three Realms** (上窮三界),
To the **lowest Nine Yins** (下及九陰),
Their **blessings universally permeate** (惠澤普沾),
And all **equally attain the Domain of Longevity** (同臻壽域).

Above, we **illuminate the Dao Lord’s boundless compassion** (上明天尊大慈之澤),
Below, we **fulfill our subjects’ sincere surrender** (下副臣等皈向之誠).

We **respectfully present this invocation** (謹啟以聞).

The **Knowledge Chime** (知磬) is raised,
And the **twelve vows** (十二願) are proclaimed.

The **Grand Lecture** (都講舉) is begun,
And we **preserve our spirits while burning incense** (存神烧香).

The **High Functionary** (高功) **replenishes the furnace** (复炉).

The **Incense Officials and Envoys** (香官使者),
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** (左右龍虎君),
And the **Attendant Spirits of Incense** (侍香諸靈官),
Shall **now command our subjects to ascend the ritual platform** (當令臣向來早朝升坛行道之所),
Where **Golden Elixir and Azure Jade naturally generate** (自然生金液丹碧),
And **Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** (芝英百靈) **converge**.

May the **Ten Directions’ Immortal Children and Jade Maidens** (十方仙童玉女),
**Receive the fragrant incense** (接侍蘭煙),
And **transmit our subjects’ sincere invocation** (傳臣向來所啟之誠),
Swiftly and directly to the **Supreme, Boundless, Most True Dao of the Highest Extremity** (至真無極大道),
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms** (三清三境天尊),
The **Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme Void** (昊天玉皇上帝),
And the **Vermilion Axis, Northern Dipper Grand Emperor** (紫微北極大帝御前).

The **Knowledge Chime** (知磬) is raised,
And the **praise is chanted outside the hall** (出堂頌).

We **exit the door** (出戸),
And **proceed to the Six Curtain Hall** (引至六幕堂).

**The Complete Collection of Daoist Ritual Methods** (道門科範大全集) **Volume One concludes**.
**Volume Two begins**.

chunks.original_text: 广成先生杜光庭删定 生日本命仪 午朝行道 都讲举，各礼师存念如法。 高功宣卫灵咒。 丹灵朱火，炎霞激风。 赤轮刚运，天光八冲。 迸威包罗，交变万方。 流金豁落，群魔灭踪。 辟奸破妖，明耀元功。 金符召制，蹑云策龙。 谣歌庆会，散花太空。 神化宜运，四极安隆。 伏御帝前，罔有不恭，和与道合真。 都讲举，鸣法鼓二十四通。 高功发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，各三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今午朝，升坛行道，谨奏为入意，其诸忱悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣等身中，令臣所启之诚，速达径御太上无极大道、三清三境天尊、昊天玉皇上帝、星主紫微大帝御前。 都讲举，请称法位。 具位臣姓某与合坛众官等，谨同诚上启，斗极祖师、洞真大道元始天尊，斗极宗师、洞玄大道太上道君，斗极真师、洞神大道太上老君，玉皇大天尊、玄穹高上帝，斗中之尊、天皇大帝，斗中之主、紫微大帝，北斗高上玉皇尊帝君，太微玉帝玄卿大帝君，北斗太尉阳明贪狼玉晨君，北斗上宰阴精巨门玉晨君，北斗司空真人禄存玉晨君，北斗游擎玄冥文曲玉晨君，北斗斗君丹元廉贞玉晨君、北斗大常北极武曲玉晨君，北斗上帝天关破军玉晨君，北斗玉帝洞明外辅玉晨君，北斗帝真隐元内弼玉晨君，斗中天罡万真节度奎光帝君，北斗九皇夫人，九阴内妃，三台华盖星君，三官五帝，九府四司，斗中道德诸君，无鞅圣众二六十甲子本命星君，玄中大法师，三天大法师，宝上真人，二仙使者，九宫官属，一切真灵。 臣等伏闻元始开图，演长生之秘箓； 玄元阐化，弘广济之妙门。

The **Master Guangcheng** (广成先生) **Du Guangting** (杜光庭) **compiled and edited**
The **Japanese Command Ritual** (生日本命仪)
At **midday Dao practice** (午朝行道),

The **Grand Master** (都讲举) **assembles**,
Each **offers respect to the Teacher** (各礼师) **and holds the mind in accordance with the Law** (存念如法).
The **High Functionary** (高功) **declares the protective spirit incantations** (宣卫灵咒).

The **Elixir Spirits and Vermilion Fire** (丹灵朱火) **blaze with radiant clouds and gusting winds** (炎霞激风).
The **Crimson Wheel** (赤轮) **moves with mighty force** (刚运),
And the **Heavenly Light** (天光) **strikes eight directions** (八冲).
Its **overwhelming might encompasses all** (迸威包罗),
**Transforming the myriad realms** (交变万方).
**Molten gold cascades** (流金豁落),
And **hostile spirits vanish without trace** (群魔灭踪).
**Evil is repelled, demons shattered** (辟奸破妖),
**Illuminating the Primordial Virtue** (明耀元功).
**Golden Talismans summon and command** (金符召制),
**Treading clouds, wielding dragons** (蹑云策龙).
**Hymns of praise resound** (谣歌庆会),
**Flowers scatter through the void** (散花太空).
**Divine transformations unfold** (神化宜运),
**Stabilizing the Four Quarters** (四极安隆).

**Humblest obeisance before the Celestial Sovereign** (伏御帝前),
**None dare be disrespectful** (罔有不恭),
**In perfect harmony with the Dao’s True Essence** (和与道合真).

The **Grand Master** (都讲举) **sounds the Law Drum twenty-four times** (鸣法鼓二十四通).
The **High Functionary** (高功) **ignites the furnace** (发炉).

**The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Originator** (无上三天玄元始三炁),
**The Most High Dao Lord** (太上道君),
**The Most High Venerable Lord** (太上老君),
**Summon forth from within my body** (召出臣身中)
**The Three Five Functionaries** (三五功曹),
**Left and Right Official Messengers** (左右官使者),
**Left and Right Incense Bearers** (左右捧香),
**Dragon-Coursing Postal Officials** (驿龙骑吏),
**Incense-Serving Golden Boys** (侍香金童),
**Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens** (传言散花玉女),
**The Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman Officials** (五帝直符),
**Direct Sunlight Incense Officials** (直日香官),
**Thirty-six each** (各三十六人) **now emerge**.

The **emerging ones** (出者) **adorned in solemn attire** (严装显服),
**Headgear and sashes with trailing ribbons** (冠带垂缨),
**Opening the Mystic Altars and local deities** (关启玄坛土地),
**And the territorial spirit lords** (方域神真).

Now, **at this midday Dao practice** (臣今午朝),
**Ascending the altar to perform the Way** (升坛行道),
**With utmost sincerity I present my heart’s intent** (谨奏为入意),
**My deepest reverence already recorded and heard** (其诸忱悃，已录告闻),
**I pray that the Most High Dao’s Ten Directions’ True Essence** (愿得太上十方至真道炁),
**The Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light** (灵宝瑞光) **descend and flow into our bodies** (下降，流入臣等身中),
**That my sincere invocation may swiftly reach** (令臣所启之诚，速达径御)
**The Most High Boundless Dao** (太上无极大道),
**The Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms** (三清三境天尊),
**The Heavenly Jade Emperor of the Supreme Void** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**And the Star Sovereign, the Great Emperor of the Vermilion Axis** (星主紫微大帝御前).

The **Grand Master** (都讲举) **invites the proclamation of ranks** (请称法位).
**The assembled officials and I** (具位臣姓某与合坛众官等),
**With united sincerity, humbly present our invocation** (谨同诚上启) **to:**

The **Polar Star Ancestral Teacher** (斗极祖师),
**The Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Perfected Dao** (洞真大道元始天尊),
The **Polar Star Patriarch** (斗极宗师),
**The Most High Dao Lord of the Mystic Dao** (洞玄大道太上道君),
The **Polar Star True Teacher** (斗极真师),
**The Most High Venerable of the Perfected Spirit Dao** (洞神大道太上老君),
The **Great Heavenly Venerable of Jade Sovereignty** (玉皇大天尊),
**The Highest Supreme Emperor of the Mystic Vault** (玄穹高上帝),
The **Sovereign of the Polar Center** (斗中之尊),
**The Heavenly Emperor** (天皇大帝),
The **Master of the Polar Center** (斗中之主),
**The Great Emperor of the Vermilion Axis** (紫微大帝),

chunks.original_text: 普及人天，同臻福佑。 由是宿瑕往结，咸得忏祈，片善微功，备蒙铨录，洪纤罪福，毫末无遗。 臣职在敷扬，愿裨大化，凡有祈告，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，诚深修奉，所宜誊奏，冀获感通。 窃惟三十六部尊经，修生为本； 二十七等斋法，崇善为先。 所以本命七星移度之篇，具明神咒三皇监乾之旨，许佩宝符，司马度籍，以延生太一，制魂而保寿。 元父玄母，内镇百关； 金晨玉华，外祛众恶。 降日华於大洞，解宿结於三田。 勤而行之，可以云升羽化，则本命具存修之理，载彼真经； 生日敷大有之书，明于奥旨，司命回十绝之信，元君开定籍之章，三界在庭，万神列位。 然后纪善录恶，保寿延生。 大哉，察气毓神，惊天骇地，诞生之重，圣教所尊，爰属兹辰，宜申福会，是用虔诚三宝，注仰十华，信币盟心，香花展礼，转经行道，悔过祈恩，依按典仪，奉修斋直。 以今午朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真道宝。 臣等志心皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，上资社稷尊灵，列圣昭穆，神升王阙，品列琼宫，腾逸驾於上清，介殊祥於大宝，允昌帝业，遐福群生。 弟子某家九世七玄，亿曾万祖，克辞幽夜，咸睹光明。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保长存，和与道合真。 以今午朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，养无上，供养无上至真经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，归流今上皇帝。 伏冀圣图悠久，宝祚延洪，日并睿明，山齐圣寿。 储宫妃后，光赞鸿休。 百辟忠贞，扶持景运，三光融朗，六炁和平，谷稼滋丰，兵戈戢息。 航深梯险，会万国以朝宗； 车轨书文，总八弦而混一。 俗臻有道，化洽无为。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，保天长存，和与道合真。 以今午朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香。 愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真师宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，归流斋主某，及内姻外族，眷属亲缘，体豫神安，福隆寿远，三灾不染，九厄无侵，家传忠孝之风，门袭安贞之吉。 九围之内，率土之中，景贶所资，群生咸泰。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保长存，和与道合真。 忏方，命魔，三启，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某等，谨同诚上启，三清上圣，十极高真，斗府神仙，醮筵真宰。 臣闻妙道垂文，三乘演教，至真流化，普度人天，得以微生，参奉玄奥，遵依圣本，敷赞玄科，冀罄丹诚，用裨鸿化。 今斋主某，窃惟上真弘济，三洞开光，有感必通，惟善是佑。 敢因初诞本命之日，愿伸祈忏之仪，稽首法筵，披心众圣，转经行道，请福希恩。 伏愿太上三尊，十方众圣，倾光三境，回驾九清，鉴省丹襟，滂流洪泽，降无涯之施，开大宥之慈。 赦除臣某己身，及六亲眷属、九玄七祖、一切亲缘，历劫以来，至于今日，六根障恼，三业罪条，或不孝不忠，不仁不义，犯违天地，秽慢三光，呵忿神明，轻凌四大，染滞声色，耽玩繁华，伤杀众生，以为快乐，妬胜己，抑绝贤明，冒利贪财，酷害於物，评论道德，毁败正真，口是心非，罔上凌下，犯三元品目、百八十条，无边无涯，不可忆识。
chunks.translated_text:
**Universal blessings extend to all beings, human and celestial,**
**All attaining shared fortune and grace.**
Thus, past sins and karmic entanglements are dissolved,
All may repent and pray—
Even the slightest merit or virtue is fully recorded,
Great and small transgressions and virtues none are omitted.

**Our duty lies in proclaiming and upholding**—
We humbly assist the **Dao’s transformation**,
And for all supplications, how dare we not report them?

**Proclamation:**
As the words declare, sincere devotion is practiced,
Worthy of being inscribed and presented,
Hoping for divine response and communion.

We reflect upon the **Thirty-Six Sacred Scriptures** (三十六部尊经),
Where nurturing life is the foundation;
And the **Twenty-Seven Grades of Ritual Fasting** (二十七等斋法),
Where upholding virtue takes precedence.

Thus, the **Seven Stars of the Native Command** (本命七星) are moved and transformed,
Revealing the **Three Sovereigns’ divine decrees** (三皇监乾之旨),
Permitting the wearing of **Sacred Talismans** (佩宝符),
And the **Celestial Registrar’s records** (司马度籍),
To prolong life through **Great Unity** (延生太一),
And preserve the soul while extending years.

**Primordial Father and Mystic Mother** (元父玄母)
Internally govern the **Hundred Passes** (百关);
**Golden Dawn and Jade Splendor** (金晨玉华)
Externally dispel all malevolence.

**Descending the Radiant Light into the Great Cavern** (降日华於大洞),
**Dissolving karmic bonds in the Three Fields** (解宿结於三田).
Diligently practicing this,
One may ascend as a **Feathered Immortal** (云升羽化),
For the principles of nurturing one’s **Native Command** are recorded in the **True Scriptures** (本命具存修之理，载彼真经);
The **Birthday Scripture of Great Abundance** (生日敷大有之书) clarifies its profound meaning,
The **Celestial Registrar** (司命) reverses the **Ten Absolute Judgments** (回十绝之信),
And the **Primordial Lord** (元君) opens the **Register of Destiny** (开定籍之章).
The **Three Realms** gather in the courtyard,
And **Ten Thousand Spirits** take their ranks.

Then, virtues are recorded, vices censured,
Longevity preserved, life extended.

**Great indeed is the discernment of qi and nurturing of spirit**—
Awe-inspiring to heaven and earth—
The weight of birth,
Honored by the **Sacred Teachings** (圣教所尊).
On this auspicious day,
We must proclaim the **Assembly of Blessings** (申福会),
Thus, with reverence to the **Three Treasures** (三宝),
We aspire to the **Ten Radiant Ones** (十华),
With sincere vows and offerings of incense and flowers,
Turning the **Sutra and practicing the Dao** (转经行道),
Repenting sins and praying for grace,
Following the prescribed rites,
And observing the **Fast of Rectitude** (修斋直).

At this **midday ritual** (午朝),
We ascend the platform to practice the Dao,
And invite the **Assembled Lawful Ones** (法众) to offer this **first incense strand** (初捻上香).
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
Nourishing the **Supreme Dao/Way Treasure** (无上至真道宝).

We, with devoted hearts, **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
Prostrating our heads to the earth.

We rely upon the **Three Supreme Ones** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints** (十方众圣),
That the merit of this incense strand
May benefit the **State’s Sacred Spirits** (社稷尊灵),
The **Ancestral Lineage of Illustrious Saints** (列圣昭穆),
Ascending to the **Celestial Gate** (神升王阙),
Ranked in the **Jade Palaces** (品列琼宫),
Soaring in the **Upper Clarity** (腾逸驾於上清),
And attaining **Auspicious Distinction at the Great Treasure** (介殊祥於大宝).
May the **Imperial Line flourish** (允昌帝业),
And blessings extend to all beings (遐福群生).

Descendants of **Certain Family, Nine Generations, Seven Ancestral Lines** (某家九世七玄),
Countless generations past and future,
All emerge from darkness to witness the light.
Now, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the **Dao’s Supreme Saints and True Ones** (道尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We shall eternally preserve life,
Harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).

At this **midday ritual** (午朝),
We ascend the platform to practice the Dao,
And invite the **Assembled Lawful Ones** (法众) to offer this **second incense strand** (二捻上香).
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
Nourishing the **Supreme Sutra Treasure** (养无上，供养无上至真经宝).

We, with devoted hearts, **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
Prostrating our heads to the earth.

We rely upon the **Three Supreme Ones** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints** (十方众圣),
That the merit of this incense strand
May flow to **the Present Emperor** (归流今上皇帝).
May the **Imperial Vision endure eternally** (伏冀圣图悠久),
And the **Sacred Destiny extend abundantly** (宝祚延洪),
With the sun’s wisdom ever bright (日并睿明),
And mountains echoing with sacred longevity (山齐圣寿).
The **Consorts and Royal House** radiate auspicious grace (储宫妃后，光赞鸿休).
Ministers remain loyal and steadfast (百辟忠贞),
Supporting the flourishing age (扶持景运),
While the **Three Lights shine harmoniously** (三光融朗),
And the **Six Qi** remain balanced (六炁和平).
Grain and crops flourish abundantly (谷稼滋丰),
Weapons rest in peace (兵戈戢息).
Deep seas are traversed, perilous heights ascended (航深梯险),
Uniting all nations in homage (会万国以朝宗);
Wheels of law and letters unify the **Eight Strings** (车轨书文，总八弦而混一).
The people attain the **Dao** (俗臻有道),
And transformation spreads effortlessly (化洽无为).

Now, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the **Sutra’s Supreme Saints and True Ones** (经尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We shall eternally preserve heavenly life (保天长存),
Harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).

At this **midday ritual** (午朝),
We ascend the platform to practice the Dao,
And invite the **Assembled Lawful Ones** (法众) to offer this **third incense strand** (三捻上香).
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
Nourishing the **Supreme Master Treasure** (供养无上至真师宝).

We, with devoted hearts, **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
Prostrating our heads to the earth.

We rely upon the **Three Supreme Ones** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints** (十方众圣),
That the merit of this incense strand
May flow to **the Ritual Master Certain** (斋主某),
And to his **inner and outer kin** (内姻外族),
All relatives and connections (眷属亲缘),
That they may be **physically and spiritually at ease** (体豫神安),
With abundant blessings and longevity (福隆寿远),
Unscathed by the **Three Calamities** (三灾不染),
And untouched by the **Nine Hardships** (九厄无侵).
May the **House transmit loyal and filial virtues** (家传忠孝之风),
And the **Gate inherit steadfast harmony** (门袭安贞之吉).
Within the **Nine Enclosures** and across the **Entire Realm** (九围之内，率土之中),
May all benefit from **Auspicious Grace** (景贶所资),
And all beings prosper (群生咸泰).

Now, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the **Master’s Supreme Saints and True Ones** (师尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We shall eternally preserve life (永保长存),
Harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).

**Repentance, Command Demons, Three Invocations, Three Rituals.**
We reaffirm our **Lawful Stations** (重称法位).

**The humble officials Certain and others** (具位臣某等),
With sincere hearts, humbly petition the **Three Pure Ones, Supreme Saints** (三清上圣),
The **Ten Extremes’ High True Ones** (十极高真),
The **Northern Dipper Celestial Officials** (斗府神仙),
And the **Ritual Banquet’s True Sovereigns** (醮筵真宰).

We have heard that the **Mystic Dao** manifests in scripture,
With the **Three Vehicles expounding teachings** (三乘演教),
The **Supreme True Ones** spread transformation (至真流化),
And universally save all beings, human and celestial (普度人天).
Thus, even the lowly may participate in the **Profound Mysteries** (微生参奉玄奥),
Following the **Sacred Originals** (遵依圣本),
And assisting in the **Mystic Rites** (敷赞玄科),
Hoping to exhaust our **Crimson Sincerity** (罄丹诚),
And aid the **Great Transformation** (用裨鸿化).

Now, the **Ritual Master Certain** reflects:
The **Supreme True Ones** universally bestow salvation (上真弘济),
The **Three Caverns radiate light** (三洞开光),
And all supplications are answered (有感必通),
For they favor only the virtuous (惟善是佑).

Daring to mark this **Native Command’s Birthday** (初诞本命之日),
We extend our **Repentance and Supplication Rites** (伸祈忏之仪),
Bowing before the **Ritual Platform** (稽首法筵),
Opening our hearts to the **Assembled Saints** (披心众圣),
Turning the **Sutra and practicing the Dao** (转经行道),
And praying for blessings and grace (请福希恩).

We humbly pray that the **Three Supreme Ones** (太上三尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints** (十方众圣),
Shine upon the **Three Realms** (倾光三境),
And descend to the **Nine Pure Lands** (回驾九清),
Examining our **Crimson Hearts** (鉴省丹襟),
And flooding us with **Abundant Grace** (滂流洪泽).
Grant us **Boundless Mercy** (降无涯之施),
And **Great Forgiveness** (开大宥之慈).

Pardon **ourselves, Certain** (臣某己身),
And our **six relatives, kin, seven ancestral lines, and all connections** (六亲眷属、九玄七祖、一切亲缘),
From **past kalpas to this day** (历劫以来，至于今日),
For the **Six Senses’ obstructions and afflictions** (六根障恼),
And the **Three Actions’ transgressions** (三业罪条)—
Whether **disobedience to parents, lack of loyalty, cruelty, or injustice** (或不孝不忠，不仁不义),
**Defying heaven and earth** (犯违天地),
**Dishonoring the Three Lights** (秽慢三光),
**Provoking the Divine** (呵忿神明),
**Disrespecting the Four Great Elements** (轻凌四大),
**Indulging in sensual pleasures** (染滞声色),
**Wallowing in worldly luxuries** (耽玩繁华),
**Harming living beings for joy** (伤杀众生，以为快乐),
**Jealousy and suppression of the virtuous** (妬胜己，抑绝贤明),
**Greed and harm to others** (冒利贪财，酷害於物),
**Criticizing the Dao and defaming the True** (评论道德，毁败正真),
**Hypocrisy and deceit** (口是心非),
**Rebellion against superiors and tyranny over inferiors** (罔上凌下),
**Violating the Three Primordial Precepts and the Hundred and Eighty Prohibitions** (犯三元品目、百八十条),
**Endless and boundless offenses** (无边无涯),
**Beyond count or recollection.** (不可忆识).

chunks.original_text: 因今忏悔，并乞荡除。 上愿帝道兴昌，寰瀛康泰，三光调理，五纬顺常，人归朴素之风，俗洽和平之化。 九幽夜府，咸睹光明； 六趣殊伦，共臻祯贶。 斋主某椿骞等算，金玉齐身，寿禄内延，灾凶外息，子孙忠孝，门宇清安，三界真灵，潜加佑护。 上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚。 谨启以闻。 知磬举，十二愿。 都讲举，存神烧香。 高功复炉。 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来午朝升坛行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、三清三境天尊、昊天玉皇上帝、紫微北极大帝御前。 知磬举，出堂颂。 出户，弘至六幕堂。

「In light of today’s repentance and supplication, I humbly beseech the purification and elimination of all sins.

I pray that the **Dao of the Sovereign** (帝道) may flourish and spread, that the world may enjoy peace and prosperity, that the **Three Lights** (三光) be harmonized, and the **Five Celestial Stems** (五纬) follow their natural order. May all people return to the **plain and simple customs** (朴素之风), and may the realm embrace the **culture of universal harmony** (和平之化).

May the **Nine Abysses** (九幽) and the **Nocturnal Palaces** (夜府) all witness the radiance of the **Dao**. May the **Six Paths of Rebirth** (六趣) of diverse beings alike attain the **auspicious blessings** (祯贶) of the **True Dao** (至真).

As for this humble practitioner, **[name] Zhenchuan** and others, may we be adorned with **gold and jade** (金玉齐身), our longevity and blessings extended within (寿禄内延), while calamities and misfortunes be dispelled without (灾凶外息). chunks.original_text: 所以大道垂文，至真演教，延生保寿，丰国安人。 臣等获奉真乘，栖身道域，披八会九光之篆，睹琼编玉籍之文，皆以旷劫宣行，先天流布，理国太平之旨，修身延寿之篇。 而寓迹尘寰，和光陆海，惟期敷赞，以着微功。 凡有所陈，理宜关奏，况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，所宜上达。 盖以初诞本命之日，志切香灯，虔启法坛，精修斋直，拂三清之宝牒，披三洞之简章，太一度符之篇，五灵奉籍之要，皆以凝神三境，属念上玄，期禀受於初天，仰宗元於大道，用祈通感，宜合真灵，涤虑洗心，愿孚真佑。 以今晚朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真道宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，上资社稷宗庙，列圣尊灵，宴处玉京，流祥宝祚，克昌大业，广福群生。 斋主某七祖九玄，登真证道，炼神丹阙，超迹玄阴，三界十方，同臻胜福。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保长存，和与道合真。 以今晚朝，升坛行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养无上至真经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地。 仰依太上三尊，十方众圣，愿以是捻香功德，上祝当今皇帝，伏冀睿图隆永，圣寿遐长。 握金镜以低临，万方昭泰； 俨珠旒而端穆，八海澄清。 朝有忠贞，俗臻富寿。 储皇妃后，协赞昌期，公主诸王，保宁休运。 火鼠烛龙之外，琛赆争驰； 虞泉蒙谷之乡，车书混一。

Thus, the **Great Dao** descends in scripture, the **True Essence** expounds in teaching;
To prolong life and preserve longevity, to enrich the state and secure its people.

Your servants, having received the **True Vehicle**,
Dwell within the **Dao Domain**,
Donning the seals of the **Eight Assemblies** and **Nine Lights**,
Beholding the **Jade Registers** and **Celestial Scriptures**,
All are proclaimed across boundless eons,
Flowing from the **Primordial Heaven**,
Containing the principles of state pacification,
And the chapters on self-cultivation for prolonged life.

Yet, we dwell in the dusty world,
Harmonizing our **qi** as we traverse land and sea,
Only desiring to spread and extol,
To manifest even the slightest merit.

For whatever we may present,
It should be properly recorded and submitted;
How much more so when we receive imperial edicts—
How dare we not report them above?

**Proclamation of Words.**

According to the words spoken,
It is fitting to submit them to the highest authority.

For on the day of our birth and **Native Star**,
Our hearts yearned for fragrant incense,
Devoutly opening the **Law Altar**,
Diligently observing **fasting and purity**,
Polishing the **Three Pure Ones'** sacred tablets**,
Unfolding the **Three Enclosures'** ancient scrolls**,
Studying the **Great One**’s talismans,
And the **Five Spirits'** essential registries,
All with concentrated minds in **Three Realms**,
Devoted thoughts ascending to the **Supreme Mysteries**,
Seeking to receive from the **Primordial Heaven**,
To revere the **Great Dao**,
To pray for mutual resonance and alignment with **True Spirits**,
To purify our thoughts and wash our hearts,
To earnestly trust in the **True Auspices**.

In this evening’s **Dao Assembly**,
Ascending the altar to practice the **Way**,
We request the **Law Assembly** to perform this **first offering of incense**,
May this incense smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To venerate the **Supreme True Dao Treasure**.

Your servants, **returning body, returning spirit, returning life**,
Prostrate ourselves with heads to the ground.

We rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns**,
The **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints**,
May the merit of this incense offering
Ascend to benefit the **Altars of Land and Grain**,
The **Sacred Spirits** of the **Heavenly Court**,
To dwell in **Jade Capital**,
To spread blessings and **Precious Auspices**,
To achieve great prosperity,
To broadly bestow fortune upon all beings.

The **seventh ancestor of the Nine Mysteries**,
Ascended to **True Perfection** and **Dao Attainment**,
Refined the **Divine Elixir** at the **Celestial Pass**,
Transcended the **Mysterious Yin**,
In the **Three Realms** and **Ten Directions**,
All attain supreme blessings.

Thus, we now burn incense,
**Returning in devotion** to the **Dao Sovereign’s** **True Saints**,
After attaining the **Way**,
Forever safeguarding our **long abiding**,
In harmony with **Dao and True Essence**.

In this evening’s **Dao Assembly**,
Ascending the altar to practice the **Way**,
We request the **Law Assembly** to perform this **second offering of incense**,
May this incense smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To venerate the **Supreme True Scripture Treasure**.

Your servants, **returning body, returning spirit, returning life**,
Prostrate ourselves with heads to the ground.

We rely upon the **Supreme Three Sovereigns**,
The **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints**,
May the merit of this incense offering
Ascend to bless the present emperor,
Humbly hoping his **enlightened vision** may flourish eternally,
His **sacred life** extend far and long.

With the **Golden Mirror** held low to survey,
All under heaven shall know **Great Harmony**;
With the **Pearl Tassels** adorned in solemn dignity,
The **Eight Seas** shall be serene and clear.

Morning shall have **loyal and sincere** officials,
Common folk shall attain **wealth and longevity**.
The **Empress and Consorts** shall be reserved,
Assisting in the **auspicious period** of prosperity,
Princesses and **Noble Kings**,
Shall be kept in **peace and good fortune**.

Beyond the **Fire Rat** and **Dragon Torch**,
**Jade and gold** shall vie in swift procession;
In the lands of **Yu Spring** and **Meng Valley**,
**Carriages and documents** shall flow as one.
