Though it may be recorded without seeing its form,
And though its name be unknown, it is called **Dao**.

Thus, the **Yang** abides in **Great Xia**,
Nurturing and fostering all things as its duty.
The **Heavenly Ancestor** encompasses all beings,
And embraces and covers all without distinction.

All things, great and small, are entirely entrusted to its cultivation.
Without words, it is understood;
The four seasons proceed, and all things are born.
No malevolent *qi* can prevail—
The five grains ripen, and the myriad people flourish.
The **transformative work** depends upon it,
And blessings are bestowed in due measure.

The **Temple Official** [Name], having long cultivated virtuous roots,
Has now heard the **True Dao**.
Reflecting upon himself and acknowledging faults,
How dare he not reverently fear the **Celestial Above**,
And observe the precepts while fasting in devotion,
Hoping to appease the **Childless**,
That I, the humble servant, may present this plea,
And seek the **Sage’s return and reliance**,
With sincere words at dawn,
Dutifully declaring my intent.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As stated in the petition, the sincerity is profound and earnest.
With reverence, I await the **Celestial’s gracious hearing**,
And humbly beg for **merciful indulgence**.
I pray for the **greatest of blessings**,
That my **long-lasting prayers** may be granted.

I have heard that the *Yijing* speaks of the **Great Ultimate**,
From which the **Two Principles** arise.
Great is the **Primordial of Heaven**,
The origin of all things.
All who dwell beneath Heaven and tread upon Earth
Naturally balance **Yin and Yang**.
Those who receive the **Great Dao** attain a nature of **Purity and Harmony**;
Those who receive but little manifest as **soaring and crawling creatures**.
Thus, no thing fails to be nourished by **dew and rain**,
And all sentient beings emerge from **molding and refining**.

All who rely upon this **transformative birth**—
How dare we forget to return and align with it?
Though the **sunflower’s heart** be distant,
Its sincerity still turns toward the **Sun**;
Though the **otter’s sacrifice** be humble,
It still performs rites to **Heaven**.
How much more so for those in **humanity’s path**,
Residing in this **transitional age**—
With offerings and prayers,
We must be **precise and singular** in devotion.

The **Temple Official** [Name], in fasting and ceremonial attire,
Choosing this auspicious day,
Reverently obeys the **Celestial Above**,
And solemnly serves the **Most High Emperor**.
Hoping the **hundred spirits** will come to witness,
I pray that **one prayer may yield a son**,
Fulfilling my supplication,
And glorifying the **transformative power**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **first incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Dao Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To bless the **Current Emperor of China**.
May he and his **descendants for a hundred generations** live **ten thousand years**,
With **royal lineage secure** and **Heaven’s decree fulfilled**.
Following **Jiang Yuan’s** footsteps in **military virtue**,
Nurturing the people as **Di Xin** did;
Exceeding **Di Jian’s** prayers to Heaven,
And receiving the **auspicious phoenix**.
Enhancing the **prosperity of the ancestral halls**,
And fulfilling the **blessings of longevity**,
May this grace extend to the **Temple Official**,
And flow to his **future descendants**.

Thus, the **ancestral halls** shall flourish like **sage and bamboo**;
**Sincerity in harmony with Heaven** shall bring **auspicious cranes and harmonious offspring**.
Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Dao’s Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve Heaven’s eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **second incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Scriptural Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To the **Spirits of the State and Ancestral Temples, the Revered and Sacred Forefathers**.

May the **clan and ancestral halls** be **cared for with compassion**,
And the **ancestral temples** maintained in **solemn reverence**.
Though the **ancestors above** may be distant,
Their blessings extend as **nine autumns of longevity**;
The **glory of the lineage** shall align with **Heaven’s decree**,
And **match the Emperor’s virtue without partiality**.
Descending to the **Temple Official**,
May **ancestral grace** be bestowed upon his **forebears**,
And may he **joyfully ascend to the Imperial Abode**,
His praises **resounding in the Celestial Court**;
His **sorrowful incense** shall **shine in the divine *qi***,
And his **humble offerings** shall **bring blessings to the living**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Scriptural Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **preserve eternal life**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

With this **dawn ritual**, I request the **assembly of the Law** to perform the **third incense offering**.
May this **incense cloud** ascend to the heavens,
And offer homage to the **Supreme and Most True Master Treasures of the Ten Directions**.

We, the servants, **surrender body, spirit, and fate**,
Prostrate ourselves in devotion,
And dedicate the merit of this incense offering
To **all distant and near, encompassing the dim and the luminous**.

May the **three luminaries** move in **harmonious order**,
And the **four seas** unite in **civilization**;
May **floods and droughts** be forever **dissipated**,
And **wars and punishments** **cease**.
Let there be **five days of wind and ten days of rain**,
Without fear of **broken branches or shattered earth**;
Let there be **ten thousand granaries and ten thousand chests**,
With **ease in tilling and reaping**.
May **one household’s blessings** extend to **all under Heaven**,
And all **share in the happiness of Hua Xu**,
Ascending to the **Mystic and Wondrous**.

Even the **calf of the plow-ox** shall bear **fine horns and multiply**;
The **old clam** shall **radiate brilliance**, its **pearls fully formed**.
Grace shall be **equally bestowed upon all living things**,
Each fulfilling its **natural destiny**.

Now, with this incense offering,
We **return in reliance to the Great Saints of the Master Treasures’ Most True Assembly**.
After attaining the **Dao**, we shall **permanently prosper and flourish**,
And merge in **harmony with the True Way**.

**Chant the Square**, **Confess the Square**, **Three Invocations**, **Three Rites**.
Reaffirm the **Law’s station**.
The **officiating servants** [Names],
With **sincere hearts**, now **humbly present our petition** to:
The **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I have heard that when **disaster strikes**, one should **fear and reflect**,
And **great virtue** shall **descend in guidance**.
Seeing **goodness**, one must **follow its path**,
As the **Teachings of Righteousness** instruct.
**Heaven is supreme**—
**Repentance must come first**.
When **sacrificial rains return** and **winds reverse**,
**Bright Virtue** is **manifested**.
When **Mars retreats**,
It **aligns with virtuous speech**.
Though it may lack **sound or scent to trace**,
Its response is **as certain as the echo of a hollow vessel**.

chunks.original_text: 而况恶人斋戒沐浴，则可以昭事於上帝； 君子恐惧修省，亦能主祭於长男。 非惟变咎以为祥，乃使回心而向道。 醮官某伏念自从前世，以至今生，意马奔驰，心猿狂率，愧怍天地，讪谤君师，不孝二亲，问离九族。 忘哀废礼，或不祀於祖先； 弃子堕胎，夙自残於骨肉。 阴贼犯上，蔽贤害能，黩真无厌，遏籴不顾。 苟利道於锥刀之末，私富贵於垄断之中。 乐祸喜灾，妄绝他宗之祭祀； 欺孤伐冢，巧增自己之田园。 素无恻隐之心，是亦强梁之行。 又或焚山竭泽，煮茧覆巢，枉害众生，未偿夙业，自贻谴责，故触神灵。 又或为臣不忠，杀人以政。 劳民动众，为祸首於一时； 尸位素餐，旷天工於百辟。 伐牛山於旦旦，漏天网於恢恢。 凡百所为，罔知纪极，有一干此，未或不亡，以致朋淫于家，用殄厥世，不德罔大，将坠厥宗。 此皆先圣之格言，抑亦天心之可畏。 用是存诚洁己，改往修来，敬终日以乾乾，罄小心而翼翼，自陈罪网，仰丐恩怜。 伏愿浩浩高天，皇皇后帝，发好生之大德，敷旷荡之深恩，咸与惟新，哀此统独，庶传种姓，用守宗祊。 载育载生，长阶庭之兰玉； 以嗣以续，学弓冶之箕裘。 庶几荀氏之八龙，不愧河东之三凤，愿有加於帝力，宜俾肖於后昆。 恳祷之诚，朝夕以冀，再惟蕃衍，尤赖操修。 孤立於赵者，为十世之诸侯； 功着於梁者，为八叶之宰相。 或使谏君而知臧孙之有后，或以阴德而信丙氏之必与，于公高门，张汤扬善，傥使一二而悉数，虽至千百而匪周，此皆作善降之百祥，抑亦惟天佑于一德。 傥有克艰厥后，为业所牵，历考古初，亦存龟鉴。 汉侯犯法，四五世而靡有孑遗； 虞诩多冤，二十年而不传一口。 或以阴谋六出而废后，或以为将三代而覆宗。 受玉堕容，尚招恶报； 先配后祖，岂保吉祥。 顾阴谴之甚明，虽它美而莫赎。 苟能见其过而内自省者，将反身而诚乐莫大焉。 某敢不寅畏天威，归依造化，誓从今日，以及来生，惟改过以自新，将迎祥而集庆。 资生资始，均有赖於乾坤； 成象成形，庶归功於天地。 早符吉兆，下慰凡情，上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等归命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来清旦行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿罪罟蠲消，庆源增衍。 倾心受度，即膺馈鲤之祥； 蒙道顺生，允获弄璋之庆。 一门被泽，四海沾荣。 次愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

「Then how much more so for wicked men who fast and bathe in purification,
Yet still may **manifest reverence** before the **Supreme Emperor**;
For the **Noble Ones** who fear and reflect in **self-cultivation**,
May also **preside over sacrifices** as the eldest sons.

Not only do they transform calamity into auspicious fortune,
But they turn hearts back toward the **Dao/Way**.
This **Dao/Way** is the **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Responsive Deities of the Three Realms**,
And **all True Spirits**.

I, **a Daoist Official**, humbly reflect:
Since my **past lives** until this present birth,
My **mind-monkeys** have galloped wild,
My **heart-demons** have raged unrestrained,
Shaming **Heaven and Earth**,
Defaming **sages and teachers**,
Disobeying my **two parents**,
Severing ties with my **nine clans**.
I have **forgotten filial piety**, neglected rites—
Sometimes **not venerating** my **ancestors**;
Or **abandoning children**, **destroying fetuses**,
Long ago **inflicting harm** upon my own **kin**.

With **treacherous deceit**, I **offend superiors**,
Conceal the **virtuous**, harm the **able**,
Gleefully **corrupt** without restraint,
**Hoarding grain** while ignoring the people’s suffering.
If **profit** lies at the **tip of a needle**,
I **privately covet** **honor and wealth** in **land monopolies**;
I **rejoice in disaster**, **delight in others’ ruin**,
**Arbitrarily severing** the **sacrifices of rival sects**;
**Exploiting orphans**, **ravaging graves**,
**Cunningly expanding** my own **fields and gardens**.

I **lack compassion**—
My deeds are those of the **tyrant and oppressor**.

Or I **burn mountains**, **exhaust marshes**,
**Boil silkworms**, **overturn nests**,
**Wrongfully harming** **all living beings**,
Yet **unfulfilled** my **past karmic debts**,
**Bringing ruin upon myself**,
And thus **offending the Divine**.

Or as a **subject**, I **fail in loyalty**,
**Condemning men to death** under false pretenses.
I **exhaust the people**, **disturb the masses**,
Becoming the **chief of calamity** in an age;
I **hold office without merit**, **feasting idly**,
**Wasting Heaven’s work** among the **hundred officials**.
I **fell the sacred cows** of **Mount Niu**,
**Piercing the vast net** of **Heaven’s justice**.

All my actions—
**None know their limits**,
And if one **engages in such deeds**,
**None shall escape ruin**,
Leading to **licentious partners** in my home,
And **extinction of my lineage**,
**Lacking virtue and greatness**,
My **clan shall fall**.

These are the **precepts of the sages**,
And **Heaven’s will** is **dreadful indeed**.
Thus, I **preserve sincerity**, **purify myself**,
**Rectify my past**, **cultivate my future**,
With **vigilant devotion** all day long,
And **trepidation** in my smallest thoughts,
**Confessing my karmic sins**,
And **humbly beseeching mercy**.

I pray that the **vast and august Heaven**,
The **magnificent Sovereign Emperor**,
May **unleash the great virtue of life-giving**,
And **bestow boundless compassion**,
So that **all may renew their hearts**,
And **this humble clan** alone **may be spared**,
Its **lineage preserved**, its **rites upheld**.
**Nurturing and sustaining life**,
May we **raise noble offspring** like **lan and jade** in the courtyard;
**To inherit and continue**,
May we **learn the arts** of **archery and metallurgy**,
Like **Ji and You**—
So that the **Eight Dragons of the Xun Clan** may **not shame**,
Nor the **Three Phoenixes of Hedong** **be dishonored**,
And may we **receive Heaven’s favor**,
**Emulate the virtuous descendants** of the **Empress**.

My **earnest prayers** are **offered day and night**,
And **prolific blessings** depend **on moral cultivation**.
The **lonely one in Zhao** became a **feudal lord for ten generations**,
And the **meritorious in Liang** was a **prime minister for eight**;
Some **advised their rulers** and **earned descendants** like **Zang and Sun**,
Others **accumulated hidden virtue** and **were trusted** like **the Bing Clan**.

Though **publicly renowned** like **Zhang Tang and Yang Shen**,
Even if **one or two** were counted,
Though **a thousand or ten thousand** were named,
**None would be exhaustive**—
These are the **hundred auspicious signs** of **doing good**,
And **Heaven’s aid** comes **from a single virtue**.

If **one perseveres in difficulty** afterward,
**Dragged by past deeds**,
Yet **reviews ancient precedents**,
**Heaven’s warnings** remain clear.

The **Han Marquis** who **broke the law**—
His **clan perished** in **four or five generations**, leaving **no survivors**.
**Yu Xu** who **harbored many grudges**—
His **lineage died out** in **twenty years**, **not passing a single mouth**.

Some **schemed treacherously** and **overthrew their rulers**,
Others **plotted to destroy** the **Three Dynasties** and **ruin their clans**.
Even if **one receives the jade seal** and **falls into disgrace**,
**Evil retribution** shall **still be incurred**;
If **one marries first** and **buries their parents last**,
**How can auspicious fortune** be **guaranteed**?

Yet **Heaven’s condemnation** is **plainly evident**,
Even if **other virtues** exist, **none can redeem** it.
If **one sees their faults** and **reflects inwardly**,
They shall **return to righteousness**—
**No greater joy** than this.

I, **a humble petitioner**, dare **not defy Heaven’s might**,
But **submit to the creative transformation**,
And **pledge from this day forward**,
Until **future lives**,
To **rectify my errors** and **renew my heart**,
And thus **invite auspicious fortune** and **gather blessings**.

**Life and its beginnings** rely **on the interplay of Heaven and Earth**,
**Form and completion** owe **their debt to Heaven and Earth**.
**Early signs of good fortune** descend,
**To comfort all beneath**,
And **to reveal Heaven’s great mercy**,
While **below**, my **sincere submission** is **fulfilled**—
Thus, I **humbly present** this **petition**.

**Twelve Vows** are **restored**.
The **Incense Official and Messengers**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals**,
And the **Attendant Spirits of Incense**,
Shall **command** that at my **former sites of Daoist practice**,
**Golden elixir and emerald dew**,
**Mushrooms and herbs of all kinds**,
And **gathered True Spirits**,
May **naturally appear**, **converging** at this **incense burner**.
Then shall **my karmic sins be absolved**,
And **sources of blessings be expanded**.

With **devoted heart**, I **receive the Dao’s guidance**,
And **shall attain the auspicious sign** of **the fish and the tortoise**;
**Blessed by the Dao**, I **shall be born anew**,
And **earn the joy** of **holding jade and pearl**.
My **entire household** shall **be favored**,
And **all under Heaven** shall **share its glory**.

Next, I **vow** that **celestial children and jade maidens** from the **Ten Directions**,
Shall **attend the fragrant incense**,
And **convey my former petitions’ sincerity**,
Swiftly **reaching the presence** of the **Supreme and Limitless Dao**,
The **Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
And the **True Spirits of the Three Realms**.

**Hymns of praise** are **offered from the hall**,
**From the doorway**.

Its response is **as certain as the echo of a hollow vessel**.

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之二十六竟 道门科范大全集卷之二十七 祈嗣大醮仪 临午行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 丹灵朱火，炎霞激风。 赤轮刚运，天光八冲。 迸威包罗，交变万方。 流金豁落，群魔灭踪。 辟奸破妖，明耀元功。 金符召制，蹑云策龙。 谣歌庆会，散花太空。 神化宜运，四极安隆。 伏御帝前，罔有不恭，和与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，各三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今临午行道，谨奏为入意，其诸忱悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与临坛官众，谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，玉晨大道灵宝天尊，万天教主道德天尊，昊天至尊玉皇上帝，勾陈星宫天皇大帝，中天星主紫微北极大帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，神霄真王长生大帝，东极注生青玄上帝，九天应元雷声普化天尊，九天雷祖大帝，上清紫微碧玉宫太一大天帝，六天洞渊大帝，六波天主帝君，九天好生可韩司丈人天尊，九天采访应元保运真君，九天上帝，三十二天上帝，五老上帝，东华木公道君，西灵金母元君，日宫太阳帝君，月府太阴皇君，五方五德星君，二十八宿星君，北斗七元上道真君，南斗六司上生真君，五福十神太一真君，上清四余四曜星君，天曹诸司真君，三元三官大帝，泰玄枢机三省诸相天君，玄中大法师真君，三天大法师真君，法主四圣真君，上清雷霆院使真君，雷霆九司列职真君，九天注生监生真君，九天司禄梓潼帝君，九天卫房圣母元君，本靖诸省府院司经箓法部主宰真君，三天门下三元真君，上章词表灵官，五岳圣帝，洞天福地、靖庐治化仙官，本靖祖玄真师、列位真人，经籍度列位真人，北阴酆都大帝，扶桑丹林大帝，三河四渎、五湖四海龙王，名山大川真宰，九天金阙、玉阙灵济洪恩二位真君，风云雷雨部威烈圣众，城隍里社庙貌一切真灵。 臣闻主器莫若长子，盖有重於承传； 天道常与善人，惟密移於造化。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Compendium of Daoist Rituals and Precepts—Volume Twenty-Six Completed**
**Volume Twenty-Seven: The Grand Rite for Praying for Lineage**

At noon, the **Dao** is practiced. The ritual proceedings ascend the platform as prescribed.

Each pays homage to the Master with sincere reverence, as the law directs.
The **Guardian Spirit’s** incantations are proclaimed.
**Dan qi** and **Jiuhuo** blaze forth—
Flames and winds surge, radiant and fierce.
The **Red Wheel** rolls with mighty force,
Its light piercing the **Eight Directions**.
Its **thundering power** envelops all,
Its **cyclic transformations** span the **Ten Thousand Worlds**.
**Liquid gold** cascades, **magical barriers** collapse—
All **demons and malevolent forces** vanish without trace.
**Evil spirits** and **fiends** are repelled,
The **radiant brilliance** of the **Primordial Work** shines forth.
**Golden talismans** summon and command—
**Cloud-striding officers** and **Dragon-taming scribes** appear.
**Hymns of joy** and **celebratory songs** resound,
**Flowers of praise** scatter across the **void**.
**Divine efficacy** runs smoothly,
The **Four Quarters** stand in tranquil splendor.

Humbly **submitting before the Celestial Sovereign**,
I **bow in reverence**, with **no trace of disrespect**,
And **harmonize** with the **Dao’s true essence**.

The **law-drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

The **Supreme Three Heavens’** *Xuan Yuan Shi* of the **Three Qi**,
The **Supreme Dao Lord** and **Supreme Old Lord**,
Are invoked to summon forth from my body the **Three Five Functionaries**,
The **Left and Right Officers** and **Messengers**,
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**,
The **Dragon-Coursing Postmen** and **Cavalry Scribes**,
The **Incense-Attending Golden Boys**,
The **Speech-Conveying, Flower-Scattering Jade Girls**,
The **Five Emperors’** *Zhi Fu* talismans,
The **Zhi Ri** Incense Officers—
Each **thirty-six persons** appear.

Those who emerge are clad in **solemn attire and resplendent garments**,
Their **headdresses and sashes** adorned with trailing **ribbons**.
The **Mysterious Daoist Altars’** *Tudi* and **regional deities** are opened.

Now, at noon, I practice the **Dao**,
And **solemnly present** my **sincere petition**.
With **heartfelt devotion** and **unfaltering sincerity**,
My **vows** have already been **recorded and heard**.
I pray that the **Supreme Dao’s** *Qi* of the **Ten Directions**,
The **Sacred Treasure’s** *Gui Guang* radiance,
May **descend and flow** into my body,
So that my **petition** may **swiftly reach** the **Supreme Limitless Dao**,
And the **Jade Emperor of Heaven’s** *Huangdi* presence.

**Invoke the sacred titles** as prescribed.
**I, [Name],** with the **officers assembled on the platform**,
**Together present** this **sincere petition**:
To the **Primordial Lord of the Void-Natural**,
The **Sacred Treasure Lord of the Jade Morn**,
The **Master of the Ten Thousands of Heavens**,
The **Moral Dao Lord**,
The **Supreme Celestial Sovereign, Jade Emperor of Heaven**,
The **Great Emperor of the Gōuchén Star Palace**,
The **Star Master of the Zhongtian**,
The **Great Emperor of the Purple River, Northern Pole**,
The **Earthly Sovereign of the Posterior Soil**,
The **Long-Life Great Emperor of the Divine Dawn**,
The **Lord of the Eastern Pole, Vitality**,
The **Lord of the Green Primordial**,
The **Lord of the Nine Heavens, Responsive Primordial**,
The **Thunderous Voice, Universal Transformation Lord**,
The **Great Emperor of the Nine Heavens, Thunderous Ancestor**,
The **Great Heavenly Sovereign of the Upper Clarity, Purple River, and Jade Morn**,
The **Great Emperor of the Six Heavens, Cavernous Abyss**,
The **Lord of the Six Waves**,
The **Lord of the Nine Heavens, Benevolent Life**,
The **Honorable Elder of the Nine Heavens, Investigating and Responding**,
The **Lord of the Nine Heavens, Sovereign**,
The **Thirty-Two Heavenly Sovereigns**,
The **Five Elderly Sovereigns**,
The **Dao Lord of the Eastern Hua, Wood Public**,
The **Elemental Lady of the Western Spirit, Golden Mother**,
The **Lord of the Sun Palace, Supreme Sun**,
The **Lord of the Moon Bureau, Supreme Yin**,
The **Star Lords of the Five Directions**,
The **Star Lords of the Twenty-Eight Constellations**,
The **Seven High Lords of the Northern Dipper**,
The **Six High Lords of the Southern Dipper**,
The **True Lords of the Five Blessings and Ten Spirits**,
The **Four Residues and Four Luminaries of the Upper Clarity**,
The **True Lords of the Heavenly Tribunals**,
The **Three Elemental Lords, Three Official Lords**,
The **Lords of the Great Primordial Axis, Three Provinces**,
The **True Lord of the Mysterious Central Dao**,
The **True Lord of the Three Heavenly Dao Masters**,
The **Four Sacred Dao Lords**,
The **True Lords of the Upper Clarity, Thunderous Retribution**,
The **Nine Official Lords of the Thunderous Retribution**,
The **True Lords of the Nine Heavens, Vitality, and Superintendence**,
The **Lord of the Nine Heavens, Bestowing Provision**,
The **Lord of the Nine Heavens, Palace Guard**,
The **Sacred Mother of the Nine Heavens, Room Guard**,
The **True Lords of the Original Calm, Provincial Tribunals, and Departments**,
The **True Lords of the Original Calm, Ancestral Daoist Teachers**,
The **Five Sacred Emperors of the Mountains**,
The **Divine Daoist Teachers of the Cavernous Immortal Abodes**,
The **Divine Daoist Teachers of the Auspicious Abodes and Tranquil Lodges**,
The **Honored True Persons**,
The **Degrees-Conveying True Persons**,
The **Great Emperor of the Northern Yin, Bīngdū**,
The **Great Emperor of the Vermilion Forest, Danlin**,
The **Lords of the Three Rivers, Four Marshes, Five Lakes, and Four Seas**,
The **True Lords of the Mountains and Great Waters**,
The **Two Lords of the Nine Heavens, Golden and Jade Gates**,
The **Divine Spirits of the Wind, Cloud, Thunder, and Rain Departments**,
The **Sacred Assembly of the City Gods and Village Shrines**—
All **true and holy spirits**.

I have heard:
**"No vessel is more precious than the eldest son**,
For he **bears the weight of lineage and transmission**.
**Heaven’s Dao** always **favors the virtuous**,
And **secrets of transformation** are **bestowed upon those who create harmony**."

chunks.original_text: 宛不言而善应，随有感以必通。 粤自神灵，为之主宰，在昔高祺，请子必严。 郊外之祈，尧帝多男，亦假华封之祝，况兹凡陋，敢昧归依。 当一意以告虔，冀三元之道养。 钦哉，首上圩顶，孔父有祷於尼丘； 骏极于天，申甫降神於嵩岳。 或元精之育固，或昴宿之储萧。 邑姜梦帝，则文在手而曰虞； 燕姑梦兰，则使称天而与已。 未有不关於造化，而能自遂於生成。 醮官某伏念功浅行微，祸盈恶积，放於利而多怨，旷仁宅而弗居，获罪于天，克艰厥后。 念胙之土，而命氏传自古初； 苟坠厥绪，而覆宗谁尸伏腊。 恐一旦溘先於朝露，则九原有愧於先灵。 顾只影以自怜，仅如丝而不绝。 年高绛县，辱久矣於泥涂； 鬼哭若敖，将馁而於求食。 每茕茕而知惧，常栗栗以祈天。 又虞冢讼之牵连，欲丐洪恩而普度，乃严净宇，祇荐嘉诚。 臣等职奉金科，身参宝箓。 祈男祷嗣，音每诵於监生； 仙化成人，经获闻於上品。 凡据情素，敢不上闻，爰有心诚，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 谛详词语，灼见忱诚。 臣闻不孝有三，无后为大； 生道非一，本出於虚。 拟天地而参诸身，致中和而育万物， 宜内循於一己，庶有格於万灵。 用荐芯芬，将祈盻蠁。 九重金格，奉灵宝之秘言； 三级瑶坛，延众真於珠馆。 八天云篆，安镇九宫； 两极星灯，光连五斗。 沥陈丹悃，拜伏朱章，庶凭众妙之功，用格多男之庆。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香云，腾空上彻，供养十方无上道宝天尊。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地，以是捻香功德，上祝当今皇帝陛下。 伏愿璇玑调理，龟鼎燕宁，绝灾异而不书，涤妖氛而永息。 龙楼鹤禁，继照重明。 甲观画堂，含饴增庆。 百子协螽斯之咏，六宫歌芣苡之诗，俾万物各得其宜，无一夫或失其所。 今故烧香，自归依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，保天长存，和与道合具。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香云，腾空上彻，供养十方无上经宝天尊。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地，以是捻香功德，归流某家九世七先，亿曾万祖。 伏愿天慈赦宥，道气发舒，拔苦除愆，和冤释对，告下九幽泉曲之府，速登朱陵流火之庭，受炼生方，逍遥仙界，绝恶根而断灭，俾胎注以蠲除，庶无夭横之灾，永保绵长之庆。 今故烧香，自归依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永天长存，和与道合真。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香云，腾空上彻，供养十方无上师宝天尊。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，首体投地，以是捻香功德，归流某寿德齐明，魂神澄正。 结天地氤氲之气； 流注百关； 禀阴阳涎坛之功，冥符八景。 育婴端就，寝息无惊，锡其肯获之人，流以有余之庆。 桑弧蓬矢，将有事於四方； 燕颔虎头，或封侯於万里。 恩沾九有，泽及含生。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，永保利享，和与道合真。 唱方，忏方，命魔，三启，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某等，谨重诚上启，金阙虚无三宝天尊，昊天至尊玉皇上帝，勾陈星宫天皇大帝，中天星主紫微大帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，神霄真王长生大帝，诸天天尊，诸天天帝，三界应感，一切真灵。 臣闻茫茫九有，形质既分；
chunks.translated_text:
「Though speechless, yet responsive with kindness,
Though silent, yet attuned to all sensations—
Since ancient spirits and gods,
Who rule as sovereigns over all things.
In times past, High Qí [高祺] sought thee with solemn reverence,
And the Emperor Yáo [尧], with many sons,
Also relied on Huàfēng’s [华封] invocation.
How much more so I, a humble mortal,
Dare I neglect to offer my devout surrender?
I now wholeheartedly pray,
Hoping the **Three Primordial** [三元] **Dao** may nurture me.

Revered be the **Nine Heavens**,
Where Kǒng Fǔ [孔父] prayed at Níqiū [尼丘],
And Shēn Fǔ [申甫] descended upon Sōngyùe [嵩岳].
Some are born from **Yuanjīng’s** [元精] fixed essence,
Others reserved in the **Mǎoxiù’s** [昴宿] celestial storehouse.
When **Yì Jiāng** [邑姜] dreamed of the Emperor,
She held a scripture in hand and called it **Yú** [虞].
When **Yān Gū** [燕姑] dreamed of the orchid,
She made **Shēn Yǔ** [申甫] proclaim himself **"Heaven’s Decree"** [称天] and bestow it upon her.
None can escape the **Dao’s** influence in **transformation** [造化],
Yet still achieve fulfillment in their **birth and growth** [生成].

I, the **Ritual Official** [醮官],
Humbly reflect:
My virtues are shallow, my deeds meager,
Guilt and misfortune have piled high.
I have strayed after profit, am filled with grievances,
And though **virtue’s dwelling** [仁宅] stands open, I do not reside there.
I have incurred Heaven’s wrath,
And now face the trials of my descendants.
I fear that one day I may perish before dawn’s dew,
Leaving my **Nine Springs Ancestral Domain** [九原] in shame before the **ancestral spirits** [先灵].
I behold only my fading shadow,
A fragile thread that may not break.
With age, I am dishonored in **Jiàng Xiàn’s** [绛县] muddy depths,
Like the **Ghost’s Weeping** [鬼哭] at **Ruò** [若敖],
I am near exhaustion in my search for sustenance.
Each day, I feel isolated and fearful,
And constantly tremble in prayer to Heaven.

Moreover, the **litigation of Yú’s Tomb** [虞冢讼] entangles me,
I beg for **Great Mercy** [洪恩] to universally deliver all.
Thus, I purify my dwelling,
And offer **sincere homage** [嘉诚] with utmost devotion.

We, Your **devoted servants** [臣等],
Have received the **Golden Precepts** [金科],
And partaken in the **Treasure Scrolls** [宝箓].
We pray for sons and descendants,
And our voices echo through the **examinations of life** [监生].
We seek **transformation into the Dao** [仙化] and human perfection,
And have heard the **supreme teachings** [上品] within the scriptures.

In accordance with our earnest sincerity,
We humbly petition to declare this.

Examine our words with care,
And witness our heartfelt devotion.
I have heard:
**"Unfiliality has three forms, but the gravest is having no descendants**,
And **"the Way of birth** [生道] is not singular—
It originates from the **Primordial Void** [虚]."

To emulate Heaven and Earth,
And align with the **Central Harmony** [中和] that nurtures all things,
I should first adhere within my own self,
So that I may resonate with the **spirits of all** [万灵].

With **incense offerings** [荐芯芬] and **devout prayers** [祈盻蠁],
I invoke the **Ninefold Celestial Hierarchy** [九重金格],
And deliver the **Sacred Dao’s** [灵宝] secret words.
At the **Threefold Jade Platforms** [三级瑶坛],
I summon the **multitudes of True Ones** [众真] to the **Pearl Hall** [珠馆].
The **Eightfold Cloud Seals** [八天云篆] of the heavens
Are set to pacify the **Nine Palaces** [九宫],
And the **Two Celestial Poles’** [两极] stars
Shine brightly, connecting the **Five Battlements** [五斗].

I pour forth my **sincere supplications** [丹悃],
And bow to the **Vermilion Scripture** [朱章],
Hoping through the **wonders of all spirits** [众妙],
To achieve the **blessing of many sons** [多男].

Now, at this **hour of the Ox** [临午],
As we follow the **Dao’s path** [行道],
We beseech the **Assembled Lawful Ones** [法众] to ignite this **first incense** [初捻],
May this **incense-cloud** [香云] ascend,
Piercing the heavens to offer homage,
To the **Supreme Dao-Treasures** [无上道宝] of the **Ten Directions** [十方],
The **Heavenly Sovereign** [天尊].

We, Your **devoted servants** [臣等],
Surrender our **bodies** [皈身], **spirits** [皈神], and **fates** [皈命],
Prostrate ourselves with heads to the ground,
And dedicate these **incense merits** [捻香功德]
To bless the **current Emperor** [当今皇帝] of **Vermilion Majesty** [陛下].

Humbly we wish:
For the **Celestial Sphere** [璇玑] to regulate in harmony,
And the **Tortoise and Tripod** [龟鼎] to bring **peaceful tranquility** [燕宁].
May all **disasters and omens** [灾异] cease to be recorded,
And **demonic influences** [妖氛] be forever dispelled.
May the **Dragon Palaces** [龙楼] and **Crane Forbiddances** [鹤禁]
Continue to radiate **august brilliance** [重明].
May the **Hall of Painted Portraits** [甲观画堂] be filled with **honeyed blessings** [含饴].
May the **Hundred Sons** [百子] harmonize their **prayers of prosperity** [协螽斯],
And the **Six Palaces** [六宫] sing the **poems of the wild millet** [歌芣苡],
So that all things may find their rightful place,
And none shall be deprived of their destiny.

Now, we burn this incense,
And surrender ourselves to the **Supreme Dao-Treasures** [无上道宝] of the **Great Holy Multitudes** [大圣众],
The **True Ones’** [至真] **virtue** [德].
After attaining the **Dao** [得道],
We shall **preserve Heaven’s longevity** [永天长存],
And achieve **harmony with the Dao** [和与道合].

Now, at this **hour of the Ox** [临午],
As we follow the **Dao’s path** [行道],
We beseech the **Assembled Lawful Ones** [法众] to ignite this **second incense** [二捻],
May this **incense-cloud** [香云] ascend,
Piercing the heavens to offer homage,
To the **Supreme Scripture-Treasures** [无上经宝] of the **Ten Directions** [十方],
The **Heavenly Sovereign** [天尊].

We, Your **devoted servants** [臣等],
Surrender our **bodies** [皈身], **spirits** [皈神], and **fates** [皈命],
Prostrate ourselves with heads to the ground,
And dedicate these **incense merits** [捻香功德]
To flow back to our **family’s ancestral line** [某家], spanning **nine generations and seven ancestors** [九世七先],
And to the **myriad descendants** [亿曾万祖].

Humbly we wish:
For **Heaven’s Mercy** [天慈] to forgive and pardon,
And for the **Dao’s Qi** [道气] to spread and flourish.
May we be **extracted from suffering** [拔苦] and **cleansed of offenses** [除愆],
And may all **grievances and disputes** [冤对] be resolved.
We summon the **Nine Abysses** [九幽] and the **curved springs** [泉曲],
And hasten to the **Vermilion Lingering Court** [朱陵], where **flaming trials** [流火] await.
May we receive the **flaming birth** [生方] and **roam freely in the Celestial Realm** [逍遥仙界],
Severing **evil roots** [恶根] and **cutting off their destruction** [断灭],
So that our **fetal destiny** [胎注] may be **relieved and absolved** [蠲除].
Thus, we may avoid **untimely death** [夭横],
And forever preserve the **blessing of continuous prosperity** [绵长].

Now, we burn this incense,
And surrender ourselves to the **Supreme Scripture-Treasures** [无上经宝] of the **Great Holy Multitudes** [大圣众],
The **True Ones’** [至真] **virtue** [德].
After attaining the **Dao** [得道],
We shall **preserve Heaven’s longevity** [永天长存],
And achieve **true harmony with the Dao** [和与道合真].

Now, at this **hour of the Ox** [临午],
As we follow the **Dao’s path** [行道],
We beseech the **Assembled Lawful Ones** [法众] to ignite this **third incense** [三捻],
May this **incense-cloud** [香云] ascend,
Piercing the heavens to offer homage,
To the **Supreme Teacher-Treasures** [无上师宝] of the **Ten Directions** [十方],
The **Heavenly Sovereign** [天尊].

We, Your **devoted servants** [臣等],
Surrender our **bodies** [皈身], **spirits** [皈神], and **fates** [皈命],
Prostrate ourselves with heads to the ground,
And dedicate these **incense merits** [捻香功德]
To flow back to our **family’s ancestral line** [某家], seeking **longevity and virtue** [寿德齐明],
And **clarity of soul** [魂神澄正].

May we **bind the Heavenly and Earthly Qi** [氤氲],
And **channel it through the Hundred Passages** [百关].
May we **inherit the virtues of Yin and Yang** [禀阴阳],
And **resonate with the Eight Auspicious Signs** [冥符八景].
May our **children be born upright** [婴端就],
And **sleep peacefully without fear** [寝息无惊].
May those who **receive the blessings** [肯获] of this
Be **bestowed with abundant fortune** [流以有余].
With **mulberry bows and rush arrows** [桑弧蓬矢],
We shall **undertake matters in the Four Quarters** [四方],
And with **swan necks and tiger heads** [燕颔虎头],
Some may be **enfeoffed as marquises** [封侯] in **ten thousand leagues** [万里].
May **mercy permeate the Nine Realms** [九有],
And **blessings extend to all living beings** [含生].

Now, we burn this incense,
And surrender ourselves to the **Supreme Teacher-Treasures** [无上师宝] of the **Great Holy Multitudes** [大圣众],
The **True Ones’** [至真] **virtue** [德].
After attaining the **Dao** [得道],
We shall **forever enjoy benefits** [永保利享],
And achieve **true harmony with the Dao** [和与道合真].

**Chant the Four Quarters** [唱方],
**Repent the Four Quarters** [忏方],
**Command the Demons** [命魔],
Three **invocations** [三启], three **bowings** [三礼].
We **reaffirm the Lawful Positions** [重称法位].

We, Your **servants of fixed rank** [具位臣某等],
With utmost sincerity, **declare our petitions** [上启],
To the **Golden Gate of the Void** [金阙虚无],
The **Three Treasures of Heaven** [三宝天尊],
The **Supreme Celestial Jade Emperor** [昊天至尊玉皇上帝],
The **Great Sovereign of the Gōuqín Star Palace** [勾陈星宫天皇大帝],
The **Grand Star Lord of the Central Heaven** [中天星主紫微大帝],
The **Earthly Sovereign, Hòutǔ** [后土皇地祇], who **receives Heaven’s mandate** [承天效法],
The **True King of the Divine Dawn** [神霄真王长生大帝],
The **Heavenly Sovereigns of All Realms** [诸天天尊],
The **Heavenly Emperors of All Realms** [诸天天帝],
The **Three Realms’ Responsive Spirits** [三界应感],
And **all True Spirits** [一切真灵].

I have heard:
**"The vast Nine Realms** [九有] are boundless,
For when the **form and substance** [形质] are divided..."

chunks.original_text: 蠢蠢含生，陶镕莫测。 虽世间有有无有，皆暗昧於始终； 而一气生生之生，实全繄於水火。 苟赋形於宇内，总托化於仙乡。 唯南斗之六虚，乃太微之都紏。 领天枢天机之二省，有司命司录之尊神。 延寿益算，则度厄於长生大君； 起死回骸，则主录於韩君司马。 咸彰品物，号南昌之上宫； 济拔三涂，置朱陵之火府。 傥超离於阴境，先沐浴於天池。 闻八天隐语之音，接三洞飞玄之气。 玉眸炼质，黄华荡形，再返人寰，各正性命。 然念世人罪福，尽达天司。 丹笔善分，列为等级。 姓类既别，毫发无私。 行齐八百者，即证果以登真； 刑属三千者，乃计功而补过。 三官鼓笔，常料别於种人； 万圣督仙，实无间於昼夜。 皆有条而不紊，故善应以无方。 唯此丹天，功高紫极。 凡繁道荫，注上生名，皆逆推三世之业因，以计定一生之禄等，玉历考诞弥之月，庆云开化育之门。 俾全受炼之魂，即注更生之所。 或寄胞於贫寒之所，或赋形於积善之家。 考算毫分，搜罗人品。 千生父母，有夙世之良因； 万劫子孙，亦三缘之和会。 共业所感，聚为一家。 然后九炁齐并，二仪同化，帝君品命，圣母履纲。 道与之貌而天与之形，阳为之魂而阴为之魄。 四肢五体，各整具於形神； 六甲三元，悉扶承於胎命。 又千和而万合，至十月以九周。 惟九天司马，不下於命章； 则万品生根，莫彰於神奥。 大矣哉，惊天骇地，贵亦难胜，陶魄铸魂，神灵微妙。 斋官某爰念日暮途远，嗣绪世微，耻门户之雕零，究生源之本始，载严净宇，遐企上真，庶通蠲洁之诚，以格蕃昌之裔。 伏愿九天圣母，浮驾云轮。 八方胎神，各领官属。 流布至真之气，灌溉胞命之门，胎元结於黄房，祥烟塞於死户。 时贵月吉，拥三界以齐临； 形具神全，保万灵而称庆。 允获自天之佑，旁依锡类之仁。 乃子乃孙，肯堂肯构，上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来临午行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿忱诚上达，睿泽旁流，赦已往之愆尤，开自新之轨路。 九玄七祖，释注讼以升形； 六甲三元，保胎真而固本。 庶获宁馨之子，率归仁寿之乡。 次愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

「**The teeming vitality of all living beings** [含生蠢蠢] is profound and boundless.
Though the **worldly realms of existence and nonexistence** [世间有有无有] may vary,
All remain **obscured in the beginning and end** [暗昧於始终].
Yet the **single breath of eternal generation** [一气生生] truly **emanates from Water and Fire’s primordial unity** [实全繄於水火].

If **bestowed with form within the cosmos** [赋形於宇内],
All **entrust their transformation to the Daoist domain** [总托化於仙乡].
Only the **Six Stars of the Southern Dipper** [南斗六虚] govern
And the **Central Heaven’s celestial capital** [太微之都紏].
They oversee the **Two Celestial Provinces of Heaven’s Pivot and Daoist Mechanism** [领天枢天机之二省],
And the **Heavenly Registrars of Fate and Records** [有司命司录之尊神].

To **prolong life and enhance numerology** [延寿益算],
One must **cross the calamities under the Long-Life Lord** [度厄於长生大君].
To **revive the dead and restore skeletal integrity** [起死回骸],
One must **submit to the Heavenly Registrar, Lord Hàn** [主录於韩君司马].

All **manifest the virtues of created beings** [咸彰品物],
Known as the **Upper Palace of the Southern March** [号南昌之上宫];
They **rescue from the Three Trials** [济拔三涂],
And **establish the Fire Bureau of Zhūlíng** [置朱陵之火府].

If one **ascends beyond the mortal realm into the yin domain** [超离於阴境],
One must **first bathe in the Heavenly Pool** [先沐浴於天池].
There, one **hears the hidden speech of the Eight Heavens** [闻八天隐语之音],
And **receives the Daoist breath of the Three Caverns** [接三洞飞玄之气].

The **jade pupils refine essence** [玉眸炼质],
And the **yellow blossoms dissolve form** [黄华荡形],
Thus **returning to the human cycle twice** [再返人寰],
Each **restoring their innate nature and vital essence** [各正性命].

Yet, **considering the worldly beings’ sins and blessings** [念世人罪福],
All are **fully known by the Heavenly Registrars** [尽达天司].
With the **crimson brush’s precise judgment** [丹笔善分],
They **are categorized into ranks without bias** [列为等级].
Once **distinctions by lineage are made** [姓类既别],
Not even a **hair’s breadth is overlooked** [毫发无私].

For those whose **conduct aligns with the Eight Hundred Daoist Precepts** [行齐八百者],
They **attain fruition and ascend to Truehood** [即证果以登真].
For those whose **offenses belong to the Three Thousand Karmic Debts** [刑属三千者],
Their **merits are weighed to compensate for past sins** [乃计功而补过].
The **Three Officials strike their registers** [三官鼓笔],
Ever **distinguishing individuals by their fate** [常料别於种人];
The **Ten Thousand Saints supervise the Daoists** [万圣督仙],
**Without interruption day or night** [实无间於昼夜].
All **proceed in orderly sequence** [皆有条而不紊],
Thus **responding harmoniously in every direction** [故善应以无方].

**Supreme is this Vermilion Heaven** [唯此丹天],
Whose **merits surpass the Purple Extremity** [功高紫极].
All who **proliferate under the Dao’s influence** [繁道荫],
Their **names inscribed in the Heavenly Registers** [注上生名],
Are **retrospectively traced to their three-lifetime karmic causes** [逆推三世之业因],
To **determine their fate’s rank in this life** [以计定一生之禄等].
The **Jade Calendar marks their birth month** [玉历考诞弥之月],
And the **Auspicious Clouds open the gates of Heaven’s nurturing** [庆云开化育之门].

Thus, **the souls fully refined** [全受炼之魂]
Are **assigned to their new rebirths** [即注更生之所].
Some **take root in humble, impoverished wombs** [寄胞於贫寒之所],
Others **are formed in households of accumulated virtue** [或赋形於积善之家].
With **precise calculations and thorough scrutiny** [考算毫分],
They **search out every human disposition** [搜罗人品].

For **thousands of generations of parents** [千生父母],
There are **preordained causes of benevolence** [有夙世之良因];
For **millions of eons of descendants** [万劫子孙],
They are **also gatherings of the Three Affinities** [亦三缘之和会].
Shared karmic causes **bind them into one family** [共业所感，聚为一家].

Then, the **Nine Breaths harmonize** [九炁齐并],
And the **Two Principles unify** [二仪同化].
The **Celestial Lords decree their fates** [帝君品命],
And the **Heavenly Mothers uphold the cosmic order** [圣母履纲].

The **Dao bestows their appearance** [道与之貌],
And **Heaven grants their form** [天与之形].
The **yang essence becomes their spirit** [阳为之魂],
And the **yin essence their soul** [阴为之魄].
The **four limbs and five bodies** [四肢五体]
Are **each fully formed in their physical and spiritual nature** [各整具於形神];
The **Six Stars and Three Elements** [六甲三元]
**All support and sustain their prenatal vitality** [悉扶承於胎命].

Again, **thousands align and ten thousand coalesce** [千和而万合],
Reaching **ten months and nine cycles** [至十月以九周].
Only the **Heavenly Registrar of the Nine Heavens** [九天司马]
Does **not descend to the Fate Charts** [不下於命章];
Yet **all ten thousand types of life take root** [万品生根],
And **none surpass the mysteries of their divine origins** [莫彰於神奥].

**Great indeed is this—**
Awe-inspiring to Heaven and Earth,
Its **nobility is hard to bear** [贵亦难胜].
It **refines souls and molds spirits** [陶魄铸魂],
In **divine subtleties beyond measure** [神灵微妙].

**Your humble servant** [斋官某],
**Reflecting on the fading path of life** [念日暮途远],
And the **waning lineage of the world** [嗣绪世微],
Shames the **decline of our ancestral gates** [耻门户之雕零],
And **seeks the source of life’s origin** [究生源之本始].
Having **purified this sacred space** [载严净宇],
And **yearning for the Supreme Truehood** [遐企上真],
I **hope to convey sincere devotion** [庶通蠲洁之诚],
To **reach the lineage of Auspicious Prosperity** [以格蕃昌之裔].

**With deepest reverence, I pray:**
That the **Heavenly Mother of the Nine Heavens** [九天圣母]
**Descends upon the Cloud-Carriage** [浮驾云轮],
And the **Eight-Directional Fetal Deities** [八方胎神]
**Each lead their respective officials** [各领官属].
May they **dispense the breath of Supreme Truth** [流布至真之气],
And **irrigate the gates of prenatal life** [灌溉胞命之门].
May the **Fetal Essence be knotted in the Yellow Chamber** [胎元结於黄房],
And the **Auspicious Smoke seal the doors of mortality** [祥烟塞於死户].

At the **auspicious month and favorable day** [时贵月吉],
When the **Three Realms gather in unison** [拥三界以齐临],
And **form and spirit are complete** [形具神全],
May they **preserve the Ten Thousand Spirits in celebration** [保万灵而称庆].
I **trust in Heaven’s blessings** [允获自天之佑],
And **lean upon the benevolent grace of the Celestial Deities** [旁依锡类之仁].

Thus, **my descendants and their descendants** [乃子乃孙],
May **build halls and construct ancestral temples** [肯堂肯构],
**Honoring the Heavenly Emperor’s vast mercy** [上明天尊大慈之泽],
And **fulfilling our sincere submission to fate** [下副臣等皈命之诚].
**Respectfully declared and submitted** [谨启以闻].
**Twelve Petitions** [十二愿].
**Reignite the Incense Altar** [复炉].
**Incense Officials and Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and Attendant Spirits of Fragrant Incense** [香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官],
May **command my humble servant to ascend to the Daoist practice at the meridian hour** [当令臣向来临午行道之所],
Where **golden nectar and crimson elixir naturally form** [自然生金液丹碧],
And **mushroom sprouts and myriad sacred herbs flourish** [芝英百灵].
May **all True Spirits gather here before this incense altar** [众真交会],
And **my sincere petitions be swiftly conveyed** [在此香火炉前].

**My first prayer is:**
That **my devotion reaches Heaven** [当愿忱诚上达],
And **divine grace flows to all sides** [睿泽旁流].
May **my past transgressions be forgiven** [赦已往之愆尤],
And **the path to self-renewal be opened** [开自新之轨路].
May the **Nine Mysteries and Seven Ancestors** [九玄七祖]
**Release me from karmic disputes and elevate my form** [释注讼以升形];
And may the **Six Stars and Three Elements** [六甲三元]
**Protect the prenatal Truehood and solidify my foundation** [保胎真而固本].

Thus, **I may attain a peaceful and fragrant child** [庶获宁馨之子],
And **lead them to the Daoist realm of Ren’s longevity** [率归仁寿之乡].

**My second prayer is:**
That **the Ten Thousand Daoist Immortals and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女]
**Attend to the fragrant incense** [接侍兰烟],
And **transmit my humble petitions** [传臣向来所启之诚]
**Swiftly to the Supreme Court of the Jade Emperor, the Highest Dao** [速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**With reverence, I depart the Hall** [出堂颂].
**With reverence, I exit the Gate** [出户].

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之二十七竟 道门科范大全集卷之二十八 祈嗣大醮仪 晚朝行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星高耀，瑞气飞浮。 元始集神，天地交周。 玉符宝节，啸命微幽。 掷火扬威，奸凶无留。 万魔振伏，纷葩却消。 摧怪灭恶，道炁周流。 神光照夜，阴翳俱收。 万神降格，扇景乘飙。 群生咸遂，惠遍神州，和与道合真。 呜法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，各三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今静夜行道，谨奏为入意，其诸忱悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与临坛官众，谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，玉晨大道灵宝天尊，万天教主道德天尊，昊天至尊玉皇上帝，勾陈星宫天皇大帝，中天星主紫微北极大帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，神霄真王长生大帝，东极注生青华大帝，九天应元雷声普化天尊，九天雷祖大帝，上清紫微碧玉宫太一大天帝，六天洞渊大帝，六波天主帝君，九天好生可韩司丈人天尊，九天采访应元保运真君，九天上帝，三十二天上帝，五老上帝，东华木公道君，西灵金母元君，日宫太阳帝君，月府太阴皇君，五方五德星君，二十八宿星君，北斗七元上道真君，南斗六司上生真君，五福十神太一真君，上清四余四曜星君，天曹诸司真君，三元三官大帝，泰玄枢机三省诸相天君，玄中大法师真君，三天大法师真君，北极法主四圣真君，上清雷霆院使真君，雷霆九司列职真君，九天注生监生真君，九天司禄梓潼帝君，九天卫房圣母元君，本靖诸省府院司经箓法部主宰真君，三天门下三元真君，上章词表灵官，五岳圣帝，洞天福地、靖庐治化仙官，本靖祖玄真师、列位真人，经籍度列位真人，北阴酆都大帝，扶桑丹林大帝，三河四渎、五湖四海龙王，名山大川真宰，九天金阙、玉阙灵济洪恩二位真君，风云雷雨部威烈圣众，城隍里社庙貌一切真灵。 臣闻碧落浮黎，受六甲保胎之品； 紫阳玉笈，开九天生神之章。

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Code, Volume Twenty-Eight: The Great Ritual for Seeking Descendants**

**Evening Dao Practice**

Proceed with the ritual rites as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao.

**Invoke the Sacred Protective Incantations.**
The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious *qi* ascends in flight.
The Primordial Sovereign gathers the spirits—heaven and earth unite in harmony.
The Jade Talismans and Sacred Nodes command with celestial might;
Their summons pierces the depths of the unseen.
Fires are cast, their might proclaimed—evil and malevolence are banished.
Ten thousand demons are subdued, their chaotic forms dispersed.
Monstrous and wicked forces are crushed, the Dao’s *qi* flows universally.
Divine radiance illuminates the night, all obscurity vanishes.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their blessings sweep across the land like a breeze,
And all living beings prosper, grace permeating the sacred land—harmony with the Dao, truth perfected.

**Strike the sacred drum twenty-four times.**

The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Sovereign of the Three *Qi*,
The Most High Dao Sovereign,
The Most High Laozi,
**summon forth from my body the Three Five Officials of Merit,**

**On the Human in the World,**

From within the womb, we are called **body**—
born from a single source,
yet branching into six functions:
the eyes perceive the five colors,
the ears hear the five tones,
the nose discerns the five fragrances,
the tongue discerns the five flavors.
Sometimes we move the arms and bend the fingers,
sometimes we wield strength and race like the wind—
all from that single **spark of luminous spirit**,
the workmanship of **transformation**.

Like shaping clay into vessels,
turning the potter’s wheel to perfect them;
or like carved wooden figures,
activated by their mechanisms to serve their purpose.
How much more so for those in the **Human Way**—
truly endowed with **self-cultivation**—
who kindle the **Lan-cauldron’s flame** at midnight,
shake the **cloud-axe** beyond the heavens,
halt the **Nine-Dragon celestial chariot**,
and dance the **Three-Layered Embryonic Immortal**.

We humbly pray that the **Lofty Vision** descend and illuminate,
that its radiance descend upon us.
May the **World-Nurturing Dao** descend its **piercing qi** to harmonize;
may the **Jade Infant** be nourished without interruption.
Further, we hope for **abundant blessings**,
extending to all **sentient beings**.

Now, in this **quiet night of Dao practice**,
we request the assembled **Law Assembly** to light the **first pinch of incense**,
wishing this incense-smoke to ascend to the heavens,
offering to the **Ten-Directional Supreme Dao-Jewel Heavenly Sovereign**.

We, the subjects, **surrender body, surrender spirit, surrender fate**,
prostrate ourselves with our heads to the ground,
and with this incense-lighting merit,
we bless the **Current Emperor of the Han Dynasty**.
May the **foundation be as firm as the **Pan Stone**,
and the governance as refined as **hanging robes**.
May the **Red Canopy** be ever-august,
protecting the **sovereign’s lineage and household**;
may the **Imperial Foundations** be unshaken,
gathering **timely blessings** for the common folk.
May the **abundance** be as boundless as **plum and willow**,
and the **faithfulness** as steadfast as **the tracks of the qilin**.
Thus may the **ten thousand years** endure,
hearing the **Song of Mount Song**;
then may the **hundred sons** be virtuous,
harmonizing with the **blessings of the Hua Seal**.

Now, we light incense in devotion,
**surrendering to the Supreme Virtue of the Great Sage, Perfect Truth Assembly of the Dao-Jewel Sovereign**.
After attaining the Dao,
we **preserve Heaven’s longevity**,
harmonizing with the **True and Real**.

Now, in this **quiet night of Dao practice**,
we request the assembled **Law Assembly** to light the **second pinch of incense**,
wishing this incense-smoke to ascend to the heavens,
offering to the **Ten-Directional Supreme Scripture-Jewel Heavenly Sovereign**.

We, the subjects, **surrender body, surrender spirit, surrender fate**,
prostrate ourselves with our heads to the ground,
and with this incense-lighting merit,
we **return blessings to the ancestral lineage of the [specific family]—**
a hundred generations, ten thousand descendants—
ascending in form to the **Effulgent Platform of the Kalpa**;
all children and grandchildren,
obeying in the **Great Harmony Era**.

May the **Dao-Eye** be illuminated,
and the **roots of evil** extinguished;
may the **five viscera** flourish,
and the **three palaces** be serene.
As **Heaven’s children**, may we preserve the **breath of the womb** in the **Mysterious Female Root**;
as **Original Qi** descends into the body,
may we **receive the Wu-Ji** in the **Spirit Storehouse**.

Now, we light incense in devotion,
**surrendering to the Supreme Virtue of the Scripture-Jewel Sovereign, Great Sage, Perfect Truth Assembly**.
After attaining the Dao,
we **permanently preserve longevity**,
harmonizing with the **True and Real**.

Now, in this **quiet night of Dao practice**,
we request the assembled **Law Assembly** to light the **third pinch of incense**,
wishing this incense-smoke to ascend to the heavens,
offering to the **Ten-Directional Supreme Teacher-Jewel Heavenly Sovereign**.

We, the subjects, **surrender body, surrender spirit, surrender fate**,
prostrate ourselves with our heads to the ground,
and with this incense-lighting merit,
we **return blessings to the vast and boundless karma of [specific family] across the Three Realms**—
nothing left unbestowed;
we **scatter virtuous fruits** in the Ten Directions—
all forms **transcended**.

May **weapons cease**, and both **Yi and Xia** submit;
may **epidemics not arise**, and **auspicious omens** manifest.
Our **teachers, preceptors, and benevolent friends**,
all **realizing fruit** and ascending in form;
the **guardian spirits**,
all **speaking of merit** and advancing in office.
Awaiting the **bestowal of decrees**,
extending to both **living and dead**,
bathed in this **auspicious cause**,
all may ascend to the **Dao-shore**.

Now, we light incense in devotion,
**surrendering to the Supreme Virtue of the Teacher-Jewel Sovereign, Great Sage, Perfect Truth Assembly**.
After attaining the Dao,
we **permanently preserve Heaven’s longevity**,
harmonizing with the **True and Real**.

**Chanting the Square Array, Confessing the Square Array,**
**Three Invocations, Three Salutations.**
**Reaffirming the Law Position.**

The **officiating subjects**, including **Certain [Name] and the assembled officials at the altar**,
with **sincere hearts**, now humbly present our petition to the **Golden Threshold’s Supreme Three Pure Celestial Sovereigns,**
the **Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven,**
the **Responsive Spirits of the Three Realms,**
and **all True Essences**.

We have heard that the **Heavenly Dao values life**,
and the **Mystic Gate universally saves**.
Above, there is no **return to the Original Ancestors**,
for the **Azure Realm** is the **Heaven of the Native People**;
nearby, within our own bodies,
**Primordial Beginning** resides above the **muddy sphere**.
The **Five Phases** are examined together,
and the **Seven Deities** share the same category.
Thus, the **Dao generates One**,
One generates Two,
Two generates Three,
Three generates the **Ten Thousand Things**—
the **source of the womb’s vital breath**;
while **humanity follows Earth**,
Earth follows Heaven,
Heaven follows the Dao,
and the Dao follows **Spontaneous Nature**—
the **foundation of form and appearance**.

The **commoner’s nature and fate** all depend on the **Dao’s generation**;
all **sages and worthies** emerge from the **womb’s nurturing**.
Thus, within a single body,
the **infant and maiden** embody the **law of yin and yang**,
with no distinction between **refined and coarse**,
nor separation between **metal and wood**.
The **pearl congeals from qi and fluid**,
holding the **mechanism of the Five Phases’ inversion**;
the **fire refines the golden essence**,
concealing the **meaning of the Three Fields’ reversal**.

For those who cultivate—
they may **merge with the Hundred Spirits**;

chunks.original_text: 以今某屡陈丹恳，欲厚人伦。 琼席瑶坛，肃罄倾心之仰； 云车风马，伫因飞步之游。 歆礿祭以荐诚，保充闻而袭庆。 伏愿空浮五色，俱离劫仞之台； 辅翼万仙，克享苹蘩之荐。 曲流恩德，溥福堪舆。 臣与众官等，无任皈依之至、再拜望云，奉迎大驾。 降圣，初献，散花。 臣某谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，上清真境灵宝天尊，太清仙境道德天尊，昊天至尊玉皇上帝，三界应感，一切威灵。 臣闻大道杳冥，真灵肇布。 玄元始气，开图於亿劫之初； 日月星辰，高列於万天之上。 互分主宰，共济生民。 醮官某念以子息不荣，忧惶在念。 谓生非汝有，乃天地之委形； 而物以道生，籍阴阳之和气。 载蠲吉旦，交荐明诚，望鹤驾以凝情，想琼轮而注目。 伏愿仙灵下盻，列圣回光。 六甲三元，各运保胎之节； 亿乘万骑，周扶度命之章。 享以明馨，庶臻蕃衍。 臣叨依真教，获预关行，爰有词诚，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 谛详词语，备见至诚。 念人为万物之灵，不灵则无以异於物； 子者亲之后，非后则无以继其亲。 用倾亹亹之诚，仰读高高之听。 伏愿苍穹降佑，帝祚无疆。 后妃符穜稑之祥，媒官显弓矢之异。 皇储锡羡，玉牒增光。 君臣胥庆於明良，夷夏共遵於文轨。 上以广寥萧四海之泽，下以尽天保归美之诚。 然后福及醮官，泽流后裔。 格于天而格于帝，敢徼四世之五公； 拜乎后而拜乎前，庶或一门之万石。 仰祈真造，俯鉴精衷。 臣与醮官等，无任祈恳激切之至，再拜上香，酒陈亚献。 散花。 臣闻元纲流演，布三景於天根； 造化枢机，统万灵於斗柄。 分五行而迭运，斡四序以顺成。 十一曜星，纪灾祥於历等； 四七列象，注寿夭於胎禽。 顾惟阴惊之司，凭用竭精，衷而有祷。 伏念某保姓受氏，积有岁年，侍膳问安，本传冢嫡，载陈蠲洁，希降仙灵。 伏愿泰阶平而风雨时，火星中而寒暑正。 三百六十五度四分之一，并无爽於岁时； 万有一千五百二十之星，悉罔愆於宙伏。 然后享其诚意，注上南宫，传干蛊以相承，保鸣谦而获吉。 长庚入梦，愿符太白之精； 箕尾乘天，庶协商岩之祝。 臣与合坛众等，无任祈恩请命之至，酒陈终献。 散花。 臣谨重诚上启，诸天上帝，十极高真，咸望洪慈，洞回昭格。 臣闻岳峙海澄，谅无文而不度； 喙鸣口语，皆在地以成形。

「Thus, I, [Your Name], have repeatedly submitted humble petitions in earnest, seeking to enrich humanity.

At the **jewel-strewn banquets** and **jade platforms** of the **Sacred Daoist Altars**,
I reverently offer my wholehearted devotion;
With **cloud-chariots** and **wind-horses**,
I await the **ascended steps** of the **Celestial Journey**.

I present **sacrifices to the **Mining Spirits****, offering sincerity to honor them,
And may the **Guardian Spirits** hear my prayers and bestow blessings in return.

I humbly pray that the **Five-Colored Clouds** may dissolve and vanish,
That all **immortal spirits** may ascend to the **Eon-Peaks**,
And that I may **assist the myriad immortals**,
Ever enjoying the **offerings of the **Sacred Daoist Altars****.

May the **endless virtues** of the **Dao** flow forth,
And blessings extend to all under heaven.

I, [Your Name], along with the **officiating officials**,
Am deeply moved by the **supreme reverence** of our devotion—
We kneel twice, gazing toward the **Celestial Clouds**,
And respectfully welcome the **Great Procession** of the **Holy**.

May the **Holy One descend**,
And first receive our **sacrificial offerings**,
Then bless us with **scattered flowers**.

I, [Your Name], with utmost sincerity, now declare:
The **Primordial Natural Sovereign of the **Dao’s Beginning****,
The **Sacred Realm’s True Sovereign of the **Lingbao Dao****,
The **Highest Daoist Realm’s Sovereign of the **Moral Way****,
The **Supreme Celestial Emperor of the **Jade Sovereign****,
And all **Three Realms** that respond to devotion—
All **mighty and sacred spirits**—

I have heard that the **Great Dao** is profound and mysterious,
And that the **true spirits** first established its foundation.

The **Primordial Qi** of the **Dao’s Beginning**,
Unfurled the **cosmic diagram** at the **first eon** of the **ten billion kalpas**;
The **sun, moon, and stars**,
Were exalted above the **ten thousand heavens**.

Together they **divided and governed** all things,
And **jointly aided** the living in harmony.

Now, I, **officiant [Your Name]**, reflect upon my **unfulfilled desires**,
And my **deep anxiety** over my **offspring’s lack of prosperity**.

For **life is not solely my own**—
It is the **manifested form** entrusted by **Heaven and Earth**;
Yet **all things are born of the Dao**,
And owe their existence to the **harmonious Qi** of **Yin and Yang**.

On this **auspicious day** of **prayer and purification**,
I **sincerely present** my **devoted offerings**,
Hoping the **Celestial Journey** may pause,
And the **jewel-wheeled chariots** may descend before my gaze.

I humbly pray that the **immortal spirits** may **lower their presence**,
And the **ranked saints** may **return their radiance**.

The **Six Celestial Stems** and **Three Heavenly Cycles**,
May each **fulfill their role** in **protecting the fetus**;
The **ten billion chariots** and **millions of mounted escorts**,
May **circulate and sustain** the **command of life**.

With **pure and fragrant offerings**,
May all **prosper and multiply**.

I have **received the True Doctrine**,
And **participated in its sacred rites**—
Thus, I now **solemnly present** my **devoted words**,
To be **proclaimed to the heavens**.

**Proclaiming the Words**:
I carefully examine each **sacred phrase**,
And **display my utmost sincerity**.

I reflect that **humans are the most refined of all living beings**,
And without this refinement, we would not differ from other creatures;
That **children are the descendants of their parents**,
And without proper lineage, there would be no **continuation of the ancestral line**.

With **unceasing sincerity**, I **present my prayers**,
Hoping the **highest heavens** may **listen with favor**.

I humbly pray that the **celestial realm** may **bestow its grace**,
And that the **imperial lineage** may endure **without bounds**.

May the **empress and consorts** bear **auspicious omens** of **peace and abundance**,
And the **matchmaking officials** display **divine signs** of **harmony and union**.

May the **heir apparent** receive **favor and blessings**,
And the **imperial records** shine with **augmented glory**.

May the **ruler and ministers** all rejoice in **enlightened virtue**,
And the **barbarians and the civilized** alike follow **the Dao’s refined path**.

The **highest heavens** may **broaden their vast blessings** across the **four seas**,
And the **lowest realms** may **fulfill their duty** in **protecting the lineage**.

Then may blessings **reach the officiating officials**,
And grace **flow to our descendants**.

May we **align with Heaven** and **align with the Emperor**,
And dare to **pray for the five blessings** of the **four generations**;
May we **bow to the past** and **bow to the present**,
And hope to **attain the prosperity** of the **ten thousand stones in one gate**.

With **devotion**, we **pray to the True Creator**,
And with **humility**, we **seek the Emperor’s insight**.

I, [Your Name], along with the **officiating officials**,
Am deeply moved by our **earnest supplications**—
We kneel twice, **presenting incense**,
And **pour libations** as **final offerings**.

**Scattering flowers**.

I have heard that the **primordial principles** unfold in **endless succession**,
And the **three luminaries**—**sun, moon, and stars**—
Are **established at the roots of Heaven**;
That the **mechanisms of creation**,
**Govern all spirits** beneath the **Big Dipper’s handle**.

The **Five Phases** are **divided and cyclically activated**,
And the **Four Seasons** are **regulated in harmony**.

The **eleven luminaries** of the **astrological system**,
Record **calamities and blessings** in the **celestial calendar**;
The **four stars and seven constellations**,
**Influence longevity and fate** through the **fetal and animal spirits**.

Now, I **solemnly entrust** the **Minister of Yin**,
To **devote all my sincerity**,
And **pray with a pure heart**.

I **reflect upon my humble lineage**,
And my **years of service**—
Attending to **imperial meals** and **offering respectful inquiries**,
As **direct descendant of the ancestral line**,
I have **repeatedly presented petitions** for **purification and blessings**,
And **humbly hope** for the **descent of the immortal spirits**.

I pray that the **auspicious stages** may **be level and harmonious**,
And that the **fire star** may **remain centered** while **cold and heat** are **properly balanced**.

The **three hundred sixty-five degrees** of the **celestial sphere**, divided into **four quarters**,
May all **align perfectly** with the **seasons and years**;
The **ten thousand and five hundred twenty** stars,
May **none deviate** from their **proper celestial positions**.

Then may they **receive my sincere offerings**,
And **transmit them to the Southern Celestial Palace**,
**Passing on the **Sacred Daoist Talismans**** to **ensure continuity**,
And **protect the **auspicious sounds**** while **securing blessings**.

May **Venus** appear in my **dreams**,
And my wishes **align with the **Luminous White Star**’s **precision**;
May the **stars of the Big Dipper’s tail** ascend to the **heavens**,
And my prayers **harmonize with the **auspicious blessings of the **Divine Rocks****.

I, [Your Name], along with the **assembled officiants**,
Am deeply moved by our **supplications for grace and command**—
We **pour libations** as **final offerings**.

**Scattering flowers**.

I, [Your Name], with **renewed sincerity**, now declare:
All **Heavenly Emperors** and **Highest True Ones of the **Ten Extremes****,
May **all gaze upon** the **great compassion**,
And **pierce the mysteries** of the **radiant decrees**.

I have heard that the **mountains stand firm** and the **seas are clear**,
And that even without **scriptural teachings**, the **Dao** is **manifest**;
That the **mouth’s utterances** and **words**,
Are all **formed on earth** and **transmitted to Heaven**.»

May the **numinous brilliance** of the **Yangtze and Han rivers** **permeate**,
And the **mountains and marshes** **channel the harmonious qi**—
**Observe** my **sincere devotion**, even as **inconsequential** as an **ant**,
And **accept** my **modest oblations**, though **impure** as the **muddy waters**.

The **seas do not raise waves**—
There are **nine marshes** that **do not overflow**;
The **Earth’s vast capacity** **nourishes all**—
Yet **three rivers** **do not all shake** in **turbulence**.

**Universal salvation** of the **living and the dead**,
**All may receive** the **blessings of virtue**,
**Forgiving** their **offenses and transgressions**,
And **granting** them **future prosperity**.

With **rituals and music, scriptures and calculations**,
May **prosperity flourish** within our **household**;
With the **four great elements** of **earth, water, fire, and wind**,
May **harmony be preserved** in the **four directions**.

The **Han dynasty’s officials** **illuminate** the **local communities**,
**Shining** with the **glory of learning**;
The **Jin dynasty’s ministers** **support** their **descendants**,
**Flowing** like the **Huai River’s currents**—**unbroken**.

The humble servant and the assembled officials of the fast, with deepest sincerity and fervent devotion, prostrate ourselves twice and present incense and sacred wash.

**Step on the Void**—
**Reaffirm the Dao’s station.**

With the assembled officials and the humble servant [name], we humbly unite in sincere supplication before:

The **Jade Purity Emperor, Yuan Shi Tian Zun**,
The **Upper Clarity Emperor, Ling Bao Tian Zun**,
The **Great Emperor of the Supreme Clarity, Dao De Tian Zun**,
The **Most High Sovereign of the Azure Sky, Jade Emperor of the Supreme**,
All the **Heavens, the Earths**,
All the **Waters, all the Mountains**,
The **Three Realms of responsive spirits**,
And all **true and numinous essences**.

We have heard that **fasting and Daoist practice**, though following the **six seasons’ disciplines**,
And **sacred wine and grand offerings**, must be **complete in the three presentations**.

Yet, alas, we—**mired in dust and filth**—
Have **repeatedly offended the Celestial Hearth**,
Offering **meager tributes of coarse grains and herbs**,
And **delaying the proper rites and attendants**.

We humbly reflect: our **learning of the Dao is incomplete**, our **transgressions manifold**,
Our **actions contrary to ritual**, our **words careless and unrefined**,
Every movement **inviting guilt**—
All we **beg for pardon and absolution**.

We only **hope that the High Immortals of the Upper Realm** may **return to their jade palaces**,
That the **saints of the Lower World** may **all ascend to the ranks of the Dao**,
That **blessings descend and grace flows**,
That **calamities be dispelled and hardships crossed**.

May the **Heavens restore their order**, their **echoes fading in an instant**;
May the **Great Ultimate’s breath** **preserve the embryonic qi** in the **Hall of Prolonged Life**.

We, the servants, **fix our gaze on the Dao’s path**, **concentrating on the boundless void**,
Yet **lament the mire of dust**—
**Unable to retain the Sacred Footsteps**.

The humble servant and the assembled officials of the fast, with all the gathered congregation,
With deepest **yearning to gaze upon the Celestial Stairs** and **prostrate before the Divine Procession**,
With **uttermost devotion and longing**, now **humble our words**.

**Reignite the furnace.**
The **incense officials and messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the attendant spirit officials of incense**—
Let it be decreed that at the place where we have **previously established the ritual**, there shall **naturally arise golden elixirs, emerald-green herbs, and the hundred numinous essences**,
Where the **multitudes of true ones gather** before this **incense furnace**.

May it be our **wish that the ten-direction celestial children and jade maidens**,
**Attend to the fragrant mists**,
And **transmit our sincere supplications** directly to the **Most High, the Supreme Dao of the Non-Extreme, before the Jade Emperor of the Azure Sky**.

**The Complete Collection of Daoist Rituals and Precepts, Volume 29, concludes.**

chunks.original_text: 洞经箓弟子仲励编 誓火禳灾说戒仪 法事升坛如式。 念净天地咒。 洒水，序立。 高功临案说戒。 具位臣某等，谨焚道香、德香，无为清静、自然真香，虔诚奏启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，九皇至尊，十方上圣，诸君丈人，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，圆穹上象火德荧惑星君，鹑火鹑首鹑尾之次，雍秦周洛楚荆之分，列宿星君，厚地洞宫，岳渎主宰，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯垂洞鉴。 臣今奉为宣意，其诸情悃，已对敷宣，谅沐天恩，鉴明祀事。 臣伏以夫南方火德荧惑星君，主掌万物，烛幽洞微，福善祸淫，助天行化，考之前代，效验灼然。 按《前汉□天文志》云：荧惑出则大兵，入则兵散还止息，乃为死丧寇乱，在其野亡地以战则不胜。 孝景四年七月癸未入，东井行阴道。 又以九月癸未入，舆鬼。 戊寅日出，占之曰：为诛伐火灾。 其从有栗氏事未央，东阙灾，元鼎中守南斗，占之曰：所守为乱贼丧兵，其国绝祀南斗，越分野，其后相杀王及太后。 汉兵诛之灭，其国前汉，荧惑示现，凡十七八，莫非凶乱之起也。 后汉中元二年，火星犯太微西南星，为将相后、太尉司徒坐事免官。 永平十三年，犯舆鬼，为大丧； 质星，为大臣诛戮。 后楚王英、颜忠等，妖谋事觉而死。 后汉荧惑示现，凡十二余，莫非祸灾之至也。 降自晋宋、隋唐五代之间，不可备录。 此於行度之间，变起在国者如此。 按《五星明体经》云：荧惑照人，命寿促贫。 穷顺於命，寿至五旬，刑克妻男，多有障难。 照於疾厄，刑折风劳。 逆在运宫，行年必死。 此於照临之位，灾应在人者如此。 至於祝融回禄，变现人世。 火自天降，名之曰灾。 因世人之罪恶贯盈，则遭其祸。 秦起阿房宫，覆压三百余里，五步一楼，十步一阁，取之尽锱铢，而用之如泥沙。 楚人一炬、火三月不灭，此因人为所致也。 摩竺尝从洛阳乘车而归，未至家，见一妇人求寄载。 临别曰：我是天人，使我焚东海縻竺家，今已寄君车，又不可不烧。 君但速归，我当缓来。 竺乃至家，收资财以避之，至日中而火大发，此以警悟世人也。 汝南桓景，因费长房谓之曰：九月九日，汝家有火灾，可速去，令家人各以绛囊盛茱萸，登高山，饮菊花酒，祸乃可销。 景如其言，举家登高。 少顷还，见牛羊鸡犬，皆暴死焉。

**Daoist Scripture and Ritual Disciple Zhòng Lì compiles,
Oath of Fire to Avert Calamities and Exhortation of Precepts.**

**Ritual Procedures for Ascending the Platform as Prescribed:**

Recite the **Pure Heaven-and-Earth Incantation**.
Sprinkle water, then arrange the formation.
The **High Master** presides at the altar and delivers the precepts.

**We, the officials of such-and-such rank, humbly offer:**
Daoist incense, **virtue-incense**, the incense of **Non-Action, Tranquility, and Natural True Fragrance**,
With sincere supplications to:
**The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void-Natural,**
**The Supreme Daoist Lord,**
**The Supreme Old Lord,**
**The Jade Emperor of the Azure Sky,**
**The Nine Sovereigns Most High,**
**The Ten-Directional Saints,**
**All Revered Lords and Elders,**
**The Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Master of the Mystic Great Law,**
**The Lord of the Fire-Star Upholding the Rounded Firmament,**
**The Lord of the Upholding Star of the Fire-Mandate,**
**The Lords of the Fire-Star’s Head and Tail,**
**The Lords of the Constellations of Yong, Qin, Zhou, Luo, Chu, and Jing,**
**The Lords of the Stars of the Four Directions,**
**The Lords of the Earthly Mound and Cavernous Palaces,**
**The Masters of the Mountains and Waters,**
**The Three Realms of Responsive Spirits,**
**All True and Numinous Essences.**

**May all behold Your Boundless Mercy and Condescend to Pierce with Insight.**

We now **proclaim Your Will**—our **sincere devotion** has been laid bare before You.
**Trusting in Heaven’s Grace and the Clarity of Our Ritual Offerings,**

We humbly submit that the **Lord of the Southern Fire-Star, the Upholding Star (Mangzhuo),**
**Oversees all things, illuminates the hidden and profound,**
**Bestows blessings on the virtuous and calamity on the licentious,**
**Assists Heaven in its transformations.**
**Examining past dynasties, the evidence is clear:**

According to the *Han Records on Astronomy*:
*"When the Upholding Star emerges, great armies rise;
When it retreats, armies disperse and cease hostilities.
Its appearance portends death, robbery, and chaos.
If battles are fought in its domain, victory is unattained."*

In the **fourth year of Emperor Jing’s reign (150 BCE), on the seventh month’s *gengwei* day,**
it entered the **East Well, traversing the Yin Path.**
Again, in the **ninth month’s *gengwei* day, it entered the *Yuche* constellation.**
On a *wuren* day, it emerged—**the omen read: ‘Execution, warfare, and fire calamities.’**
When it guarded the **Southern Dipper during the Yuan Ding era,**
the omen read: **‘The realm it guards will face rebellion, bandits, and military defeat.
Its nation will sever worship of the Southern Dipper,
transgressing its celestial domain—**
**later, the king and empress dowager will be slain in mutual slaughter.’**
The Han armies exterminated them, and their state perished.
**In the Han, the Upholding Star manifested seventeen or eighteen times—**
**each instance heralded disaster and chaos.**

In the **second year of Zhongyuan (57 BCE) of the Later Han,**
when the **Fire Star invaded the Southwest stars of Taiwei,**
it foretold the **dismissal of high officials—**
**the Grand Commandant and Minister of Works—**
**for their offenses.**
In the **thirteenth year of Yongping (70 CE),**
when it invaded *Yuche*, **great mourning ensued;**
when it invaded *Zhi*, **high officials were executed.**
Later, **King Ying of Chu and Yan Zhong** were exposed for treason and put to death.
**In the Later Han, the Upholding Star manifested twelve times—**
**each time, calamity struck.**

From the **Jin, Song, Sui, and Five Dynasties onward,**
the records are too numerous to enumerate.
**Such are the disasters that arise within its celestial course.**

According to the *Five Stars’ Manifest Essence Scripture*:
*"When the Upholding Star shines upon a person,
their lifespan is shortened, poverty ensues.
If they submit to fate, they may live to fifty,
but **wives and sons will suffer misfortune,**
and **obstacles will multiply.**
If it shines upon sickness or peril,
**wind and labor will bring affliction.**
If it opposes the celestial station,
**death will come within the year.**
**Such are the calamities it brings when it illuminates mankind."**

**When Zhūróng and Huìlù manifest in the mortal world,**
**fire descends from Heaven—this is called *disaster*.**
**It arises from the accumulation of humanity’s sins.**
**The Qin built the Alang Palace, spanning three hundred *li*,**
**with a pavilion every five steps and a gallery every ten,**
**exhausting every grain of wealth like dust and sand.**
**The Chu burned it, and the flames raged for three months—**
**this was the work of humanity.**

**Mo Chu once returned to Luoyang by carriage from home.**
Before arriving, a woman begged for passage.
As they parted, she said:
*"I am a Heavenly Being.
I was sent to burn the Mo family’s eastern sea estate.
Now that I’ve borrowed your carriage,
I cannot fail to set it ablaze.
You must return quickly—I will come later."*
Mo Chu hurried home, gathered his valuables to flee,
and by noon, the fire blazed fiercely—**a warning to all.**

**Huán Jǐng of Sìnán was told by Fèi Chángfáng:**
*"On the ninth day of the ninth month,
your home will face a fire calamity.
Quickly depart—**
**have each family member carry a crimson pouch of *zhūyú* berries,**
ascend a high mountain, and drink chrysanthemum wine.
Only then will the disaster be averted."*
Jǐng followed his words, leading his household to the heights.
**Soon after returning, he saw his cattle, poultry, and dogs—**
**all violently dead.**

Subsequent generations thus retained this practice, establishing methods of exorcism and disaster warding.

During the Han Dynasty under Emperor Huán, at the New Year’s grand assembly with his ministers, Lè Bā held wine and spat toward the southwest. The Emperor asked the reason, and he replied: *"Shu is suffering from a fire calamity, so I am warding it off."* The Emperor sent envoys to investigate, and indeed, it was said that a great rain came from the northeast, carrying the scent of wine within—this was a method of salvation and relief.

In the past, when *Xīnghuǒ* (Mars) occupied the *Xīn* (Heart) constellation, corresponding to the celestial division of the State of Sòng, Duke Jing of Qi was troubled by it. He then issued three imperial edicts, and the calamity shifted three times.

When **Liú Kūn** governed Jianglíng, a household fire broke out. Kūn knelt before the flames, begging forgiveness, and soon, the wind reversed, extinguishing it—this was a method of turning disaster.

For indeed, the coming of calamities and blessings all stem from human summoning. The Heavenly Will is benevolent and loving, and the Dao permits supplication and exorcism. Now, certain Daoist practitioners—[names omitted]—with sincere devotion, have constructed a solemn vow-fire exorcism ritual platform. They command us to proclaim the rites and regulations, to pray for blessings and ward off disasters, and to safeguard the peace of the land.

At the beginning of the platform’s establishment, if we do not first recite the ritual matters and expound the precepts and prohibitions, how then can we move the High Celestial Spirits?

Now, we shall proclaim the **Ten Precepts for the Ritual Platform** to all assembled here, that each may receive and uphold them. Listen carefully:

**The First Precept:** Do not disturb the body and spirit. Maintain unwavering focus—let joy, anger, sorrow, and delight not arise within. Strive for clarity and precision to commune with the Most Holy Above.

**The Second Precept:** Do not treat the Sacred and True with arrogance or neglect. Hold reverence and awe, gazing upon the honored images. With sincere devotion, the Heavenly True Ones descend from the void to receive you.

**The Third Precept:** Do not slight the Sacred Scriptures. Hold them with faith and weight. Study, recite, and ponder the Three Caverns’ classics, awakening to their truth and seeking the fruit of the Dao.

**The Fourth Precept:** Do not slander the Dao’s teachings. Hold them with respect, spreading the Way and clarifying the Law. Save both the living and the dead, guiding all to take refuge and gain liberation.

**The Fifth Precept:** Do not defile the ritual grounds. Maintain purity—bathe and fast before approaching the sacred platform. Avoid foul odors, blood, and slaughter. Keep poultry, dogs, and livestock from intruding.

**The Sixth Precept:** Do not indulge the body and mind—no shouting, cursing, idle chatter, or drunken revelry. Serve the Celestial Worthies with solemnity, as before one’s sovereign and parents.

**The Seventh Precept:** Do not falter in Daoist resolve. Hold firm—let no petty frustration extinguish your sincerity. Persevere in devotion, and boundless blessings shall follow.

**The Eighth Precept:** Do not neglect the ritual duties. Be diligent and earnest—chant the Dao, recite the scriptures, and pay homage to the True Ones. Let your merits be complete, that both the living and the dead may share in the grace.

**The Ninth Precept:** Do not err in petitioning or ritual offerings. Be precise—if reckless or careless, without proper deliberation, the Three Heavens may reject your supplications, turning blessings into misfortune. This is deeply to be feared.

**The Tenth Precept:** Do not haggle over profit. Be humble and yielding—let giver and receiver both rejoice, without resentment. Do not harm your own field of merit.

**These Ten Precepts—can the assembled officials uphold them?**
*Answer:* We can uphold them.

The Celestial Worthy speaks: *"When petitions are made and the Dao is practiced, the Four Heavenly Sovereigns ride upon flying clouds in green palanquins and eight-scenery jade carriages. Attended by True Persons and Jade Maidens bearing flower-adorned banners, they are preceded by phoenix hymns and followed by the Celestial Balance. White cranes and lions chant in unison, while incense smoke and scattered flowers drift from the void. Those who observe the rites and hear the Law shall see the Heavenly True Ones descend, and all spirits gather in homage. How then can one not exhaust the fullness of the ritual?"*

First, receive the Ten Precepts, then practice the Dao. Walk with measured steps, quiet the mind, and still the will. In sitting, standing, or repose, do not stray from proper form. Let the Heavenly True Ones rejoice, and your name shall be inscribed among the Upper Clarity Immortals—thus attaining the Dao’s gate within the mind.

To the ritual officials: The ritual’s solemnity is strict, its prohibitions grave. Sweep and purify the courtyard, ensuring absolute cleanliness. Discipline both inner and outer attendants—great and small—to maintain perfect silence. Do not mix mundane affairs with the Sacred, lest you offend the Celestial Spirits.

If any devout men or women wish to hear the Dao, let them bathe and fast in purity, then come to the ritual platform to pay homage and take refuge, sharing in the blessings. But if they are insolent or dismissive, unfaithful to the True—such shall surely invite retribution in the dark. Let those who partake in the ritual take heed.

**The vow is sealed; the platform is closed.**

*End of Volume Thirty of the Daoist Rites and Regulations Compendium*
