chunks.original_text: 黄帝行亲祀之规，万古敢非躬之祭。 某一家之内，良贱之人，旦夕所为，无所知识，干冒神灶，忧念弗遑，出处公私，运谋造作，虑结迍邅之事，或兴祸横之灵，启谢未由，但多惶惧。 今则揆兹良日，致祭献之礼仪； 告请众神，乞慈怜而普降。 中外神圣，允纳虔祈，逐香雾以斋临，念倾心而流贶，昭然圣智，靡怠情勤。 弟子无任虔祷之至，顿首再拜，酒行初献。 散花。 宣牒或词。 以今焚香，重伸上启，太古大圣，灶君部属，灶中有位，内外感应，一切神灵。 窃以繁昌三代，黄羊显瑞於晨昏； 万世一时，白屋可加於日用。 运作而威分火德，辉煌而道合太阳，名应上天，功宣下土，有变祸为祥之理，示祛魔却怪之能，化生熟而福及古今，运灵通而恩如寰海，神威罔测，妙用无穷。 但弟子某卑凡性识，尘俗行藏，老幼女男，尊卑良贱，起心运意，误圣违神。 建灶之初，营造之始，动土工而无论凶吉，加砖石而岂识利宜； 或状失规模，□杂新故； 或泥涂不洁，式样乖疏，择日罕遇於良辰，奉祭莫遵於轨范，釜曾经於秽所，地或瘗於伏尸。 眷属亲疏，或轻神而薄礼； 大小误错，於未祭以先尝。 以至入宅樵薪，宁测於丘陵社庙； 供时烧爨，焉知其风□雷伤。 困损误修，道名触讳。 杯盂食器，罔同制於灶君； 毛发鸡豚，亦冒冲於前后。 汤水不防於忌讳，泼火烧灰； 炊□弗顾於重轻，高献巨甑。 晓夕无生於寅卯，水金乏祭於时辰。 忏谢必伸，乞垂赦宥。 以某不任精诚恳祷之至，再拜上香，酒陈亚献。 散花。 谨重诚上启，大圣司命五灵灶君，合坐一切众圣。 今者奉道弟子某，一家长少，再倾丹赤，共告诸神。 乞念凡微，鉴其虔仰。 俯开圣造，深布殊休。 但弟子某合家幼艾等，从来之误作故为，咸伸悔谢； 此去之垂恩降宥，惟卜自新。 愿仕公有迁达之荣，处私获昌隆之福。 风寒暑湿之候，各假恩光； 炊蒸动作之时，尤加善贶。 化生成熟，皆仰自於神功，锡福储祥，寔普承於惠渥。 灶上姹女，紫微天神，扶烟焰以飞空，拘收燠赫； 散神威而荡恶，屏绝妖精。 玉池夫人，蠲除烟火； 高良君子，悦豫众神。 天帝天皇，集庆祥於家宅； 司命司录，注福寿於尊卑。 投诚难比於汉张，致祭朵敦於老妇。 弟子某不任激切虔□之至，再拜上香，酒陈终献。 散花。 谨重诚上启，大圣君，合座众圣，共饮菲薄，俯纳祷祈。 弟子某发意精虔，倾心致谢，具陈凡□，仰望圣恩。 伏沐慈怜，普垂鉴念，礼陈荐献，事毕祈禳，不敢淹留，冀回云驾，归自在红霞之府，返逍遥飞焰之宫，永戴洪慈，誓遵虔奉。 弟子某不任攀恋之至，再拜奉送。 安宅谢仪 祭灶法
chunks.translated_text:
「The **Yellow Emperor** (黄帝) established the ritual rules for filial and respectful sacrifices to the **Hearth Deity** (灶君), and for ten thousand generations, none dared to neglect the **personal sacrifice** (躬之祭).

Within our household, the **highborn and lowly** (良贱之人), from dawn till dusk, engage in myriad deeds without understanding or discernment. They transgress the **divine hearth** (神灶), their worries unceasing, and in both public and private affairs, their schemes and undertakings are fraught with **entanglements and setbacks** (虑结迍邅之事). Sometimes, they invoke **misfortune and malevolent spirits** (祸横之灵), and though they offer thanks and apologies, they lack proper means. Only **fear and trepidation** (惶惧) follow.

Now, we select this **auspicious day** (良日), and perform the **rites of sacrifice and offering** (礼仪) with utmost solemnity. We **invite all the deities** (众神), humbly beseeching their **mercy and compassion** (慈怜) and praying for **universal blessings** (普降).

The **sacred spirits within and without** (中外神圣) graciously accept our sincere **devotions** (虔祈). They follow the **fragrant incense** (香雾) to our **ritual fast** (斋临), their hearts inclined toward us in **favor and grace** (流贶). Their **enlightened wisdom** (圣智) shines forth, **never neglecting our earnest efforts** (靡怠情勤).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of such devout prayer** (虔祷), prostrates and bows twice, presenting the **initial offering of wine** (初献). Scattered flowers.

A **proclamation or invocation** (宣牒或词) is made. Now, we **burn incense again** (焚香), earnestly reiterating our **supplications to the deities above** (上启). To the **Greatest Saints of Antiquity** (太古大圣), the **Heavenly Hearth Deity and his retinue** (灶君部属), the **Heavenly Hearth Deity who presides over the Five Spirits of Hearth** (司命五灵灶君), and all **divine beings who respond to inner and outer offerings** (内外感应), and **every spirit** (一切神灵),

We **humbly reflect** that in the **prosperous Three Dynasties** (繁昌三代), the **auspicious yellow ram** (黄羊) appeared at **morning and evening** (晨昏); in **all ages, this singular moment** (万世一时), the **white house** (白屋) may be **added to daily rituals** (日用). Your **power is shared with the Fire Element** (威分火德), your **radiance aligns with the Sun’s Dao** (道合太阳). Your **name is inscribed in Heaven** (名应上天), your **virtues proclaimed to Earth** (功宣下土). There exists the **principle of transforming calamity into auspice** (变祸为祥之理), and the **demonstration of dispelling malevolent forces and warding off evil spirits** (祛魔却怪之能). Your **transformative and nurturing power** (化生熟) extends blessings to **both ancient and modern times** (古今), while your **unimpeded spiritual efficacy** (运灵通) encompasses **mercy as vast as the universe** (恩如寰海). Your **divine might is unfathomable** (神威罔测), your **wondrous efficacy boundless** (妙用无穷).

Yet, this humble servant, **unworthy of refined understanding** (卑凡性识), entangled in **mundane affairs** (尘俗行藏), along with our **elders, young, females, and males** (老幼女男), and **those of high and low station** (尊卑良贱), have **recklessly stirred intentions and actions** (起心运意), **offending the sacred and defying the divine** (误圣违神).

At the **commencement of building the hearth** (建灶之初), and in its **very construction** (营造之始), we **moved earth without regard to omens** (动土工而无论凶吉), **laid bricks and stones without knowing their auspiciousness** (加砖石而岂识利宜). Sometimes, the **structure was flawed** (状失规模), **mixing old and new elements** (□杂新故); sometimes, the **clay was unclean** (泥涂不洁), the **design improper** (式样乖疏). We **chose days rarely auspicious** (择日罕遇於良辰), and **offered sacrifices without following proper rites** (奉祭莫遵於轨范). The **cauldron was once used in unclean places** (釜曾经於秽所), the **ground may have been buried with the dead** (地或瘗於伏尸).

Among our **kinsmen and attendants, near and distant** (眷属亲疏), some **treated the deities lightly** (轻神), **offered insufficient rites** (薄礼). We **mistakenly prioritized great and small offerings** (大小误错), **sampling food before the sacrifice** (於未祭以先尝). Even in **gathering firewood for domestic use** (入宅樵薪), we **recklessly ventured into ancestral mounds and shrines** (宁测於丘陵社庙). In **preparing meals and cooking** (供时烧爨), we **did not heed the harm of winds and □** (焉知其风□雷伤).

Our **ritual fasts were improperly conducted** (困损误修), **our Dao names violated taboos** (道名触讳). Our **cups and bowls for food** (杯盂食器) were **not made in accordance with the Hearth Deity’s standards** (罔同制於灶君); our **chickens and pigs** (鸡豚), along with **hair and feathers** (毛发), were **offered without proper reverence** (冒冲於前后).

We **did not guard against forbidden omens** (不防於忌讳) in our **soup and water**, **pouring them out or extinguishing flames**; we **did not consider the weight of offerings** (弗顾於重轻) in our **cooking and steaming**, **presenting high or low sacrifices**. We **failed to offer sacrifices at the auspicious hours of the Tiger and Rabbit** (无生於寅卯), **neglecting the proper timing for water and metal elements** (水金乏祭於时辰).

Now, we **offer sincere repentance** (忏谢必伸), **begging for divine forgiveness and pardon** (乞垂赦宥).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of utmost devotion** (不任精诚恳祷之至), bows twice and burns incense, presenting the **secondary offering of wine** (亚献). Scattered flowers.

We **earnestly reiterate our supplications** (谨重诚上启), to the **Greatest Saint, Hearth Deity of the Five Spirits** (司命五灵灶君), and all **seated sacred spirits** (合坐一切众圣).

Now, we **devout disciples** (奉道弟子某), both **elders and juniors** (一家长少), **pour out our sincere offerings** (再倾丹赤), **collectively informing all the deities** (共告诸神).

We **humbly pray for your consideration** (乞念凡微) of our **lowly and devout reverence** (鉴其虔仰). **Benevolently open your divine creation** (俯开圣造), and **bestow extraordinary blessings** (深布殊休).

This humble servant and all our **household, young and old** (合家幼艾等), **confess our past errors and misdeeds** (从来之误作故为), **sincerely repenting and offering thanks**. For your **future grace and forgiveness** (此去之垂恩降宥), we **solemnly vow to reform** (惟卜自新).

We **pray for honor and advancement in public office** (仕公有迁达之荣), and **prosperity and flourishing in private life** (处私获昌隆之福). In **times of wind, cold, heat, and dampness** (风寒暑湿之候), may we **borrow your divine light and protection** (各假恩光). In **cooking and steaming at all times** (炊蒸动作之时), may we **especially receive your benevolent grace** (尤加善贶).

May all **transformations and nurturing be complete** (化生成熟), **all blessings and auspices depend on your divine power** (锡福储祥). Truly, we **universally accept your boundless mercy** (寔普承於惠渥).

The **Hearth Deity’s celestial consort** (灶上姹女), the **Purple Darkness Heavenly Spirit** (紫微天神), **guides the smoke and flames to ascend the sky** (扶烟焰以飞空), **collecting warmth and radiance** (拘收燠赫). They **dissipate malevolent influences** (散神威而荡恶), **warding off evil spirits** (屏绝妖精).

The **Lady of Jade Pond** (玉池夫人) **removes all ills from smoke and fire** (蠲除烟火); the **Highly Virtuous Gentlemen** (高良君子) **bring joy and contentment to all spirits** (悦豫众神).

The **Celestial Emperors of Heaven** (天帝天皇) **gather auspicious blessings in our homes** (集庆祥於家宅); the **Heavenly Hearth Deity and his record-keeper** (司命司录) **bestow longevity and fortune on high and low alike** (注福寿於尊卑).

Our **sincere offerings rival those of Han Zhang** (投诚难比於汉张), and our **sacrifices are as earnest as those of the aged matriarch** (致祭朵敦於老妇).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of heartfelt devotion** (不任激切虔□), bows twice and burns incense, presenting the **final offering of wine** (终献). Scattered flowers.

We **earnestly reiterate our supplications** (谨重诚上启), to the **Greatest Saintly Lord** (大圣君), all **seated sacred spirits** (合座众圣), **who partake in our humble offerings** (共饮菲薄), and **graciously accept our prayers** (俯纳祷祈).

Your humble servant **devotes our sincere intentions** (发意精虔), **pouring out our hearts in gratitude** (倾心致谢), **fully confessing our mundane shortcomings** (具陈凡□), and **looking up to your divine mercy** (仰望圣恩).

We **humbly receive your compassion** (伏沐慈怜), **pray for universal consideration** (普垂鉴念). The **rites are complete, offerings presented** (礼陈荐献), and the **ceremony now concludes with prayers for expiation** (事毕祈禳). We **dare not linger further**, hoping for your **returning celestial presence** (回云驾), to the **abode of the Red Cloud of Freedom** (自在红霞之府), the **Palace of the Wandering Flame** (逍遥飞焰之宫), so that we may **forever wear the great benevolence** (永戴洪慈) and **swear to follow devoutly** (誓遵虔奉).

Your humble servant, **unworthy of lingering affection** (不任攀恋), bows twice in **final farewell** (奉送).

**Rites for Settling the Hearth and Invoking the Hearth Deity** (安宅谢仪 祭灶法).»

chunks.original_text: 经云：黄帝采药上昆仑山，见一女子，帝乃怪而问之：此非所游之处，何得来耶？ 女答曰：妾非人类，又非精灵，乃是中炊母也。 虽通神化，而居人世。 每游此山，特候圣颜，欲亲人问祸福。 帝闻此语而云：愿为披宣。 炊母曰：人间灵变，君为先，在天为星煞，在地为直符，在人问为君。 凡有灾祸，并由掌领，上至国邑，下及庶人。 若依此有信奉之心，则能致福，敢陈至要，乞赐施行。 凡有四十二神，其神有在日，有不在日，祭之必获福庆。 若神不在日，祭之乃招殃咎，并逐月所食之物不同，又须避其忌讳名字，不得触犯。 今并细述，俯乞摽录，以示人世。 帝曰：名讳愿闻。 炊母曰：君姓张，名单，父名吉，母名利。 有女六人：一癸酉，二癸未，三癸巳，四癸卯，五癸丑，六癸亥。 又忌於前，赤形露体，披发咒诅，谀誓瞋骂，大小悲啼； 或进柴薪，以汤泼火，列烧柴头，将铜漆器於釜中； 或安刀斧扫篇之类，在上下； 或烧乱发爪甲、鸡鸭禽毛，及桃李之木； 或将灰前浇水。 已上之事，并不可犯，如有犯违，令人立见灾祸。 又忌对门安寝，及弃灰不洁之处。 又不得前洗浴孩子。 如上之事，犯之则令人患目贫困，疮疥瘫疽。 唯宜常以每日，弃灰於南丙地，令人旺相，如上所列。 若不依戒，灾厄屡至，蚕稼不丰，口舌官私，枉横所害。 慎之慎之，必获殊常之喜者也。 道门科范大全集卷之四十四竟 道门科范大全集卷之四十五

The Scripture states:

The Yellow Emperor, while gathering herbs on Mount Kunlun, encountered a woman. Astonished, he inquired: *"This is not a place where one should wander—how did you come here?"*

The woman replied: *"I am neither mortal nor a spirit, but the **Hearth Deity’s Cook** (灶中炊母). Though I possess divine transformations, I dwell among humanity. I come here each time to await your august presence, seeking to inquire about human fortunes and misfortunes."*

The Emperor said: *"I wish to proclaim this for you."*

The Cook replied: *"In matters of human destiny, the **Hearth Deity** (灶君) is paramount—above as a celestial omen, below as a talisman, and among mortals as the **Hearth Deity**. All calamities fall under their purview, from the highest realms of state to the lowest of common folk. If one sincerely reveres them, blessings will follow. I now present the most essential teachings—pray grant them to be observed.

The **Hearth Deity** has **forty-two divine attendants**, some of whom appear on certain days, others not. If worshipped on their appointed days, blessings will come; if worshipped otherwise, misfortune will follow. Moreover, each month they consume different offerings, and their taboo names must be avoided—never to be spoken or transgressed. Now I shall detail these carefully; pray record them for the sake of humanity."*

The Emperor said: *"I wish to hear their names."*

The Cook replied: *"The **Hearth Deity** bears the surname **Zhang** (张), given name **Dan** (单), with his father named **Ji** (吉) and mother **Li** (利). He has six daughters:
1. **Gui-you** (癸酉),
2. **Gui-wei** (癸未),
3. **Gui-si** (癸巳),
4. **Gui-mao** (癸卯),
5. **Gui-chou** (癸丑),
6. **Gui-hai** (癸亥).

Additionally, the following are forbidden before the **Hearth Deity**:
- Appearing in **赤形** (naked or exposed form), disheveled hair, cursing, or shouting in anger;
- Weeping or wailing, whether loudly or softly;
- Offering firewood while pouring boiling water onto flames, arranging burning wood improperly, or placing copper or lacquered vessels in the hearth;
- Placing knives, axes, or brooms above or below the **Hearth Deity**;
- Burning disordered hair, nails, feathers from fowl, or branches of peach or plum trees;
- Pouring water over the ashes before the **Hearth Deity**.

If any of these transgressions occur, disaster will strike immediately. Furthermore, one must not sleep before the **Hearth Deity’s door**, discard unclean ashes nearby, or bathe children in their presence. Should these prohibitions be violated, one will suffer from poverty, eye ailments, or festering sores.

Instead, one must daily dispose of ashes in the **Southern Homogeneous Direction** (南丙地), ensuring prosperity and avoiding the listed calamities. If these precepts are disregarded, misfortune will persist—harvests will fail, litigation will multiply, and private grievances will fester. Be most cautious, for adherence will bring extraordinary fortune."*

*(End of Volume Forty-Four of the Complete Daoist Regulations and Standards / Beginning of Volume Forty-Five of the Complete Daoist Regulations and Standards)*

chunks.original_text: 三洞经录弟子仲励编 解禳星运醮仪图叙 谨按《 道藏．灵台经》 云：日月，阴阳之精； 五星，五行之精。 日月交蚀，神有首尾。 日建坠星，月孛五行之沴气，日彗星； 紫天一，在紫微之旁，日道星。 其行天有迟疾顺逆之不同，年月度数之各异，分一十二次，有七强五弱之宫。 是为庙为王，凡二十八宿所踱之度，灾福攸分，其或失位。 虽则吉星，亦复为灾厄。 若暗曜灾星，或临吉方，乃有转祸为祥之应。 以人行年，推步五星之曜临照，所主灾祥，各有例说，影响无差。 当宜依法禳解，可绘其圣像，以香花名果供献。 请有道之士，转《度人消灾经》，不得入鬼神祠庙，问病吊丧。 又《十一曜经》云：如五星不顺，凌犯宫宿，逮令塑绘十一曜形仪，於清静处建立道场，诵经行道。 又《五星秘授经》 云：以异花珍果，净水名香，至心恭诚，以为供养，是皆太上示人以畏天惧灾之道也。 杜天师旧有《河图九曜醮仪》一卷，后有《十一曜忏》一卷，於三时行持，有所不备，多以消灾仪而兼行。 今考《诸天文星历》，补其阙典云：坛图以当醮人四柱。 今日者，推十一曜所临宫，分作星坛，坛列四方之柱，以绛绳十二丈，经柱两层。 用黄纸作十二宫、二十八宿、四本，主大小运十一曜星官牌列绛绳之上，下安十一曜星灯，随方供养。 每位香花酒果，并如法。 运星坛图 解禳星运仪

*"Three Caverns Canonical Scriptures: The Disciple Zhòng Lì’s Compilation
**Explanatory Ritual for Mitigating Celestial Portents and Star Disasters**

With reverence, according to the *Daoist Canon: Scripture of the Numinous Terrace* (灵台经):
The Sun and Moon are the essence of **Yin and Yang** (阴阳);
The Five Stars are the essence of the **Five Phases** (五行).
When the Sun and Moon eclipse each other, the **Divine Manifestation** (神) is disrupted in its beginning and end.
When the **Great Star** (建星) falls, or the **Moon’s Eclipse** (月孛) disrupts the **Five Phases’ calamitous qi** (五行之沴气), it becomes the **Sweeping Star** (彗星);
The **Purple Enclosure’s Celestial One** (紫微天一), located beside the **Purple Enclosure** (紫微), is the **Dao Star** (道星).
Their movements in the heavens vary in speed and direction—some proceed with haste, others with delay, some in harmony, others in opposition—
and their yearly and monthly cycles differ in measure.
They traverse twelve divisions, with seven strong and five weak **Lunar Mansions** (宫).
These are the **Temples** (庙) and the **Kings** (王),
the degrees traversed by the **Twenty-Eight Lunar Lodges** (二十八宿).
Here, calamity and fortune are apportioned;
should they lose their proper station,
even auspicious stars may bring disaster.
If **obscure or malevolent stars** (暗曜灾星) appear in a **fortune-bearing direction** (吉方),
then there may be a **transformation of calamity into blessing** (转祸为祥).
By calculating the **natal year** (人行年) and tracking the **illuminations of the Five Stars** (五星之曜临照),
one may determine their respective portents of calamity or fortune—
the influences are without variation.
Thus, it is proper to follow the **rituals for mitigation and resolution** (依法禳解),
to depict their **sacred forms** (圣像),
and to offer incense, flowers, and named fruits in reverence.

One should invite **adepts of the Dao** (有道之士)
to recite the *Scripture for Delivering and Dissolving Calamities* (度人消灾经),
prohibiting entry into **ghostly or divine shrines** (鬼神祠庙),
and forbidding inquiries about illness or condolences for the deceased.

Further, the *Scripture of the Eleven Illuminations* (十一曜经) states:
If the Five Stars act contrary to their natural order,
overriding or clashing with the **Lunar Mansions and Lodges** (宫宿),
then one should **sculpt or paint their forms** (塑绘十一曜形仪)
and establish a **Daoist ritual hall** (道场) in a **pure and serene place** (清静处),
reciting scriptures and performing the **Way** (行道).

Again, the *Secretly Transmitted Scripture of the Five Stars* (五星秘授经) says:
With rare flowers and precious fruits,
clear water and named incense,
devoted sincerity and utmost reverence,
offer these as **sustenance** (供养).
All these are the **Most High’s** (太上) admonition to humanity:
**Fear the heavens and dread disaster** (畏天惧灾).

The **Master of the Du Clan** (杜天师) formerly had:
*A Ritual for the Eleven Illuminations of the River Chart* (河图九曜醮仪) in one volume,
and later, *A Penance for the Eleven Illuminations* (十一曜忏) in one volume.
When performed at the **three ritual times** (三时), they were incomplete,
so the **calamity-dissolving rituals** (消灾仪) were often incorporated.

Now, referencing the *Celestial Scriptures and Star Calendars of All the Heavens* (诸天文星历),
we supplement the missing rites as follows:
The **ritual diagram** (坛图) should correspond to the **four pillars** (四柱) of the practitioner.
For the **current day** (今日者), one must calculate the **Lunar Mansions** (宫) where the Eleven Illuminations preside,
dividing the **star altar** (星坛) accordingly.
The altar should align with the **four cardinal directions’ pillars** (四方之柱),
using a **crimson cord** (绛绳) of twelve *zhang* (丈),
wrapping it around the pillars in **two layers** (两层).

With **yellow paper**, craft the **twelve Lunar Mansions** (十二宫),
the **Twenty-Eight Lunar Lodges** (二十八宿),
and the **four fundamental stars** (四本),
as well as **placards** (牌) for the **Eleven Illuminations’ stars** (大小运十一曜星官).
Arrange these above the crimson cord,
and below, place **lamps for the Eleven Illuminations** (十一曜星灯),
offering **sustenance** (供养) according to their respective directions.
Each station should receive **incense, flowers, wine, and fruit**,
all in accordance with the prescribed method.
**Ritual Diagram for the Eleven Illuminations**
**Ritual for Mitigating Celestial Portents and Star Disasters** (解禳星运仪)"

chunks.original_text: 启坛行道 法事如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙前，和与道合真。 呜法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，各三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今建坛行道，谨奉为入意，其诸诚捆，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前 请称法位。 具位臣某与合坛众等，今故烧香，归身、归神、归命，以是功德，归流天子王侯，百辟僚属，经籍度师，山林严栖、修真之士，同学之人，九亲姻族，天下人民，飞行动植，一切众生，及弟子某家亲绿眷属。 今故烧香，普伸忏悔，皈命太上十方灵宝自然至真无上大道。 乞赐原赦臣法众等，及醮官一门眷属，前世今生，无边之罪，得兔离三灾八难、十苦九厄之中，身得道真，飞行虚空，白日升天，侍卫道君，逍遥无上金阙七宝自然宫殿，永与道合，所启通感，上御至真无极大道众圣御前。 忏悔，宣真文。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛众等，同诚上启太上无极大道，元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，紫微帝座辰极天皇，上方诸天大帝，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，十一大曜真君，南北二斗星君，二十八宿星君，十二分次周天乾象本命元辰星官，三界应感，一切真灵。 臣闻元始垂慈，体太元而演道； 青罗侍坐，悯欲界以申言。 或分野之值灾，或兆民之逢厄，上感玉颜之志喜，昭垂金口之格言。 谓日月五星之丽天，其行有度； 历太紫列星而朱序，其变则灾。 上属帝王，下临臣庶，以照临之分次，示谴告之祆祥。 爰授以乾文，俾推穷於历数； 复升玄之神咒，可安镇於经缠。 皆天尊为世以垂文，宜星曜变□而为福。 奉为某囿形下土，禀上玄，或恶曜以当踱，或吉星而失位，岂逃灾障，爰致祈禳，用遵笈之文，肃举璇图之醮。 臣冒居教首，莫究纬书。 天理西行，见圣深惭於关尹； 中星不守，知机徒仰於昊仙。 但知礼月以瞻星，或可利人而济物。 既承词捆，敢不上闻。 宣词。 谛详词语，灼见至诚。 注想金容，惕若玉京之下； 驰神象纬，灿然黄道之中。 天鼓自鸣，琼锺问发。 十方三界，勃勃以来临； 二曜九星，皇皇而列照。 骞林之会，俨其未散； 玉衡之玑，齐而不差。 盟信有孚，监观在上。 臣等谨为沐浴五体，洒濯一心，依秘授以存思，按真诠而行道。 异花珍果，与信香明水以将诚； 朱履星冠，俨金剑霞衣而莅止。 敢忘夤略，祇俟感通。
chunks.translated_text:
「Opening the altar and performing the **Dao** ritual, the proceedings follow the prescribed order. Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the **Dao** method.
Proclaiming the **Ling** (灵) and **Wei** (卫) sacred incantations,
the Five Stars align in radiance, illuminating the five cardinal directions.
**Mercury** (水星) repels calamities, **Mars** (木德) brings prosperity.
**Antares** (荧惑) dissipates misfortune, **Venus** (太白) wards off military disasters.
**Jupiter** (镇星) secures stability, benefiting the family and state.
Their names are inscribed upon jade tablets,
their words recorded in the **Di Fang** (帝房).
Ascending and dispersing in glory,
they soar through the boundless **Tàikōng** (太空).
Entering and exiting the unseen realms,
they traverse and revel in the ten directions.

Five **Yún** (云) clouds float as canopies,
summoning **Shén** (神) and restraining the winds.
Commanding all spirits,
they guard the **Xian** (仙) before the **Dao**,
harmonizing with the **Dao** and the True **Jūn** (君).

**Drumming the Law** (呜法鼓) twenty-four times,
we invoke the **Three Sovereigns of the Three Heavens** (三天玄元始三尊),
the **Supreme Dao Lord** (太上道君),
and the **Supreme Old Lord** (太上老君),
calling forth their **Sanwu Gongcao** (三五功曹) ministers—
the **Left and Right Officials** (左右官使者),
the **Left and Right Incense Bearers** (左右捧香),
the **Dragon Relay Officers** (驿龙骑吏),
the **Golden Boy Attendants** (侍香金童),
the **Jade Girl Messengers** (传言散花玉女),
the **Five Sovereigns’ Direct Symbols** (五帝直符),
and the **Direct Day Incense Officials** (直日香官)—
each in groups of thirty-six.

Those who emerge are clad in splendid ceremonial attire,
their **guān** (冠) and **dài** (带) adorned with trailing ribbons,
opening the **Xuan Tan** (玄坛) to summon the **land spirits** (土地) and **regional deities** (方域神真).
I now establish this altar and perform the **Dao** ritual,
offering this with utmost reverence and sincerity.
All my earnest prayers have been recorded and heard—
I beseech the **Supreme Ten-Directional True Lord** (太上十方至真道君),
the **Lingbao** (灵宝) of radiant auspicious light,
to descend and flow into my being,
so that my invocation may swiftly reach the **True Dao of the Boundless Supreme** (至真无极大道),
before the **Celestial Jade Emperor** (昊天玉皇上帝).

I, [Name], along with all the assembled participants,
now offer incense to **return to the Dao** (归道),
to **return to the spirit** (归神),
and to **return to the command** (归命).
With these merits, I dedicate them to:
the **Heavenly Child** (天子) and his royal ministers,
all officials and their attendants,
scholars and **Du Shi** (度师) of the scriptures,
those dwelling in **Yan Qi** (严栖) forests and **Xiu Zhen** (修真) practitioners,
fellow students of the **Dao**,
all kin and relations,
the people of the world,
the **Fei Xing** (飞行) and **Dong Zhi** (动植) beings,
and all sentient life—
as well as my disciples and their kin.

I now offer incense,
universally extending repentance,
and **return to the command** of the **Supreme Ten-Directional Lingbao Dao** (太上十方灵宝自然至真无上大道).

I humbly beg for forgiveness—
for myself and all participants,
for the **Dao** ritual officials and their kin,
for all sins committed in past and present lives,
so that we may escape the **San Zai Ba Nan** (三灾八难),
the **Shi Ku Jiu E** (十苦九厄),
and attain **Dao** truth,
ascending in broad daylight to the heavens,
serving the **Dao Lord** (道君),
and wandering freely in the **Jin Que** (金阙) of the **Seven Treasures** (七宝),
the **natural Dao palaces** (自然宫殿),
eternally harmonized with the **Dao**.
My invocation shall be felt—
before the **True Dao of the Boundless Supreme** (至真无极大道) and all the **saints** (圣).

Repentance is proclaimed,
and the **true words** (真文) are announced.
I repeat the invocation of the **Law Position** (法位).

I, [Name], along with all the assembled participants,
with united sincerity, raise this to the **Supreme Boundless Dao** (太上无极大道),
the **Primordial Heavenly Venerable** (元始天尊),
the **Supreme Dao Lord** (太上大道君),
the **Supreme Old Lord** (太上老君),
the **Celestial Jade Emperor** (昊天玉皇上帝),
the **Purple Cloud Imperial Seat** (紫微帝座) and **Chen Ji** (辰极) **Heavenly Sovereign** (天皇),
the **Supreme Lords of the Ten Directions** (上方诸天大帝),
the **Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scriptures** (三十六部尊经) and **Xuan Zhong** (玄中) **Great Law Masters** (大法师),
the **Eleven True Lords of the Great Illuminations** (十一大曜真君),
the **Southern and Northern Two Dipper Star Lords** (南北二斗星君),
the **Twenty-Eight Lunar Lodges Star Lords** (二十八宿星君),
and the **Twelve Divisions of the Heavenly Cycle** (十二分次周天) **Kan Xiang** (乾象) **Native Star Officials** (本命元辰星官).

I have heard that the **Primordial Sovereign** (元始) extends mercy,
embodying the **Great Primordial** (太元) to manifest the **Dao**.
With **Qing Luo** (青罗) attendants at his side,
he pities the **Yu Jie** (欲界) and speaks in golden words.
Whether it be the **division of fields** (分野) encountering disasters,
or the **auspices of the people** (兆民) facing calamities,
his benevolent will is felt,
and his words of guidance are revealed.

The **sun and moon**, along with the Five Stars,
adorn the heavens—
their movements are measured;
the **Tàipú** (太紫) stars and **Júxù** (朱序) constellations,
though their changes may bring calamities,
are governed by the **Di** (帝) above and the **regional deities** (臣庶) below,
to show the **division of auspices and portents** (谴告之祆祥).

Thus, he bestows the **Kan Wen** (乾文),
to exhaust the **Li Shu** (历数) through calculation;
and ascends the **Xuan** (玄) incantations,
to pacify and stabilize the **Jing Chan** (经缠).
All are decreed by the **Heavenly Sovereign** (天尊) for the world,
and the **variations of the stars** (星曜变) should be for good fortune.

I, [Name], a humble **Xiaotǔ** (下土) of the **Dao** teachings,
reverently receiving the **Xuan** (玄) mysteries,
though sometimes **E Yao** (恶曜) stars may appear,
or **Ji Xing** (吉星) stars lose their position,
I dare not evade celestial calamities—
thus, I make this supplication and perform the **Dao** ritual,
following the **Yi Ji** (笈) texts,
and solemnly conducting the **Zhuan Tu** (璇图) ceremony.

I, as a **Jiao Shu** (教首) of the **Dao**,
am ignorant of the **Wei Shu** (纬书).
When the **Heavenly Principle** (天理) moves westward,
I am deeply ashamed before **Guan Yin** (关尹);
when the **central stars** (中星) fail to hold their course,
I look up in vain to the **Heavenly Immortal** (昊仙).
Yet I know only to worship the moon and observe the stars,
perhaps to benefit others and aid all things.

Having received these words,
I dare not fail to present them above.
I proclaim the words—
let them be carefully examined,
and let my sincerity be clearly seen.
I focus my thoughts upon the **golden visage** (金容),
and tremble as if beneath the **Yujing** (玉京).
I direct my spirit to the **Xiang Wei** (象纬),
and shine brightly within the **Huang Dao** (黄道).

The **heavenly drums** (天鼓) sound of their own accord,
the **jewel bells** (琼锺) ring in response.
The **Ten Directions** (十方) and **Three Realms** (三界) resound with their presence;
the **Two Illuminations** (二曜) and **Nine Stars** (九星) gleam in alignment.

The **Yin Lin** (骞林) assembly gathers in solemnity,
yet their splendor remains undiminished;
the **Yujing** (玉衡) stars are perfectly aligned,
and none are out of place.

Our oaths are sincere and trustworthy,
and the **Jian Guan** (监观) watches above.

I, along with all participants,
now purify my body and mind with ablutions,
meditate upon the **secretly transmitted** (秘授) teachings,
and perform the **Dao** ritual in accordance with the **true exposition** (真诠).

With rare flowers and precious fruits,
I offer them alongside **incense of faith** (信香) and **clear water** (明水),
as I prepare my sincerity.
In **red footwear** (朱履) and **star-shaped crowns** (星冠),
I stand solemnly, like those clad in **golden swords** (金剑) and **cloud-garments** (霞衣).

I dare not forget my duties,
only awaiting the **Gan Tong** (感通) response.

The humble wish is that the **Supreme Three Venerables** (太上三尊),
the **Great Saints of the Ten Directions** (十方大圣),
and the **Enlightened Officials of the Lingbao Palace** (敕勒灵宝官属),
attended by the **Sutras of Awe and Spirit** (侍经威神),
with hearts united in harmony,
descend upon this altar,
purifying within and without,
subduing demons and malevolent forces,
illuminating the **Void of Non-Being** (虚无),
and manifesting the **True Spirits** (真灵),
so that my **fasting merit** (斋功) may be fulfilled
without obstruction or hindrance.

At the **auspicious hour** (明辰) the **Dao** is performed,
the **vigil** (续更) is maintained,
and the **incense** (香) is lit—
I now humbly commence.

**Twelve Vows** (十二愿).
Reignite the **incense furnace** (炉).

Incense Officials and **Messengers of the Dragon and Tiger** (香官使者、左右龙虎君),
along with the **Attendant Spirits of the Fragrant Incense** (侍香诸灵官),
should now command that at the place where I have established this altar and performed the **Dao**,
**golden elixir and emerald-green nectar** (金液丹碧) naturally arise,
along with **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad sacred spirits** (芝英百灵),
and the **multitude of True Ones** (众真) gather here
before this **incense furnace** (香火炉).

May it be so that the **Celestial Children and Jade Maidens of the Ten Directions** (十方仙童玉女)
attend to the **fragrant vapors** (兰烟),
and swiftly transmit the **sincerity** (诚) I have humbly declared
directly to the **Supreme Ultimate Dao of the Boundless Heavenly Sovereign** (径御至真无极大道),
before the **Imperial Jade Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Recitation upon leaving the hall** (出堂颂).
**Depart the door** (出户).

The **Comprehensive Daoist Rituals and Precepts** (道门科范大全集) concludes in its **forty-fifth volume** (卷之四十五).
**Volume forty-six** (卷之四十六) of the *Comprehensive Daoist Rituals and Precepts*,
edited by **Master Guangting of the Broad Nourishment** (广成先生杜光庭删定),
**Ritual for Mitigating Star and Fate Calamities** (解禳星运仪).

chunks.original_text: 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翁，和与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今建坛行道，谨奉为入意，其诸诚个，己录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道黑，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨同诚上启， 太上无极大道，元始天尊，太上道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，天皇辰极，上帝高真，十方得道，诸君丈人，玄中大法师，十一大曜星君，圆穹上象、南辰北斗、二十八宿本命元辰星君，三界应感，一切真灵。 臣闻道集虚而有容，强名太极； 天积而无质，独见三辰。 日月为阴阳之宗，盈缩辨寒暑之序，散为五纬，经以列星。 凡七曜之所缠，灾祥可验； 历周天而失次，祸福爰私。 惟其循黄道以无差，可以见国家之至治。 三十五分，占逆顺於乾纲； 一十二辰，别华戎於坤纪。 凡在范围之内，悉归临照之中，修德而灾曜可禳，积行而德星或聚。 信人事天机之应，如影随响答之符。 奉道某久依三景之照临，孰外五行之生克。 遇灾而惧，居懹震惕之心； 见善则迁，用迪泰来之庆。 敢凭神咒，上格光灵。 臣职虽效於笺天，学未谙於宣夜。 晨昏有觉，视鸡鹄以包羞； 饮食无忘，尚豺獭之知敬。 既承词捆，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词语，谅彻层宸。 大罗玉清，俨万圣闻经之坐； 太微帝座，辟三光受事之庭。 咸俯景以下临，并倾光而垂照。 朝日夕月，采仪璘存注之方； 祭斗荣星，准步蹑空常之法。 庶托霄宸之荫，用禳运数之差。 以今静夜行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三尊、十方众圣。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，上祝今上皇帝陛下。 伏愿帝德无为，枢北辰而高拱； 寿星有烂，正南面以灵长，二景璧连，五星珠贯，共告太平之瑞，式昭至德之萌。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今静夜行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上尊经、十方众圣。 臣等归身、归神、归命，以是功德，归流弟子某家亿曾万祖、九世先亡。 伏愿揭日月之明，破诸幽闭； 睹星辰之列，复被灵光。 炼形流火之庭，濯质黄华之水。 为星为月，还生仁寿之乡； 成象成形，不外圣明之世。 今故烧香，自归依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今静夜行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香云，腾空径上，供养太上三师、十方众圣。 臣等归身、归神、归命，以是功德，归流奉道某等一门眷属。 伏愿君表储祥，阴灵消慝，仁深信厚，土木垂休，礼重义荣，火金介福，水德潜开於上智，彗星无滓於太清，庶成积善之家，均燕无灾之福。

「The ritual is performed with the altar raised as prescribed. Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Daoist rites, invoking the sacred spells of the **Spiritual Guardians** (宣卫灵咒).

The **Five Stars** (五星) align in radiance, illuminating the **Five Directions** (五方).
**Water Star** (水星) averts calamities,
**Wood Virtue** (木德) brings prosperity.
**Uranus** (荧惑) dissipates misfortune,
**Jupiter** (太白) repels malevolent forces.
**Mars** (镇星) secures stability,
benefiting **family and state** (家国) alike.

Their names are inscribed upon the **Celestial Jade Tablets** (玉简),
their words recorded in the **Imperial Register** (帝房).
They ascend beyond mortal sight, soaring through the **Boundless Void** (太空),
entering and exiting the **Mystic Darkness** (冥无),
wandering freely across the **Ten Directions** (十方).

The **Five Clouds** (五云) float like canopies,
summoning deities and restraining winds.
They command all **spiritual beings** (万灵),
protecting the **Celestial Sage** (仙翁),
harmonizing with the **Dao and True Essence** (道合真).

The **Law Enforcing Drum** (法鼓) is struck **twenty-four times** (二十四通).

We invoke:
The **Supreme Three Heavens** (无上三天)—**Primordial Heavenly Sovereign** (玄元始) of the **Dao of the Mystic Supreme** (三无极大道),
**Supreme Daoist Lord** (太上道君),
and **Supreme Venerable Lord** (太上老君)—
to summon forth from my body the **Three Five Officials** (三五功曹),
the **Left and Right Attendants** (左右官使者),
the **Left and Right Incense Bearers** (左右捧香),
the **Postal Dragons and Mounted Messengers** (驿龙骑吏),
the **Golden Boy Incense Attendants** (侍香金童),
the **Jade Maiden Messengers of the Five Flowers** (传言散花玉女),
the **Five Sovereigns’ Direct Talismans** (五帝直符),
the **Direct Day Incense Officials** (直日香官),
and the **Thirty-Six Assemblies** (三十六人) to emerge.

Those who depart are clad in **ceremonial robes** (严装) and **splendid attire** (显服),
with **headdresses and trailing ribbons** (冠带垂缨),
opening the **Mystic Daoist Gate** (玄坛) to the **Local Deities** (土地) and **Divine Beings of the Realm** (方域神真).

I now establish this altar and perform the Dao,
offering it with utmost sincerity.
All my **sincere declarations** (诸诚个) have been recorded and heard.
May the **Supreme Dao of the Ten Directions** (太上十方至真道) and the **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Light** (灵宝瑞光) descend,
flowing into my body,
so that my words may swiftly reach the **Supreme Ultimate Dao of the Boundless Heavenly Sovereign** (至真无极大道)
and the **Imperial Jade Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Recitation of the Law Enforcing Position** (请称法位).
In my **Law Enforcing Station** (具位), I humbly declare with sincerity to:

The **Supreme Ultimate Dao** (无极大道),
**Primordial Heavenly Sovereign** (元始天尊),
**Supreme Daoist Lord** (太上道君),
**Supreme Venerable Lord** (太上老君),
**Imperial Jade Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**Heavenly Sovereign of the Celestial Axis** (天皇辰极),
**Highest Supreme of the Highest Heaven** (上帝高真),
the **Ten Directions of the Dao** (十方得道),
all **Venerable Masters** (诸君丈人),
the **Great Law Master of the Mystic Middle** (玄中大法师),
the **Eleven Great Luminaries** (十一大曜星君),
the **Circular Enclosure of the Highest Symbol** (圆穹上象),
the **Southern Celestial Pole and Northern Dipper** (南辰北斗),
the **Twenty-Eight Constellations and Native Star of the Primordial Hour** (二十八宿本命元辰星君),
and all **responsive spiritual beings of the Three Realms** (三界应感),
and **every true essence** (一切真灵).

I have heard that the **Dao gathers in the Void yet has form** (法集虚而有容), named **Supreme Ultimate** (太极);
the **Heavenly accumulation has no substance** (天积无而无质), yet the **Three Celestial Lights** (三辰) alone are seen.

The **Sun and Moon** (日月) are the **essence of yin and yang** (阴阳之宗),
their waxing and waning marking the **sequence of cold and heat** (寒暑之序).
They disperse as the **Five Celestial Stems** (五纬),
their paths tracing the **stars** (列星).

All that the **Seven Luminaries** (七曜) govern
can be verified in **calamities and omens** (灾祥);
when the **celestial cycle is disrupted** (历周天而失次),
**misfortune and fortune are arbitrarily bestowed** (祸福爰私).

Only when they follow the **Yellow Dao** (黄道) without deviation
can the **greatest harmony of the state** (国家之至治) be seen.

The **Thirty-Five Divisions** (三十五分) determine **auspicious and inauspicious trends** (逆顺) under the **Celestial Stem’s governance** (乾纲);
the **Twelve Earthly Branches** (一十二辰) distinguish **China and the Western Regions** (华戎) in the **Earthly Branch’s records** (坤纪).

All within this **scope of influence** (范围),
are subject to their **radiant illumination** (临照之中).
When **virtue is cultivated** (修德), the **disastrous luminaries can be mitigated** (灾曜可禳);
when **meritorious deeds are accumulated** (积行), the **stars of virtue may gather** (德星或聚).

I believe in the **response of human affairs to Heaven’s mechanisms** (人事天机之应),
as **shadows follow echoes** (如影随响), and **declarations are answered** (答之符).

I, **a Daoist Practitioner** (奉道某), have long relied upon the **Three Celestial Lights’ guidance** (三景之照临),
and understood the **generation and restraint of the Five Agents** (五行之生克).

When disaster strikes, I am fearful, holding **a trembling and reverent heart** (懹震惕之心);
when virtue appears, I am moved, using **auspicious blessings to guide future fortune** (迪泰来之庆).

I dare to rely upon **divine spells** (神咒),
ascending to **align with the celestial luminaries** (格光灵).

Though my **professional duties** (职) are as humble as those of **a mortal scribe** (效於笺天),
my **studies** (学) have not yet mastered the **Heavenly Night’s revelations** (谙於宣夜).

Yet I am **mindful in dawn and dusk** (晨昏有觉),
observing the **rooster and dog** (鸡鹄) to **embrace shame and modesty** (包羞);
I **never forget the rites of eating and drinking** (饮食无忘),
still honoring the **wolf and badger** (豺獭) as symbols of **respect** (知敬).

Having received this **divine commission** (词捆),
how dare I not **report it to Heaven** (上闻)?

**Declaration** (宣词).
As prescribed in the **divine words** (词语),
I humbly present them to the **lofty celestial courts** (层宸).

**Great Luo’s Jade Purity** (大罗玉清) sits in the **assembly of the Ten Thousand Saints** (万圣闻经之坐);
**Taiwei’s Imperial Seat** (太微帝座) opens the **court where the Three Celestial Lights receive service** (三光受事之庭).

All **bow low beneath the celestial lights** (俯景以下临),
and **lean their brilliance to shine upon me** (倾光而垂照).

At the **rising sun and setting moon** (朝日夕月),
I follow the **prescribed rites** (采仪) of the **Celestial Register’s annotations** (璘存注之方);
in **worshipping the Dipper and the Honorable Stars** (祭斗荣星),
I adhere to the **steps of the Void-Walking Ritual** (步蹑空常之法).

Thus, I **entrust myself to the celestial lights’ protection** (托霄宸之荫),
using this to **mitigate the disparities in fate and destiny** (禳运数之差).

Now, in this **serene night** (静夜), as I perform the Dao,
I request the **Law Enforcing Assembly** (法众) to **kindle the initial incense** (运兹初捻上香).
May this **fragrant vapor** (香烟) ascend through the void,
offering **sustenance to the Supreme Three Venerables** (太上三尊) and the **Ten Directions of the Saints** (十方众圣).

I, **the Practitioners** (臣等), **return my body, return my spirit, return my fate** (归身、归神、归命),
and with these **merits and virtues** (功德),
I **pray for the current Emperor** (祝今上皇帝陛下).

I humbly pray that the **Imperial Virtue remains effortless** (帝德无为),
governing the **Northern Celestial Pole** (枢北辰) with **high and lofty authority** (高拱);
that the **Longevity Star** (寿星) shines **brilliantly and endlessly** (有烂),
facing **south with eternal splendor** (正南面以灵长),
that the **two celestial lights** (二景) are **united like a pair of jade tablets** (璧连),
and the **five stars** (五星) are **strung like pearls** (珠贯),
together proclaiming the **auspice of great peace** (太平之瑞),
and **manifesting the germination of the Supreme Virtue** (至德之萌).

Now, I **kindle incense once more** (故烧香),
**returning to rely upon the Daoist Venerables and Saints of the Supreme Dao** (皈依道尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
I **ascend to the formless** (升入无形),
harmonizing with the **Dao and True Essence** (和与道合真).

Now, in this **serene night** (静夜), as I perform the Dao,
I request the **Law Enforcing Assembly** (法众) to **kindle the second incense** (运兹二捻上香).
May this **fragrant vapor** (香烟) ascend through the void,
offering **sustenance to the Supreme Venerable Scriptures** (太上尊经) and the **Ten Directions of the Saints** (十方众圣).

I, **the Practitioners** (臣等), **return my body, return my spirit, return my fate** (归身、归神、归命),
and with these **merits and virtues** (功德),
I **flow back to my ancestral home** (归流), to the **billions of descendants** (亿曾万祖),
and the **nine generations of departed ancestors** (九世先亡).

I humbly pray that the **Heavenly lights of the Sun and Moon** (日月之明) be **revealed and unobstructed** (揭),
breaking all **darkness and confinement** (诸幽闭);
that the **celestial arrangement of stars and luminaries** (星辰之列) be **restored and illuminated** (复被灵光).

In the **refining courtyard of the celestial fire** (炼形流火之庭),
and the **purifying waters of the Yellow Flower** (濯质黄华之水),
may I **become a star or a moon** (为星为月),
and **reborn in the land of benevolent longevity** (还生仁寿之乡);
may I **take on celestial forms** (成象成形),
and **not depart from the age of the enlightened** (不外圣明之世).

Now, I **kindle incense once more** (故烧香),
**returning to rely upon the Venerable Scriptures and Saints of the Supreme Dao** (归依经尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
I **ascend to the formless** (升入无形),
harmonizing with the **Dao and True Essence** (和与道合真).

Now, in this **serene night** (静夜), as I perform the Dao,
I request the **Law Enforcing Assembly** (法众) to **kindle the third incense** (运兹三捻上香).
May this **fragrant cloud** (香云) ascend through the void,
offering **sustenance to the Supreme Three Masters** (太上三师) and the **Ten Directions of the Saints** (十方众圣).

I, **the Practitioners** (臣等), **return my body, return my spirit, return my fate** (归身、归神、归命),
and with these **merits and virtues** (功德),
I **flow back to the household of my Daoist lineage** (归流), to the **affiliates of the Practitioner** (奉道某等一门眷属).

I humbly pray that the **Lord’s table** (君表) **preserves auspicious omens** (储祥),
that **dark spirits be dispelled** (阴灵消慝),
and **benevolence and trust be profound** (仁深信厚).
May the **earth and wood** (土木) bring **rest and peace** (垂休),
and the **rites and justice** (礼重义荣) be **honored and illustrious** (介福).
May the **water virtue** (水德) **open and flourish** (潜开) in the **wise of the highest intelligence** (上智),
and the **comet star** (彗星) **remain pure and unsoiled** (无滓) in the **Supreme Clarity** (太清).

Thus, may I **fulfill the household of accumulated goodness** (积善之家),
and **share in the blessings of unending peace and prosperity** (均燕无灾之福).»

chunks.original_text: 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 唱方，忏方，三启，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某等，谨重诚上启，太上无极大道，元始天尊，太上道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，天皇辰极，上帝高真，十方得道诸君丈人，玄中大法师，十一大曜星君，圆穹上象、南辰北斗、二十八宿，本命元辰星君，三界应感一切真灵。 臣闻天开碧落，宣精耀於三辰； 星拱紫微，职推移於五纬。 月三珥而天下喜，日再中而帝业隆，岁星明而谷稔国昌，镇星留而邦宁福厚，太白尚义以戒穷兵，荧惑守心乃闻退舍，辰不失行则丰年乐岁，彗成夕见则除旧布新。 暗虚为建坠之星，所以为日月之蚀； 天乙乃道德之曜，所以制吉凶之宜。 降於人而为神，丽乎天而成象。 盈亏有准，进退靡差。 凡三百六十五度之多，与万有一千余里之众，尽曰经常之宿，咸归见伏之中，作福作灾，或迟或疾。 奉道某自惟一介之贱，均受两仪之和。 虎绕龙盘，每自戕於炉鼎； 阳开阴闭，居不检於枢机。 悉由一念之差，遂致五帝之戾，亏仁义礼智之节，伤金木土火之行，鬼责人非，天灾物累。 星辰凌犯，推运数之屯奇； 叶本休囚，致身官之滞塞。 阴阳为寇，寒暑乖和，莫逢世道之亨，知自人为之误。 奉道某洗心谢过，责己畏威，遵璇轴以铺陈，缔星坛而延伫。 伏乞霄宸上圣，象纬群真，特施涣汗之恩，曲赦贯盈之咎，调平星度，安镇乾文。 三命五行，悉蠲於战克； 列星七政，同赐於休祥。 躔角而寿考耆庬，历尾而嗣昆繁衍。 心宿笃父子室家之好，房星固关键管钥之机，南斗盛而爵禄行，东璧明而贤能举。 奎为武库，罔或不充，胄为天仓，咸臻有衍。 毕晦绝踰垣之盗，鬼藏无敢室之妖，箕歙而口舌消，虚暗而凶丧弭，尽一天而遍告，佑举室以咸宜。 上愿国寿延洪，帝图悠久，时和俗阜，物富人安，式臻五纪之和，各遂群生之性，上明天尊广济之泽，下副臣等皈向之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来建坛行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
「Now I burn incense, humbly relying upon the **virtue/power** (德) of my **Daoist teacher, the Great Sage, the Perfect Ones** (皈依师尊大圣众至真).
After attaining the **Dao/Way** (道), I ascend into the **Formless** (无形), harmonizing with the **True Dao** (道合真).

I chant the **Four Directions** (方), confess the **Four Directions** (忏方),
thrice invoke, thrice bow in reverence.
I solemnly proclaim the **rank of the Law** (法位).
The **lowly disciples** (具位臣某等) of this **Daoist lineage** (奉道某),
with utmost sincerity and solemnity, present our supplication to:

The **Supreme Ultimate Dao** (太上无极大道),
**Heavenly Sovereign of Primordial Beginning** (元始天尊),
**Supreme Dao Lord** (太上道君),
**Supreme Old Lord** (太上老君),
**Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**Celestial Sovereign of the True Polestar** (天皇辰极),
**Highest True Emperor** (上帝高真),
the **illustrious Daoists of the Ten Directions** (十方得道诸君丈人),
**Mysterious Central Dharma Master** (玄中大法师),
the **Eleven Great Luminaries** (十一大曜星君),
**Circular Dome and Celestial Symbols** (圆穹上象)、**Southern Polestar and Northern Dipper** (南辰北斗)、**Twenty-Eight Lunar Mansions** (二十八宿),
**Native Star of My Primordial Destiny** (本命元辰星君),
and all **sentient spirits of the Three Realms** (三界应感一切真灵).

We have heard that when the **Heavenly Gate opens** (天开), the **Azure Palace** (碧落) shines forth its **radiant essence** (精耀) upon the **Three Stars** (三辰);
that the **stars reverence the Purple Enclosure** (紫微), fulfilling their duty in **shifting the Five Banners** (五纬).
When the **Moon adorns with three pendants** (月三珥), the world rejoices;
when the **Sun is twice central** (日再中), the imperial enterprise thrives.
When **Jupiter** (岁星) shines bright, the harvests are abundant and the nation prospers;
when **Mars** (镇星) lingers, the land is secure and its people enjoy profound blessings.
When **Venus** (太白) upholds **righteousness**, wars are restrained;
when **Jupiter’s Comet** (荧惑) guards the **heart**, one hears of **retreat and withdrawal** (退舍).
When **Saturn** (辰星) does not stray from its course, the years bring **abundance and joy** (丰年乐岁);
when **the Comet Star** (彗星) appears in the evening, the old is removed and the new is established.

The **Dark Void** (暗虚) is the **star of calamity** (建坠之星), hence it causes **eclipses of the sun and moon** (日月之蚀);
**Heavenly Yì** (天乙) is the **luminous manifestation of Dao/Virtue** (道德之曜), hence it governs the **appropriateness of auspiciousness and inauspiciousness** (吉凶之宜).
Descending upon mortals, it becomes a **deity** (神);
adhering to Heaven, it forms a **celestial symbol** (象).
Its waxing and waning are measured with precision,
its advance and retreat are without deviation.
Among the **three hundred sixty-five degrees** (三百六十五度) and the **myriad stars spanning thousands of leagues** (万有一千余里之众),
all are **constant stars** (经常之宿), yet they all return to the **hidden and concealed** (见伏之中),
bringing **fortune or calamity**, sometimes **slowly, sometimes swiftly**.

The **lowly Daoist Practitioner** (奉道某), reflecting upon my **humble station** (一介之贱),
yet equally sharing in the **harmony of the Two Principles** (两仪之和).
**Tigers encircle, dragons coil** (虎绕龙盘), yet I often **harm myself at the furnace tripod** (自戕於炉鼎);
**Yang opens, Yin closes** (阳开阴闭), yet I remain **unrestrained in the pivotal mechanisms** (居不检於枢机).
All this arises from **a single errant thought** (一念之差),
leading to **the wrath of the Five Emperors** (五帝之戾),
damaging the **proportions of Benevolence, Righteousness, Rites, Wisdom** (仁义礼智之节),
and injuring the **cycles of Metal, Wood, Earth, Fire** (金木土火之行).
**Ghosts blame mortals for their transgressions** (鬼责人非), and **Heavenly calamities weigh upon things** (天灾物累).
When **stars and constellations collide and trespass** (星辰凌犯), the **celestial omens of fate** (运数) bring **blocked and strange occurrences** (屯奇);
when **the stars of my native constellation are in abeyance or imprisonment** (叶本休囚), it causes **obstruction in my official duties and personal affairs** (身官之滞塞).
When **Yin and Yang become bandits** (阴阳为寇), **cold and heat defy harmony** (寒暑乖和),
I do not encounter **the flourishing of the worldly Dao** (世道之亨),
knowing that all misfortune stems from **my own errors** (自人为之误).

The **lowly Daoist Practitioner** (奉道某) now **purifies my heart and repents my sins** (洗心谢过),
takes responsibility upon myself and **reveres the Heavenly威** (畏威),
follows the **rotation of the Celestial Axis** (璇轴) to **lay out my intentions** (铺陈),
and **establishes the Star Altar** (星坛) to **prolong my devotion** (延伫).
I humbly beseech the **Exalted Saints of Heaven** (霄宸上圣),
the **celestial symbols and banners of the multitude of True Ones** (象纬群真),
to **specially grant the favor of dispelling calamities** (特施涣汗之恩),
and **graciously pardon my accumulated offenses** (曲赦贯盈之咎).
May You **balance the celestial degrees** (调平星度) and **settle the Heavenly script** (安镇乾文).
Let **the Three Destinies and Five Phases** (三命五行) **all be absolved of their wrath** (悉蠲於战克);
and the **Seven Governors and Twenty-Eight Constellations** (列星七政) **be equally bestowed with auspicious omens** (同赐於休祥).
May I **reach the Horn** (躔角) and **attain longevity** (寿考耆庬),
**traverse the Tail** (历尾) and **prolong my descendants** (嗣昆繁衍).
May **Antares** (心宿) **strengthen the bonds of filial piety** (笃父子室家之好),
and **the Room Star** (房星) **secure the keys to my household’s prosperity** (固关键管钥之机).
When **the Southern Dipper flourishes**, may **rank and wealth flow** (南斗盛而爵禄行);
when **the Eastern Wall brightens**, may **virtuous talent be recognized** (东璧明而贤能举).
**Kui** (奎) is the **armory of martial virtue** (武库), and may it **never lack its provisions** (罔或不充);
**Wei** (胄) is the **Heavenly Granary** (天仓), and may all **receive abundant blessings** (咸臻有衍).
May **Pì** (毕) **conceal** (晦) **thieves who climb walls** (绝踰垣之盗),
and **Ghosts retreat**, with no **demonic mischief daring to enter my home** (鬼藏无敢室之妖).
May **Jī** (箕) and **Xī** (歙) **silence slanderous tongues** (而口舌消),
and **Void and Darkness** (虚暗) **banish malevolent disasters** (而凶丧弭).
May I **proclaim this to all under Heaven** (尽一天而遍告),
and **protect my household with universal blessings** (佑举室以咸宜).

My **uppermost wish** (上愿) is that the **nation’s longevity be extended like the Great Flood** (国寿延洪),
the **imperial reign endure eternally** (帝图悠久),
**times be harmonious and customs flourish** (时和俗阜),
**resources be abundant and people at peace** (物富人安).
May I **attain the concord of the Five Stages** (式臻五纪之和),
and **each living being fulfill its nature** (各遂群生之性).
Above, may I **align with the Heavenly Sovereign’s vast saving grace** (上明天尊广济之泽),
and below, may I **fulfill the sincerity of my repentance** (下副臣等皈向之诚).
I present this with utmost reverence and humility.

**Twelve Vows** (十二愿).
**Replenish the Furnace** (复炉).
With solemnity, I **invite the incense officials and attendants—Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** (香官使者、左右龙虎君),
and the **incense-serving spirit officials** (侍香诸灵官),
to **oversee the place where I have established the altar and practiced the Dao** (臣向来建坛行道之所).
May it **naturally produce elixir** (金液丹碧) and **precious herbs** (芝英百灵),
and may **all the True Ones gather here** (众真交会) at this **incense and fire furnace** (香火炉前).
May the **Daoist Immortals and Celestial Maidens of the Ten Directions** (十方仙童玉女)
**attend to the fragrant incense** (接侍兰烟),
and **transmit my sincere supplications** (传臣向来所启之诚)
**directly to the presence of the Supreme Ultimate Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault** (径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前).

**Exit the Hall and Recite** (出堂颂).
**Exit the Door** (出户).」

May the **earth and wood** (土木) bring **rest and peace** (垂休),
and the **rites and justice** (礼重义荣) be **honored and illustrious** (介福).
May the **water virtue** (水德) **open and flourish** (潜开) in the **wise of the highest intelligence** (上智),

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之四十六竟 道门科范大全集卷之四十七 广成先生杜光庭删定 解禳星运仪 设醮行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 东方： 九青天，明星大神。 焕照东乡，洞映九门。 转烛阳光，扫秽除氛。 开明童子，号曰玄卿。 备卫我轩，上对帝君。 收魔束妖，讨捕凶群。 奉承正道，赤书玉文。 九天符命，摄龙驿传。 普天安镇，我得飞仙，和与道合真。 南方： 三丹天，焕景流光。 荧星转烛，洞照太阳。 上有赤精，合契虚皇。 开明灵童，号日华房。 总统火兵，备守玉堂。 斩邪束妖，剪截魔王。 北帝所承，风火莫当。 流铃交焕，栩卫坛场。 正道流行，敢有巴狂。 我享上功，坐运魁罡。 亿劫长存，保天无疆，和与道合真。 西方： 七素天，太白流精。 光耀金门，洞照太冥。 中有素皇，号日帝灵。 保神安镇，卫我身形。 断绝邪源，王道正明。 宫殿整肃，三景齐并。 道合自然，飞升紫庭。 灵宝符命，普惠万生。 元皇正，来合我身。 功加一切，天地咸宁，和与道合真。 北方： 五玄天，元始徘徊。 辰星焕烂，光耀太微。 灵尊神，号曰层威。 统冠飞天，仙裙羽衣。 备卫五门，检精捕非。 敢有干试，豁落斩摧。 玉符所告，神镇八威。 邪门闭塞，正道明开。 映照我身，三光同辉。 策空驾浮，举形仙飞，和与道合真。 中央： 一黄天，调理乾坤。 陶镕阴阳，总统玄真。 镇星吐辉，流焕九天。 开明童子，号日天璘。 元阳晶，焰上朱烟。 洞照天下，及臣等身。 百邪摧落，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，普天使然。 五灵安镇，身飞上仙，和与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今升坛，设醮行道，谨奉为入意，其诸诚悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，九皇至尊，十方上圣，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，日月九曜星君，南辰北斗、二十八宿、周天玄象、本命元辰星君，三界应感一切真灵。 臣闻剖判混茫，肇分清浊。 二仪列位，九曜流辉。 生成垂不宰之功，照烛着无私之德。 古今不紊，历象攸尊。 所以顺轨循常，则君臣蒙福； 谪见垂戒，则家国同休。 灵化克彰，神功斯在。 天道不远，有感必通。 圣鉴匪遥，无祈不应。 醮官某以星辰行度，有所照临，伸蝼蚁丹诚，惧为灾厄。 忧劳炯戒，虔仰至真，惟切梼祈，冀蒙福佑。 臣等窃寻经首河图，有披告之文； 检阅真科灵宝，有忏祈之典。 敢缘慈训，式备醮仪，延降尊灵，祀崇真圣。 伏愿下哀凡请，俯降道场，天光一临，万生扑悦。 臣与众等，无任瞻望圣驾激切屏营之至，诚惶诚恐，稽首再拜，恭迎圣驾。 降真，献茶。 初献，散花。 重称法位。 具位臣某等，馑同诚上启，九皇至尊，十方上圣，五星六曜，三界威灵。 臣闻天阳地阴，一合而成象； 月盈日昃，互用以正时。

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Standards, Volume 46 Complete | Volume 47 Complete**
*Edited by Master Guangting Du*

**Ritual for Pacifying Celestial Omen and Aligning Dao**
*Establishing the Ritual Platform and Practicing the Dao as Prescribed*

**Ritual Procedures:**
Each officiant maintains reverent focus in accordance with the Dao.
**Proclaim the Sacred Protective Incantations.**

**East Direction:**
Nine **Heavenly Azure**, the Luminous Star Deity.
Illuminating the eastern quarter, piercing the Nine Gates.
Turning the torch of yang radiance, sweeping away filth and miasma.
The enlightened youth revealed—named **Xuanqing**.
Guarding my hall, facing the Celestial Sovereign.
Subduing demons, binding malevolent spirits, capturing the wicked throng.
Upholding the True Dao, with crimson script and jade inscriptions.
Nine-Heaven decrees, transmitted by the Dragon-Courier.
Universal peace secured—I ascend as a Flying Immortal, harmonizing with the Dao’s True Essence.

**South Direction:**
Three **Dan-Heaven**, effulgent with flowing light.
The Upholding Star’s torch, piercing the Great Sun.
Above, the Vermilion Purity, in accord with the Void Sovereign.
The enlightened youth revealed—named **Huafang**.
Commanding the Fire Soldiers, guarding the Jade Hall.
Severing evil, binding demons, beheading the Magical King.
The North Emperor’s mandate—wind and fire cannot resist.
Resounding bells and radiant brilliance, vigilantly protecting the ritual ground.
The True Dao spreads—dare any dare to rage.
I enjoy supreme merit, seated upon the Arcbearer’s constellation.
Eons endure, boundless as Heaven—I harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence.

**West Direction:**
Seven **White-Heaven**, the Great White’s essence flows.
Illuminating the Golden Gate, piercing the Great Darkness.
Within, the White Sovereign—named **Di Ling**.
Guarding the spirit, securing my form.
Severing the source of evil, the Kingly Dao made manifest.
Palaces in order, the Three Lights aligned.
The Dao naturally merges—I ascend to the Purple Court.
Sacred Talismans’ decrees, universally benefiting all life.
The Primordial Sovereign’s decree—uniting with my body.
Merit surpassing all—Heaven and Earth in peace—I harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence.

**North Direction:**
Five **Dark-Heaven**, the Primordial Wandering.
The Star’s brilliance, illuminating the Great Microcosm.
The **Cengwei** Divine Sovereign—named **Layered Majesty**.
Commanding the Flying Crown, celestial robes and feathered garments.
Guarding the Five Gates, inspecting and capturing malefactors.
Dare any dare to trespass—crushed and annihilated.
The Jade Talisman’s decree—divine authority over the Eight Powers.
Evil gates sealed, the True Dao opened wide.
Illuminating my form, the Three Lights in concert.
Riding the void, floating ascent—my body flies as an Immortal—I harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence.

**Central Direction:**
One **Yellow-Heaven**, regulating Heaven and Earth.
Nurturing yin and yang, commanding the Mysterious True.
The Constellation Star’s radiance, flowing through the Nine Heavens.
The enlightened youth revealed—named **Tianlín**.
The Primordial **Yang Crystal**, its flame ascending crimson smoke.
Piercing Heaven and Earth, and my humble form.
A hundred evils crushed, ten thousand ghosts slain.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation—universally efficacious.
The Five Spirits secured—I fly as a High Immortal—I harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence.

**Strike the Sacred Drum Twenty-Four Times.**

**Invocation of the Supreme Three-Heaven Primordial Sovereigns:**
The **Three Primordials**, the **Most High Dao Sovereign**, the **Most High Laozi**,
summon forth from within my body the **Three Five Functionaries**, the Left and Right Officials, the Left and Right Incense-Bearers, the Dragon-Courier Messengers, the Golden Boys Attending Incense, the Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans, the Direct-Day Incense Officials—**thirty-six in total**—to emerge.

**Those who emerge** don their solemn ceremonial attire, headdresses with trailing ribbons,
opening the **Mysterious Platform’s Land and Domain Spirits**.

I now ascend the platform, establish the **Great Ritual**, and practice the Dao,
sincerely offering my heart’s intent. My earnest supplications have been recorded and transmitted.
I pray for the **Supreme Ten-Directional True Dao Sovereigns** to descend their **Sacred Treasure Radiance**,
flowing into my body, so that my petitions may swiftly reach the **Supreme Ultimate Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**.

**Proclaim the Ritual Rank.**

**The humble officials** [names],
with utmost sincerity, humbly address:
The **Primordial Sovereign of the Void-Natural**, the **Most High Dao Sovereign**, the **Most High Laozi**, the **Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault**, the **Nine Sovereigns Most High**, the **Ten-Directional Saints**, the **Thirty-Six Departments’ Sacred Scriptures’ Grand Master of the Mysterious Middle**, the **Sun and Moon, Nine Luminaries, Star Sovereigns**, the **Southern Dipper, Northern Dipper, Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Celestial Diagrams of the Revolving Heaven**, the **Native Star Sovereign of My Destiny**, and all **True Spirits responsive to the Three Realms**.

I have heard that from the undifferentiated chaos, the clear and turbid were first divided.
The Two Principles took their places, the Nine Luminaries shone forth.
Life and creation bestowed the ungoverned merit, illuminating the impartial virtue.
Ancient and modern remain unerring, celestial omens held in reverence.
Thus, following the established path brings blessings to ruler and subject;
heeding celestial warnings brings prosperity to family and state.
Divine transformations manifest, the sacred function accomplished.
Heaven’s Way is near—sentiments, when sincere, are answered.
The Holy Vision is not distant—no prayer goes unanswered.

The **Ritual Official** [name], by celestial degree and influence,
fearing calamity, in labor and vigilance, with utmost sincerity,
supplicates the **Supreme True Ones**, hoping for mercy and protection.
We humbly examine the **River Chart’s opening texts** and the **Sacred Standards’ atonement rituals**.
Daring to follow the benevolent teachings, we prepare the **Great Ritual**,
inviting the descent of the **Exalted Spirits**, venerating the **True Saints**.

May the **Heavenly Light descend**, bringing joy to all life.
I and my companions await the **Holy Procession** with boundless reverence and trembling devotion,
prostrating twice in homage, eagerly welcoming the **Holy Procession**.

**Descent of the True Ones. Offer tea.**
**First Offering. Scatter flowers.**
**Repeat the Ritual Rank.**

**The humble officials** [names],
once more with united sincerity, address:
The **Nine Sovereigns Most High**, the **Ten-Directional Saints**, the **Five Stars and Six Luminaries**, the **Three Realms’ Mighty Spirits**.

I have heard that **Heaven’s yang and Earth’s yin**, in union, form the pattern;
the **moon’s fullness and the sun’s decline**, in alternation, regulate the times.

chunks.original_text: 分五纬以专司，行周天而有度。 或重轮表瑞，或聚舍发祥，或为至德之符，上广无私之照。 依躔顺轨，灼为治象之光； 变色作灾，昭示机微之朕。 休戚上关於邦政，□祥亦系於民生。 某有命在天，交食乎地。 六合而视己，何啻蟭螟； 均一以禀形，忍同草木。 粗知为善之最乐，终以寡过而未能。 神历其盈，会交此而赐罚； 帝临有赫，因迷复以降灾。 尚通解谢之门，俾迪亨嘉之运。 爰凭道范，肃敞星坛，腾精悃於钧天，降光灵於玄象。 臣今关奏，敢不上闻。 宣词，亚献。 谛详词语，灼见钦崇。 太上巍巍，荷俯临於法席，，众真济济，咸拱侍於虚皇。 谅昭鉴於悃悰，必加怜於恳请。 伏愿正璇玑於玉斗，抚经纬於天图，消五行｛裳败之灾，解三命凶危之数，增长补短，去危即安，克膺耆艾之年，永息灾凶之运。 臣等不任祈恳之至，酒陈终献。 散花。 臣谨虔诚上启，虚元上圣，九曜尊星。 臣闻垂象上穹，照临下土。 金木水火，假休王以立功； 春夏秋冬，任推迁而成岁。 以康家国，以福生灵，大哉神休，光赞天地。 尚虑分野之内，有钩己凌犯之期； 躔次之中，有迟伏留逆之数。 大则灾缠郡邑，为兵水旱蝗！ 少则祸及行年，为凶哀疾厄。 兢兢忧惧，冰炭在怀，深恐履行多违，操守乖，六情积咎，三业成非。 既积罪尤，更逢厄会，善功难着，恶作易兴，非托醮祈，无由洗涤。 是敢肃恭香火，精备醮筵，仰紫府以冥心，望丹霄而稽首，尽投素悃，罄露凡情。 伏乞众圣哀怜，列星悯护，降以真，陶以太和，照以灵光，沐以神泽，流恩降福，解厄消灾，和顺五星，均明四景，无凌犯之变，无薄蚀之虞，万象成宁，百谷时稔，五兵戢息，四序调平，君圣臣忠，人安物泰。 某或行运之内，宫宿之中，使灾不横生，妖无妄作。 一十二宫之分，各保休祥； 二十八舍之问，永无氛沙。 六星南纪，司命增延寿之文； 九府北元，太尊锡长生之简。 三光齐景，万善咸臻。 若醮官某有过咎灾厄，在太阳荧惑二宫者，请以赤帝真文为解禳之； 有过咎灾厄，在太阴辰星神首神尾四宫者，请以黑帝真文为解禳之； 有过咎灾厄，在岁星宫者，请以青帝真文为解禳之； 有过咎灾厄，在太白星宫者，请以白帝真文为解禳之； 有过咎灾厄，在镇星诸曜星官者，请以黄帝真文为解禳之。 即使众厄自消，千灾自殄，神安礼豫，益算延龄，福禄惟新，凶衰不作，眷属亨泰，公私利宜，门宇兴隆，云为黛叶，蒙如所请，永荷洪恩。 臣等无任禳谢之至，诚惶诚恐，稽首再拜，献汤。 祝真文，宣疏 臣谨重诚上启，九清上圣，三宝真灵，乾象列星，坤仪主宰。 今则礼成清夜，词达昊穹。 金阙真游，驻属车於尘世； 璇霄上象，迂法从於星坛。 心方切於钦承，仪已临於夤饯。 情不随於文祝，愿效进修； 凡自与於仙违，徒深依恋。 冀垂肆赦，允纳虔祈，恍真卫以言旋，睇清光而顺拜。 臣等不任攀恋之至，奉辞仙驾。 发愿。 复炉。 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来设醮之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 送圣，焚燎。

The **Five Celestial Stems** divide their duties with strict governance,
and traverse the **Circumference of Heaven** with measured steps.
Sometimes they manifest as **revolving wheels** of auspicious signs,
sometimes they cluster in **stellar mansions** where destinies arise,
sometimes they serve as **symbols of the highest virtue**,
and **illuminate the boundless compassion** of the **Way**.

Following their **lunar stations** and **celestial tracks**,
they **burn brightly** as the **radiant symbols of governance**;
when their **colors change**, they **foreshadow calamities**,
and **reveal the subtle omens** of fate.
Their **auspicious and inauspicious portents** are deeply tied to the **state’s affairs**,
and **celestial anomalies** likewise affect the **people’s lives**.

I have been granted **life by Heaven**,
yet **eclipses occur upon Earth**.
If the **Six Directions** regard me with scrutiny,
how much less than a **locust plague** am I?
If the **Five Agents** measure me for form,
how can I endure like **grass and trees**?

I **coarsely** know that **doing good** is the **greatest joy**,
yet I **fail to cease my faults** and cannot achieve it.
When the **Divine Calendar** reaches its fullness,
and the **eclipses converge** in their **awarding of punishments**,
the **Heavenly Sovereign** descends with **wrathful splendor**,
and **confusion brings forth disasters** once more.

I still **aspire to the path of enlightenment**,
to **attain the blessings** of the **Way’s guidance**.
Thus I **revere the Dao’s principles**,
and **solemnly open the Star Altar**,
sending my **refined essence** to the **Pivot of Heaven**,
and **invoking the luminous Spirits** of the **Dark Symbols**.

I now **submit my petition**,
daring not to **fail in reporting it upward**.

**Proclaim the words**, then **offer the secondary libation**.
**Carefully examine** the **prayer’s language**,
and **clearly see** the **veneration and reverence**.
The **Supreme Most High** stands **perched in majesty**,
and **graciously descends** to the **Dharma seat**,
while the **True Ones** gather in **abundant splendor**,
all **respectfully attending** the **Empty Sovereign**.

I trust that **Heaven’s discerning gaze** will **illuminate my sincere devotion**,
and that **certainly** the **Saints** will **take pity** on my **earnest supplication**.

May I **rectify the Celestial Pivot** in the **Jade Dipper**,
and **smooth the Celestial Loom** in the **Heavenly Chart**,
to **dispel the Five Agents’ calamities**,
and **break the Three Fates’ malevolent decrees**,
to **lengthen and supplement** what is lacking,
and **remove dangers** to achieve **tranquility**,
so that I may **attain the years of the wise and aged**,
and **forever cease** the **disasters of calamity**.

I and my companions,
with **uttermost devotion** in our **supplications**,
**present the final libation**.

**Scatter flowers**.

I **sincerely and reverently** submit:
The **Empty Origin’s True Saints**,
the **Nine Manifestations of Auspicious Stars**.

I have heard that **celestial symbols descend from the vault**,
and **illuminate the lands below**.
**Gold, Wood, Water, and Fire**,
**borrow the Agents’ auspiciousness** to **establish merit**;
**Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter**,
**fulfill their cycles** to **complete the year**.

To **benefit the family and the state**,
and **bless all living beings**,
how **great** is the **Divine Auspiciousness**,
**praised throughout Heaven and Earth**!

Yet I **fear** that within my **allotted domain**,
there may be a **time when I am harmed by hooks**;
and in the **sequence of stations**,
there may be **delays, detentions, or rebellious omens**.

The **greater disasters** may **ensnare the districts**,
bringing **wars, floods, droughts, and locust plagues**!
The **lesser calamities** may **afflict my years**,
bringing **misfortune, grief, sickness, and adversity**.

With **constant vigilance and dread**,
like **ice and fire** in my heart,
I deeply fear that **my actions may often stray**,
and **my conduct may deviate from the Dao**,
that **the Six Passions** accumulate **guilt**,
and **the Three Karma** lead to **transgressions**.

Having **amassed many crimes**,
and **further encountering inauspicious conjunctions**,
good deeds **fail to take root**,
while **evil actions readily arise**—
without **rites of expiation and supplication**,
there is **no way to purify** them.

Thus I **dare to solemnly kindle incense and fire**,
and **meticulously prepare the expiatory feast**,
**looking upward** to the **Purple Bureau** with **devoted heart**,
and **gazing toward the Vermilion Celestial Realm** with **prostration**.

I **utterly devote** my **sincere essence**,
and **fully reveal** my **mundane emotions**.

I **humbly beg** the **Saints’ compassion**,
that the **stars** may **take pity and protect**,
and **bestow true virtue**,
**mold me with Supreme Harmony**,
**illuminate me with luminous light**,
and **bathe me in divine grace**,
so that **blessings flow and descend**,
**disasters are resolved and calamities dispelled**,
the **Five Stars** are **harmonized and bright**,
and the **Four Seasons** are **balanced and clear**,
with **no rebellious eclipses**,
and **no partial obscurations**,
all **manifestations** achieving **serenity**,
and **all grains** ripening **in due time**,
the **Five Calamities** **ceasing their ravages**,
and the **Four Seasons** **restored to order**,
the **Sage-Ruler** **virtuous**, the **loyal minister** **steadfast**,
the **people at peace**, and **all things flourishing**.

Even if I **reside within the Twelve Lunar Mansions**,
or **among the Celestial Hosts**,
may **disasters not arise unchecked**,
and **evil spirits not act wantonly**.

The **twelve divisions of the Celestial Mansions**,
each **preserving their own auspicious signs**;
the **twenty-eight constellations**,
**forever free** from **harmful vapors**.

The **Six Stars** in the **Southern Memorandum**,
**extend life** through the **Scriptures of the Lord of Destiny**;
the **Nine Palaces** in the **Northern Origin**,
**grant longevity** through the **Tablets of the Supreme Sovereign**.

The **Three Luminaries** **align in brightness**,
and **all good things** **come to pass**.

If **disasters and calamities** **befall** me,
and I **reside in the mansions of the Great Sun or the Wandering Star**,
I **request the True Scriptures of the Red Sovereign** for **atonement**.
If **disasters and calamities** **befall** me,
and I **reside in the mansions of the Great Moon, Chen Star, God’s Head, or God’s Tail**,
I **request the True Scriptures of the Black Sovereign** for **atonement**.
If **disasters and calamities** **befall** me,
and I **reside in the mansion of the Year Star**,
I **request the True Scriptures of the Green Sovereign** for **atonement**.
If **disasters and calamities** **befall** me,
and I **reside in the mansion of the Great White Star**,
I **request the True Scriptures of the White Sovereign** for **atonement**.
If **disasters and calamities** **befall** me,
and I **reside in the mansions of the Stationary Star or other luminaries**,
I **request the True Scriptures of the Yellow Sovereign** for **atonement**.

Even if **all calamities vanish**,
and **thousandfold disasters cease**,
may **the Spirits be tranquil** and **rites harmonious**,
**fortune and longevity** **ever increase**,
**blessings and wealth** **ever renew**,
**misfortune and decline** **never arise**,
my **kin** **prospering in peace**,
and **public and private affairs** **thriving as desired**,
my **household flourishing**,
like **dark green leaves** upon the **roof**,
and **dew** descending as **I pray**—
forever **receiving the vast mercies**.

I and my companions,
with **uttermost devotion** in our **supplications**,
**sincerely and reverently** present **the final libation**.

**Invoke the True Scriptures**, and **proclaim the incantation**.

I **earnestly and sincerely** submit:
The **Nine Purity’s True Saints**,
the **Three Treasures’ True Spirits**,
the **Celestial Symbols’ arrayed stars**,
and the **Earthly Pattern’s principal deities**.

Now the **rites are complete** in the **pure night**,
and the **words ascend** to the **vast vault**.
The **Golden Gate’s True Procession**,
**dwells in the dusty world** with **attendants’ carriages**;
the **Jade Celestial Symbols**,
**follow the Dao** through the **Star Altar**.

My **heart** is **devoted** to **reverent acceptance**,
and my **conduct** is **already aligned** with **respectful farewell**.
My **devotion** does not **follow the words of the incantation**,
but **seeks to emulate** the **path of cultivation**;
my **mundane self** **longs to join** the **Celestial Dao**,
yet **remains deeply attached** in vain.

I **hope for** a **grant of universal amnesty**,
and **that my sincere supplications** will **be fully accepted**,
as the **True Guards** **revolve with words**,
and I **behold the Pure Light** in **orderly homage**.

I and my companions,
with **uttermost devotion** in our **supplications**,
**present the words** to the **Celestial Procession**.

**Express my vows**. **Reignite the incense**.

**Incense Officials, Messenger Officials, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Generals, and the Attending Spirits**,
you must **command** that the **place where I have set up the rites**,
**naturally produce** the **Golden Elixir and Azure Jade**,
**mushrooms and spirits of a hundred kinds**,
and that the **True Ones** **converge** here at the **incense and fire altar**.

May I **vow** that the **Ten-Directional Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens**,
will **attend** the **Orchid Smoke**,
and **transmit my sincere petitions** directly to the **Supreme Ultimate’s Great Dao**,
and **before the Jade Emperor’s Heavenly Sovereign’s Court**.

**Send the Saints forth**, and **burn the effigy**.

**The humble officials** [names],

The **Nine Sovereigns Most High**, the **Ten-Directional Saints**, the **Five Stars and Six Luminaries**, the **Three Realms’ Mighty Spirits**.

**The Complete Canon of Daoist Rituals, Volume 47 complete**
**The Complete Canon of Daoist Rituals, Volume 48**
*Compiled and Revised by Master Guangting Du of Guangcheng*
**Ritual for Invoking the Stars: The Grand Petition Ceremony**

**At the quiet night of the ascension to the platform, perform the rites in proper order.**

**With utmost reverence, address the Eleven Great Luminaries of the Celestial Orbs;**
**the Twelve Constellation Deities, my natal star’s Great Saint, the Black Talisman Star True Lord, and all assembled Saints.**
**Humbly, we beseech Your Sacred Benevolence to condescend to our mortal plea.**

**Now, with sincerity, we offer our devotion.**
**Let the pure *qi* ascend as Heaven, arraying the likenesses of the sun, moon, and stars;**
**let the turbid *qi* descend as Earth, arranging the forms of male and female, beasts and birds.**
**When the sun and moon are eclipsed, the world knows no peace;**
**when men and women clash, the lofty vault of Heaven is imperiled.**
**Human fortunes and misfortunes are bound to the stars.**
**Without ritual invocation, how could we ascend to Heaven’s ear?**

**My misfortune star is in motion, and calamities press near.**
**With utmost sincerity, I implore the radiance of the Celestial Pivot,**
**and with reverent devotion, I knock upon the luminaries of the Mysterious Yellow.**
**With a heart in darkness, I prostrate myself,**
**moved by Heaven’s merciful love for the common folk;**
**with incense and talismans ascending to the skies,**
**I pray that the Emperor’s virtue may dissolve my afflictions.**

**May my misfortunes be dispelled, and my blessings and longevity flourish—**
**for Heaven’s aid is upon me, and virtue spreads far.**
**Yet my humble prayers are insufficient.**

**Next, summon the ritual officials in order to proceed with incense offerings and star invocation.**

**The Solar Palace:**
**With utmost reverence, address the Solar Palace’s Emperor of the Sun, and the celestial assembly beneath.**
**Humbly, the radiant Sun, sovereign of the Solar Palace,**
**holds dominion over all celestial forms,**
**governing the life-giving light that illuminates the myriad beings.**
**It shapes the spirit and body, commands yin and yang,**
**and the Vermilion Bird’s ceaseless day-and-night patrol,**
**while the Azure Emperor oversees virtue and vice.**
**Each time it fulfills its celestial course,**
**all things thrive and prosper.**
**Now, with incense and lamps prepared, we extend our utmost reverence.**

**May Your radiance illuminate and discern my decline,**
**strengthen my fate’s calculations,**
**and expand my blessings and fortune.**
**I vow with sincere devotion to endure Your boundless grace,**
**and now present my petition for Your proclamation.**

**Next, recite the talisman incantation:**

**Incantation of the True Lord of the Sun:**
*"Eastward, I gaze upon the Fuxiang Palace,*
*prostrating before the radiant court.*
*The Sun’s luminous brilliance—*
*vast and boundless, what thoughts does it hold?*
*Let me kneel in gold, awaiting Heaven’s noble form.*
*The Imperial Flower’s maidens descend,*
*now before the hall’s threshold."*

**The Lunar Palace:**
**With utmost reverence, address the Lunar Palace’s Sovereign of the Dark, and the attending celestial assembly.**
**Humbly, the Most Holy Purple Light of the Lunar Palace,**
**who governs the Northern Celestial Pole’s Yin Pass,**
**oversees the right *po* (ethereal soul) of humankind,**
**and wanders without rest, shining without end.**
**Its light divides short and long, revealing virtue and vice,**
**its movements and stillness arise from measured deliberation,**
**its expansion and contraction follow the cardinal directions,**
**and it brings forth fortune and misfortune—now full, now void,**
**bestowing calamity and blessing without error.**

**Now, with sincere prayers, I beseech Your discernment,**
**following the True Talisman of the Most High,**
**to pardon the sins of living beings,**
**that this ritual master may attain blessings as boundless as the sea,**
**longevity like the ancient pines,**
**no generation of misfortune,**
**and peace for high and low.**
**I vow with humble sincerity, unworthy as I am,**
**and now present my petition for Your proclamation.**

**Next, recite the talisman incantation:**

**Incantation of the True Lord of the Dark:**

**Gazing upward to the Eight Directions,**
**I see the Moon cradling the essence of Yin.**
**Within it dwells the Great Celestial Sovereign,**
**The Lady riding in a green palanquin.**

**Her radiant splendor shines upon the Two Poles,**
**Her mingled light illuminates the Three Pure Ones.**
**With earnest devotion, I seek the Dao of fulfillment,**
**And the Five Colors descend to greet me.**

**To the Star of Wood:**
**With humble reverence, I address the Star of Wood, the True Lord of Resplendent Virtue,**
**Attended by celestial retinues.**

**I submit that the Year Star in the Eastern Pole’s palace,**
**Gathers noble brilliance in Qingyang,**
**Known as the Wood Virtue governing the quadrant,**
**It discerns virtue and vice in human affairs,**
**And reveals fortune and misfortune in the celestial omens.**
**The Three Black [stars] mark the first season of Spring,**
**When auspicious radiance descends upon the Ten Directions,**
**Enriching calculations and extending years,**
**Prolonging blessings and nurturing fortune.**

**Now, with sincere prayers, I beseech Your discernment,**
**Following the True Talisman of the Most High,**
**To pardon the sins of living beings,**
**That this ritual master may attain blessings as boundless as the sea,**
**Longevity like the span of Heaven and Earth,**
**No generation of misfortune,**
**And peace for high and low.**
**I vow with humble sincerity, unworthy as I am,**
**And now present my petition for Your proclamation.**

**Incantation of the True Lord of Wood Virtue:**

The Year Star rides the Wood Virtue,

Ascending to the heavens, its luster nourishes and glistens,
Its true hue gazes upon the Celestial Sovereign.
Its brilliance echoes in grand harmonious song,
Its waters cascade in the chant of the Hall of Zhi.
Through time, I frequently invoke and pray,

**Its flames dance along the Three Edges.**
**Its pure brilliance aligns with the Black [stars],**
**Its talismans gleam with martial authority.**
**It dispatches swift retribution to extinguish malevolence,**
**And dares to confront comets that obstruct its path.**

**To the Star of Metal:**
**With humble reverence, I address the Metal Star, the True Lord of Celestial Brilliance,**
**Attended by celestial retinues.**

**I submit that its subtle yet mighty influence governs the quadrant,**
**Mastering the creation of the Golden Gate.**
**Tai Bai presides over destiny,**
**Holding the essence of Hu-Su’s spiritual treasury.**
**It rules the autumnal dews,**
**And its virtue aligns with the Western Direction.**
**Great is the Dao of the Supreme Path,**
**Difficult to fully reveal.**

**Its light bestows upon mortals hidden wealth and prosperity,**
**And when it enters the courtyard, official rank and merit are perfected.**
**Gazing upon it extends longevity and blessings,**
**Invoking it dispels calamities and disasters.**

**Following the True Talisman of the Most High,**

**Incantation of the True Lord of Metal Virtue:**

---
**Tai Bai ascends the Pure Celestial Han,**
**Its vaporous brilliance radiates like the White Spirit.**
**It floats resplendent in the hues of auspicious clouds,**
**And shines luminous with the glory of Changsheng.**
**Its sharp edge repels invaders,**
**Its polished hue brings peace to armies.**
**Its talismans probe the depths of fate,**
**Its Dao unites with eternal life.**

**To the Star of Water:**
**With humble reverence, I address the Water Star, the True Lord of Observing the Hour,**
**Attended by celestial retinues.**

**I submit that among the Five Phases, Water Virtue is paramount.**
**It rules the Black [stars] of Winter,**
**And governs the rivers and seas.**
**Its nature is gentle, its disposition benevolent,**
**Its nourishment sustains all life.**
**When it aligns with the Moon, official rank and merit are extraordinary,**
**And its true radiance secures lasting longevity and fortune.**

**With reverence, I accept Your sacred blessings,**
**Achieving peace and fulfillment,**
**Never failing in my devout and sincere heart.**
**Yet I am ever guilty of folly and delusion.**

With a devout heart, I seek manifold blessings,

Your influence descends upon the lowly,

In wrath, You shatter mountains and peaks,
Your authority dims the vast heavens.
Dragons and serpents breed strange forms,
Transformations arise with sudden darkness.
The host attains long life and joy,
Averting calamities through reverence and sincerity.

The most exalted and noble among them,
The **Great Saint of *Tiānyī***—most sublime and spiritually potent.

Your splendor is immeasurable,

Your essence radiates through the **Purple Enclosure**.
In harmony with the **yin-yang** cycles and movements,
You conceal and reveal the mysteries of life and spirit.

The **Nine Soils** revere Your celestial authority.
