**Incantation of the *Tàiyī* Star:**

With reverence, I address the **True Lord of the *Tàiyī* Moon and Comet Stars**, attended by celestial retinues.
I acknowledge that the **Moon and Comet** are the most sacred,
The stars of dark radiance.
Your nature is most august and awe-inspiring,
Your presence marked by majestic and formidable winds.

All blessings and misfortunes arise from Your grasp,
The length of life determined by Your decree.
When You deign to illuminate,
No one dares to resist or refuse Your grace.

Now, with this sincere offering of *dan*[†] prayers,
I humbly beseech Your inspection and discernment,
To follow the True Symbols of the **Celestial Sage**,
To pardon the sins of all living beings,
So that the host of this ritual may attain blessings as boundless as the seas,
A lifespan as enduring as the **Sōng-zhuāng**[‡] pillars,
No calamities arising,
Superiors and inferiors alike in peace and well-being,
To heed the earnestness of the lowly,
And not betray the divine favor.
All invocations are now respectfully proclaimed.

**Next, the Incantation of the Moon and Comet Stars:**

The **Great Yin** shines with the **Jade Belt**,
Its essence nurtures all plants and growth.
The **Green Cassia and Yellow Flower**[§§] assist,
The **Luo[*] Star** preserves the **innate spirit**.
Its **hair-like head** divides strange forms,
Its **comet tail** sometimes hides within the constellations.
When You bestow blessings and misfortunes,
The ritual host seeks purification through incense and fasting.

---

**Incantation of the *Hēifú* Star:**

With reverence, I address the **True Lord of the Great Saint *Hēifú* Star**.
I acknowledge that You are the **celestial executioner**[||],
The star of dire influence in human affairs,
Raising the banner early and moving unseen through the heavens,
Illuminating the innocent yet bringing calamities in both stillness and motion.
When fate encounters You,
Hardships and dangers are certain to follow.

Now, with this sincere offering of *dan*[†] prayers,
I humbly beseech Your inspection and discernment,
To follow the True Symbols of the **Celestial Sage**,
To pardon the sins of all living beings,
So that the host of this ritual may attain blessings as vast as the great seas,
A lifespan as enduring as the **Heaven and Earth**,
No calamities arising,
Superiors and inferiors alike in peace and well-being,
To heed the earnestness of the lowly,
And not betray the divine favor.
All invocations are now respectfully proclaimed.

---

**Incantation of the *Tiāngāng* and Native Command Star:**

With reverence, I address the **Native Command Star**.
I acknowledge that You are the **Star Constellation of Birth and Life**,
The one who governs the descent of a mortal’s fate;
The **Native Command Star**, the **Native Hour Star**,
Who presides over the life and death of all beings.
The **Five Elements** are all under Your dominion,
The **Three Calamities**[¶¶] rely upon Your judgment.

When You are invoked to grant deliverance,
May all be preserved with enduring longevity.

Now, with this sincere offering of *dan*[†] prayers,
I humbly beseech Your inspection and discernment,
To honor the **Celestial Sage’s True Doctrine**,
And universally pardon the sins of all living beings,
So that the host of this ritual may attain blessings as boundless as the seas,
A lifespan as enduring as the **Sōng-zhuāng**[‡] pillars,
No calamities arising,
Superiors and inferiors alike in peace and well-being,
To heed the earnestness of the lowly,
And not betray the divine favor.
All invocations are now respectfully proclaimed.

**Next, the Incantation of the Native Command Star:**

The Native Command Star’s majesty is resplendent,
Its Native Hour Star stands in the **Leopard Mansion**.
The **Three Primordial Cycles**[&&] divide its ranks and stations,
The **Sixty Guardians**[****] attend to its movements.
Celestial officials are transformed into divine beings,
True officers govern their functions.
Among all mortals, none are noble or lowly—
From beginning to end, they rely upon Your boundless embrace.

**Exposition:**
The rituals of star worship, as performed in the past,
Have now achieved complete fulfillment.

**Dedication and Invocation:**

With solemn reverence, we now present offerings to the Eleven Great Luminaries, the Black Talisman of Great Sagehood, the Native Command Star of Japan, and the Star of Annual Fortune and Calamity.

May the Auspicious Star ever shine its blessings,
Its radiance concealed yet potent,
Transforming misfortune into fortune,
Turning disaster into blessing.

To the twelve divisions of the Zodiac,
Bestow your pure omens;
To the twenty-eight lunar mansions,
Ever bestow your sacred light and grace.

May my personal mansion remain pure and serene,
My movements and dwellings secure and tranquil.
With this vow, I pledge this life to eternal reliance upon the Great Constructor.

With devout heart, I invoke the Great Sage of Wisdom and Longevity,
Whose inconceivable virtues and merits are beyond measure.

---
**Volume Forty-Eight of the Complete Daoist Ritual Canon**
**Volume Forty-Nine of the Complete Daoist Ritual Canon**
*Edited by Master Guangting Du, South-North Double Dipper Altar for Longevity Rituals*

**Opening the Altar and Conducting the Dao**

The ritual proceedings commence as prescribed.
Each officiant maintains proper reverence in accordance with the rites.

**Invocation of the Guardian Spirits:**

The Five Stars shine in orderly array,
Illuminating the Five Directions.
Mercury repels calamity,
Wood’s virtue brings prosperity.
Mars dissipates misfortune,
Jupiter wards off warfare.
The Star of Stability governs with firmness,
Bringing benefit to family and state.
Names inscribed upon jade tablets,
Words recorded in the Celestial Registry.
Riding the clouds, they scatter their radiance,
Soaring through the void of ten thousand directions.
Entering and exiting the unseen,
Feasting in all realms.
Five clouds float as canopies,
Summoning spirits and controlling winds.
Commanding all spirits,
Protecting the Daoist Sage,
In harmony with the Dao and the True.

The Law-Drum is struck twenty-four times.

To the Most High Three Celestial Sovereigns of Primordial Beginning—
The Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Laozi—
We summon forth from within my body the Three Five Officials of Destiny,
Left and Right Attendants, Official Messengers,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers, Dragon-Courier Clerks,
Attendant Gold Boys, Flower-Dispersing Jade Maidens,
The Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans,
Direct Day Incense Officials—
A total of thirty-six officials.

Those who emerge are attired in solemn, resplendent robes,
Their headgear adorned with trailing ribbons.
The gates of the Mysterious Altar are opened,
Inviting the local deities and territorial spirits.

I, your humble servant, now conduct this ritual with sincere devotion,
Offering this as my heart’s intent.
May all who are earnestly sincere be recorded in the Celestial Hearings.
I pray that the Most High Ten-Directional True Dao of Black Soul,
The Sacred Treasure of Radiant Light, descend upon me,
Flowing into my body,
So that my petition may swiftly reach the Most High, the Supreme Ultimate Dao,
Before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault.

**Proclamation of Rank:**

Your humble servant [Name], along with all assembled here,
Now properly incense-offering,
With these merits, we dedicate on behalf of:
The Son of Heaven, kings and princes,
All ministers and officials,
Sages of scripture and ritual,
Mountain-dwelling hermits,
Seekers of the Dao,
Scholars of the Caverns,
Nine kinds of kin and relatives,
All under heaven,
Flying, walking, and growing beings,
All sentient life—
That they may return their bodies, their spirits, and their allegiance
To the Most High Ten-Directional Sacred Treasure,
The Natural, True, Supreme Dao.

I humbly beseech the Most High to grant absolution
To my ritual assembly and to the household of the Ritual Master,
For all sins of past and present lives,
Freeing us from the Three Calamities and Eight Hardships,
From all evil influences,
So that wisdom may be clear and radiant,
And our spirits steadfast and pure.
To depart from the path of delusion,
To ascend to the gate of supreme mystery,
Attaining the Dao’s True Essence,
Soaring through the void,
Ascending to Heaven in broad daylight,
Serving the Dao Lord in the Natural Jade Palace of Seven Treasures,
Forever united with the Dao.
My petition is now conveyed,
Directly before the Supreme Ultimate Dao.

**Ritual Homage to the Ten Directions, Confession of Sins.**

**Reproclamation of Rank:**

Your humble servant [Name], along with all assembled here,
With utmost sincerity, we now invoke:
The Primordial Heavenly Sovereign of Natural Void,
The Most High Dao Lord,
The Most High Laozi,
The Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault,
The Nine Celestial Sovereigns,
The Ten-Directional Perfected Saints,
All True Ones and Noble Lords,
The Thirty-Six Departments of Sacred Scriptures,
The Grand Masters of Mysterious Symbols,
The Celestial Canopy, Sun, Moon, and Stars,
The Northern Dipper Emperor,
The Seven Celestial Ministers,
The Southern Polar Emperor,
The Lord Marshal,
The Six Celestial Ministers,
The Native Command Star,
The Cavern-Heavens and Ocean-Mountains,
The Officials of the Three Realms,
All True Spirits.

We humbly hear that the Dao is formless,
Yet its profound essence is sought by all.
When the True descended into the world,
The path of guidance was gradually revealed.
The Sage was summoned by the Celestial Master,
And the True Form manifested in Shu.
Where the Dragon Chariot passed,
The Jade Array preceded.
First expounding the Northern Dipper’s scriptures,
Then elucidating the Southern March’s teachings.
The Dao governs life and death,
Its officials overseeing the transformations of water and fire.
To those who understand the principle of separation,
They are the officials of Yang’s movement—
Ever still, yet never changing.
To those who master the principle of the Abyss,
They embody the One’s number—
Operating secretly without fixed form.

Thus, the mysteries of the scriptures’ opening
Reveal the essence of fixed contemplation.
If sentient beings hold fast to this with unwavering devotion,
Like the two poles adorned with celestial patterns,
They will not be swayed by external things,
Holding the Dao’s pivot to transform all.
Ascending to the rank of Spirit Sovereign,
Their wisdom illuminates, their spirits complete.
Thus, their hearing, speech, and actions are regulated,
And longevity and well-being are fully attained.

How much more so when the Sage points to the image and expounds the teachings,
Guiding them toward the Dao and turning their hearts.
If they fail to awaken to the Mysterious Words,
How could they transcend calamity and obstruction?
They must revere virtue and goodness,
Gradually attaining peace and prosperity.

I, your servant, have confined my physical form to the duality of question and answer,
Inheriting the spirit from the One.
I recognize the principles of health preservation,
Discerning the mechanisms of illness and misfortune.
Fortunate am I that the True Talisman has opened the gate of repentance,
So that the path of delusion may be illuminated.
I now properly initiate the Purple Altar Ritual,
Extending the Mysterious Symbols to their utmost,
Confronting the radiant spirits,
Welcoming the blessings of virtue.

I dare not fail to report this.
**The Petition is Complete.**

**The Complete Canon of Daoist Rituals, Volume Forty-Nine Complete**
**The Complete Canon of Daoist Rituals, Volume Fifty**
*Edited by Master Guangting Du of the Broad Achievement*
**The Unified Ritual of the Northern and Southern Dipper Constellations**

At dawn, the ritual is performed as prescribed.
The assembled officials observe the Master’s intent in accordance with the Dao.

The **Sacred Guardians’ Incantations** are proclaimed:
The **Azure Yang Void** shines forth, its radiance reviving the numinous.
The **Divine Tiger** repels malevolence, the **Flying Celestial** tolls its bells.
The wicked are crushed, demons bound—ten thousand spirits submit.
The **Nine Mysteries** return to the Dao, the **Eight Awe-Inspiring Powers** gather essence.
A thousand True Ones are summoned, the **Three Primordials** purge the impure.
The Left **summons the Central Yellow**, the Right **deploys the Six Ding**.
Seven rotations, eight harmonies—revolving through the Celestial Scriptures.
The **Sacred Transformation** stands majestic, the **Great Dao** now unfolds.
Auspicious clouds disperse, merging with the **Yellow Court**—harmony with the Dao’s True Essence.

The **Supreme Law Drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

We invoke:
The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Beginning** [三清],
The **Most High Dao Lord** [太上道君],
The **Most High Laozi** [太上老君],
To summon forth from my body:
The **five deceased officials of the Five Departments** [五功曹],
The **Left and Right Official Messengers** [左右官使者],

chunks.original_text: 精降为魄，用以守形； 神凝为魂，因以聚。 群生所系，两极攸司。 功寔济於生灵，德普资於动用。 自二仪既判之后，为众品受命之根。 天阳地阴，二感应以相与； 群分类聚，万物曲成而不违。 成资陶冶之能，以遂器形之化，增禄俸於士庶，注爵秩於人天，延促年龄，去留灾福，凡处生成之域，难逃予夺之权。 醮主某久慕仙宗，未超浊境，荷高穹之覆冒，沐斗极之照临。 处己治身，岂适中庸之道； 待人接物，第深过举之忧。 进无众善之修，退有后时之悔。 意欲导迎景贶，扫去不祥。 是敢奉灵宝之彝仪，展河图之明训，合醮乎南北二斗，遍仰乎天地众真，谢过祈恩，禳灾恳福。 臣获参玄奥，备列真司，瞻参横斗转之余，致晋接寅恭之始。 既承词悃，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，丹诚恳切。 爰赖神明之来相，肆令敔谷之攸宜。 作善降祥，效商书之明训； 遇灾而惧，闻周雅之格言。 兹既露於丹衷，冀俯回於洪造，常使淳风溥扇，惠泽滂流，付醮主之精衷，明天尊之至德。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三尊，十方众圣。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是捻香功德，上祝皇帝陛下。 伏冀睿图隆永，圣寿遐延。 握金镜以低临，万方昭泰； 俨珠旒而端穆，八海澄清。 朝有忠良，俗臻富寿。 储皇妃后，协赞昌期。 公主诸王，保宁休运。 火鼠烛龙之外，琛赆争驰； 虞泉蒙谷之乡，车书混一。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Essence** descends to become the **vital spark** [精], to guard the form;
The **Spirit** condenses into the **soul** [神], to gather and sustain life [因以聚**生**].
All living beings depend upon them—
The **Two Poles** govern them in turn.

Their **virtue/power** benefits all sentient life,
Their **virtue/power** endows all movement and function.
Since the **Two Principles** [二仪] were divided,
They became the root from which all beings receive their fate.

**Heaven’s Yang** and **Earth’s Yin**—
The **Two Principles** respond and interact;
All classes gather in their kinds,
And the myriad things take form without deviation.

They shape the **transformative capacity** of **molding and refining** [成资陶冶],
To complete the **transformation of form** [遂器形之化],
Increasing the **rank and stipends** of scholars and commoners,
Bestowing **titles and orders** upon humans and celestial beings,
Extending or shortening lifespans,
Bringing or removing calamities and blessings.
Wherever life takes form,
None can escape their **granting or withholding**.

This **Ritual Master** [醮主] has long revered the **Daoist lineage**,
Yet has not yet transcended the **profane realm**.
Under the **lofty vault’s** shelter,
Beneath the **Dippers’ luminous governance**,
I govern myself—
How could I merely follow the **Middle Way**?
In dealing with others—
I fear only the **weight of excessive virtue**.

Advancing, I lack the **accumulation of merit**;
Retreating, I bear the **regret of later times**.
I wish to **invite blessings** and **sweep away misfortune**.

Thus, I dare to present the **Sacred Jewel’s ritual rites** [灵宝之彝仪],
To unfold the **clarity of the River Diagram** [河图之明训],
And join the **Ritual of the Two Dippers** [合醮乎南北二斗],
To reverently address the **Heavenly and Earthly Spirits** [遍仰乎天地众真],
To confess faults and pray for grace,
To **appease calamities** and **implore blessings**.

I have been granted access to **mystic profundities**,
And stand among the **True Officials**.
Gazing upon the **residual radiance of the Cross-Dipper’s rotation**,
I now present my **reverent submission at the beginning of the **Tian** hour**.

Having received this sincere petition,
I dare not fail to report it.
**Proclamation:** As the words state,
The **sincerity is profound and earnest**.

Thus, I rely upon the **Divine’s coming aid**,
To implement the **proper rituals of the **Zuo Valley** [敔谷之攸宜].

When **good deeds are done**, blessings descend—
As in the **clarity of Shang’s scriptures** [效商书之明训];
When **calamity strikes**, one fears—
As in the **precepts of Zhou’s music** [闻周雅之格言].

Now that this **sincere intent** has been revealed,
I hope for **Heaven’s compassionate response**,
That **pure winds may spread far**,
And **blessings flow abundantly**,
Committed to the **Ritual Master’s devotion**,
Illuminating the **Heavenly Sovereign’s supreme virtue**.

On this **clear morning**, the **Dao** is performed.
I request that the **assembly of **Law** bearers** light the **first incense strand**,
That this **incense smoke** may ascend directly to the heavens,
To **venerate the Three Supreme Ones** [太上三尊],
And the **Ten Directions’ Holy Saints** [十方众圣].

I and my followers **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate**,
With this **incense-offering’s merit**,
To pray for the **Emperor’s longevity and prosperity**.
May the **Divine Plan endure eternally**,
And the **Sage’s life extend far**.

With the **Golden Mirror** held low,
All lands shall shine with prosperity;
With the **Jade Tassels** held in solemn dignity,
The **Eight Seas** shall be serene.

Let **loyal ministers** serve in the morning,
And the people attain **wealth and longevity**.
Let the **Empress and Consorts** be reserved,
To **assist in the auspicious period**.

Let the **Princesses and Princes** be secure,
And the **state’s fortunes rest in peace**.
Beyond the **Fire Rat and Dragon’s torch**,
Let **treasures and tributes** rush to come;
In the **lands of Yu’s springs and Meng’s valleys**,
Let **wagons and documents** flow as one.

chunks.original_text: 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无为，和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上尊经，十方众圣。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流弟子某家，九世七玄，亿曾万祖，亲绿眷属，往逝神仪。 伏冀乘紫箓之玄功，上朱陵之仙界。 阳光莹质，流火炼形，黑简落名，青宫注籍。 逍遥真境，永祛流注之殃； 利佑见存，克享安荣之福。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三师，十方众圣。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流弟子某，灾躔弥息，厄运清消，至道资熏，灵真卫护。 南昌司命，开丹录以延年； 北府帝君，削黑书而落死。 魂神澄正，万长存。 眷属亲绿，同沾景福。 飞沉异质，蠢动殊形，成沐玄休，共臻身吉。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 唱方，忏方，步虚，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某与闱坛众等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，九皇上真，十方已得道大圣，众至真，诸君丈人，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，圆穹玄象、日月星辰、北斗尊帝，七元辅弼星君，南极大帝，丈人司马，六司星君，本命元辰，洞天海岳，三界官属，一切真灵。 臣闻七元在太微之北，为造化之枢机； 六司在朔方之东，经日月之终始。

chunks.original_text: 乃知火官以北为贵，水神以中为尊，一则旋乾转坤，运动而机衡正； 一则褒贤进士，盛明而爵禄行。 体道德而垂光，助乾坤而育物。 欲上延於禄寿，宜有祷於神真。 某爰自宿生，至于今日，罪衅积如山岳，福力轻若鸿毛，或违天地覆载之仁，或负日月照临之德，犯二五行之性，伤三光六纪之和，不悟因缘，罔知禁忌，违越经训，冒触星光，曾未忏除，虑成殃咎。 今则归真知命，悔过冥心，冀开大宥之恩，俾获自新之路。 仰惟南宫六纪，北斗七元。 斟酌化元，无一人不禀以为命； 生持教令，无一物不赖以为生。

Thus it is known that the **Fire Official** holds the north as noble,
The **Water Deity** the center as exalted—
One governs the **cycling of Heaven and Earth**,
Setting in motion the **balancing mechanisms** of **creation and transformation**;
One **honors the worthy and advances scholars**,
Illuminating the **profound virtue/power** of **rank and reward**.

They embody **Dao/Way and virtue/power**, casting their luminous influence,
Aiding **Heaven and Earth** in nurturing all things.

To **ascend in fortune and longevity**,
One must **pray to the numinous and true**.

From my **past life** to this day,
My **offenses accumulate like mountains and seas**,
While my **merit is as light as a feather**—
Sometimes defying **Heaven and Earth’s benevolent embrace**,
Sometimes betraying the **virtue/power of the sun and moon’s illumination**,
Violating the **nature of the Five Phases**,
Disrupting the **harmony of the Three Lights and Six Seasons**,
Unaware of **karmic causes and effects**,
Ignorant of **taboos and prohibitions**,
Transgressing sacred teachings,
Daring to offend celestial portents,
Never having **repented or atoned**—
Lest I invite **calamity and retribution**.

Now, **returning to the True** and **knowing my fate**,
I **repent in my heart**,
Hoping to **open the boundless mercy** of the **Great Forgiveness**,
That I may **find the path of self-renewal**.

I **revere the Six Ministries of the Southern Celestial Palace**,
And the **Seven Primordial Stars of the Northern Dipper**—
They **measure the essence of transformation**,
And none escape their **decree as the source of life**;
They **uphold the teachings of creation**,
And all things **rely upon them for sustenance**.

chunks.original_text: 肃严坛靖之规，夤奉苹蘩之荐，投词献款，罄志皈诚，谢己往之非，补将来之短，拜迎百福，洗涤众灾，保家属之团圆，祝封疆之宁谧。 免息冢讼，使滞塞之通开； 以致康荣，望祈求之稍遂。 落死籍於至阴之境，上生名於洞阳之宫。 皇图长睹於休明，海宇永闻於富庶。 灭烽卧谷，边陲无介冑之人； 薄赋轻摇，比屋有弦歌之士。 百官拱极，万姓奠居，宜众志之咸熙，使万邪之归正，恩沾动植，泽被幽遐，先亡离苦以超生，异类乘时而变化。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来清旦行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝迎刖。 出堂烦。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
The solemn and reverent rules of the **Altar of Serenity** are observed,
With humble offerings of **incense and prayers** presented,
Words and sincerity poured forth in devotion,
Exhausting all intent to return with true faith—
Repenting past transgressions,
Amending future shortcomings,
Invoking a hundred blessings,
Purging all calamities,
Ensuring the unity of my family,
And praying for the peace of the realm’s borders.

To cease lawsuits and disputes,
That stagnant paths may open wide;
To attain prosperity and honor,
Hoping my petitions may be granted.

May I be **released from the register of the Underworld** in the **Domain of Ultimate Yin**,
And ascend to **renown in the Hall of Celestial Yang**.

May the **Imperial Vision** endure in **Enlightened Clarity**,
And the **Four Seas** forever resound with **abundance and prosperity**.

May the **beacons be extinguished**, the valleys at peace,
With no warriors at the frontiers;
May taxes be light and burdens few,
That every household may have scholars and poets.

May officials **align with the Celestial Pole**,
And the people **settle in harmony**—
Fitting that all hearts may flourish,
That all malevolence may return to rectitude.
May **Grace permeate all things, living and growing**,
And **Bounty extend to the remotest reaches**,
That the departed may escape suffering and be reborn,
And all beings may transform with the times.

Above, I honor the **Great Compassion of the Heavenly Venerable**,
Below, I fulfill my subjects’ **sincere return to fate**.

With reverence, I submit this petition.

**Twelve Vows.**

**Reignite the Furnace.**

With solemnity, I command the **Incense Officials and Envoys**, the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**, and the **Attendant Spirit Officials of Incense**—
That at the place where I formerly performed **morning Dao practices**,
**Golden Elixir and Jade Green Essence** may spontaneously arise,

**The Complete Ritual Canon of the Dao Gate, Volume Fifty-One**
*Broadened and Refined by Master Guangting Du of the Southern and Northern Dipper Conjunction Rites*
**Midday Dao Practice**

The ritual ascends the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
The **Spirit-Warding Incantations** are proclaimed.

The **Cinnabar Spirits and Vermilion Fires** blaze forth, their flames surging like crimson clouds and gusting winds.
The **Red Wheel** rolls with unyielding force, its radiance piercing the celestial void.
Its might envelops all directions, transformations weaving through the ten thousand realms.
Molten gold cascades, demons vanish without trace—
**Evil is dispelled, fiends are shattered**, the **Original Virtue** shines forth.
**Golden Talismans** summon and command; the **Cloud-Striding Dragon** obeys.
Hymns of joy resound, petals scatter across the boundless sky.
Divine transformations unfold—**the Four Quarters prosper in harmony**.
Beneath the **Imperial Presence**, none dare be disrespectful—**harmony aligns with the True Dao**.

The **Supreme Law-Drum** is struck **twenty-four times**.

**The Most High Three Celestial Sovereigns of the Primordial Beginning**—
**The Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Laozi**—
**Summon forth from within my body** the **Three Five Officials**, the **Left and Right Attendants**, the **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**, the **Dragon-Courier Clerks**, the **Golden Boy Incense Attendants**, the **Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, the **Direct-Sun Incense Officials**—**each thirty-six in number**—to emerge.

Those who emerge are **arrayed in solemn splendor**, their **headdresses adorned with trailing ribbons**, opening the **Mystic Platform’s Earth and Domain Spirits**.

Now, as I perform the **Midday Dao Practice**, I humbly present this as my **sincere intent**. My **earnest petitions** have already been recorded and conveyed. May the **Most High Dao of the Ten Directions** descend with **Divine Treasure Radiance**, flowing into my body, so that my petitions may swiftly reach the **Most High Supreme Dao of the Great Ultimate, the Jade Emperor of Heavenly Sovereignty**.

**I now invoke the Law-Position** and, together with all the assembled officials, **sincerely present this petition** to:
**The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Sovereign of the Void-Natural, the Most High Dao Lord, the Most High Laozi, the Jade Emperor of Heavenly Sovereignty, the Nine Sovereigns of Highest Truth, the Ten-Directional Perfected Saints, the Crowd of Supreme Truths, the Noble Masters of the Thirty-Six Departments, the Rounded Vault of Mystic Symbols—the Celestial Sovereigns of the Sun, Moon, and Stars, the North Dipper Emperor, the Seven Celestial Ministers of the Five Agents, the Southern Polar Emperor, the Marshal of the Stars, the Six Celestial Officials, my Native Star, the Cavern-Heavens and Ocean-Peaks, the Three Realms’ Officials, and all Divine Spirits.**

I have heard that the **Round Vault hangs its symbols**, the **waxing and waning** first governed by the **Seven Celestial Stems**; the **Luminous Patterns** shift in their courses, their rotation originating from the **Two Celestial Ministers**. The **Dipper Constellation** marks the celestial calendar, its meaning illuminated in the classics; the **Polar Star** governs the **Celestial Sovereign’s Chariot**, its **Jade Balance** establishing the moon’s course. The **Southern Dipper** resides in the **Tiger Position**; the **Northern Polar Star** truly rules from the **Central Axis**. The **Throat and Tongue** transmute the cosmos, their authority extending to **calendar and symbol**. The **Three Hundred Sixty-Five Degrees** uphold the **Celestial Temple’s guiding principles**; the **Ten Thousand Plus Stars** all submit to the **Dipper’s Ladle’s command**. The **Four Seasons** are regulated by the **Jade Candle**, the **Three Celestial Stems** respond to the **Bronze Instrument**—all governed by the **Two Poles**, assisting the **One Ultimate’s motion**.

All who dwell within mortal bounds **draw their essence from the Heavenly Pattern**. Though their ranks differ, their **principles converge in unity**.

I, **Dao-Practitioner [Name]**, though granted the **imperial mandate’s destiny** and endowed with **jewel-like purity**, am born of **water and fire’s fundamental nature**, the **Southern and Northern Dipper’s divine descent**. Though I wield the **four elemental forms**, I cultivate the **One True Root**. How dare I not **revere the Mystic**, striving to **return to the Origin**?

I establish the **Platform as the Dipper’s likeness**, encircling the **Imperial Seat with radiant light**; I offer **water and flowers**, gazing toward the **Celestial Pivot’s axis** with unwavering faith. The **rites follow the Secret Edicts**, the **solemn observances adhere to the unique laws**. With reverence for the **nearby威 (awe)**, I dare to **threefold prostrate my petitions**.

I dwell in the **Secret Hall**, ascending the **True Stages**. Though I follow the **Celestial Steps’ order**, I am unworthy of **Pengzi’s daughter’s ascension**; though I **light the lamp for the Dipper**, I lack **Deng De’s sincerity in subduing rebellion**. Yet, if I **proclaim the Mystic Teachings**, perhaps **auspicious blessings** may descend upon the virtuous.

Having received these **earnest words**, I dare not withhold them. **The Petition is Proclaimed.**

As the words declare, **my sincerity is profound and urgent**. May my offering ascend to the **Imperial Presence**, permeating the **Celestial Platform**.

The **Shared Governance** is just, the **Assisting Sovereigns** are impartial. **Life’s sustenance** is equally bestowed; **daily needs** are mutually dependent. Though the **Treasure-Sword** lies hidden, its light still shines in its sheath; though the **Abundant Fox** is of strange kind, it still extends its reverence to the **Dipper’s Ladle**. Since I possess the **most refined essence**, I must recognize **the Origin of All Life**.

The **True Body of the Dao** manifests through the **transformations of water and fire**; the **Heavenly Form** is ever-changing in the **celestial courses**. Thus, I **conduct the Conjunction Rites on this unified platform**, solemnly revering the **Supreme Celestial’s brilliance**.

The **lofty Heavenly Beam** spans the **Yellow River’s source**, its pillars interlocked; the **resplendent Jade Dipper** rotates with the **Dragon’s Ladle and Horn**, its motion ever-leftward. I **fix my thoughts on the high vault**, my spirit **soaring through the Mystic Symbols**, wishing to **descend upon the winds and clouds**, humbly casting aside past shame.

May all who pass be **transformed**, all who remain be **deified**—**bringing blessings to family and nation**. May **flourishing prosperity** bring **longevity and joy**, extending **blessings to both the visible and unseen**.

With **fragrant incense rising**, I **attain the boundless grace**. Now, as I perform the **Midday Dao Practice**, I request that the **Law-Assembled** kindle the **first incense strand**. May this **smoke ascend directly to the heavens**, offering **sustenance to the Most High Three Sovereigns and the Ten-Directional Saints**.

I, along with all present, **submit my body, my spirit, my fate**—
With these **merits and virtues**, I **pray for the current Emperor**.

May **clarity and brilliance** shine together, the **Celestial Pivot and Polar Star** align in harmony.
May **forms and symbols** be perfected, surpassing even my own body in reverence;
From **south to north**, may all be **molded by the Dao’s transformations**.

May the **Heavenly Steps** be unobstructed, **human culture** flourish eternally.
The **principles** gleam like the **order of stars**; the **land endures as Heaven does**.
**Grain and rice** abound like **water and fire**; the **seasons are harmonious, the years bountiful**.

Now, as I **burn this incense**, I **take refuge in the Dao’s Perfected Saints and Supreme Truths**.
After attaining the **Dao**, I shall **ascend to the Formless**, **harmonizing with the True Dao**.

chunks.original_text: 昧刚柔之负抱，孤健顺之生成。 迷本忘真，乘愆蹈过。 莫悟擢形於斯世，端从禀气於泻钧。 悼彼胚胎之初，诚如浑沌之始。 分化炉之真火神水，为人身之丹田绛宫。 离己之日凝魂，坎戊之月制魄。 六腑五脏，九窍百骸，皆次第以成形，洎圆满而诞质。 或富或贵，或贱或贫，各从情窦之萌，莫匪世罗之绊。 六欲障虚明之性，七情断久视之根。 既与道以阔疏，宜行世之坎坷。 天灾物累，鬼责人非，运元推屯否之临身，斡厄消暑寒之相寇。 倚伏之机，皆藏於危□； 避趋之路，宜诰於通津。 玉局遗言，昭示解禳之法； 紫庭秘诰，许陈忏谢之仪。 可转祸以为祥，庶迁善而远罪。 今奉道某虑灾凶在运，忧惕于中，用遵金口之言，恭敞郁庭之醮。 伏乞虚无上圣，寥廓高真，示以自新，嘉其退省，敕下南宫六纪、北斗七元，迂景倾光，□祥介福。 深灾重患罡指以蠲除； 元真情，斡斗杓而增注。 调平星度，安镇天纲，五行无流逆之灾，三命息刑妨之厄。 固蒂探根而养寿，怀珠抱玉以全生。 居之斯安，动罔不吉，均繁禧於眷属，茂纯嘏於门阑，上愿国寿延洪，帝图悠久，三边不警，九译归仁。 物类□於泰通，平安遂性； 重阴廓於丰照，离苦超生。 愿力难周，恩光无尽。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来临午行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

The **unaware** embrace of firm and yielding,
The **lonely** birth of vigor and compliance.

Lost in origin, forgotten in truth,
They stray and err, treading in transgression.

None awaken to **ascend** in this world,
Yet all receive their **inherent qi** from the **Celestial Balance**.

Lament the **embryo’s** first dawn—
Truly like the **primordial chaos** at its start.

The **true fire of the alchemical furnace** and the **divine water**,
Form the **Dan Tian** and **Vermilion Palace** of the human body.

At the **separation of self**, the **soul congeals** in the day;
In the **Kan-Wu month**, the **spirit** is shaped.

The **six viscera** and **five organs**,
The **nine orifices** and **hundred bones**—
All **gradually** take form,
Until **perfection** and **birth** are complete.

Some grow **wealthy**, some **noble**,
Some **lowly**, some **poor**—
Each follows the **emergence of their passions**,
None escapes the **world’s entangling snares**.

The **six desires** veil the **luminous nature**,
The **seven emotions** sever the **root of lasting vision**.

Having **drifted from the Dao** with **growing distance**,
They **rightfully** endure the **world’s hardships**.

**Celestial calamities** and **worldly burdens**,
**Ghostly accusations** and **human blame**—
The **celestial cycles** bring **Pisces, Hexagram 23, and Hexagram 24** upon them,
While **misfortune** and **hardship** assail like **summer’s heat and winter’s cold**.

The **mechanisms of rise and fall** are all hidden in **perilous □**;
The **paths of avoidance and pursuit** must be **heeded at the crossroads**.

The **Jade Bureau’s**遗言 **reveals the rites of expiation**;
The **Purple Court’s** secret edicts **grant the rituals of confession and atonement**.

Thus, **misfortune may be turned to fortune**,
And **virtue may be cultivated to avoid guilt**.

Now, **we humbly follow** the **Daoist Master’s** foresight of impending calamity,
Anxious in heart, and **diligently adhere** to the **Golden Mouth’s** teachings,
**Reverently opening** the **Idyllic Court’s** ritual assembly.

We **humbly pray** to the **Supreme Saint of the Void**,
The **Lofty and Vast Perfected One**,
To **enlighten us in self-renewal**,
To **rejoice in our repentance**,
And **command** the **Six Records of the Southern Palace** and the **Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper**—

chunks.original_text: 所以南极注生，北宫主死，总领图线，统较幽明。 粤自混茫，至于今日，纪纲不紊，历数无差，上惟帝王，下该臣庶，成依主宰，仰赖神休。 弟子某词悃所陈，已具敷奏，自惟积庆，叨荷玄功。 而六气运神，五帝演性，贞闲难固，流遁易迷，旋隳福善之阶，日践愆违之境，或积生所构，或今世所为，罪书缀五帝之篇，咎目鼓三官之笔，未曾祈忏，莫得蠲除。 又恐宿曜行藏，交期所属。 行年经历，厄会所临。 或故杀误伤，探冤往债； 或系心起念，履恶为非。 上犯天元，下违坤德，触阴阳禁忌，负日月神明，罪目恶绿，无边无量，非凭忏谢，莫遂原除。 伏闻南宫为阳德之司，生成万物； 北极为裁成之府，主制群灵。 生死吉凶，咸归统录。 除灾解厄，实赖圣慈。

Thus, the **Southern Pole** governs life’s birth,
while the **Northern Enclosure** presides over death,
overseeing the grand design and measuring the hidden and manifest.

From the **Primordial Chaos** to this very day,
the cosmic order remains unbroken,
the celestial cycles never err.
Above, the **Sovereign Emperor** reigns supreme;
below, all subjects—noble and common—
stand in dependence upon the **Celestial Master’s** rule,
relying upon the **Divine Grace** that sustains them.

Your humble disciple, [Name], has sincerely laid forth his petition,
which has already been fully presented.
By the grace of accumulated blessings,
I have been favored by the **Mysterious Virtue’s** power.

Yet the **Six Qi** govern the spirits’ movements,
while the **Five Emperors** refine their natures—
constant vigilance is hard to maintain,
while transience and retreat are easily lost.
Daily, I tread the path of **accumulating merit**,
yet also step into the realm of **transgressions unrepented**.
Whether from past deeds or present actions,
my offenses are recorded in the **Five Emperors’ ledgers**,
my sins inscribed by the **Three Officials’ pens**.
Without repentance and atonement,
there is no absolution.

Moreover, I fear the **Lunar Mansions’** influences may converge,
and the **fated years** of my destiny may now be upon me.
The years I have lived have passed through **critical junctures**,
and **calamitous encounters** may soon descend.
Perhaps I have caused **unintentional harm**,
or perhaps my **thoughts and deeds** have strayed into evil.
I have offended the **Heavenly Primordial** above,
and violated the **Earthly Virtue** below,
transgressing the **taboos of Yin and Yang**,
betraying the **Divine Light of Sun and Moon**.
My sins are vast and boundless—
without sincere repentance and supplication,
there can be no forgiveness.

It is said that the **Southern Palace** governs the **Yang Virtue**,
giving rise to all things;
while the **Northern Pole** is the **Hall of Final Judgment**,
commanding all spirits.
Life and death, fortune and misfortune—
all are recorded under its authority.
To remove calamities and resolve crises,
one must truly rely upon the **Sage’s Merciful Grace**.

before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor, the Great Lord of the Celestial Realm**.

**Hymns of departure** are chanted.
**Steps from the hall** are taken.
**Exits the door**.»

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之五十二竟 道门科范大全集卷之五十三 广成先生杜光庭删定 南北二斗同醮仪 设醮行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翕，和与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今设醮行道，谨奉为入意，其诸诚悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方正真道，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与阖坛众官等，谨同诚上启， 虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，大上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，九皇上真，十方己得道大圣，众至真，诸君丈人，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，圆穹玄象、日月星辰、北斗尊帝，七元辅弼星君，南极大帝，丈人司马，六司星君，本命元辰，洞天海岳，三界官属，一切真灵。 臣伏闻上极无上，大罗弥覆於诸天； 玄之又玄，洪造实根於元气。 丽三辰而垂象，尊紫极以御图。 四布于方，七政纲维於南斗，西揭之柄，九天喉舌於上天。 仰斡乾枢，俯包地纪。 经传玉局，称两极之同科； 史验铜仪，观周天之有度。 凡圆首方趾之肖像，皆南离北坎之降神。 敢不皈依，冀回恩贶。 奉道某冥心坛靖，凝睇经躔，洁荷羞乳 馔之蒸，沦火枣云腴之荐。 九微腾焰，百末飞烟，有严秩秩之筵，伫降飘飘之驾。 伏愿九扇洞开於闾阖，十方悉下於轮舆。 鹤盖成阴，扈和銮而有节； 霓旌启道，森仪仗以无哗。 俯临圭洁之场，曲副翘勤之请。 臣与醮官阖坛众等，不任激切延请之至，诚惶诚恐，稽首再拜，奉迎圣驾。 降真，献茶，初献，散花。 具位臣某，虔诚上启，九清上圣，十极高真，北斗尊帝，七元辅弼星君，斗中真宰。 臣闻元气无形，斗杓於焉斟酌； 周天有度，玉衡所以斡旋。 建四时而成岁功，均五材而握民命。 六度下降，自天子而达庶人； 一年运行，起汉津而终营室。 有尊帝以主仙道，建辅弼而佐斗功。 刑德生杀之相参，官禄寿富之攸系。 虚心以存，则可御邪而敌害； 按法而步，端能招真以致仙。 巍巍神功，纪赞莫尽。 奉道某托迹光明之下，伦安临照之中。 清夜沈寥，仰光芒而肃敬； 浮生胶扰，於香火之缺违。 致於欲寿而康，遇灾知惧，许亟伸於醮告，爰恭启於坛仪，敬按金科，辄伸恳请。 臣既承词悯，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，丹诚恳切。 谅彻九重之听，不违片善之微。

「The Grand Compilation of Daoist Rituals and Regulations concludes its fifty-second volume,
and begins its fifty-third volume—
the *Broadly Achieved Master Gu Cheng* [廣成先生], edited by Du Guangting [杜光庭],
with the **Southern and Northern Dipper** [南北二斗] **Conjunction Ritual** [同醮儀].

**Ritual procedures ascend the platform** as prescribed.
Each **officiant** [師] pays homage with **devout reverence** [存念] in accordance with the **Dao**.

**Sacred incantations** [靈咒] are proclaimed.
The **Five Stars** [五星] array themselves in radiance, illuminating the **Five Directions** [五方].
The **Water Star** [水星] repels calamity, the **Wood Virtue** [木德] brings prosperity.
The **Uranus** [荧惑] dispels misfortune, the **Jupiter** [太白] wards off soldiers.
The **Saturn** [鎮星] holds firm its fourfold authority, benefiting **house and state**.
Their names are inscribed on **jade tablets** [玉簡], their words recorded in the **Imperial Archives** [帝房].
They ride the **scattered light** [散景], ascending into the **vast expanse** [太空].
They move freely through the **mysterious void** [冥無], feasting across the **Ten Thousand Directions** [十方].
The **Five Clouds** [五云] float as canopy, summoning **spirits** [神] and restraining **winds** [風].
They command the **myriad spirits** [萬靈], guarding the **Daoist retinue** [仙翕] above,
and harmonizing with the **True Dao** [道合真].

The **Sacred Law Drum** [法鼓] is struck **twenty-four times** [二十四通].

We invoke:
The **Supreme Sovereign of the Three Heavens** [無上三天], the **Primordial Beginning of the Mysterious** [玄元始三尊],
the **Great Lord of the Dao** [太上道君], the **Great Lord of the Daoist Way** [太上老君],
and request the **Three Five Officials** [三五功曹] within my body,
along with the **left and right officials** [左右官使者],
the **left and right attendants bearing incense** [左右捧香],
the **Dragon Messengers** [驿龙骑吏] and **Golden Boys attending incense** [侍香金童],
the **Jade Maidens scattering flowers** [传言散花玉女],
the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** [五帝直符],
the **Direct-Day Incense Officials** [直日香官],
and the **Thirty-Six** [合三十六人] **persons**—all to emerge.

The **emerging spirits** [出者] are clad in **resplendent attire** [嚴裝], adorned with **display robes** [顯服],
their **headdresses and sashes** [冠帶] trailing **pendant ribbons** [垂缨].
They open the **mystic gates** [玄坛] for the **local deities** [土地],
and the **regional spirits** [方域神真].

I now set forth this **Conjunction Ritual** [醮],
and humbly offer my **sincere devotion** [入意].
My **earnest petitions** [諸誠悃] have been recorded and heard.
I pray that the **Supreme Daoists of the Ten Thousand Directions** [太上十方正真道尊],
the **Sacred Treasures of Auspicious Light** [靈寶瑞光], descend,
flowing into my being,
so that my **supplications** [所啟] may swiftly reach
the **Ultimate True Dao of the Boundless Supreme** [至真無極大道],
before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor, the Great Lord of the Celestial Realm** [昊天玉皇上帝御前].

I request the **recitation of the Sacred Law** [稱法位].

I, **the humble servant** [具位臣某], along with all the **ritual officials** [醮官] on this **platform** [坛],
offer our **collective sincerity** [同誠] in supplication:

To the **Primordial Sovereign of the Void** [虛無自然元始天尊],
the **Great Daoist Lord** [太上大道君],
the **Great Lord of the Daoist Way** [大上老君],
the **Heavenly Jade Emperor, the Great Lord of the Celestial Realm** [昊天玉皇上帝],
the **Nine Sovereigns of the Highest Truth** [九皇上真],
the **Ten Thousand Directions’ Immortal Saints** [十方己得道大聖],
the **All-Pervading True Ones** [眾至真],
the **Exalted Masters** [諸君丈人],
the **Thirty-Six Departments’ Venerable Scriptural Masters of the Mysterious Middle** [三十六部尊經玄中大法師],
the **Circular Celestial Symbols** [圓穹玄象], **Sun and Moon, Stars and Dipper** [日月星辰],
the **Venerable Northern Dipper Emperor** [北斗尊帝],
the **Seven Auxiliary Stars** [七元輔弼星君],
the **Southern Dipper’s Great Emperor** [南極大帝],
the **Master of the Dipper’s Array** [丈人司馬],
the **Six Official Stars** [六司星君],
my **Native Star and Birth Hour** [本命元辰],
the **Celestial Caverns and Oceanic Peaks** [洞天海嶽],
the **Three Realms’ Officials** [三界官屬],
and **all true spirits** [一切真靈].

I, the humble servant, have heard that the **Supreme Sovereign** [上极] is **boundless** [无上],
and the **Great Luo** [大罗] pervades all **Heavens** [诸天].
The **Mysterious** [玄] is profound yet again profound,
and the **Great Creation** [洪造] takes root in the **Primordial Qi** [元气].
Adorned with the **Three Celestial Lights** [三辰], their **symbols** [象] descend;
the **Purple Extremity** [紫极] is exalted, its **decrees** [图] proclaimed.
The **Four Directions** [四布] are spread, the **Seven Governors** [七政] are held in place by the **Southern Dipper** [南斗],
its **handle** [柄] raised to the **West**.
The **Nine Heavens’ Throat and Tongue** [九天喉舌] are stationed in the **Highest Heaven** [上天].

They **oversee the Celestial Pivot** [乾枢] above, and **embrace the Earth’s Measure** [地纪] below.
They **administer the rules of the Jade Canon** [玉局], in accordance with the **shared principles of the Two Extremes** [两极].
They **verify the records of the Bronze Ritual** [铜仪], observing the **limits of the Revolving Heaven** [周天].

All **circular-headed, square-footed** [圓首方趾] **efficacious images** [肖像]
are **descended spirits** [降神] of the **Southern Dipper’s Separation** [南離] and the **Northern Dipper’s Abyss** [北坎].
How dare I not **surrender in reverence** [皈依]?
I only hope to **return to Your grace** [冀回恩贶].

I, the humble servant, **devotedly maintain the purity of the Mystic Platform** [坛靖],
**fix my gaze on the celestial movements** [凝睇经躔],
and **offer pure, unblemished** [圭洁] **libations of tea and incense** [茶火],
with **steamed rice and fragrant clouds** [蒸馔], **dates and plump offerings** [枣云腴之荐].

The **Nine Bright Stars** [九微] rise in flames, the **Hundred Stars of the End** [百末] ascend in smoke,
forming a **strictly ordered feast** [严秩秩之筵].
I await the **graceful descent of the Divine Procession** [降飘飘之驾].

I pray that the **Nine Gates of the Mystic Caverns** [九扇] open for all,
and the **Ten Thousand Directions’ spirits** [十方] descend into the **ritual vehicles** [轮舆].
The **Phoenix canopy** [鹤盖] casts its shadow,
and the **auspicious procession** [扈和銮] moves with **proper order** [有节].
The **Rainbow banners** [霓旌] reveal the **Dao’s path** [启道],
and the **solemn retinue** [森仪仗] advances without **disorder** [无哗].

**Bending low** [俯临], You **oversee the pure and unblemished field** [圭洁之场],
and **graciously respond** [曲副] to my **earnest, urgent pleas** [翘勤之请].

I, the humble servant, along with the **ritual officials** [醮官] and all on this **platform** [坛],
cannot bear the **urgency of our fervent supplications** [激切延请之至].
With **deepest trepidation** [诚惶诚恐], we **bow repeatedly** [稽首再拜],
and **humbly welcome the Divine Procession** [奉迎圣驾].

The **True Ones descend** [降真], **tea is offered** [献茶],
**first offering** [初献], **flowers are scattered** [散花].

I, the humble servant, **devoutly supplicate** [虔诚上启]:
To the **Nine Pure High Saints** [九清上圣],
the **Ten Extremes’ Highest Immortals** [十极高真],
the **Venerable Northern Dipper Emperor** [北斗尊帝],
the **Seven Auxiliary Stars** [七元輔弼星君],
and the **True Sovereign within the Dipper** [斗中真宰].

I have heard that the **Primordial Qi** [元气] is **formless** [无形],
yet the **Dipper’s ladle** [斗杓] measures it.
The **Revolving Heaven** [周天] has **limits** [有度],
and the **Jade Balance** [玉衡] governs its **movements** [斡旋].
They **establish the Four Seasons** [四时], completing the **year’s function** [成岁功],
and **balance the Five Elements** [五材], holding the **fates of the people** [握民命].
The **Six Degrees** [六度] descend from **Heaven’s Son** [天子] to the **common folk** [庶人],
and the **year’s cycle** [一年运行] begins at **Han’s Ford** [汉津] and ends at **Camp Room** [营室].

There is the **Venerable Emperor** [尊帝] who **oversees the Daoist Path** [主仙道],
and the **Seven Auxiliaries** [建辅弼] who **assist the Dipper’s function** [佐斗功].
The **punishments and virtues** [刑德] of **life and death** [生杀] are **interwoven** [相参],
and the **official ranks and blessings** [官禄] of **longevity and wealth** [寿富] are **inextricably linked** [攸系].
If one **preserves a voided heart** [虚心以存],
then one may **ward off evil and resist harm** [御邪而敌害].
If one **follows the Dao’s method** [按法而步],
then one **can summon True Ones and attain immortality** [招真以致仙].

The **august power of the spirits** [巍巍神功] is **incalculable** [纪赞莫尽].
I, the humble servant, **trust my fate beneath the luminous Dao** [托迹光明之下],
and **rank among those who dwell in security** [伦安临照之中].

In the **stillness of the night** [清夜沈寥],
I **raise my gaze to the radiant light** [仰光芒] and **pay homage with reverence** [肃敬].
Amid the **turbulence of mortal life** [浮生胶扰],
I **offer incense and fire** [於香火] where they are **lacking or deficient** [之缺违].

I **seek longevity and health** [欲寿而康],
and **know fear when facing calamity** [遇灾知惧].
I **pledge swift response** [许亟伸] to my **ritual petitions** [醮告],
and **respectfully begin** [爰恭启] with the **platform’s rites** [坛仪].
I **follow the Golden Rules** [敬按金科] and **extend my humble supplications** [辄伸恳请].

Since I have **received Your compassionate words** [承词悯],
how dare I not **report them above** [上闻]?

**Words are proclaimed** [宣词].
**As spoken**, my **sincere, earnest petitions** [如词言] are **uttered with deep sincerity** [丹诚恳切].
I trust they **penetrate the Nine Heavens’ listening** [谅彻九重之听],
and **do not fail even the slightest good** [不违片善之微].

chunks.original_text: 若弟子某等，身宫滞塞，气本休囚，忧致冤於阴阳，欲全生於覆载者，请贪狼太星君为保护之； 若命元羁蹇，星度刑妨，欲去危而即安，求转祸而为福者，请巨门元星君为消解之； 若弹冠愿仕，干禄代耕，问官海之要津，蹑天朝之华贯者，请禄存真星君为迁达之； 若福基不厚，产殖未饶，於义利之交兴，愿富仁之兼美者，请文曲纽星君为增注之； 若行全儒素，艺绝词华，期志在崇高之美，得身膺宠擢之荣者，请廉贞纲星君显佑之； 若顺考寿历，欲致耆年图安，以遗后昆，好德而全五福者，请武曲纪星君为延益之； 若嗣息未蕃，室家多难，思保松萝之固，更延瓜瓞之绵者，请破军关星君为全护之。 乞使某等志愿感通，真灵降接，万愿咸遂，众善兴修。 臣与阖坛众等，不任所请之至，再诵大圣北斗都管吉祥咒日：北斗九晨，天中大圣。 上朝金阙，下覆昆仑。 调理纲纪，统制乾坤。 大魁贪狼，巨门禄存。 文曲廉贞，武曲破军。 高上玉皇，紫微帝君。 大周天界，细入微尘。 何灾不灭，何福不臻。 元皇正，来合我身。 天罡所指，昼夜长输。 俗居小人，好道求宁。 愿见尊仪，永保长生。 三台虚精，六淳曲生。 生我养我，护我身形。 臣等稽首致恭，谨陈亚献。 散花。 具位臣某谨虔诚上启， 九清至尊，十方上圣，南斗大帝，丈人司马，六司星君，斗中真宰。 臣闻日宫至阳之精，发轫於左界； 南斗列星之纪，宣精於河源。 谓准日以生成，虽称南而在北。 汉津黼黻，专贤良命禄之司； 历象枢机，主将相府庭之事。 运会而灵图正，盛明则君道兴。 悼为缠度之元，宴主生民之命。 倾心以请，无愿不从。 奉道某等徒闻挹酒之言，难接乘搓之武。 仰观分野，南北迷方； 俯建坛场，坎离定位。 荐苾芬於褥坐，仁盼蠁於烟霄。 有灾有患之禳除，延福延生之迓续。 奉道某若命元谫薄，禄气单微者，请天府司命君为增益之； 若黑录着名，青宫削籍者，请天相司录君为回改之； 若寿历不修，世途多梗者，请天梁延寿君为延佑之； 若卫生乖和，布算有限者，请天同益算保生君为保全之； 若厄难相凌，魂神不守者，请天枢度厄炼魂君为禳镇之； 若生意萧条，事机紏逆者，请天机上生君为启迪之。 即使奉道某对服宠灵，导迎休证，百祥纷 委，众恶伏藏，式昭感应之仁，少付倾虔之请。 臣与众等不任恳梼之至，诵大圣南斗六星天纪延寿颂曰：南斗六星，天中宰臣。 上参元化，七政攸遵。 下主扬州，吴越斯分。

「Should disciples such as I—**whose palaces are obstructed** [身宫滞塞], **whose vital *qi* is imprisoned and weak** [气本休囚], **who suffer unjust afflictions from yin-yang imbalance** [忧致冤於阴阳], **and who seek to preserve life beneath the heavens’ shelter** [欲全生於覆载]—then I pray to **the Lord of the Acquisitive Wolf Star** [贪狼太星君] to act as our **protector** [保护].

Should one’s **fate be bound by hardship** [命元羁蹇], **with celestial influences causing obstruction and harm** [星度刑妨], **and who wish to escape peril and attain security** [去危而即安], **or to transform misfortune into blessing** [转祸为福], then I pray to **the Lord of the Great Gate Star** [巨门元星君] to **dissolve and mitigate** [消解] these afflictions.

Should one **aspire to officialdom** [弹冠愿仕], **seeking wealth and favor instead of tilling the fields** [干禄代耕], **and who inquire about the gates of imperial service** [问官海之要津], **or who step upon the illustrious paths of the celestial court** [蹑天朝之华贯], then I pray to **the Lord of the True Prosperity Star** [禄存真星君] to **facilitate our advancement** [迁达].

Should one’s **foundation of virtue and fortune be thin** [福基不厚], **with meager offspring and no abundance** [产殖未饶], **and who seek prosperity in both righteousness and material blessings** [於义利之交兴，愿富仁之兼美], then I pray to **the Lord of the Literary Harmony Star** [文曲纽星君] to **augment and bestow** [增注] upon us.

Should one **embrace the complete teachings of Confucianism** [行全儒素], **and excel in the arts of eloquence and refinement** [艺绝词华], **while aspiring to the highest ideals of virtue** [期志在崇高之美], **and who desire the honor of being chosen by the court** [得身膺宠擢之荣], then I pray to **the Lord of the Stern Integrity Star** [廉贞纲星君] to **manifestly assist** [显佑] us.

Should one **follow the natural course of longevity** [顺考寿历], **and who wish to reach old age in tranquility** [致耆年图安], **to leave a legacy for future generations** [以遗后昆], **and who delight in virtue while securing the Five Blessings** [好德而全五福], then I pray to **the Lord of the Martial Harmony Star** [武曲纪星君] to **extend and benefit** [延益] our lives.

Should one’s **descendants be few** [嗣息未蕃], **and the household face many hardships** [室家多难], **while pondering the stability of the pine and bamboo** [思保松萝之固], **and who wish to perpetuate the lineage like gourds and melons** [更延瓜瓞之绵], then I pray to **the Lord of the Star of the Broken Army** [破军关星君] to **fully safeguard** [全护] us.

I beseech that **our aspirations may be deeply felt and answered** [志愿感通], **that the true spirit may descend to meet us** [真灵降接], **and that all our wishes may be fulfilled** [万愿咸遂], **while goodness and virtue flourish** [众善兴修].

With **all the disciples** [臣与阖坛众等], **unworthy as we are of such gracious requests** [不任所请之至], we **reiterate the Great Sage’s Auspicious Northern Dipper Cauldron’s Vow** [再诵大圣北斗都管吉祥咒] daily:

*"The Northern Dipper’s Nine Stars, the Celestial Sage supreme,*
*Above attend the golden gates of the imperial court,*
*Below shelter the peaks of Kunlun.*
*They regulate the cosmic order,*
*Commanding the cycles of heaven and earth.*
*The Great Arc of the Acquisitive Wolf,*
*The Great Gate and the True Prosperity,*
*Literary Harmony and Stern Integrity,*
*Martial Harmony and the Broken Army.*
*The Lofty Jade Emperor, the Purple Micro Lord.*
*The Great Heavenly Cycle, refined to the subtlest dust.*
*What calamity cannot be extinguished,*
*What fortune cannot be attained?*
*The Primordial Sovereign’s decree is just,*
*Now merging with my form.*
*The Heavenly Ganges’ arrows strike,*
*Day and night, my life is prolonged.*
*Though dwelling among the vulgar,*
*I seek the Dao for lasting peace.*
*May I behold Your sacred presence,*
*And forever preserve eternal life.*
*The Three Palaces’ pure essence,*
*The Six Stars’ harmonious flow.*
*They give birth to me,*
*Nourish me,*
*And safeguard my mortal frame."*

**We humbly prostrate** [稽首致恭], **and respectfully present our offerings** [谨陈亚献]. **The incense is scattered.**

**Your devoted disciple** [具位臣某], **with utmost sincerity** [谨虔诚], **now humbly invokes** [上启]:

*"Nine Pure Celestial Sovereign,*
*Ten Directions’ Supreme Sage,*
*The Great Emperor of the Southern Dipper,*
*Venerable Master Sima,*
*The Six Departments’ Star Lords,*
*The True Ruler within the Dipper.*

**We hear that** the **Sun Palace’s radiant yang essence** [日宫至阳之精] **originates from the left boundary** [发轫於左界]; **the Southern Dipper’s stars’ celestial records** [南斗列星之纪] **proclaim their essence at the Yellow River’s source** [宣精於河源]. **Though named the Southern Dipper** [虽称南], **they align with the Sun’s course** [准日以生成], **and thus their influence extends to the North** [而在北].

**At the Han Dynasty’s capital**, they **supervise the selection of virtuous officials** [专贤良命禄之司]; **in the cosmic calendar**, they **oversee the affairs of generals and ministers** [主将相府庭之事]. **When celestial movements harmonize and the diagram of fate is correct** [运会而灵图正], **then the bright reign of the Sage’s Dao flourishes** [盛明则君道兴].

**They are the origin of all entanglements** [悼为缠度之元], **and they govern the fate of all beings** [宴主生民之命]. **With sincerest hearts, we make our petitions**, **and no wish shall remain unanswered** [倾心以请，无愿不从].

**Though we, the disciples of the Dao**, have **heard of the sacred elixir’s teachings** [闻挹酒之言], **we lack the strength to ascend to its power** [难接乘搓之武]. **Gazing upward at the celestial divisions**, we **find the North and South in confusion** [仰观分野，南北迷方]; **below, in constructing our ritual platforms**, we **establish positions according to the trigram of Water and Fire** [俯建坛场，坎离定位].

**We offer fragrant incense** [荐苾芬] **upon our humble seats**, **and with benevolent anticipation** [仁盼蠁], **we await Your descent in the misty heavens** [於烟霄].

**For the alleviation of calamities and afflictions** [有灾有患之禳除], **and the continuation of blessings and longevity** [延福延生之迓续], **we pray:**

Should one’s **fate be frail and fortune meager** [命元谫薄], **with scant *qi* of prosperity** [禄气单微], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Treasury** [天府司命君] to **augment and enrich** [增益] our lives.

Should one’s **name be recorded in darkness** [黑录着名], **and their celestial register be erased** [青宫削籍], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Response** [天相司录君] to **restore and amend** [回改] our records.

Should one’s **lifespan be unfulfilled** [寿历不修], **and their path in life be obstructed** [世途多梗], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Beam** [天梁延寿君] to **extend and bless** [延佑] our years.

Should one’s **health be discordant** [卫生乖和], **and their fortunes be limited** [布算有限], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Concord** [天同益算保生君] to **fully preserve** [保全] our lives.

Should **hardships assail relentlessly** [厄难相凌], **and our spirits fail to remain steadfast** [魂神不守], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Pivot** [天枢度厄炼魂君] to **alleviate and pacify** [禳镇] these trials.

Should one’s **life’s purpose be desolate** [生意萧条], **and their affairs meet with reversals** [事机紏逆], then I pray to **the Lord of the Heavenly Mechanism** [天机上生君] to **enlighten and guide** [启迪] us.

**Even if we, the disciples of the Dao**, **may only partially receive Your gracious spirit** [对服宠灵], **and imperfectly lead Your descent** [导迎休证], **with countless blessings bestowed** [百祥纷委], **and all evils suppressed** [众恶伏藏], **may the benevolence of Your response be evident** [式昭感应之仁], **and our humble petitions be granted** [少付倾虔之请].

**Though unworthy of such earnest supplication** [臣与众等不任恳梼之至], we **recite the Great Sage’s Southern Dipper Six Stars Celestial Vow of Longevity** [诵大圣南斗六星天纪延寿颂] daily:

*"The Southern Dipper’s Six Stars,*
*The Celestial Ministers supreme,*
*Above align with the Primordial Transformation,*
*And the Seven Governors follow in reverence.*
*Below they oversee the Yangzhou region,*
*And the lands of Wu and Yue are their domain."*

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之五十三竟 道门科范大全集卷之五十四 广成先生杜光庭删定 南北二斗同醮宝灯仪 静夜行道 法事升坛如式。 念静天地咒，洒水。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，九皇上真，十方已得道大圣，众至真，诸君丈人，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，圆穹玄象、日月星辰、北斗尊帝，七元辅弼星君，南极大帝，丈人司马，六司星君，本命元辰，洞天海岳，三界官属，一切真灵，俯降灯坛，证明虔祷。 谨奉为宣意，其诸情悃，已对敷宣，以今关祝星灯，请众诵天尊圣号，为某等合门眷属，解灾解厄，延福延生。 稽首皈依，虔诚赞咏。 信礼无上大罗天星主紫微大帝。 臣众等至心皈命枢宫大圣贪狼阳明真皇君，斗中神仙，和诸灵官。 伏闻飞晨合景，枢星掌劫会之权； 司政紏非，阳明主璇玑之运。 上宰九天之化，中监五岳之灵，下总人伦，傍分品类，定死生之有命，鉴善恶以无私。 以今某恭款刍心，虔依妙范，至心皈命枢宫大圣贪狼阳明真皇君。 伏愿回光启曜，垂渊鉴於玄坛； 增禄延年，注生名於青简。 稽首皈依，虔诚赞咏。 信礼高上紫微垣、北斗第一贪狼星君。 贪狼延生，回真四灵。 流辉下映，洞达玄冥。 七元纪籍，名列紫庭。 保身续寿，永亨利贞。 耳目开爽，魂魄长宁，和愿得长生。 臣众等至心皈命璇宫大圣巨门阴精真皇君，斗中神仙，和诸灵官。 伏闻星有五门，侠三光而远映； 门开四照，合万气以腾辉。 校天府之升迁，主兆民之禄寿。 委质难逃於渊鉴，通津皇类於明梁。 以今某蒇事瑶坛，驰诚金阙，至心皈命纵官大圣巨门阴精真皇君。 伏愿身度千灾，命延百福，天开神宇，气袭真源。 碧简题名，固长年於劫石； 丹台纪籍，增上算於灵椿。 稽首皈依，虔诚赞咏。 信礼高上紫微垣、北斗第二巨门星君。 巨门延命，元灵散陈。 丹田通畅，运合仙真。 七元定籍，名列紫文。 护身注寿，福庆维新。 辟除妖恶，善瑞日臻。 去来无碍，与神同伦。 延命自然，上升玉宸，和愿得长生。 臣众等至心皈命玑宫大圣禄存真人真皇君，斗中神仙，和诸灵官。 伏闻偃息华盖，徒知空步之名； 潜洞太虚，莫测飞身之妙。 八景九天之上，道契青箓以通真； 五岳四渎之高，仙隶黄台而受事。 矧兹下士，实仰余光。 以今某洁己斋盟，法为坛惮，至心皈命玑宫大圣禄存真人真皇君。 伏愿庆叶遐年，福资浩劫。 三千万之甲子，地久天长； 一十二之灵门，阳开阴闭。 翛闲白日，咽味冲和。 稽首皈依，虔诚赞咏。 信礼高上紫微垣、北斗第三禄存星君。 北斗度厄，高仙上灵。 流辉遍照，内外肃清。 七元录籍，名列紫庭。 扶身延寿，禄位长亨。 脏腑开朗，动止咸宁。 光运合景，与神同荣。 度厄自然，上升玉京，和愿得长生。 臣众等至心皈命权宫大圣文曲玄冥真皇君，斗中神仙，和诸灵官。 伏闻星主玄冥，位司游击。 隐微潜耀，领北斗之三宫； 福善祸淫，摄黑灵之五炁。 或殄除凶勃，飞火甲於六天； 或剪馘不祥，耀朱兵於四鄙。

the **Divine Immortal within the Dipper** (斗中神仙),
and the **Harmonious Spirits** (和诸灵官).

May **life-preserving virtue** (生德) be extended,
so that we may **forever be free from untimely demise** (永无夭横之虞).
With **devoted hearts**, we take refuge and **sincerely chant** (虔诚赞咏),
paying homage to the **Supreme High Lord of the Azure Enclosure (Tàiwéiyuán)** and the **Great Saint of the Southern Dipper’s Third Palace, the Prolonging-Life True Lord** (南斗第三延寿真君).

the **Third Star** (第三之星),
named **Prolonging-Life** (延寿),

Now, we, the humble **弟子** (disciples),
**symbolically align with the Dipper’s Prolonging-Life True Lord** (象斗延真).

the **Celestial River’s crossing** (河汉之津).

the **savior guiding all beings** (济度群伦).
We pray for **blessings and guidance** (赐降接),
to **escape calamities and misfortunes** (免灾述),

「If the mind remains unbetrayed by falsehood,
then surely the years will grow more enduring.

The True Spirits are manifest and gracious,
and earnest sincerity is the proper way to seek them.

Now, I, the humble one, wish to extend my aged years,
reverently following the radiant and responsive signs of the Dao.

The Dao exists in the form of elusive wonder,
its echoes resonating in sound and shape—
with devoted heart, I take refuge in the **Great Saint of the Southern Dipper’s Fourth Palace, the Equalizing-Benefits and Preserving-Life True Lord** (同益算保生真君),
the **Divine Immortal within the Dipper** (斗中神仙),
and the **Harmonious Spirits** (和诸灵官).

I humbly pray that **Great Compassion** may descend to aid me,
and that my life may flourish like spring’s endless growth;
that my **numerical fate** may greatly increase,
and that my longevity may endure like mountains’ steadfastness.

With bowed head, I take refuge and devoutly praise.
I sincerely vow to the **Supreme and Lofty True Lord of the Southern Dipper’s Fourth Palace, Equalizing-Benefits and Preserving-Life** (高上太微垣、南斗第四保生真君),
the **Fourth Star of the Southern Dipper** (南辰第四之星),
named **Equalizing-Benefits** (益算),
**Master of Vital Qi and Divine Life** (御炁生神).

Now, I, the humble disciple, make offerings to the **Divine Immortal** (仙真).
My resolve is fixed upon the **Southern Dipper’s Court** (南昌),
the **Lofty Hall of the Southern Dipper** (太微之庭).
Only the **Celestial Dipper’s Equalizing-Benefits** (斗天同) can guide my **life and fate** (寿命所经).

I pray that You may **extend Your favor and grant my wish** (垂矜允),
and that my name be **inscribed in the Celestial Register** (丹录书名).
May I be granted **advanced years** (介以耆年),
and **eternally preserved from decline** (永保无倾),
so that my **sincere wish for eternal life** (和愿得长生) may be fulfilled.

We, the humble officials,
with **devoted hearts**, take refuge in the **Great Saint of the Southern Dipper’s Fifth Palace, the Overseeing-Destiny and Removing-Calamities True Lord of Literary Brilliance and Soul-Refinement** (枢度厄文昌炼魂真君),
the **Divine Immortal within the Dipper** (斗中神仙),
and the **Harmonious Spirits** (和诸灵官).

I humbly hear that **vital qi** (二炁) shifts subtly,
and that there are **principles of flourishing and decline** (亦有盛衰之理);
that the **Five Phases** (五行) cycle in succession,
and that **there is no absence of their transformative signs** (岂无消息之机).
Even those with **toilsome lives** (劳生) are not spared **calamitous fate** (厄运).
Since the **True Saints** govern **salvation and guidance** (救度),
the **black-haired masses** (黔黎) should earnestly **revere and purify their hearts** (谨於忱恂).

Now, I, the humble one, fearing **unforeseen misfortunes** (恐惧饬躬),
reverently observing the **auspicious signs** (钦崇观象),
swear to take refuge in the **Great Dao** (大道),
and pray to be **guided by the True Rest** (真休).
With devoted heart, I take refuge in the **Great Saint of the Southern Dipper’s Fifth Palace, the Overseeing-Destiny and Removing-Calamities True Lord of Literary Brilliance and Soul-Refinement** (枢度厄文昌炼魂真君).

I humbly pray that my **destiny** be endowed with **a hundred blessings** (命资百福),
and that **hidden calamities** be **dissipated** (潜消不测之虞);
that my **body may escape the Three Catastrophes** (身度三灾),
and that I may **constantly enjoy the blessings of self-preservation** (常保自身之庆).

With bowed head, I take refuge and devoutly praise.
I sincerely vow to the **Supreme and Lofty True Lord of the Southern Dipper’s Fifth Palace, the Removing-Calamities True Lord** (高上太微垣、南斗第五度厄真君),
the **Fifth Star of the Southern Dipper** (南辰第五之星),
named **Removing-Calamities** (度厄),
**Dissipating Disasters and Calamities** (消荡灾述).

Now, I, the humble disciple, summon the **Divine Immortal** (招真致灵)
and **aspire to the Vermilion Mound** (翘想朱陵),
the **auspicious hour of Literary Brilliance** (文昌之辰).
Only the **Celestial Dipper’s Pivot** (斗天枢) opens the **gates of transformation** (开闱化钧).

I pray that the **flow of Dao and qi** (流道炁) may **control the spirit** (制魄),
and **bind the soul** (拘魂).
May You **grant me long years** (赐以长年),
and **renew my virtuous deeds** (善业增新),
so that my **sincere wish for eternal life** (和愿得长生) may be fulfilled.

We, the humble officials,
with **devoted hearts**, take refuge in the **Great Saint of the Southern Dipper’s Sixth Palace, the Vitality-Overseeing and Life-Sustaining True Lord of the Celestial Mechanism and Grand Register** (机上生监簿大理真君),
the **Divine Immortal within the Dipper** (斗中神仙),
and the **Harmonious Spirits** (和诸灵官).

I humbly hear that **immortals cultivate virtue** (仙人作德),
and **shame ignorance of even one thing** (耻一物之不知);
that the **Sage’s Dao** responds to the times,
and that its **essence is the marvelous function of the heart** (为中心之妙用).」

*«Humbly submitting my heart and establishing my fate,
I receive the *qi* and am endowed with form.
With reverence, I grasp the vital threads of life and creation,
Daring to bow in devotion and pray with sincerity.

Now, I, [Name], with a pure heart in this ritual fast,
Turn my mind toward the Dao, focus my intent on the heavens,
And contemplate the boundless nurturing grace of the Celestial Mechanism.
Though unworthy, I dare not neglect the rites of petition and expiation,
And with a devoted heart take refuge in the **Vitality-Overseeing and Life-Sustaining True Lord of the Celestial Mechanism and Grand Register** (机上生监簿大理真君).

I humbly pray to embody the **virtue/power of the Heavenly and Earthly** (乾坤之生德),
To wield the **Dao’s balancing authority** (运权衡),
To safeguard my **nature and fate** (性命) by entrusting them to harmony,
And to all return under the **Dao’s protective shade** (道荫).

With bowed head and refuge taken,
I devoutly extol and praise in faith.

I believe in and honor the **Supreme True Lord of the High Upper Enclosure** (高上太微垣),
And the **Vitality-Overseeing True Lord of the Southern Dipper’s Sixth Star** (南斗第六上生真君).

With bowed head, I take refuge in the **Southern Dipper’s Sixth Star** (南辰第六之星),
Named **Vitality-Overseeing** (上生),
Who **grasps the celestial principles** (掌握天经).

Now, I, a disciple of the Dao,
Aspiring to the Way and seeking immortality,
Turn toward the **High Celestial Palace** (高宫),
The **court of the Star Record** (星纪之庭).

Behold the **Celestial Dipper’s Vitality** (斗天机),
The **patterned threads of the Heavenly Text** (组织乾文).

I pray You may **bestow Your luminous presence** (垂光景),
And **shelter my body and form** (庇护身形).
May You **oversee and lead the Grand Register** (监领簿录),
**Record my blessings and extend my years** (注福延龄),
So that my **sincere wish for eternal life** (和愿) may be fulfilled.

[End of the *Sutra/Scripture*] (□经).

From past to present, I have worshipped the Dipper,
Offered prayers for the **meritorious deeds of the lamp** (祝灯功德),
And completed the **circumambulation of the seven stars** (并已周圆).

I humbly recognize that the Dao **gathers in the void and responds to all things** (集虚而应物),
That the **celestial transformations generate without end** (生化以无穷),
And that the heavens **display symbols to guide humanity** (垂象以示人),
Revealing **auspicious and inauspicious signs** (吉凶) that may be discerned.

The **True Sovereigns of the Two Offices** (二司之真宰),
Are the **fundamental principles of the ten thousand phenomena** (万象之元纲).
Without **previously attaining the true source** (夙习真源),
How could I now **unfold the treasures of the Dao** (披宝蕴)?

With my **ritual fast official**, [Name], now pure in heart and free of worldly concerns,
I command the **celestial messengers** (羽流),
And set up the **altar beneath the Star Axis** (辰极),
Establishing the **Celestial Dipper’s pattern** (法璇玑而建斗).

The **jade chimes resound with ethereal melodies** (琼钟逸韵),
Truly **communicating with the transcendent realm beyond symbols** (通象外之天);
The **jade seals congeal with misty clarity** (玉篆凝烟),
And I **envision the Saints within the Dipper** (想见斗中之圣).

I humbly hope that the **Six Celestial Offices may radiate in unison** (六司合照),
And that this may **be the cause of all auspicious deeds** (美成众善之因).
May the **Seven Celestial Governors distribute their light equally** (七政分辉),
And **bestow complete blessings upon my household** (均赐全家之福).

Thus, I pray for **countless generations of my ancestors** (亿曾万祖),
Both **distant and near**, both **living and departed** (远化近亡),
To **all depart from the realm of darkness** (尽离幽暗之乡),
And **enter the domain of radiant clarity** (俱入光明之界).
From the **highest celestial canopy** (上穷圆盖) to the **lowest earthly expanse** (下雨方舆),
May we **all bathe in the auspicious blessings of the Dao** (同沐胜缘),
And **ascend together to the Dao’s shore** (齐登道岸).

With bowed head, I take refuge in the **Boundless Dao** (无极大道).

Again, I invoke the **Celestial Sovereign of the Shifting Stars and Dipper’s Rotation** (星移斗转天尊),
The **Celestial Sovereign of Eternal Life and Preserved Fate** (长生保命天尊),
Whose **incomprehensible merits** (不可思议功德) are limitless.

chunks.original_text: 广成先生杜光庭删定 北斗延生清醮仪 凡奉事上真，或不能法天象地，随斗杓而建坛，先违道训也，不如不修之为愈。 建坛之人，非内境清明，召魂集神，听吾命而造化，形止极以伸恳焉，则不足以昭格，物虽丰而无益也，故以祝香为先。 次以叙陈科教，则道俗之伦，不是因缘，而信心衰焉，降圣难矣，故以叙事次之。 既叙事已，不能纪述天文，对扬元妙，则无知北斗之尊也，故以述圣次之。 既述圣已，不陈词则诚不立，故以宣词次之。 然其陈情，请福禳灾，苟非行道发愿，后己先人，无以契合圣意，故以三上香次之。 既上香已，则吾之宿业重罪，不可不忏； 玄功妙善，不可不勉。 不如是，则罪不灭而福不降矣，故以忏悔次之。 既忏悔己，又当思惟七元之德，诚如在焉，乃可以几其佑助，故赞德次之。 既赞德已，又当皈依，以罄吾之诚愿，庶几神必飨焉，故以七皈依次之。 既皈依已，可以浊醪之礼表心，故以三献次之。 既三献已，威仪既备，恩贶卒获，言功送神，仰空存慕，不可以有加也，故以散坛终焉，止系一词。 祝香。 道香、德香、无为自然香，以今热向炉中，奏启大罗三宝天尊，金阙玉皇上帝，中天星主紫微大帝，南辰北斗本命星君，周天河汉列宿群真。 仗此真香，普同供养。 臣今奉为弟子某家，宣科行道，请福禳灾，先当赞叙条章，对扬功德，庶使坛场之内，道俗之伦，悉乃见闻，尽生恭敬。 仰祈恩佑，少契天心，理合敷陈，愿垂昭鉴。 臣闻太上立德，摽清静之高风； 其次立言，演慈悲之妙典。 编诸蕊笈，藏在名山，时显迹以度人，或垂科而拯世。 具述下元之运数，敷陈本命之因缘，开度斯民，归依大道，俾修心而养气，容忏罪以延生，常於降圣之期，辄许精衷之祷。 至以三元八节，本命生辰，严置坛场，恭修斋醮，将严观宇，或在家庭。 持种种之香花，精意已享； 列芬芬之酒果，明德惟馨。 法天地以包罗，像威仪而荐献。 修斋则一日而至七日，随力建功； 命道则一人而至七人，请行法事。 或讽其神咒，或认此真形，归心北斗之尊，稽首紫微之下，伸恳於三官五帝，达诚於九府四司，荐福延生，消灾捍厄，用广无边之福，仰膺莫大之休，念真圣之毋违，见邪宗而莫入，致灾衰之洗荡，同罪业以消除，善果臻身，福寿资命，获超升於十极，兔沉坠於三涂，兹皆启祝之功，莫匪扶持之德。 或有下元生人，国土遇札瘥之厄，瘟疫流行； 岁年逢荒歉之灾，品物不遂。

**The *Comprehensive Daoist Ritual Precepts Collection* – Master Guangtong Du’s Revised *North Dipper Prolonging Life Pure Ritual Rites***

**On Establishing the Ritual Platform**

Should one who serves the **Supreme Celestial** (上真) fail to align with the **Heavenly Symbols and Earthly Patterns** (法天象地), constructing the platform according to the **Dipper’s Ladle** (随斗杓而建坛), they violate the **Dao’s Teachings** (违道训). It is better not to perform the rites at all than to proceed thus. The ritualist must first purify their **inner realm** (内境), clarifying their **spirit and vital essence** (召魂集神), so that the **Ten Thousand Things** respond to their command and transform in accordance with their will. Only then can their sincerity be manifest—otherwise, though offerings may be abundant, they will yield no benefit. Thus, **invoking the incense** (祝香) must come first.

Next, one must **recite the ritual precepts and teachings** (叙陈科教), for without this, the **Daoist and layfolk** will lack proper cause and effect, and their **faith will wane**, making it difficult for the **Celestial Worthies** to descend. Thus, **reciting the ritual’s purpose** follows.

Once the purpose is declared, if one cannot **describe the celestial patterns** (纪述天文) and **proclaim the Primordial Mystery** (对扬元妙), they will fail to honor the **Dipper’s Sovereignty** (北斗之尊). Thus, **narrating the Worthies’ virtues** comes next.

After recounting the Worthies’ virtues, if no **sincere words** are spoken, sincerity cannot stand. Thus, **proclaiming the invocation** follows.

Yet even then, if one’s **petitions for blessings and averting of calamities** are not made with **practiced Dao and vowed aspirations**, placing others before oneself, they cannot align with the **Celestial Intent**. Thus, **offering the three incense** follows.

Once the incense is offered, one’s **past karmic burdens and grave offenses** must be **repented**. The **Mysterious Virtues and Marvelous Benevolence** must be **striven for**. Without this, sins will not be extinguished, and blessings will not descend. Thus, **repentance** follows.

After repentance, one must **contemplate the Seven Celestial Worthies’ Virtues** (七元之德), holding them in mind as if they were present, so that their **auspicious aid may be secured**. Thus, **praising their virtues** follows.

Once the virtues are praised, one must **take refuge**, exhausting their **sincere aspirations**, so that the **Divine Presence may surely accept them**. Thus, **the Seven Refuges** follow.

After taking refuge, one may **offer the coarse wine** (浊醪) as a ritual expression of the heart. Thus, **the three libations** follow.

Once the libations are complete, the **ritual decorum is fulfilled**, the **gracious blessings obtained**, and the **words of thanksgiving** must be spoken to **send the Worthies back to the void**, while **gazing upward in reverence**. Nothing further can be added, so the **dismissal of the platform** concludes the rites—**a single phrase suffices**.

---
**The Invocation of Incense**

*"Dao Incense, Virtue Incense, the Incense of Effortless Naturalness*—now burning in the heated censer—**I summon the Three Treasures of the Great Luo, the Jade Seal Celestial Sovereigns, the Golden Gate Jade Emperor, the Central Heavenly Star Sovereign of Purple Micro, the Native Star Sovereign of the Southern Dipper and Northern Dipper, and all the Celestial Worthies of the Encompassing Heavenly River and Constellations.**

With this **true incense**, I **universally offer reverent homage**.

I, **your humble disciple of the [Surname] household**, now **proclaim the ritual precepts and practice the Dao**, petitioning for blessings and averting calamities. First, I shall **recite the ritual’s chapters and extol the virtues**, so that within this **ritual platform**, both **Daoists and layfolk** may witness and hear, and all generate **reverent devotion**.

I **humbly pray for celestial favor**, seeking even a slight alignment with the **Heavenly Will**. It is proper to **lay this out in detail**; I pray you **deign to inspect it with favor**.

I have heard that the **Most High established Virtue**, setting forth the **lofty winds of purity and stillness**; the next was to **establish Teachings**, expounding the **marvelous scriptures of compassion**.

They compiled the **Daoist canons**, hiding them in **sacred mountains**, sometimes revealing their traces to **deliver beings**, or bestowing **ritual precepts to save the world**.

They **detailed the cycles of the Lower Primordial** and **expounded the causes of one’s native star**, opening the way for all people to **take refuge in the Great Dao**, so that they might **cultivate the heart and nourish the qi**, confess sins to **prolong life**, and at the **times when Celestial Worthies descend**, always **grant sincere prayers**.

At the **Three Primordial Festivals and Eight Seasonal Nodes**, at one’s **native star’s birth hour**, they **solemnly established the ritual platform**, **reverently observing fasts and pure rites**, whether in **temple halls or domestic settings**.

They held **various incense and flowers**, offering them with **sincere devotion**; they arranged **fragrant wines and fruits**, their **virtues shining bright**. They **modeled the rites after Heaven and Earth**, **embodying the decorum of awe** in their offerings.

When observing fasts, they **extended from one day to seven**, according to their **capacity to perform merit**; when commissioning the Dao, they **gathered from one person to seven**, inviting them to **conduct the rites**.

Some **recited the numinous spells**, others **acknowledged the true forms**, directing their hearts to the **Dipper’s Sovereignty**, bowing beneath the **Purple Micro**, **humbling themselves before the Three Officials and Five Emperors**, **reaching sincerity to the Nine Palaces and Four Departments**, **offering blessings to prolong life**, **dissipating calamities and warding off misfortune**, **broadening boundless blessings**, and **receiving the greatest of celestial favor**. They **pondered the True Worthies’ unerring will**, **avoided false sects**, **purified the decay of calamities**, **shared in the dissolution of sins**, **attained virtuous fruits for the body**, and **secured blessings and longevity for life**, **ascending to the Ten Extremes**, **never sinking into the Three Abysses**. All this is the **power of invocation**, none other than the **support of the Worthies’ virtues**.

Yet there are those of the **Lower Primordial** born into lands afflicted by **epidemic scourges**, where **plagues spread**; or years struck by **famine and scarcity**, where **harvests fail and goods are not produced.**"
