「道门科范大全集卷之七十一竟 道门科范大全集卷之七十二

**Daoist Rituals: Completion of Volume Seventy-One, Initiation of Volume Seventy-Two**
**The Daoist Ritual of Repentance and Soliciting Virtue**
**Evening Dao Practice**

The **ritual proceedings commence upon the altar** [法事升坛] in proper form.
Each pays homage to the **Master** [师] with reverent devotion as prescribed [存念如法].
**Proclaim the sacred incantations** [宣卫灵咒]—
The **Five Stars** [五星] shine resplendent, auspicious **qi** [瑞气] ascends in flight.
The **Primordial Beginning** [元始] gathers spirits, **Heaven and Earth** [天地] revolve in harmony.
The **Jade Talismans and Sacred Nodes** [玉符宝节] resound with celestial commands, their mysteries profound.
**Hurl flames and display might** [掷火扬威], banishing all malevolence without trace.
**Ten thousand demons cower** [万魔振伏], their chaos dissolved like scattered petals.
**Subduing monstrous forces and annihilating evil** [摧怪灭恶], the **Dao qi** [道炁] circulates harmoniously.
**Divine radiance illuminates the night** [神光照夜], dispelling all darkness.
**All Worthies descend in order** [万神降格], borne upon the winds of **auspicious scenery** [扇景乘飙].

**Pray for the blessings of all beings** [掌生咸遂], **divine grace pervades the land** [惠遍神州],
And **unites with the Dao’s True Essence** [与道合真].
**Strike the sacred drum twenty-four times** [鸣法鼓二十四通].

The **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Beginning Three Qi** [无上三天玄元始三炁],
The **Highest Dao Lord** [太上道君],
The **Highest Venerable Lord** [太上老君]—
**Summon forth** [召出] from my **body** [臣等身] the **Three Five Functionaries** [三五功曹],
The **Left and Right Attendants and Messengers** [左右官使者],
The **Left and Right Incense Bearers** [左右捧香],
The **Cavalry of the Dragon’s Bell** [铎龙骑吏],
The **Golden Attendant Spirits** [侍香金童],
The **Jade Maidens who Transmit Words and Scatter Flowers** [传言散花玉女],
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** [五帝直符],
The **Incense Officials of the Direct Sun** [直日香官],
**Thirty-six assembled officials** [合三十六人]—
**All emerge** [出].

The **emerging officials** [出者] don their **solemn attire and resplendent robes** [严装显服],
Their **headdresses and sashes adorned with trailing ribbons** [冠带垂缨],
And **open the sacred Daoist gate and summon the local deities** [关启玄坛土地],
The **spirits of the domain and territory** [方域神真].

I now **perform the evening Dao practice** [落景行道],
**Devotedly offering this as sincere aspiration** [谨奉为入意].
My **earnest petitions** [诸情悃] have already been recorded and presented [已录奏闻].
I pray that the **Highest Dao’s True Essence of the Ten Directions** [太上十方至真道炁],
The **Sacred Treasure’s Auspicious Radiance** [灵宝瑞光]—
May **descend and flow into my body** [下降，流入臣身中],
So that my **petitions may swiftly reach** [臣所启] and **ascend directly before** [速达径御]
The **Highest Dao of the Supreme Ultimate** [太上无极大道],
The **Jade Sovereign of the Celestial Emperor** [昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Invoke the sacred ranks** [请称法位].
**I, [Certain Daoist of the Orthodox Unity]**, along with the **assembled officials of the altar** [合坛众官等],
**Devotedly present my sincere supplications** [谨同诚上启] to:

The **Three Pure Ones, Most Holy** [三清上圣],
The **Ten Extremes’ Highest Worthies** [十极高真],
The **Highest Lords of the Ten Directions** [十方太上],
The **Sacred Treasure Celestial Lords** [灵宝天尊],
The **Celestial Lords of Eradicating Faults and Annihilating Guilt** [消愆灭罪天尊],
The **Celestial Lords of Great Compassion and Prolonging Life** [大慈延寿天尊],
The **Celestial Lords of Eternal Life and Preserving Command** [长生保命天尊],
The **Nine Heavens’ Natural-Generating Divine Lords** [九霄自然生神上帝],
The **Supreme Celestial Emperors of Salvation** [度人太皇],
The **Thirty-Two Heaven Celestial Emperors** [三十二天上帝],
The **Celestial Lords of All Heavens** [诸天天尊],
The **Celestial Emperors of All Heavens** [诸天上帝],
The **Upper Pure Worthies of the Sun, Moon, Stars, and Milky Way** [上清日月星斗河汉群真],
The **Three Officials and Four Saints** [三官四圣],
The **Five Teachers and Three Provinces’ True Lords** [五师三省真君],
The **Nine Heaven Celestial Marshal** [九天天曹],
The **Worthy Lords of All Positions** [诸位真君],
The **Great Teachers of Past Dynasties Who Transmit the Lineage and Teach the Dao** [历代传宗启教诸大师真],
The **Thunderous and Celestial Tiger Lords, Divine Physicians of All Departments** [雷霆神虎天医诸司官将],
The **Highest Daoist Officials and Cavalry of All Stages and Scriptures** [太上诸阶经箓中仙官将吏],
The **Named Mountain Worthies and Cave Deities of the Dao** [天下名山洞府得道神仙],
The **Great Emperor of the Underworld’s Acid Fields** [地府酆都大帝],
The **Holy Multitude of the Dark Realm** [幽阴圣众],
The **Great Emperor of the Water Realm’s Azure Grove and Elixir Forest** [水府扶桑丹林大帝],
The **True Worthies of the Wave Gardens** [浪苑真仙],
The **Five Sacred Emperors of the Five Peaks and Human Realm** [人元五岳五天圣帝],
The **Territorial Deities of the Acid Fields** [酆都地祇],
The **Commanding Generals of the Eight Directions** [合干元帅],
The **Yearly Lords of Soil and Fire** [太岁土火],
The **Temperate Officials of the Holy Multitude** [温司圣众],
The **Directors of the State, County, and City** [州县城隍主者],
The **Deities of Local Temples, Shrines, and Auspicious Courts** [当境庙社神祇福庭土地真官],
The **All Officials of the Ritual Altar** [法坛诸司官将],
The **Direct Talismans and Functionaries of the Four Boundaries** [四界直符功曹使者],
The **Directors of the Ritual Feast** [醮筵主宰],
And the **assembled spirits of this seat** [合座威灵].

**Humbly gazing upon the vast compassion** [恭望洪慈],
And **penetrating the luminous discernment** [洞回昭鉴].
I and the **multitude of officials** [臣与众等] **revere and accept the sacred blessings** [仰承圣泽],
**Obtaining the True Wind’s grace** [得被真风],
**Clad in the True Texts of the Three Caverns** [披三洞之真文],
**And bearing the Jade Inspectors of the Nine Pure** [奉九清之玉检].
Morning and evening, **I rise in purity and retire in vigilance** [晨兴蠲洁，夕惕修持],
For since **receiving the Dao** [受道之初],
I have **pledged to cultivate virtue as my foundation** [约以建功为本].

Again, **I solemnly present my humble petitions** [再肃威仪於清夜，恭陈凡悃於紫宸],
**Gazing upon the True Dao’s Essence** [瞻望真斿],
**Guiding and welcoming the Auspicious Scenery** [导迎景贶],
**To pray for divine oversight** [将祈监盻],
**And offer my pure and precise ritual** [用副斋精],
**With sincere Daoist words** [行道词诚],
**Devotedly presented for proclamation** [谨当宣奏].

**Proclaim the words** [宣词].
**Carefully examine the language and perceive the sincerity** [谛详词语，灼见诚情].
**Trusting in the Dao’s True Compassion** [谅叶真慈],
**It will surely be attended to by the Holy Oversight** [必关圣监].

**I, [Certain Daoist of the Orthodox Unity]**, **have encountered this fortunate era** [叨逢景运],
**And obtained the reverence of the True Lineage** [获仰真宗].
I **owe the vast grace of the Sacred Master** [荷圣主之洪恩],
**And have entered the Daoist path** [出家入道];
I **have received the compassionate blessings of the Celestial Lord** [沐天尊之慈泽],
**And have purified my resolve to cultivate** [洁志修行].
I **wear the Sacred Texts** [佩受灵文],
**And have studied the Mysterious Teachings** [禀修玄教],
Yet **I have not yet attained the subtle perfection of the Dao** [未造冲玄之妙],
**And my practice has fallen short** [有亏习炼之功].
**My faults are evident** [罪目易彰],
**And the fields of merit are hard to construct** [福田难构].
**Through sincere devotion, I present my doubts** [用专诚而荐疑],
**Hoping to be guided by my transgressions** [庶引咎以自新],
**And solemnly purify the altar and ritual space** [恭祓坛场，精严醮席].

**Following the Three Caverns’ format of burning and cultivating** [法三洞焚修之格],
**And observing the Ten Directions’ rituals of morning and evening** [披十华朝会之仪],
**I recite the sacred sounds** [演畅法音],
**And expound upon the vast rituals** [敷扬大范].
**All Heavens attend in unison** [莫不诸天齐到],
**The Five Emperors speak in order** [五帝列言],
**And the merits of my devotion are recorded and rewarded** [赏录功勤],
**With the promise of swift response** [克期通感].

**With this evening Dao practice** [以今落景行道],
I **request the assembled ritual spirits** [请法众等] to **take this first offering of incense** [运兹初捻上香].
I pray that this **incense smoke** [香烟]—
**Ascends directly to the heavens** [腾空径上]—
To **offer homage to the Nine Grades of High Worthies** [供养九品高真],
And the **Ten Directions’ Most Holy** [十方上圣].

I and the **multitude of officials** [臣等] **return my body, my spirit, and my life** [皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits** [以是功德]—
To **bless the current Emperor** [上祝今上皇帝].

**Humbly praying** [伏愿]:
That the **Heaven of Yao** [尧天] **may spread its vast coverage** [广覆],
And the **Sun of Shun** [舜日] **may increase its brilliance** [增明].
That **life may be preserved, its foundation unshaken** [保生延不拔之基],
And the **Five Sacred Mountains may be fortified** [五山巩固];
That **the Lord of Life may grant boundless longevity** [司命益无疆之寿],
And **my lifespan may stretch across countless eons** [历劫绵长].
That the **nation may be secure and its people prosperous** [国安民丰],
**Rejoicing in the era of great peace** [欣乐乎太平之世];
That **I may be loyal and my children filial** [臣忠子孝],
**And we may foster harmony in the years of abundance** [敦睦乎大有之年].
That **wild beasts may be subdued and evil paths avoided** [懈豸触邪],
And **the crooked may be bent while the treacherous are struck** [屈轶指佞].
That **auspicious clouds may appear and celestial omens manifest** [庆云呈瑞，景曜示祥].
That the **Heavenly Might may shake the herds of dogs and sheep** [天威振犬羊之群],
And the **Five Armies may be at peace** [五兵战戢];
That the **Earthly Realm may restore the breadth of its boundaries** [土宇复关河之广],
And the **Nine Territories may share the same script** [九域同文].

**This incense-burning ritual** [今故烧香] **is performed in reverence for the Dao Lord’s Most Holy and True Worthies** [自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I **ascend to the realm of Non-Action** [升入无为],
And **harmonize with the Dao’s True Essence** [和与道合真].

**With this evening Dao practice** [以今落景行道],
I **request the assembled ritual spirits** [请法众等] to **take this second offering of incense** [运兹二捻上香].
I pray that this **incense smoke** [香烟]—
**Ascends directly to the heavens** [腾空径上]—
To **offer homage to the Nine Grades of High Worthies** [供养九品高真],
And the **Ten Directions’ Most Holy** [十方上圣].

I and the **multitude of officials** [臣等] **return my body, my spirit, and my life** [皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits** [以是功德]—
To **flow back to my Daoist household** [归流道士某家],
Where the **Nine Mysteries may dissolve my ignorance** [九玄滞识],
And the **Seven Ancestors’ Sacred Rituals** [七祖神仪]—
**All may accept the boundless grace** [咸承浩荡之恩],
And **together attain the fruit of effortless transcendence** [并证逍遥之果].

**The Vermilion Terrace and Crimson Gate** [丹台绛阙]—
**I may serve the Jade Sovereign** [景侍玉皇],
And the **Cloud Palaces and Mist Pavilions** [霞殿云房]—
**I may attend the Celestial Emperor’s court** [亲朝大帝].
I may **listen to the Celestial Balance’s harmony and find self-realization** [听天钧而自得],
**And chant the Great Cavern’s scriptures to forget worldly cares** [吟大洞以忘机].
**Grace extends without end** [惠被无涯],
**And blessings are bestowed upon future generations** [福资来裔].」

**Mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits** [芝英百灵]
Naturally **converge**, with **all Worthies assembling** [众真交会],
**Before this incense furnace.**

I **pray that the Ten Directions’ Celestial Youth and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女]

chunks.original_text: 三师四友，俱陟仙阶； 九夜三途，咸登道果。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今落景行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养九品上仙，十方上圣。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流道士某身中。 伏愿道性圆明，圣心开发。 行运不逢於坎坷，相貌长新； 流年永绝於凶衰，鬼神荫佑。 喜怒不留於胸臆，精神内固於丹田。 养浩如春，住世生身之难老； 虚心契道，超凡入圣以长存。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，命魔，步虚，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛众官等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，道经师三宝天尊，上穷圆盖之高真，下极方舆之主宰，醮筵列圣，一切真灵。 恭望洪慈，洞回昭鉴。 臣等伏闻混沦荡荡，变通莫得而为先；
chunks.translated_text:
「The Three Teachers and Four Companions,
All ascend the **Celestial Stages** [仙阶];
The Nine Nights and Three Paths,
All attain the **Daoist fruits** [道果].

Now I burn incense,
**To take refuge in the Sutra-Honored Great Saints** [经尊大圣], **seeking the Perfect Virtue of the Most Authentic Ones** [众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I rise into the **Formless** [无形],
And **harmony aligns with the True Dao** [和与道合真].
With my present **falling into the luminous Dao** [落景行道],
I **invite the Law-Bearing Assembly** [请法众等] to carry this **three-pinched incense** [三捻上香],
**May these incense fumes ascend directly to the heavens** [愿此香烟，腾空径上],
**To venerate the Nine Grades of Supreme Celestial Ones** [供养九品上仙], **and the Most Venerable Saints of the Ten Directions** [十方上圣].
**We devote our bodies, spirits, and lives** [臣等皈身、皈神、皈命],
And **dedicate these merits**
[以是功德]—
**To flow back into Daoist Certain One’s life** [归流道士某身中].
**Humbly wishing the Dao-nature be perfectly illuminated** [伏愿道性圆明], **and the Sacred Heart be revealed**.
**May our actions meet no obstacles** [行运不逢於坎坷], **and our appearance remain forever youthful** [相貌长新];
**May our years forever avoid calamity and decline** [流年永绝於凶衰], **and the spirits and gods shield and bless us** [鬼神荫佑].
**May joy and anger not linger within our hearts** [喜怒不留於胸臆],
And **our vital essence be steadfast within the elixir field** [精神内固於丹田].
**Nurturing vastness like spring’s renewal** [养浩如春],
**May we dwell in this world with a youthful, immortalized body** [住世生身之难老];
**With an empty heart attuned to the Dao** [虚心契道],
**May we transcend the mundane and enter the sacred, enduring forever** [超凡入圣以长存].

Now I burn incense,
**To take refuge in the Teacher-Honored Great Saints** [师尊大圣], **seeking the Perfect Virtue of the Most Authentic Ones** [众至真之德].
**After attaining the Dao**, I rise into the **Formless** [无形],
And **harmony aligns with the True Dao** [和与道合真].
**Repentance** [忏方], **subduing the demon of life** [命魔], **walking the void** [步虚]—
**Three reverences** [三礼].
**Repeatedly proclaiming the sacred ranks** [重称法位].
**The assembled officials and I**, in solemn sincerity, **now make this offering**:
[具位臣某与合坛众官等，谨重诚上启]
To **Primordial Heavenly Lord of Natural Voidness** [虚无自然元始天尊],
**Supreme Daoist Lord** [太上大道君],
**Supreme Old Lord** [太上老君],
**Celestial Jade Emperor of Highest Heaven** [昊天玉皇上帝],
**Gouchen, the Heavenly Sovereign Emperor** [勾陈天皇大帝],
**Purple Microdipper Emperor of the Northern Pole** [北极紫微上帝],
**Empress Hou Tu, the Earthly Sovereign who Upholds the Dao and Follows the Law** [承天效法后土皇地祇],
**Heavenly Lord of the Three Treasures of Daoist Scripture** [道经师三宝天尊],
**The Most Authentic Ones who span the highest vault** [上穷圆盖之高真],
**And the sovereigns who rule the four cardinal directions** [下极方舆之主宰],
**The arrayed deities of the ritual feast** [醮筵列圣],
**And all true spirits** [一切真灵].
**Reverently beholding their boundless compassion** [恭望洪慈],
And **their penetrating insight and clear discernment** [洞回昭鉴].
**We humbly hear that the primordial chaos is vast and boundless** [臣等伏闻混沦荡荡],
**Ever-changing yet without measure, and it alone is the first principle** [变通莫得而为先].」

chunks.original_text: 芒角明明，开辟於斯而是判。 皇人笔传於大梵，后圣总着於灵图。 大象聿成，洪源肇判。 散精则开明三景，下镇则敷落五篇。 典诰旁流，渊微远布，万神敬听，品物咸资。 臣等生禀至愚，服膺上学，遵依玄教，对越上真。 自禀命以修身，常饰躬而肄业。 金文玉札，粗识於筌蹄； 圣域仙阶，莫窥乎影响。 唯坚诚信，冀获感通，真格敷陈，尊灵必降。 道士某托身道域，切庇霄真，未能谢绝於尘寰，徒自沉迷於世网。 参经佩戒，虽加策励之心； 密行阴功，尚缺进修之力。 机灵素昧，众善弗臻，习气未除，诸缘常染。 细行分门於八百，未见指归； 威仪备列於三千，曾无精进。 业根深固，道果难成。 未登悟解之门，恐堕尘劳之障。 今则首体投地，晨夕告天，稽按明科，严陈净醮，经开玉笈，像礼金容，灵音振空洞之章，黎土集宝珠之众。 香传七驿，达诚悃於虚皇； 灯灿九微，破幽昏於夜壑。 曲尽黑修之志，不违朝赞之勤。 以格真灵，克谐昭应，万神侍卫，三界监观，奏简玄都，列言丹陛。 伏觊勅下三界，普告诸天，降福流恩，延生保命。 智通玄悟，永息昏迷。 厚禄遐龄，常居法荫。 和平冤咎，消解灾凶。 五行无刑克之殃，三景息照临之会。 上解璇玑天文宿曜十二分次之厄，下解山川岳渎九宫八卦分野之灾，夙罪积愆，深殃重衅，前冤往债，故杀误伤，三业六情，无边过咎，自今忏谢，咸乞荡除。 上愿帝道永安，洪基益茂，三光朗照，四序均调，包舜海以涵濡，广尧曦而照烛。 五风十雨，常滋物产之丰； 八谷九蚕，大足农民之望。 气无缪盭，岁兔灾氛，普及群生，旁资九有，成承道果，俱契真乘，则上明天尊大慈之化，下副弟子谢罪之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来落景行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
「The radiant **Mángjué** [芒角] stars mark the moment when the primordial chaos was opened and the **Pì** [辟] was thus distinguished.
The **Huángrén** [皇人] transmitted this through the **Great Brahman** [大梵], and the **later sages** [后圣] compiled it in the **divine diagrams** [灵图].
The grand symbol was established, and the vast source was first distinguished.
When **scattered**, it illuminates the **Three Manifestations** [开明三景]; when **settled below**, it spreads the **Five Classics** [下镇则敷落五篇].
The **imperial edicts** [典诰] flow abundantly, and the **profound mysteries** [渊微] are widely disseminated—
All deities respectfully listen, and all beings derive their blessings.
We, the humble disciples, born with utmost stupidity,
Devoted to the **highest learning** [上学],
Following the **mysterious teachings** [玄教],
And confronting the **Supreme Truths** [上真],
Have since receiving our **Daoist precepts** [命] striven to cultivate our bodies,
Ever adorning ourselves and diligently practicing our studies.
Though we have **roughly grasped** [粗识] the **golden scriptures and jade decrees** [金文玉札] from the **fishing nets and hoofprints** [筌蹄],
We have never **glimpsed** [莫窥] the **sacred realms and celestial stages** [圣域仙阶].

Only through **sincere faith and unwavering trust** [坚诚信信],
Do we hope to **attain divine communion** [冀获感通],
For **the True Pattern** [真格] will be revealed,
And the **august spirits** [尊灵] will surely descend.

A **Daoist practitioner** [道士] of humble station,
Residing in the **Daoist domain** [道域],
Seeking shelter under the **celestial truths** [霄真],
Yet unable to **sever ties with the dusty world** [谢绝於尘寰],
Still **entangled in worldly snares** [沉迷於世网].
Though we **recite scriptures and bear precepts** [参经佩戒],
Our resolve is **insufficiently driven** [虽加策励之心];
Though we **practice secret virtues and hidden merits** [密行阴功],
Our strength remains **lacking in advancement** [尚缺进修之力].
Our **natural aptitude** [机灵] is **obscured** [素昧],
And we have yet to **attain all virtues** [众善弗臻].
Our **habitual tendencies** [习气] are not yet **cleansed** [未除],
And we are **constantly entangled in karmic causes** [诸缘常染].

We have **delved into the minute practices** [细行] of the **Eight Hundred Schools** [八百],
Yet **no guiding principle** [未见指归] has been revealed;
We have **assembled the full array of ritual decorum** [威仪备列] of the **Three Thousand Precepts** [三千],
Yet **no true diligence** [曾无精进] has been achieved.
Our **karmic roots** [业根] are **deeply entrenched** [深固],
And the **fruition of the Dao** [道果] is **difficult to attain** [难成].
We have not yet **entered the gate of enlightenment** [未登悟解之门],
Lest we **fall into the obstructions of worldly toil** [恐堕尘劳之障].

Now, we **prostrate ourselves at the feet of the Most High** [首体投地],
Morning and evening **reporting to Heaven** [晨夕告天],
Examining the **clear precepts** [稽按明科],
And **earnestly presenting the pure ritual feast** [严陈净醮].
We **open the jade scripture** [经开玉笈],
And **establish the golden ritual** [像礼金容].
The **celestial harmonies** [灵音] resound within the **emptiness of the cosmos** [振空洞之章],
And the **common folk** [黎土] gather the **jewels of the assembly** [集宝珠之众].

The **fragrance** [香] is conveyed through the **seven stations** [七驿],
Reaching the **sincere devotion** [达诚悃] of the **Heavenly Sovereign** [虚皇];
The **lamps** [灯] shine brightly in the **Nine Celestial Regions** [九微],
Dispelling the **darkness and obscurity** [破幽昏] of the **nightly abyss** [夜壑].
We **fulfill our aspirations for profound cultivation** [曲尽黑修之志],
And **do not neglect our morning praises** [不违朝赞之勤].
To **harmonize with the True Spirits** [格真灵],
And **achieve resonance with the Radiant Responses** [克谐昭应],
All deities attend as **guardians** [万神侍卫],
And the **Three Realms** [三界] observe as **sentinels** [监观].
We **petition the Mysterious Capital** [奏简玄都],
And **address the Red Celestial Throne** [列言丹陛].

Humbly awaiting the **imperial decree** [勅] descending to the **Three Realms** [三界],
We **universally proclaim to all heavens** [普告诸天],
Seeking **blessings and benevolent flow** [降福流恩],
And **prolonging life while safeguarding existence** [延生保命].
May **wisdom penetrate and profound enlightenment endure** [智通玄悟],
And **eternally dispel our ignorance** [永息昏迷].
May **rich rewards and long lifespan** [厚禄遐龄] be ours,
And may we **always dwell under the protection of the Law** [常居法荫].
May **harmony and peace dissolve grievances and debts** [和平冤咎],
And **dissipate calamities and misfortunes** [消解灾凶].
May the **Five Phases** [五行] suffer **no destructive or oppressive calamities** [无刑克之殃],
And the **Three Manifestations** [三景] cease **illuminating the gatherings of misfortune** [息照临之会].

May we **resolve the celestial afflictions** [上解] of the **Lunar Lodges and Solar Stations** [璇玑天文宿曜十二分次之厄],
And **dispel the terrestrial disasters** [下解] of the **mountains, rivers, and cosmic divisions** [山川岳渎九宫八卦分野之灾].
May **ancient sins and accumulated offenses** [夙罪积愆],
**Deep calamities and heavy retributions** [深殃重衅],
**Past grievances and debts incurred** [前冤往债],
And **wrongful killings and unintended injuries** [故杀误伤],
As well as the **endless transgressions of the Three Karmas and Six Emotions** [三业六情],
All be **expiated from this day forth** [自今忏谢],
And **universally cleansed** [咸乞荡除].

Our **uppermost aspiration** [上愿] is that the **Imperial Dao** [帝道] may **forever be secure and flourishing** [永安洪基益茂],
And that the **Three Lights** [三光] may **shine brightly** [朗照],
While the **Four Seasons** [四序] are **harmoniously regulated** [均调].
May it **encompass the vast seas of Shùn** [包舜海以涵濡],
And **broaden the radiant light of Yáo** [广尧曦而照烛].
May the **Five Winds and Ten Rains** [五风十雨]
**Ever nourish the abundance of all things** [常滋物产之丰];
And may the **Eight Grains and Nine Silkworms** [八谷九蚕]
**Greatly benefit the hopes of farmers** [大足农民之望].

May the **qi** [气] be **without errant influence** [无缪盭],
And the **Year of the Hare** [岁兔] be **free from calamitous mists** [灾氛].
May this **extend to all living beings** [普及群生],
And **benefit the Nine Realms** [旁资九有].
May we **fulfill the Daoist path of inheritance** [成承道果],
And **all attain the True Vehicle** [俱契真乘].
Thus, we **acknowledge the Most High’s compassionate transformation** [上明天尊大慈之化],
And **align with the disciple’s sincere repentance** [下副弟子谢罪之诚].
We **respectfully submit this prayer** [谨启以闻].

**Twelve Aspirations** [十二愿] **completed.**
**Returning to the furnace** [复炉].

We **solemnly gather** [谨摄] the **fragrance officers and envoys** [香官使者],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** [左右龙虎君],
And the **attendant spirits of incense** [侍香诸灵官].
They shall **guide us to the places of our past transgressions** [当令臣向来落景行道之所],
Where **golden nectar and azure jade** [自然生金液丹碧],
**Mushrooms and herbs of a hundred spirits** [芝英百灵],
And **all True Ones** [众真] will **converge in assembly** [交会],
At this **incense and fire furnace** [在此香火炉前].

May we **wish that the Ten Directions of Celestial Youths and Jade Maidens** [十方仙童玉女]
**Attend to the fragrant vapors** [接侍兰烟],
And **transmit our sincere prayers** [传臣向来所启之诚]
**Swiftly to the Supreme Dao of the Boundless Ultimate** [径御至真无极大道]—
Before the **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Clarity** [昊天玉皇上帝御前].

**Exiting the hall to chant** [出堂颂].
**Exiting the door** [出户].」

**And the sovereigns who rule the four cardinal directions** [下极方舆之主宰],
**The arrayed deities of the ritual feast** [醮筵列圣],
**And all true spirits** [一切真灵].
**Reverently beholding their boundless compassion** [恭望洪慈],
And **their penetrating insight and clear discernment** [洞回昭鉴].
**We humbly hear that the primordial chaos is vast and boundless** [臣等伏闻混沦荡荡],

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之七十二竟 道门科范大全集卷之七十三 道士修真谢罪仪 设醮行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星郁灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四□，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘飙散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翁。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今设醮延真，烧香行道，谨奉为入意，其 诸情悃，已录奉闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与合坛众官等，谨同诚上启，三清上圣，十极高真，十方太上灵宝天尊，消愆灭罪天尊，大慈延寿天尊，长生保命天尊，九霄自然生神上帝，度人太皇，三十二天上帝，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，上清日月星斗河汉群真，三官四圣，五师三省真君，九天天曹，诸位真君，历代传宗启教诸大师真，雷霆神虎天医诸司官将，太上诸阶经箓中仙官将吏，天下名山洞府得道神仙，地府酆都大帝，幽阴圣众，水府扶桑丹林大帝，阆苑真仙，人元五岳五天圣帝，酆都地祇，诸司元帅、太岁土火、温司圣众、州县城隍主者，当境庙社神祇，观庭土地真官，法坛诸司官将，四界直符功曹使者，火池表钱神吏，醮筵主宰，一切威灵。 恭望洪慈，普回渊鉴。 臣闻大道无象，握万物於重霄； 真宰何私，育群生於率土。 绳愆紏缪，昭如影响之随； 福善祸淫，密若枹鼓之应。 视之不见，感而遂通。 臣等奉按冲科，恪修妙典，五节香浮於翠辇，袅袅飞轻； 九微烟散於含光，煌煌慧炬。 花开琼蕊，果荐金盘。 万象澄清，雅奏步虚之韵； 九门高敝，逼迎策景之仪。 伏愿紫炁浮空，虚光远烛。 九色之节，軿罗八景之中； 十绝之旛，摇曳九霄之上。 云车风马，鹤驭鸾骖，辞大有之妙庭，降人间之真馆，愍群生之有请，录片善之不遗，亨于克诚，开以自见。 臣与合坛官众，下情无任，虔切至恭，祇迎鹤驭。 降圣，初献，散花。 再称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微大帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，醮筵两班，合属高真。 伏望洪慈，洞回照鉴。 臣闻日月星辰，在碧汉瑶空之上； 仙灵主宰，居清虚林麓之间。 或管摄於灵坛，或隐居於福地，或镇一方之首，或为五土之尊，录善恶之二书，举功过之两簿，故无私蹈，惟道是从。 伏念臣等早簉真风，夙依道化，受法门之庥荫，寄琳馆以安居，惭亡十善之因，何赞三清之惠。 自从披戴，几度光阴，未能感彻於神明，动有轻违於科戒。 初勤末怠，有始无终，奉法心邪，慈仁不正，焚香失节，存念违言，虑三彭暗奏於愆辜，惧九府明书於罪目。 今则辄倾丹悃，广列香灯，请天界空界之群真，延地府水府之众圣，五岳主宰，十洞灵官，愿歆苹藻之羞，锡以椿松之寿，先觊恩覃帝道，福及尧天，圣明与日月同辉，雨露共乾坤普润，臣忠子孝，主圣父慈，干戈静而四海来宾，法轮转而九天垂化。

The **Complete Daoist Rituals and Precepts** [《道门科范大全集》] concludes in Volume Seventy-Two,
Volume Seventy-Three begins: **Daoist Rituals for Cultivating the True Way and Offering Repentance** [《道士修真谢罪仪》].

**Establishing the Ritual and Practicing the Dao** [《设醮行道》]:
The **ritual procedures ascend the platform as prescribed** [《法事升坛如式》].
Each **respectfully invokes the Master’s guidance in accordance with the Dao** [《各礼师存念如法》].
**Declaring the Sacred Protective Incantations** [《宣卫灵咒》],
The **Five Stars shine forth**, illuminating the **Five Directions** [《五星列照，焕明五方》].
**The Water Star suppresses calamities**, while **Wood Virtue brings prosperity** [《水星郁灾，木德致昌》].
**The Wandering Star dispels misfortune**, and **Mars wards off weapons** [《荧惑消祸，太白辟兵》].
**The Constellation Star governs the Four Quarters**, benefiting **family and nation** [《镇星四□，家国利亨》].
**Names inscribed on jade tablets**, **records filed in the Imperial Archives** [《名刊玉简，字录帝房》],
**Riding the gusts and scattering the mists**, ascending to the **vast heavens** [《乘飙散景，飞腾太空》].
**Moving through the unseen realms**, **wandering and feasting in the Ten Directions** [《出入冥无，游宴十方》].
**Five clouds hover overhead**, summoning **Divine Beings and restraining the winds** [《五云浮盖，招神摄风》].
**Commanding all spirits**, **protecting the Daoist Sage** [《役使万灵，上卫仙翁》].
**Striking the Daoist drum twenty-four times** [《鸣法鼓二十四通》].

The **Supreme Three Heavens** [《无上三天》], **Primordial Heavenly Sovereign of the Mysterious Three** [《玄元始三炁》],
**The Most High Dao Lord** [《太上道君》],
**The Most High Old Lord** [《太上老君》],
Now **summon forth** from my body:
The **Three Five Officials** [《三五功曹》],
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** [《左右龙虎君》],
The **Left and Right Attendants of Incense** [《左右捧香》],
The **Waystation Dragon and Mounted Officials** [《驿龙骑吏》],
The **Incense-Serving Golden Boys** [《侍香金童》],
The **Jade Maidens who Scatter Flowers and Transmit Messages** [《传言散花玉女》],
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** [《五帝直符》],
The **Incense Officials who Guide the True Sun** [《直日香官》],
And the **Thirty-Six Officials in total** [《合三十六人出》].

Those who **exit** shall **don formal attire and display their rank**, **headdress and trailing ribbons** [《出者严装显服，冠带垂缨》],
**Opening the Daoist Hall to the Land and Soil Spirits**, **inviting the Divine Beings of the Domain** [《关启玄坛土地，方域神真》].
I now **establish the Ritual and summon the True Way**, **burning incense and practicing the Dao** [《臣今设醮延真，烧香行道》],
**Solemnly offering my sincere prayers** [《谨奉为入意》].
All my **true and earnest sentiments** [《诸情悃》] have been **recorded and respectfully presented** [《已录奉闻》].
I pray that the **Supreme True Daoists of the Ten Directions** [《十方至真道炁》],
**The Sacred Treasures and Auspicious Light** [《灵宝瑞光》],
May **descend and flow into my body** [《下降，流入臣身中》],
So that my **prayers may swiftly reach** the **Most High Dao of the Boundless Ultimate** [《太上无极大道》],
And the **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Clarity** [《昊天玉皇上帝》] before.

**Requesting the invocation of the Daoist ranks** [《请称法位》].
I, **a humble servant of such-and-such rank** [《具位臣某》], together with the **assembled officials of the Ritual Platform** [《与合坛众官等》],
**Solemnly and sincerely present our prayers** [《谨同诚上启》],
To the **Three Pure Ones and Most Sacred** [《三清上圣》],
The **Ten Extremes of High Daoists** [《十极高真》],
The **Supreme Daoist Lords of the Ten Directions** [《十方太上灵宝天尊》],
The **Heavenly Sovereigns of Eradicating Transgressions and Annihilating Sins** [《消愆灭罪天尊》],
The **Heavenly Sovereigns of Great Compassion and Extended Longevity** [《大慈延寿天尊》],
The **Heavenly Sovereigns of Eternal Life and Preserving Command** [《长生保命天尊》],
The **Nine Heavens’ Natural and Spontaneous Divine Sovereign** [《九霄自然生神上帝》],
The **Supreme Sovereign who Guides Sentient Beings** [《度人太皇》],
The **Thirty-Two Heavens’ Sovereign** [《三十二天上帝》],
The **Heavenly Sovereigns and Sovereigns of All Heavens** [《诸天天尊，诸天上帝》],
The **High Daoists of the Upper Pure Realm, including Sun, Moon, Stars, and Milky Way** [《上清日月星斗河汉群真》],
The **Three Officials and Four Saints** [《三官四圣》],
The **Five Teachers and Three Provinces’ True Lords** [《五师三省真君》],
The **Nine Heavens’ Heavenly Officials** [《九天天曹》],
The **Divine Lords of All Ranks** [《诸位真君》],
The **Great Masters of Past Dynasties who Transmit the Lineage and Teachings** [《历代传宗启教诸大师真》],
The **Divine Beings of Thunderous Roars and Sacred Tiger Healers** [《雷霆神虎天医诸司官将》],
The **Daoist Officials and Attendants of All Stages of Sacred Scriptures** [《太上诸阶经箓中仙官将吏》],
The **Named Mountain Spirits and Cave Immortals who Achieve the Dao** [《天下名山洞府得道神仙》],
The **Great Emperor of the Underworld** [《地府酆都大帝》],
The **Holy Assembly of the Dark and Shady** [《幽阴圣众》],
The **Great Emperor of the Eastern Red Pine and Jade Forest** [《水府扶桑丹林大帝》],
The **True Immortals of the Lingyan Pavilion** [《阆苑真仙》],
The **Five Sacred Mountains and Five Sacred Peaks’ Holy Emperors** [《人元五岳五天圣帝》],
The **Earthly Deities of the Underworld** [《酆都地祇》],
The **Commanding Generals of All Departments** [《诸司元帅》],
The **Yearly Deity and Soil Fire** [《太岁土火》],
The **Holy Assembly of the Warm Season** [《温司圣众》],
The **Local and County City Deities and Masters** [《州县城隍主者》],
The **Divine Beings of the Current Domain’s Temples and Shrines** [《当境庙社神祇》],
The **Land and Soil Spirits of the Courtyard** [《观庭土地真官》],
The **Officials and Generals of the Daoist Platform** [《法坛诸司官将》],
The **Direct Talismans and Officials of the Four Quarters** [《四界直符功曹使者》],
The **Spiritual Attendants of the Fire Pool and Ritual Offerings** [《火池表钱神吏》],
The **Hosts of the Ritual Feast** [《醮筵主宰》],
And **all mighty and sacred spirits** [《一切威灵》].

**With reverence, I await the Great Compassion** [《恭望洪慈》],
**And pray for the profound understanding** [《普回渊鉴》].
I hear that the **Dao is formless**, yet **it governs all things in the lofty heavens** [《大道无象，握万物於重霄》];
The **True Sovereign has no bias**, **nurturing all sentient beings in the world** [《真宰何私，育群生於率土》].
**Transgressions and entanglements are clearly recorded**, like **shadows following their forms** [《绳愆紏缪，昭如影响之随》];
**Rewards for good and punishments for evil are swift**, like **responses to the beating of drums** [《福善祸淫，密若枹鼓之应》].
**They are unseen yet observed**, **felt yet communicated** [《视之不见，感而遂通》].
I, together with my **assembled Daoist officials**, **devotedly follow the Dao’s principles** [《奉按冲科，恪修妙典》],
**Diligently practicing the sacred precepts**:
The **Five Incense Stems float upon the verdant carriage**, **winding and ascending with light grace** [《五节香浮於翠辇，袅袅飞轻》];
The **Nine Incense Stems disperse as sacred light**, **radiant and illuminating** [《九微烟散於含光，煌煌慧炬》].
**Flowers bloom in jade petals**, **fruits are presented in golden platters** [《花开琼蕊，果荐金盘》].
**All phenomena are clear and pure**, **harmoniously performing the music of the Floating Void** [《万象澄清，雅奏步虚之韵》];
**The Nine Gates are high and open**, **urgently receiving the talismans of the Wandering Star** [《九门高敞，逼迎策景之仪》].

The **Nine-Colored Incense Stems** shall **float within the Eight Auspicious Scenes** [《九色之节，軿罗八景之中》];
The **Ten Sacred Banners** shall **wave above the Nine Heavens** [《十绝之旛，摇曳九霄之上》].
**Cloud-Carriage and Wind-Horse**, **Crane-Drawn Chariot and Phoenix-Attended Coach** [《云车风马，鹤驭鸾骖》],
**Departing from the Mysterious Court of Great Profusion**, **descending to the True Lodgings of Mortals** [《辞大有之妙庭，降人间之真馆》],
**Compassionately responding to the pleas of all sentient beings**, **recording even the slightest merit without omission** [《愍群生之有请，录片善之不遗》],
**Granting blessings to those of sincere virtue**, **opening the path to self-realization** [《亨于克诚，开以自见》].

I, **a humble servant** [《臣某》], together with the **assembled Daoist officials** [《与合坛官众》],
**With boundless sincerity and utmost reverence**, **solemnly await the Crane-Drawn Chariot** [《下情无任，虔切至恭，祇迎鹤驭》].
**The Holy Descent begins** [《降圣》],
**The First Offering is made** [《初献》],
**The Flowers are Scattered** [《散花》].
**Requesting the invocation of the Daoist ranks again** [《再称法位》].

The **Most High Dao Lord** [《太上大道君》],
The **Most High Old Lord** [《太上老君》],
The **Heavenly Sovereign of Jade Clarity** [《昊天玉皇上帝》],
The **Great Emperor of the Celestial Mansion** [《勾陈天皇大帝》],
The **Great Emperor of the Northern Pole** [《北极紫微大帝》],

The **Heavenly Sovereigns and Sovereigns of All Heavens** [《诸天天尊，诸天上帝》],
The **Two Ranks of the Ritual Feast**, **all belonging to the High Daoists** [《醮筵两班，合属高真》].

**With reverence, I await the Great Compassion** [《伏望洪慈》],
**And pray for the profound understanding** [《洞回照鉴》].
I hear that the **Sun, Moon, Stars, and Planets** dwell **above the Azure Sky and Jade Void** [《臣闻日月星辰，在碧汉瑶空之上》];
The **Immortal Spirits and Sovereign Masters** reside **within the Pure and Serene Forest’s slopes** [《仙灵主宰，居清虚林麓之间》].
Some **oversee the Sacred Daoist Platform**, some **hide in auspicious lands** [《或管摄於灵坛，或隐居於福地》],

**Recording the two books of good and evil**, **holding the two ledgers of merits and transgressions** [《录善恶之二书，举功过之两簿》],
Thus **they have no private favoritism**, **only the Dao is followed** [《故无私蹈，惟道是从》].

**In reflection**, I and my **assembled Daoist officials** have **long embraced the True Dao’s winds**, **early relied on the Dao’s transformation** [《伏念臣等早簉真风，夙依道化》],

**My devotion to the Dao is flawed**, **my compassion and virtue are not upright** [《奉法心邪，慈仁不正》],

chunks.original_text: 五风十雨，高跻汤禹之年； 海晏河清，式协羲轩之化。 臣等叨承师训，缪处职司，凡有皈投，理宜关奏，况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 词旨具宣，情诚恳切。 披陈肝胆，倾写肺心，冀伸臣子之衷，庶谢谦躬之分。 伏乞虚皇上圣，穹昊高真，咸赐威光，同垂盻响。 然愿道士某名书上善，命保长生，阴功累积於三千，灵药克成於九地。 紫文绛简，镌题久视之年； 丹策青编，注上无穷之算。 仙曹纪籍，鬼录除名。 八景灵书，得炼炁修真之术； 五文玉篆，获飞腾冲举之因。 道行日隆，灵根顿悟。 金木水火之厄，永不侵伤； 青黄赤白之灾，长希解免。 其或五行否泰，三命迍邅，厄会相仍，衰危造次，今生过咎，前世余殃，仰希含照之恩，咸赐赦原之惠。 次乞先师炼度，宗派超升，离生死之苦门，证逍遥之道岸，同宗法属，学道门人，俱沾浩浩之恩，克协生生之庆。 臣某等下情无任，再拜，酒陈亚献。 举散花。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微大帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，上穷圆盖之高真，下极方舆之主宰，有灵有圣，今古师宗，醮筵两班，合属群真。 恭望洪慈，洞回渊格。 臣闻虚无自然，乃三清之妙统； 南极司录，寔九府之总权。 掌吉凶祸福之文，判长短死生之命，功则添而过还灭，善既录而恶必除，故无阿党之门，难用苟求之事。 切念臣等下元脆质，三惑凡躯，虽承师匠之缘，指谕升腾之路。 其奈灵文宝法，七百载而一传； 凤篆龟图，六甲周而一遇。 非人不授，非道不传。 渺渺清虚，迢迢紫府，总得长生之路，应无短折之人。 仰赖一志大乘，弃捐三惑，去离爱缠之网，咸除烦恼之缘。 自然道合三生，人全得一，守身神而养寿，斥尸鬼以全龄。 玄象难寻，有为未舍，犹寄神仙之宇，尚居尘浊之间。 道寡变通，习疏隐显，性昏迷於至理，行不到於幽微。 返致三灾，来侵四大，按天师谢罪之式，建灵宝告真之坛。 仰叩玄关，聿陈丹悃。 伏愿三官玉籍，赦违经破戒之愆； 五帝琼篇，释故作误违之罪。 然后功德山之法水，洗涤尘泥； 智慧林之真风，昭苏朽木。 破冤力士，保全持戒之身； 护法神王，匡佑修行之士。 门人十哲，徒弟四科，悟三教之玄微，睹众真之户牖。 所冀真庭隆盛，四海钦崇，感至圣之亲游，传无为之妙诀。 重念臣等在法门之日浅，或求师之未深，不知教法之宗，罕识威仪之理。 遂致为人作福，多无立应之功； 依教行持，鲜有感通之效。 切虑四司捡罪，上帝言非，以今皈命首陈，愿希恩宥。 更冀祈求感格，教法广被於十方； 礼念朝真，经诰普宣於四远。 人天敬仰，坛信清芳，皆沾润泽之恩，尽获庬鸿之福。 臣等无任再三皈命恳请之至，酒陈终献。 散花。 具位臣某，谨重诚上启，上谢九清十极，万圣千真，醮筵感降，一切真灵。 臣等伏闻圣真遐邈，妙隐玄中之玄； 道境高虚，端居象外之象。 仗熏芳而按景，惟至恳以达神，元造无私，洞回昭鉴。 臣等广陈香炷，仰叩真仙，自揣行藏，多生遭遇，处履吾皇之化，宣扬大道之风，福赞人天，溥资存没，身披羽服，足履星坛，已逾十载之荣，早忝百生之幸。

The Five Winds and Ten Rains bestow upon me the longevity of Tang and Yu;
The seas grow tranquil, the rivers clear, harmonizing with the transformations of Xī and Xuān.

We, Your humble servants, have been graced by the Master’s teachings,
And entrusted with our duties—
For all who seek refuge, it is proper to report them.
How much more so when we receive Your sacred words—
How dare we fail to present them above?

**The Edict is proclaimed.**
The Edict is fully proclaimed; our sincerity is earnest and sincere.

We lay bare our hearts and lungs,
Pour forth our deepest intentions,
Hoping to express the loyalty of Your servants and children,
And to repay the humility of our station.

We humbly pray to the **Celestial Sovereign of the Void and Natural**,
To the **Highest Dao Lord**,
To the **Supreme Old Lord**,
To the **Jade Emperor of Heavenly Sovereignty**,
To the **Great Emperor of the Gourd Cluster**,
To the **Great Emperor of the Northern Pole’s Purple Micro**,
To the **Earthly Sovereign of the Posterior Soil**,
To all the **Heavenly Lords**,
To all the **Heavenly Emperors**,
To the **Highest Worthies of the Round Canopy** above,
To the **Sovereign Masters of the Four Quarters** below—
To all the **Spiritual and Holy Ones**, past and present,
To the **Teachers and Ancestors of the Ritual Assembly**—
That Your boundless compassion may pierce the depths and return with wisdom.

We have heard that the **Void and Natural** is the **Mystic Sovereignty of the Three Pure Ones**,
And that the **Southern Pole’s Record-Keeper** truly holds the **Total Authority of the Nine Departments**.
They oversee the **Records of Fortune and Misfortune**,
Judge the **Length of Life and Death**—
Where merit is added, guilt is erased;
Where virtue is recorded, vice is removed.
Thus, there is no door of partiality,
Nor room for frivolous petition.

We, Your humble servants, are of frail **Lower Elemental** constitution,
Our bodies burdened by the **Three Delusions**.
Though we have received the Master’s guidance,
And been pointed toward the path of ascent—
Alas! The **Sacred Scriptures and Precious Laws** are transmitted but once in seven hundred years;
The **Phoenix Seals and Tortoise Diagrams** appear but once in six cycles of the Heavenly Stems.
They are not given to mortals,
Nor transmitted without the Dao.

In the boundless **Pure Void**, in the distant **Purple Bureaucracy**,
The path to **Long Life** is obtained—
Yet none shall meet **Early Death**.

We rely on the **Great Vehicle of Single Aspiration**,
Abandoning the **Three Delusions**,
Freeing ourselves from the **Net of Attachment**,
And severing the **Causes of Affliction**.

Thus, the Dao naturally aligns with the **Three Existences**,
And the person attains **Oneness**.
By preserving the **Spirit-Body**, one nurtures longevity;
By banishing the **Ghostly Corpse**, one secures full years.

Yet the **Mysterious Symbols** remain elusive,
And **Conditional Beings** have not yet been abandoned—
Still dwelling in the **Abode of Immortals**,
Yet lingering in the **Filth of the Dust**.

The Dao is scarce in its **Adaptability**,
And our practices are **Negligent in Concealment and Manifestation**.
Our nature is **Obscured by Ultimate Truth**,
Our conduct **Falls short of Profound Subtlety**.

Thus, the **Three Calamities** return to assail,
And the **Four Great Elements** are invaded.
We follow the **Heavenly Master’s Ritual of Atonement**,
And establish the **Soul-Jewel Altar of True Declaration**.

We kneel and supplicate at the **Mysterious Gate**,
And pour forth our **Sincere Prayers**.

We humbly pray that the **Jade Ledgers of the Three Officials** may pardon our **Violations of Scripture and Precepts**,
And that the **Jade Tablets of the Five Emperors** may absolve our **Past Mistakes and Unintentional Offenses**.

Then, the **Law-Waters of the Merit-Mountain** shall wash away our **Dusty Filth**,
And the **True Winds of the Wisdom-Forest** shall revive our **Decayed Wood**.

The **Breakers of Grievances** shall preserve our **Steadfast Vows**,
And the **Protectors of the Law** shall uphold the **Practitioners of the Path**.

The **Ten Sage Disciples** and the **Four Categories of Adepts** shall perceive the **Mysteries of the Three Teachings**,
And behold the **Doors and Windows of the Multitude of Worthies**.

We hope that the **True Court** may flourish and be revered by the **Four Seas**,
And that we may be graced by the **Personal Guidance of the Most Sacred**,
Transmitting the **Mystic Instructions of Non-Action**.

Yet we reflect that our time in the **Law-Gate** is brief,
And our seeking of the Teacher has been shallow.
We do not grasp the **Essence of the Teaching**,
Nor fully recognize the **Principles of Ritual Decorum**.

Thus, though we act to benefit others,
Our merit yields no immediate response;
Though we follow the Teachings in practice,
Our devotion rarely brings manifestation.

We fear the **Four Departments of Punishment**,
And the **Heavenly Rebuke for False Speech**—
Now, as we humbly prostrate and confess,
We pray for Your mercy and forgiveness.

We further hope that our petitions may be answered,
That the **Teachings may spread throughout the Ten Directions**,
And that the **Ritual Offerings to the Worthies** may be proclaimed far and wide.

May all **Humans and Celestials** hold us in reverence,
May the **Altar’s Faith** remain pure and fragrant—
All shall be nourished by Your **Bountiful Grace**,
And attain the **Favor of the Phoenix and the Great Bird**.

We, Your humble servants, are overwhelmed by our **Repeated Prostrations and Earnest Petitions**.

**The Wine Offering is presented and the final libation poured.**
**Flowers are scattered.**
**The Ritual Positions are reaffirmed.**

We, **Your humble servant of such-and-such rank**, together with the **Assembled Officials of the Altar**,
Solemnly and sincerely petition above—
To the **Nine Pure Ones and Ten Extremes**,
To the **Ten Thousand Saints and Thousand Worthies**,
To the **Descending Spirits of the Ritual Assembly**,
To all the **Holy Beings**—

We have heard that the **Sacred Worthies are distant and exalted**,
Their **Mysteries hidden within the Mysterious**,
Their **Dao-Realm lofty and void**,
Residing in the **Symbol beyond Symbols**.

We rely on the **Fragrance of Incense** to reach their presence,
And with utmost sincerity, hope to touch their **Divine Response**.
The **Original Creator is without bias**,
And their **Piercing Insight** is all-encompassing.

We arrange the incense sticks in abundance,
And kneel before the **True Immortals**,
Reflecting on our **Conduct and Concealments**—
Our countless lifetimes of encounters,
Our adherence to the **Transformations of Your Majesty**,
Our propagation of the **Winds of the Great Dao**,
Our blessings bestowed upon **Humans and Celestials**,
Our **Universal Beneficence in Life and Death**—
Since we first donned the **Feathers of Immortality**,
And stepped upon the **Star Altar**,
We have surpassed **Ten Years of Honor**,
And early been graced by the **Fortune of a Hundred Lifetimes**.

The **Fragrance of Incense** is offered with reverence and sincerity,
To pay homage to the **Nine Celestial Worthies** and **Ten Extremes**,
To the **Ten Thousand Saints** and **Thousand True Ones**,
And to beseech the **Divine Response** at the ritual feast.

We **humble ourselves**, lamenting that the **Three Passes** remain unsettled,
And that the **Single Nature** still lies in darkness.
Before our eyes, the **Five Desires** and **Six Emotions**—
How can we even briefly abandon them?
Within our bodies, the **Three Calamities** and **Nine Afflictions**—
How can we not feel shame at their approach?

Again, we fear that our learning is dimmed by **Divine Clarity**,
Our **Essential Teachings** obscured by dulled perception.
How can we recognize the **Principle of Forgetting the Trap**?
How can we enter the **Gate of Liberation from Illusion**?
Morning and evening, we ponder deeply—
To whom shall we first reveal our sincerity?

Thus, we devoutly adhere to the **ritual precepts and laws**,
And humbly present our **heartfelt petitions**,
To atone for past **transgressions and offenses**,
And to resolve future **calamities and encounters**.

We earnestly pray that **Great Benevolence** be widely bestowed,
And that **Divine Rain and Dew** shower their profound grace;
That **Abundant Blessings** extend far and wide,
And that **Mountain and River’s Favor** be generously bestowed.

May **Azure Dragon** and **White Tiger** ever provide **sheltering protection**,
And may **Luminous Crane** and **Mysterious Tortoise** grant **longevity and auspicious blessings**.

Again, we fear that gazing upon the stars and saints to touch the **Extraordinary Dao**,
Wearing strange garments and speaking of the **Way**,
**Exaggerates the Six Bandits** and **increases the Five Tastes**,
Disrespecting **Master and Sage**,
Lightly defying **Heaven and Earth**,
And **recklessly climbing**—
All of which harm the **sentient beings**.

We pray that through the **power of incense and flame**,
We may all attain the **path of dispelling calamities**,
And that the **Spiritual Passes** may be brightly illuminated,
Our **Enlightened Nature** made clear,
To obtain the **Scriptures of Eternal Life and Longevity**,
And to master the **Alchemy of the Golden Elixir**.

The **Precepts of our Ancestral Master** are followed,
And the **Teachings of our Lineage** are upheld.
All depart from the **Land of Darkness**,
And enter the **Realm of Clarity**.

**Flying, swimming, crawling, and moving creatures**,
All **sentient beings** with awareness,
Rely upon the **Dao’s Benevolence**,
And ascend together to the **Domain of Longevity**.

We, your humble disciples, gaze upon the **Law** with fixed attention,
And meditate upon the **Great Void**.
Deeply regretting the **dust of worldly affairs**,
We struggle to retain the **Divine Footsteps**.

Our **lower emotions** cannot bear the **longing for attachment**—
Thus, we bow in reverence and offer our **sincere devotion**.

**Offering the Sage**, **transforming wealth**.
**Forward and return**, **dedicating merit**.

chunks.original_text: 道士修真谢罪十方忏仪 东方忏谢不能知道之罪 众等伏闻木生於三，得成形於天地； 帝出乎震，育万物於屯蒙。 青龙司岁钥之先，北斗转天关之始，少阳所莅，盛德难名。 今谨有佩箓道士某等， 夙代清修，今生庆会，感师恩而畀付，依教法以操持。 尚惭根器浅微，灵源障塞。 行道而不能知道，未尝观空； 养形而不能忘形，动皆执相。 或驰说而自满自圆，或闻道而若存若亡。 富贵贫贱之间，不能齐物； 喜怒好恶之触，必致焚和。 何以混天人之同涂，了生死之一致，负上圣奖成之大德，违玄师化度之格言，结罪目於三官，落仙名於五帝。 敬伸忏谢，仰勾恩怜，谨赍香花法信供养之仪，至心皈命东方无极太上灵宝天尊，九炁天君，东乡神仙，诸灵官。 仰惟上德好生，至仁利物，青书宥过，东华定仙，开虚无自然之心，授太一含真之道。 匪迟匪疾，绵永永而不穷； 无门无旁，洞皇皇之四达。 化天下回心而向道，均圣人一视以同仁。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 南方忏谢不能为国报恩之罪 众等伏闻虚中作离，万物相见而长养； 次二日火，大人继明而照临。

**Daoist Ritual of Repentance for Cultivators of the True Way**
**Repentance for Ignorance of the Dao**

**Eastward Repentance for the Sin of Not Knowing the Dao**

We, the humble Daoists bearing talismans, humbly hear that wood arises from the Three [Heavenly Stems], taking form beneath Heaven and Earth; the Sovereign emerges from *Zhen* [Thunder], nurturing all things in *Tun-Meng* [Difficulty and Obscurity]. The Azure Dragon governs the first key of the year, the Big Dipper marks the beginning of celestial passage, and the Minor Yang presides with boundless virtue beyond naming.

Now, we, the Daoists of such-and-such lineage, have long practiced purity in cultivation. In this lifetime, blessed by the Teacher’s grace, we have received transmission and uphold the teachings with reverence. Yet, we remain ashamed of our shallow roots and obstructed spiritual source.

Though we walk the Dao, we do not know it truly;
Though we nurture the form, we cannot forget it.
We move, yet cling to appearances.
Some boast in idle speech, self-satisfied;
Others hear the Dao yet grasp it faintly—now present, now absent.
Between wealth and poverty, we fail to equalize all things;
At the touch of joy, anger, likes, and dislikes, we burn with discord.

How then do we mingle with Heaven and humanity in the same path,
Realize the unity of birth and death,
Betray the Great Sage’s nurturing virtue,
Defy the Mysterious Teacher’s transformative precepts?
Thus, we are recorded in the Three Officials’ ledgers,
And our names are struck from the Five Emperors’ registers.

With deepest reverence, we now repent.
We humbly offer incense, flowers, and the rites of faith,
With sincere hearts turning to the East:
The **Supreme Soul of the Limitless, the Most High Treasure of Heaven**,
The **Nine-Qi Heavenly Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Court Immortals**,
And all **Spiritual Officials**.

We pray to the Most High Virtue, who cherishes life,
The Boundless Mercy that benefits all beings,
The Green Scriptures that pardon transgressions,
The Eastern Heavens that decree immortality—
Opening the heart to the Natural Void,
Granting the Dao of the Supreme One’s Embracing Truth.

Neither delayed nor hastened, it endures eternally;
Without gates or barriers, it permeates the Four Reaches.
Transforming the world, turning hearts toward the Dao,
Equalizing all under the Sage’s compassionate gaze.

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the Formless,
And harmonize with the True.

---
**Southward Repentance for the Sin of Not Repaying the Nation’s Grace**

We humbly hear that from the Void arises *Li* [Fire],
And all things emerge to grow and be nourished.
On the second day, Fire follows,
The Great Person continues the radiance, illuminating all.

chunks.original_text: 交於木而化育生灵，资於水而陶铸品汇，至士所禀，大功克成。 今谨有佩箓道士某等，生处中华，身陶圣化，惟皇在御，听民所归。 俾承清净之风，有补圣明之化。 而以栖迟苟活，休息自安，无怀道抱德之实以化人，乏还淳返素之用而复古，饰人间之礼乐，希世上之功名，空叨水土之恩，滥处簪裳之列。 南官仙籍，无梵行之可书； 衡岳阴曹，记愆尤之无数。 惟圣人南面而听治，惟国家盛德以御天，既请命於苍穹，敢归心於分野。 谨赍香花法信供养之仪，至心归命南方无极太上灵宝天尊，三炁天君，南乡神仙，诸灵官。 仰惟盛德在火，圣人向明，享寿考於万民，绵本支於百世。 次愿佩箓道士某等，六司宥过，三炁流光。 在藏为心以虚，受人而神应常静； 於时为夏纳阴，居内而火亦不流。 俾能抱一而守中，庶可长生而度世。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 西方忏谢不能补报祖先父母之罪 众等伏闻严凝而义，物咸赖以西成； 尊正而和，民率归於兑说。 先肃杀而辅大化，后静退而表少阴。 顺天应人，刚中柔外。 今谨有佩箓道士某等，世熏善念，身黍玄司，感父母之生成，荷祖宗之积累。 而未闲禁戒，多昧禀修，八节不进於表章，五腊不严於祭祀。 才分形器，生生皆自於亲恩； 虽隔古今，世世有亏於子职。 顾父母慈而无憾，惟天地公而无私。 自作之孽难逃，不孝之愆无赦，敢忘悔艾，恭致首陈，驰诚於七宝金门，注想於西那玉国，乃上智问报恩之境，依元尊尝说法之宫。 谨资香花法信供养之仪，至心归命西方无极太上灵宝天尊，七炁天君，西乡神仙，诸灵官。 仰惟金光下烛，玉简昭回，祖先俱沐於升迁，父母各增於殊胜。 次愿佩箓道士某等，西龟授道，谒仙母而炼甲庚； 金虎居离，交真龙而入戊己。 无暴其气而真元自守，不劳乎神而寿命无期，魔试不侵，心源自定。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 北方忏谢不报师恩之罪 众等伏闻太极未分，含三才而混沌； 五行既判，因一炁以循环。 阳伏於内而万物藏，辰居其所而众星拱，枢机造化，主宰生灵。 今谨有佩箓道士某等，识匪生知，理难自得，获处道家之列，率由师匠之恩。 始自训提，知孝悌忠信之大本； 迄于传度，指虚无清净之真乘。 德参天地之高，恩踰父母之大。 而以尊承素昧，给养有亏，负抠衣授道之恩，违歃血引盟之誓，泄机微於尘世，传道秘於非人。 至於遇祸以招殃，尚复怨师而咎道，想罪书於九府，恐身谢於三官，谓迎师则北面以尊崇，故谢过望坎宫而恳请。 谨赍香花法信供养之仪，至心归命北方无极太上灵宝天尊，五炁天君，北乡神仙，诸灵官。 仰惟北辰掌握於仙名，壁宿主张於道术。 宗师传度，永隆弘教之心； 保举监盟，益务成人之美。 无师不度，有翼必飞，俱诣功行之图，共证升仙之果。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 东北方忏谢行教宣科不精不法之罪 众等伏闻神功不宰，为天地之始终； 妙本自然，运阴阳之动止。
chunks.translated_text:
From the Wood we receive transformation and nurture for all living beings,
By the Water we are shaped and refined in character and destiny.
The virtuous Sage draws upon these—
Great deeds accomplished through their embrace.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,
Born in the Central Land, steeped in the Sage’s radiance,
Bow to the Sovereign’s benevolent rule,
Hearing the people’s devotion and return.

Thus, we may bear the breath of purity,
And aid the Sage’s bright and virtuous way.

Yet, lingering in idle life, content with fleeting ease,
We lack the embrace of the Dao or cultivation of virtue to transform others,
Failing to restore the ancient simplicity or return to the uncarved,
Adorning worldly rites and seeking fame in mortal affairs,
Emptyly claiming the nation’s grace,
And presumptuously standing among the Daoist ranks.

Our names are not inscribed in the Southern Celestial Register,
And the Yin Mountains record our countless transgressions.

Only the Sage sits facing south to govern,
Only the nation’s great virtue commands Heaven’s mandate.
Having invoked the decree from the boundless sky,
We dare now submit our hearts to the stars’ appointed regions.

With utmost reverence, we offer incense, flowers, scriptures, and devotional rites,
And bow our sincerest vows to the **Southern** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Three Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Southern** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge that **virtue** thrives in Fire,
The Sage turns toward radiance,
Granting longevity and reverence to all people,
Rooting blessings across generations.

Next, we pray that we Daoists with talismans at our sides,
May find pardon in the **Six Ministries**,
And receive the **Three Breaths’** luminous grace.

In our **inner alchemy**, may we **cultivate** the **Heart** with **emptiness**,
And **nourish** the **Spirit** so that it remains ever tranquil.
In the **outer alchemy** of summer, may we **harness** the **Yin**,
And **restrain** the Fire within so that it does not scatter.

Thus, we may **embrace** the **One** and **guard** the **Middle**,
And **hope** to attain **longevity** and **transcend** the world.

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

---
**Westward Repentance for the Sin of Not Repaying Ancestors’ and Parents’ Grace**

We humble ones hear that the **严凝** [austerity and solemnity] is **义** [righteous],
All things depend upon it to achieve their **西成** [westward fulfillment].

The **正** [upright] and **和** [harmonious] prevail,
The people return to the **兑说** [Joyful Teachings of the West].

First, it enforces **杀** [rigor and restraint] to aid the **Great Transformation**,
Later, it **静退** [withdraws in stillness] to manifest the **少阴** [Lesser Yin].

In accordance with Heaven and the people,
Firm within, yielding without.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,
Though lacking innate wisdom, we recognize the **大本** [Great Principles] of filial piety, fraternal duty, loyalty, and trust,
And through transmission, we point to the **真乘** [True Vehicle] of the Natural Void and purity.

Our **virtue** rivals that of Heaven and Earth,
Our **grace** surpasses that of parents.

Yet, we fail to uphold the **禁戒** [precepts],
And neglect the **禀修** [cultivation] of the Dao.
The **Eight Festivals** do not advance our **表章** [manifestation of virtue],
And the **Five Sacrifices** are not performed with **严** [rigor].

Though our **才分** [talents and fates] and **形器** [bodies and destinies] are bestowed by our parents’ life-giving grace,
Even across the ages, we have **亏** [failed] in our **子职** [duties as offspring].

Yet, parents’ love is tender and without reproach,
And Heaven and Earth are just yet without favor.

Our own sins cannot be escaped,
And **不孝** [filial disobedience] has no pardon.
Daring to forget repentance and atonement,
We now humbly confess our faults,
Sending our sincerity to the **七宝金门** [Golden Gate of the Seven Treasures],
And focusing our thoughts on the **西那玉国** [Jade Realm of the Western Retribution].

We seek the **境** [domain] of the **上智** [Superior Sage] to repay our **恩** [grace],
And rely upon the **元尊** [Primordial Venerable One]’s **说法** [teaching hall].

With utmost reverence, we offer incense, flowers, scriptures, and devotional rites,
And bow our sincerest vows to the **Western** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Seven Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Western** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge the **金光** [Golden Light] that illuminates below,
The **玉简** [Jade Tablets] that clearly return our deeds.
Our ancestors all receive blessings of **升迁** [promotion and ascent],
Our parents each gain **殊胜** [exceptional merit].

Next, we pray that we Daoists with talismans at our sides,
May receive the **Western** **Tortoise’s** transmission of the Dao,
And visit the **仙母** [Immortal Mother] to refine our **甲庚** [first and sixth heavenly stems].

May the **金虎** [Golden Tiger] dwell in **离** [the Fire position],
And we **交** [interact] with the **真龙** [Authentic Dragon] to enter **戊己** [the Earth position].

Without **暴** [excessively] depleting our **气** [vitality],
May our **真元** [True Essence] be **守** [preserved],
And without **劳** [overworking] our **神** [Spirit],
May our **寿命** [lifespan] be **无期** [boundless].

Free from **魔试** [demonic temptations],
Our **心源** [source of the heart] may be **自定** [self-stabilized].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

---
**Northward Repentance for the Sin of Not Repaying the Master’s Grace**

We humble ones hear that before the **太极** [Supreme Polarity] was divided,
It contained the **三才** [Three Powers: Heaven, Earth, Man] in **混沌** [primordial chaos].

When the **五行** [Five Phases] were distinguished,
They followed the **一炁** [Single Breath] in their **循环** [cyclical course].

The **阳** [Yang] lies dormant within,
And all things are **藏** [concealed].
The **辰** [stellar positions] reside in their places,
And the **众星** [multitudes of stars] bow in reverence,
The **枢机** [pivotal mechanisms] of transformation,
The **主宰** [lords] who govern all living beings.

Now, we humble Daoists with talismans at our sides,
Though lacking innate wisdom, we follow the Master’s guidance.
From the **训提** [early instruction],
We know the **大本** [Great Principles] of filial piety, fraternal duty, loyalty, and trust,
And through **传度** [transmission],
We are directed toward the **真乘** [True Vehicle] of the Natural Void and purity.

Our **德** [virtue] ascends to the heights of Heaven and Earth,
Our **恩** [grace] surpasses that of parents.

Yet, we fail to **尊承** [properly honor] the **素昧** [unseen and profound],
And our **给养** [nourishment] is insufficient.
We **负** [betray] the **抠衣授道** [Master’s humble teaching],
And **违** [violate] the **歃血引盟** [oath of blood and covenant].

We **泄** [leak] the **机微** [subtle secrets] to the **尘世** [mundane world],
And **传** [reveal] the **道** [Dao] to those **非人** [unworthy].

Even when **遇祸** [facing calamity] and **招殃** [inviting retribution],
We still **怨师** [blame the Master] and **咎道** [accuse the Dao],
Fearing our **罪书** [record of sins] in the **九府** [Nine Palaces],
And dreading our **身谢** [life’s termination] at the hands of the **三官** [Three Officials].

We believe that to **迎师** [invite the Master] is to face north in **尊崇** [reverence],
Thus, we confess our faults and plead with the **坎宫** [Kan Palace of the North].

With utmost reverence, we offer incense, flowers, scriptures, and devotional rites,
And bow our sincerest vows to the **Northern** Boundless **Supreme** **Jewel** **Heavenly** **Venerable** **Lord**,
The **Five Breaths** Heavenly Sovereign,
The **Northern** **Mansion** **Divine** **Immortal**,
And all the **Spiritual Officials**.

We humbly acknowledge that the **北辰** [Northern Dipper] holds the **仙名** [names of the Immortals],
And the **壁宿** [Wall Constellations] oversee the **道术** [arts of the Dao].

The **宗师** [Master] transmits the Dao,
And **永隆** [eternally upholds] the **弘教** [great teaching].
Through **保举** [recommendation] and **监盟** [oversight of covenants],
They **益务** [further strive] to **成人之美** [fulfill the potential of others].

Without a **师** [Master], there is no **度** [transmission],
And even the **有翼** [winged] must **飞** [soar].
All together we aspire to the **功行** [meritorious deeds],
And share in the **升仙** [ascension to immortality] **果** [realization].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

---
**Northeastward Repentance for the Sin of Imperfect Teaching and Transmission**

We humble ones hear that the **神功** [Divine Function] does not **宰** [rule],
It serves as the **始终** [beginning and end] of Heaven and Earth.
The **妙本** [Wondrous Source] is **自然** [self-so],
It governs the **动止** [movement and rest] of **阴阳** [Yin and Yang].

chunks.translated_text:
We stretch forth the **Hand of Transformation** [伸其转物之手],
And bestow the **Dragon of Emergence** [授以出震之龙],
Its **changes and constancies** [变化有常] are **unforced** [推移不武].

Now, we sincerely present **Daoists bearing talismans and scriptures** [有佩箓道士某等],
As **descendants of the Most High** [太上之子],
And **proponents of the Daoist tradition** [道家者流],
Yet we have not **hidden in secluded valleys to preserve the spirit** [隐谷以存神],
Nor **abided in quietude to expound the teachings** [约以居寂而演教].
Instead, our **sincere hearts grow scattered** [诚心易散],
And **wondrous methods prove difficult to refine** [妙法难精].
Our **doctrines lack coherence** [宣科而条理乖张],
And our **conduct falters in dignity** [临事而威仪跛倚],
While the **Six Demons** [六魔] mock our **erroneous practices** [想法乱],
And the **Ten Thousand Spirits** [万神] refuse to dwell where our **meditation is deficient** [存思缺].

Our **endeavors are feeble** [力么微],
And we **lean neither on the profound nor the manifest** [幽明无所依赖];
Our **nature and emotions are disordered** [性情挠乱],
Making **communication with Heaven and humanity arduous** [天人难以感通].
Unable to **bridge the sacred and the mundane** [契圣以契凡],
How can we **fulfill the Dao’s purpose for all beings** [孰为成物而成务]?

We fear the **records of the Dark Classics** [黑书] may **note our faults** [纪过],
And dread that the **registers of immortals** [仙籍] may **sever our merit** [断功].
In **humility and negligence**, we confess our failings [苟慢自陈],
Lest we **incur celestial censure** [贻阴谴].

With **devoted offerings of incense, flowers, and sincere vows** [香花拷信供养之仪],
We **wholeheartedly submit** [至心归命] to the **Most High Sovereign of the Primordial Dao** [东北方无极太上灵宝天尊],
The **Celestial Lord of the Five Essences** [梵炁天君],
The **Divine Immortals of the East-North** [东北方神仙],
And the **Assemblage of Spirits** [诸灵官].

We **solemnly beseech** [仰惟] the **Four Celestial Overseers** [申敕四司],
And **hear the commandments of the Nine Celestial Departments** [告闻九府],
That our **meritorious deeds may accumulate** [复功行於铢积寸累],
And our **transgressions be pardoned** [赦过尤]—
**Like clouds dispersed by mist** [雾卷云披].

May **celestial intent be conveyed through speech** [驿意传言],
And **resonance ascend to the Divine** [感应声而上彻];
May our **petitions reach the heights** [升章谒款],
So that our **wishes may align** [俾随愿以克谐].

Then, we **elevate our aspirations to the heavens** [抗志云阿],
And **dwell in mountain caverns** [栖身山洞],
Achieving **effortless transcendence above the age** [得逍遥於一世之上],
And **resting the Wheel of Rebirth within the Three Realms** [息轮转於三界之中].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

**East-Southward Repentance for the Sin of Neglecting the Sacred Scriptures, Precepts, and Talismans**

We humble ones hear that the **Primordial Transformation** [元化] **shapes existence** [裁形],
And there must be **those who uphold its authority** [必有主张之者];
The **Numinous Wind** [灵风] **nurtures all things** [煦物],
And the **Celestial Bureaus** [皇司] hold **commanding sway** [命令之权].

chunks.translated_text:
**East-Southward Repentance for Neglecting Sacred Scriptures, Precepts, and Talismans**

Harmonizing with the **Receptive** [Xún] and resounding with **flourishing brilliance** [振美盛明],
Assisted by the **Sieve** [Jī] to gather and disperse, **nurturing and inspiring** [歙扬鼓舞],
The **Great Virtue** remains hidden, unknown to the common folk.

Now, we, the **Daoist adepts bearing talismans** [佩箓道士], of humble birth and mortal form [挺质凡胎],
Shelter beneath the **Dao’s shelter** [栖身道荫],
Wander through the **ornate halls of the Dao** [优游琳宇],
Yet sometimes fail in **diligence in burning and refining** [或不谨於焚修];
Left and right, the **sacred texts** [洞章] are not held with **due reverence** [或不严於敬重].
We bear talismans yet **transgress ranks and order** [佩箓而踰阶越次],
Hold fasts yet **disrupt days and times** [持斋而废日乱时].
Officials, soldiers, and clerks—**three assemblies** [三会]—speak not of merit and reward;
**Gowned and armed**, we dwell yet **often mingle with the profane** [常居而多见混淆].
Our **Daoic power is weak and shallow** [道力寡浅],
While **ghosts and demons assail us** [而尸鬼交攻];
Our **precepts are slight and feeble** [戒行细微],
And the **numinous protection fails** [而威神不护].
We **master the scriptures yet distort their essence** [通经而驳杂本旨], clinging to petty wisdom;
We **teach the Dao yet cloak ourselves in empty words** [行教而□袭浮辞], failing to embody the **Great Purity** [大淳未至].
Thus, we **serve Heaven yet see no response** [奉天而事无响应],
And **violate the laws, bearing guilt from birth** [违科而罪与生俱].

We now **offer the rites of repentance** [用陈忏谢之仪],
Hoping for **forgiveness and grace** [以冀赦原之泽].
With **incense, flowers, and offerings of faith** [谨赍香花法信供养之仪],
We **devoutly submit** to the **East-Southward Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure** [无极太上灵宝天尊],
The **Celestial Qi Sovereign** [梵炁天君],
The **East-Southward Immortal Deities** [东南乡神仙],
And the **Numinous Officials** [诸灵官].
We **humble ourselves**, trusting in **divine mercy** [仰冀圣慈赦宥],
That **spiritual grace may gradually transform us** [灵泽渐陶].
May the **thunder move and the winds race** [雷动风驰],
Dissolving our **multitudinous faults** [散愆尤之纷委];
May the **clear waters and clouds moisten** [清渊云润],
Nurturing our **reverent and composed thoughts** [沃念虑之恭庄].
Thus may we **preserve the True Essence of life** [使保全性命之真],
And **harmonize with the unity of Heaven and humanity** [遂和同天人之际].
May the **Divine Followers of the Talismans** [随符仙从] and **Numinous Protective Officials** [护法灵官]
Record our **meritorious service** [录显绩之服劳],
And **advocate for our Daoic ascension** [计仙真之保奏].
After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

---

**West-Southward Repentance for Failing to Cultivate Humility in Interacting with Others**

We, the humble ones, hear that **Heaven’s decree is supremely orderly** [承天至顺],
And **Yang vigor shapes existence** [配刚健以成形];
The **Earth’s reach is boundless** [行地无疆],
Its **encompassing virtue nurtures all** [扩含弘而役物].
**Yin’s merit is immeasurable** [阴功莫大],
And **great virtue is beyond name** [厚德难名].

Now, we, the **Daoist adepts bearing talismans** [佩箓道士],
Endowed with the **five elements’ refinement** [禀秀五行],
Possessing **solitary numinous essence** [独灵万物],
Though born of dust, we **entered the Dao’s gate** [均有生於尘世，幸入道於玄门],
Yet **should have cultivated self-transformation** [益宜自化以修心],
So as to **receive others with emptiness** [庶可虚含而接物].

Instead, we **fail to govern our qi** [自以不能御气],
And **yield to emotion** [动必纵情],
Our **heart unharmonized, clashing with others** [不和其心而与物交争],
Our **body unyielding, defying the world** [不顺其身而与世相忤].
We **lack enduring virtue** [无一德而为常安之术],
And when **two passions meet, we spew malicious words** [合两怒则多溢恶之言].
We **defend our flaws, unaware of our own failings** [护短而己不自知],
And **harbor grudges, though others resent us** [敛怨而人岂无憾].
Our **errant thoughts harm the harmonious qi** [缪於心而伤和气],
And our **reckless speech defiles the Daoic body** [溺於言而污法身].
We **stand beside others yet fail to transform them** [与人并立而无以化人],
And though we **nourish the form with false Dao** [伪道养形],
We **have not yet attained the Dao itself** [未能造道].

We **dare not deceive ourselves** [敢昧自欺之过],
Lest we **invite Heaven’s retribution** [以贻天降之殃].
We **confess our guilt first** [敬负罪以首陈],
And **solemnly vow to amend** [誓责躬而悛改].

With **incense, flowers, and offerings of faith** [谨赍香花法信供养之仪],
We **devoutly submit** to the **West-Southward Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure** [无极太上灵宝天尊],
The **Celestial Qi Sovereign** [梵炁天君],
The **West-Southward Immortal Deities** [西南乡神仙],
And the **Numinous Officials** [诸灵官].
We **trust in the Receptive’s perfect fidelity** [仰惟坤仪至信],
And the **Earth’s Dao of humility** [地道流谦],
Hoping to **share in the radiant virtue of bearing all** [愿分厚德载物之休光],
That we may **constantly practice saving others** [使有常善救人之功用].
May our **Daoic nature be pure and luminous** [虚明道性],
And **all contradictions harmonized** [一顺逆以和融];
May our **refined thoughts and speech be steadfast** [粹熟心声],
And our **mechanisms of conduct be stable** [谨枢机而安定].
May **blessings naturally arrive** [福将自至],
And **calamity find no cause to arise** [祸莫由生].
We further **pray for unshakable compassion** [更祈不动之仁],
And **complete forgiveness for past transgressions** [尽赦从前之罪].

After attaining the Dao, we ascend to the **Formless**,
And harmonize with the **True**.

---

**West-Northward Repentance for Misusing Heaven’s Symbols and Earth’s Patterns in Invoking Spirits**

We, the humble ones, hear that the **Supreme Ultimate contains the Three** [太极含三],
And the **Two Principles divide to establish order** [两仪判而定位];
The **Heavenly Principle manifests the Nine** [乾元用九],
And **all things perceive and take form** [万物睹而流形].
With **One Qi preserved in purity** [得一气以贞纯],
We **ride the Flying Dragon without ceasing** [御飞龙而不息],
**Unfolding into the trigrams** [发挥入卦],
And **preserving the Great Harmony** [保合太和].

Now, we, the **Daoist adepts bearing talismans** [佩箓道士],
With **lofty aspirations for the Mysterious** [宅志希夷],
And **hearts wandering in the boundless** [游心浩素],
Store **divine essence within** [内存神而炼道]
And **practice teaching to transform others** [外行教以化人].
Though the **ritual implements exist** [虽科法之具存],
They are **not the task of the common** [岂凡庸之是任].

Yet, with **form and spirit most impure** [重以形神至浊],
And **Daoic practice unheard** [道行无闻],
We **adorn our caps with star patterns** [攒星斗於峨冠],
And **embellish our robes with cloud-and-mist designs** [饰云霞於羽服].
We **tread upon the Pole Star’s might** [蹑魁罡於履屐之下],
Yet our **roots are earthly and our deeds mundane** [地秽人凡];
We **command spirits and ghosts** [驱神鬼於掌握之中],
Yet our **merit is slight and virtue thin** [功微德薄].
We **tread the Eight Trigrams’ patterns on the altar** [践八卦之文於坛墠],
And **descend the Ten Directions’ qi into our bodies** [降十方之气於身田].
Sometimes we **nurture the prenatal breath in the Three Primordials** [或养胎息於三元],
**Stealing the essence of Yin and Yang** [暗窃阴阳之气];
Sometimes we **refine the inner elixir in the Nine Transformations** [或炼内丹於九转],
**Chasing the light of sun and moon** [高奔日月之光].
We are **no true Daoist forms** [素非仙相之人],
Yet **presume to learn the Saints’ great deeds** [冒学圣功之道].
**No act is without presumption** [无非僭越],
And **we have offended the Radiant Spirits** [有犯光灵].
We **now humbly confess our transgressions** [敬伸忏谢之诚],
Seeking to **atone for our faults** [以这谴尤之责].

With **incense, flowers, and offerings of faith** [谨赍香花法信供养之仪],
We **devoutly submit** to the **West-Northward Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure** [无极太上灵宝天尊],
The **Celestial Qi Sovereign** [梵炁天君],
The **West-Northward Immortal Deities** [西北乡神仙],
And the **Numinous Officials** [诸灵官].
We **trust in the Heavenly Principle’s vigor** [仰惟乾元至健],
And that **Heaven’s Dao is not defied** [天道弗违].
May we be **granted pure Yang** [锡以纯阳],
To **exchange our earthly, vulgar bones** [为换尘凡之胎骨];

chunks.translated_text:
「Revealing the essential Dao/Way, so that one may know the fundamental source of **transformation into Immortality** [仙化].
**The Four Bodies** [四体] are harmonious and at peace,
**The Hundred Spirits** [百神] are firmly ensconced.
Thus, **all who diligently cultivate the Higher Laws** [庶精修於上法]
May achieve **no shame in their prior merits** [得无愧於前功].

After attaining the Dao/Way,
One ascends into **Formlessness** [无形],
And **harmony unites with the True Dao/Way** [和与道合真].
**We of the lower realms** [下方] now confess our transgressions:
From ages past, we have **offended the Three Radiant Lights** [冒犯三光],
Ignorant of the **Heavenly Covering** [覆载].
**All of us** [众等] have heard in awe:
**Brahmanic Qi** [梵炁] extends to **Maha-Brahman** [弥罗],
Reaching the **Supreme Void** [上极虚无] of the highest realm.
The **Primordial Principles** [元纲] flow and manifest,
Transforming into **the myriad eons of Heaven** [化开万亿之天].

**Oh, the Venerable Dao/Way’s grandeur** [洪惟至道之尊]!
It governs **the Natural Transformations** [统御自然之化],
Its **Divine Powers** [神功] are everlasting,
And **its vast efficacy** [浩劫] endures eternally.

Now, **we humble Daoist officials bearing talismans** [有佩箓道士某等],
From **the beginningless** [无始] to the **manifested** [有形],
Have **one numinous essence** [一灵] diminished and lost,
Unable to return to the **five primordial purities** [五太之淳].
**The Six Bandits** [六贼] have clouded our minds,
Bringing upon ourselves the **karmic burdens of the Three Realms** [三生之业].

We have **soared beyond the Desire Realm and Form Realm** [超於欲界色界],
Yet **fallen back into the Wheel of Rebirth** [复堕轮回].
We have **practiced the causes of the Lesser and Middle Vehicles** [修於小乘中乖],
Yet **ourselves generated decline and backsliding** [自生退转].
Some have **dwelled in the Central Lands** [居中土] but **failed to return to their origins** [本原不返],
Others have **journeyed to distant realms** [处殊方] yet **the Dao/Way’s teachings remain unheard** [声教无闻].

The **Great Vehicle’s Dao/Way** [大乘之道] is hard to fulfill,
And the **karmic cycles of the Three Realms** [三界之业] are easily perpetuated.
**Bearing Heaven above and Earth below** [戴天履地],
**Embracing Yin and Yang** [负阴抱阳],
We have **failed to repay the Heavenly Grace** [莫酬覆焘之恩],
And **every action brings guilt and offense** [动有乖张之罪].

We have **missed the four seasons’ harmonious shifts** [四序寒暄之愆],
And **lament the Heavenly timing** [嗟怨天时].
We have **contradicted the luminous courses of the Three Celestial Marks** [逆三辰经纬之昭明],
And **offended the Radiant Dao/Way’s light** [犯冲光景].

Our **sins span countless lifetimes** [逆数千生之罪],
And **our transgressions fill myriad kinds** [贯盈万种之愆].
From this day onward, **we seek renewal** [自此自新],
And **pray for Your boundless forgiveness** [愿垂肆赦].

With **incense, flowers, and offerings of faith** [谨赍香花法信供养之仪],
We **devoutly submit** to the **Supreme Sovereign of the Numinous Treasure** [上方无极太上灵宝天尊],
The **Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors** [三十六天帝君],
The **Jade Capital of the Immortals** [玉京仙都],
The **Purple Forbidden Enclosure and Golden Celestial Gate** [紫微金阙],
The **Three Pure Ones of the Three Realms** [三清三界],
The **Celestial Qi Sovereign** [梵炁天君],
The **Divine Deities of the Upper Realm** [上乡神仙],
And the **Numinous Officials** [诸灵官].

We **aspire to the Great Dao/Way’s benevolent proclamation** [仰冀大道宣慈],
And **pray for the High True Ones’ compassionate regard** [高真垂悯].
May You **forgive the ten directions’ worlds** [下十方之世界],
And **pardon our myriad eons of transgression** [赦万劫之愆尤].

**Purple Forbidden and Supreme Mysterious** [紫微太微],
**Urge the auspicious moment for ascension** [催促举仙之运].
**Southern and Northern Dipper** [南斗北斗],
**Dispel the calamities of our lifespans** [解消临命之灾].

May **our Primordial Essence** [元精] be **full within the Mudball** [满於泥丸],
And **our True Qi** [真炁] be **congealed in the Numinous Palace** [凝於灵府].
May **Divine Light** [神明] **descend and dwell** within us,
And **our organs and viscera** [脏腑] be **cleansed and cool** [清凉].
May **our wisdom-nature** [慧性] be **illuminated and bright** [高明],
And **our blessings and karmic connections** [福缘] be **exceptional** [殊胜].
May we **receive the descent of the Perfect Ones** [得至人之降接],
And be **guided in the profound mysteries of Daoist learning** [指道学之玄微].
May we **transform all sentient beings** [回化有情],
And **together ascend to the state of Non-Defilement** [同登无漏].

After attaining the Dao/Way,
One **ascends into Formlessness** [升入无形],
And **harmony unites with the True Dao/Way** [和与道合真].
**We of the lower realms** [下方] now confess our transgressions:
**Harming living beings and injuring life** [害物伤生之罪].

chunks.original_text: 众等伏闻大方无隅，扩八弦而厚载； 元形统地，含万物以化生。 惟后土之司权，分百灵之受事。 不言而信，得一以宁。 今谨有佩箓道士某等，有生於混沌之初，失道於洪荒之后。 仁义礼智，与大伪之并出； 贤愚善恶，禀天性之自然。 率为弃本之人，动有贪生之过。 资万物而致养，不知覆载之恩； 纵一己而自安，不念饥寒之者。 极口腹之欲而恣伤生类，侈服用之美而枉害成形。 莫知反身，习为常性。 五岳四渎之府，罪目纷纭； 酆都泉曲之司，黑书委积。 幸今世潜身於道荫，尽千生讼过於玄司，誓修未来，庶臻无咎。 谨赍香花法信供养之仪，至心归命下方无极太上灵宝天尊，高皇九土，十二仙真，后土太灵，四渎五岳，下方世界，一切神仙，诸灵官。 伏愿众灵赴感，厚德有容，敷在宥之渥恩，赦无边之深过，圆融善念，发开惠源。 静重柔和，咸与物而无碍； 虚无清净，早证道以长生。 上穷碧落之高，下极黄泉之杳，人皆反本，物咸遂生。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 道门科范大全集卷之七十四竟 道门科范大全集卷之七十五
chunks.translated_text:
The multitude humbly hears that the Great Square without corners
Expands the eight strings and bears them thickly;
The Original Form governs the earth, containing all things to transform and give birth.

Now, the sovereign of the Later Soil, who holds authority,
Distributes the duties of the hundred spirits.
Without speech, yet trustworthy—
With One, all is at peace.

Now, we, the humble Daoist adepts bearing talismans, certain in name,
Were born in the chaos of the beginning,
Lost the Dao in the aftermath of Honghuang.
Ren, yi, li, zhi arose alongside great falsehood;
The wise and foolish, the good and evil, received their nature from Heaven’s spontaneity.
We were born as those who abandoned the root,
Our actions ever stained by greed for life.
We rely on all things for sustenance,
Yet fail to recognize the恩 of the covering and bearing.
We indulge our selfish ease,
Unmindful of those who suffer hunger and cold.
We gluttonously indulge in desires of mouth and belly,
And recklessly harm living beings.
We flaunt the beauty of adornments and luxuries,
And wrongly destroy the formed.
We know not to turn inward,
And this becomes our habitual nature.

The five peaks and four great rivers hold records of our crimes—
A tangled web of offenses.
The officials of the Black Registers and the Yin Valley
Pile up our dark deeds.

Fortunately, in this age, we take refuge under the Dao’s shelter,
Confessing our myriad sins of past lives before the Mysterious Tribunal,
Vowing to cultivate the future,
Hoping to reach a state without fault.

With solemn offerings of incense, flowers, and the rites of faith,
We wholeheartedly submit to the **Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Venerable of the Lower Realm’s Limitless Extremes**,
The High Sovereign of the Nine Soils,
The Twelve Immortals,
The Most Numinous Later Soil,
The Four Great Rivers and Five Peaks,
The Lower Realm’s world,
All Immortals and Spirits,
All Numinous Officials.

We humbly pray that all spirits respond to our sincerity,
That their virtue is vast and their mercy boundless,
That they extend the boundless grace of forgiveness,
Pardon our boundless transgressions,
And awaken compassionate intentions,
Unleashing the source of blessings.

May stillness and gentleness prevail,
Harmonizing with all without obstruction;
May emptiness and purity be attained,
Swiftly realizing the Dao and attaining longevity.

From the highest reaches of the Azure Palace to the deepest depths of the Yellow Springs,
May all return to their roots,
And all things flourish in life.

After attaining the Dao,
One ascends into Formlessness,
And harmony unites with the True Dao.

*The Dao Gate’s Comprehensive Regulations, Volume Seventy-Four ends.
The Dao Gate’s Comprehensive Regulations, Volume Seventy-Five begins.*
