chunks.original_text: 广成先生杜光庭删定 上清升化仙度迁神道场仪 此仪用黄箓修真十戒，用明真宿启仪，乃五炼生尸古仪。 宿启也，所以有迁拔、灭度之魂之句。 万福天师着《同学行道仪》，始自疾苦，至于终亡，皆须忏谢、救拔、解灾、悔过。 且夫修道升仙，非师不度； 超凡证圣，非友不成。 师犹父母也，同学为兄弟也，得不敬孝友爱，承顺和悦，以遵其教乎？ 师资同学，既离亲戚，栖庇山林，骨肉远矣，亲爱疏矣，一旦有疾，惟门人同学为其选备方药，营修药饮以疗之。 其或修短有常，奄从沦化，即当诵经行道，拜章上表，忏罪谢愆，以相迁度。 生死道义，惟此为先。 师友沦没，弟子同学皆当齐集，以高德者为法师，其余依位次第，沐浴更衣，可设坛出官，关启行事。 疾厄危切，亡殁极伤，应急就修，不须宿启，各在依位，主其职司尔。 其事若宿启，即依常法。 清旦行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 金真录霞，焕映三天。 飞云丹霄，诸天控轮。 晨晖启旦，阴翳俱捐。 九微震空，五星回旋。 万天感应，自然妙玄。 杳冥散布，分形百千。 玄珠光耀，瑞降坛乾。 幽明蒙惠，灌炼金泉。 魔王恐惧，合景三田，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君太上老君，召出臣等身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今清旦，烧香行道，谨奉为入意，其诸情悃，已录奏闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、东极救苦青玄上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微大帝，南极注生上帝，东极救苦青玄上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，十方太上灵宝天尊，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，上清日月星斗河汉群真，三官四圣，五师三省真君，九天天曹，诸位真君，历代传宗启教诸大师真，雷霆神虎大医诸司官将，太上诸阶经箓中仙官吏兵，天下名山洞府得道神仙，地府酆都大帝，幽阴圣众，水府扶桑大帝，阆苑真仙，人元五岳五天圣帝，酆都地祇，诸司元帅、太岁土火、瘟司圣众、州县城隍之神，当境庙社神祇，观庭土地真官，法坛诸司官将，三界提魂摄魄神吏，四界直符功曹使者，誊奏表钱神吏，醮筵主宰，一切真仙。 恭望洪慈，洞回昭鉴。 臣等微生贱质，谬预法流，早契神期，奉遵玄秘。
chunks.translated_text:
May the teachings of Master Guangcheng (杜光庭) be followed,
*The Ritual of Ascension and Divine Transformation at the Upper Clarity Dao/Way Hall of the Transcended Immortals*
This ritual employs the **Yellow Arrow** (黄箓) to cultivate the True Dao of the Ten Precepts (十戒),
and the **Hosted Initiation** (明真宿启) to perform the rites—
the ancient rites of the Five Refining (五炼) for generating the sacred body (生尸).

The **Hosted Initiation** (宿启) is thus the means
to invoke the souls of those who have been **transcended and drawn forth** (迁拔),
or **extinguished and liberated** (灭度).

Master Wanfu (万福天师) composed *The Ritual for Fellow Dao Seekers* (《同学行道仪》),
which mandates that from the onset of suffering to the final passing,
one must **confess and repent** (忏谢),
**rescue and draw forth** (救拔),
**alleviate calamities** (解灾),
and **regret past transgressions** (悔过).

Indeed, to **cultivate the Dao and ascend as an immortal** (修道升仙),
one must not rely on oneself alone—**a master is required to guide** (非师不度);
to **transcend the mundane and attain sainthood** (超凡证圣),
one must not act alone—**a fellow Dao seeker is essential** (非友不成).

A master is like **parental figures** (父母),
and fellow Dao seekers are like **brothers** (兄弟).
How can one, lacking **reverence and filial devotion** (不敬孝),
**friendship and love** (不友爱),
or **compliance and accord** (不承顺和悦),
follow their teachings?

When **masters and fellow Dao seekers** depart,
leaving kin and kindred behind,
dwelling in **mountains and forests** (栖庇山林),
with **flesh and bone distant** (骨肉远矣),
and **affection now sparse** (亲爱疏矣),
upon their **illness or decline** (修短有常),
when they **pass away** (奄从沦化),
one must **recite scriptures and perform Dao rites** (诵经行道),
**offer petitions and memorials** (拜章上表),
**confess sins and atone for faults** (忏罪谢愆),
and **assist in their transcendence and liberation** (以相迁度).

In matters of **life and death and Dao principles** (生死道义),
this is the foremost duty.

Should a **master or fellow Dao seeker perish** (沦没),
all **disciples and fellow Dao seekers** must **assemble in unison** (齐集),
and designate the **highest in virtue** (高德者) as the **ritual leader** (法师).
The rest shall follow in **ranked order** (依位次第),
**purifying themselves through bathing and changing robes** (沐浴更衣).
Then, a **sacrificial platform may be erected** (可设坛出官),
and the **rites of invocation and exorcism** (关启) conducted.

In cases of **urgent sickness or dire peril** (疾厄危切),
or **grievous loss and profound sorrow** (亡殁极伤),
one must **immediately perform the rites** (应急就修),
without awaiting the **Hosted Initiation** (不须宿启).
Each shall **stand in their appointed rank** (各在依位),
and **fulfill their designated duties** (主其职司).

If the rites are to be **conducted as a Hosted Initiation** (宿启),
then they shall proceed **according to established methods** (即依常法).

**Morning rites for the Dao:**
The **ritual proceedings commence upon the platform** (法事升坛如式).
Each **offers homage to the master’s lingering essence** (各礼师存念如法).
The **exorcising incantations** (卫灵咒) are proclaimed.

The **Golden Truth Record** (金真录霞) shines radiant,
illuminating the **Three Heavens** (三天).
**Flying Clouds ascend to the Azure Expanse** (丹霄),
as the **hosts of all the heavens** (诸天) **control their celestial wheels** (控轮).
At dawn’s first light (晨晖启旦),
all **shadows and obscurations** (阴翳) are dispelled.

The **Nine Mysterious Winds** (九微) shake the void,
as the **Five Stars** (五星) **revolve in harmony** (回旋).
The **Ten Thousand Heavens** (万天) respond in kind,
manifesting **wondrous and profound mysteries** (自然妙玄).

The **dim and obscure** (杳冥) scatter into myriad forms (分形百千).
The **Dark Pearl** (玄珠) gleams with splendor,
as **auspicious signs descend upon the sacrificial altar** (瑞降坛乾).
The **hidden and the luminous** (幽明) receive **divine grace** (蒙惠),
purified by the **Golden Spring** (金泉).

The **demonic king** (魔王) trembles in fear,
as the **Three Radiant Fields of Light** (合景三田) align,
and **harmony unites with the True Dao** (与道合真).

The **Supreme Law Drum** (法鼓) is struck **twenty-four times** (二十四通).

The **Three Highest Heavens** (三天)—
**Primordial Beginning Heavenly Sovereign** (玄元始天尊),
**Supreme Dao Lord** (太上道君),
**Supreme Old Lord** (太上老君)—
**summon forth** (召出) their **subordinate officials** (臣等),
the **Three Five Functionaries** (三五功曹) within our bodies,
**left and right celestial attendants** (左右官使者),
**left and right incense bearers** (左右捧香),
**Dragon Couriers and mounted officers** (驿龙骑吏),
**Attendant Golden Boys** (侍香金童),
**Messenger Jade Girls** (传言散花玉女),
the **Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols** (五帝直符),
and the **Direct Day Incense Officials** (直日香官),
totaling **thirty-six** (三十六人).

Those summoned **array themselves in solemn attire** (严装显服),
**adorned with crowns and sashes** (冠带垂缨),
and **invoke the sacred platform’s earthly and celestial deities** (关启玄坛土地，方域神真).

Today, at this **morning of purity** (清旦),
we **burn incense and perform the Dao rites** (烧香行道),
**devotedly offering this as an act of sincerity** (谨奉为入意).
All **earnest sentiments** (诸情悃) have been **recorded and presented** (已录奏闻).
We humbly pray that the **Supreme Ten Directions’ Most Authentic Dao Essence** (十方至真道炁),
the **Spiritual Treasure’s Auspicious Light** (灵宝瑞光),
may **descend and flow into our bodies** (下降，流入臣身中),
so that our **invocation** (所启)
may **swiftly reach the Supreme Limitless Dao** (径御太上无极大道),
the **Celestial Jade Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝),
and the **Sovereign of the Eastern Extremity, the Green Heavens, who rescues suffering** (东极救苦青玄上帝).

We request **the proclamation of our ritual ranks** (请称法位).

**The assembled officials** (具位臣某与合坛官众等),
with **sincere devotion** (谨同诚上启),
**humbly invoke** the following:
**Primordial Beginning Heavenly Sovereign of the Void** (虚无自然元始天尊),
**Supreme Dao Lord** (太上大道君),
**Supreme Old Lord** (太上老君),
**Celestial Jade Sovereign of the Highest Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**Hook-Array Heavenly Sovereign, the Great Emperor** (勾陈天皇大帝),
**Great Emperor of the Northern Extremity, the Purple Micro** (北极紫微大帝),
**Supreme Deity of the Southern Extremity, the Vitalizing Sovereign** (南极注生上帝),
**Sovereign of the Eastern Extremity, the Green Heavens, who rescues suffering** (东极救苦青玄上帝),
**Imperial Earthly Sovereign of the Ten Directions, the Model of Heaven** (承天效法后土皇地祇),
**Supreme Spiritual Treasure Heavenly Sovereign of the Ten Directions** (十方太上灵宝天尊),
**All Heavenly Sovereigns** (诸天天尊),
**All Heavenly Emperors** (诸天上帝),
**The Hosts of the Upper Clarity: Sun, Moon, Stars, and the Milky Way** (上清日月星斗河汉群真),
**The Three Officials and Four Saints** (三官四圣),
**The Five Teachers and Three Provinces’ True Lords** (五师三省真君),
**The Nine Heavenly Celestial Functionaries** (九天天曹),
**All True Lords of the ranks** (诸位真君),
**The Great Masters of Past Dynasties who transmitted the Dao** (历代传宗启教诸大师真),
**The Thunderous Divine Tiger, the Great Physician, and all subordinate officials and soldiers** (雷霆神虎大医诸司官将),
**The Immortal Officials and Soldiers from the Supreme Stages of Scripture and Arrow** (太上诸阶经箓中仙官吏兵),
**The Immortal Deities of All Famous Mountains and Caverns** (天下名山洞府得道神仙),
**The Great Emperor of the Underworld, the Acid Fields** (地府酆都大帝),
**The Sacred Hosts of the Shadow Realm** (幽阴圣众),
**The Great Emperor of the Water Fields, the Exalted Phoenix** (水府扶桑大帝),
**The True Immortals of the Lantian Gardens** (阆苑真仙),
**The Five Sacred Peaks and Five Heavenly Sovereigns of the Human Realm** (人元五岳五天圣帝),
**The Earthly Sovereign of the Acid Fields** (酆都地祇),
**All Commanding Generals of Subordinate Ranks** (诸司元帅),
**The Yearly Soil and Fire Officials** (太岁土火),
**The Saintly Hosts of the Pestilence Bureau** (瘟司圣众),
**The Divine Generals of States, Counties, and City Walls** (州县城隍之神),
**The Local Deities of Temples and Shrines** (当境庙社神祇),
**The True Officials of the Courtyard’s Earthly Sovereign** (观庭土地真官),
**The Subordinate Officials and Soldiers of the Ritual Platform** (法坛诸司官将),
**The Three Realms’ Divine Functionaries who Extract the Soul and Seize the Spirit** (三界提魂摄魄神吏),
**The Four Realms’ Direct Symbol Functionaries and Messenger Officials** (四界直符功曹使者),
**The Divine Clerks who Record and Present Memorials and Offerings** (誊奏表钱神吏),
**The Ritual Master of the Feast** (醮筵主宰),
and **all True Immortals** (一切真仙).

**With reverence and humility** (恭望洪慈),
we **seek the penetrating and manifesting gaze** (洞回昭鉴).

We, **lowly and humble mortals** (微生贱质),
**erroneously partaking in the Dao’s flow** (谬预法流),
**early attuned to the divine promise** (早契神期),
**devotedly follow the profound mysteries** (奉遵玄秘).

chunks.original_text: 未能超形物外，隐影林峦，服道思玄，研习要妙。 但人间修尚，以香火为功，济拔幽涂，超升上境，受法之日，约当奉行，救度人天，宣洪道德，况奉词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词旨，情深追慕。 臣等谨为共相携率，依按典仪，归命十方，冥祈三宝，修斋行道，请命祈哀。 伏愿至道垂慈，哀原群品，阴罪阳过，咸乞消除。 使进品仙都，升神上境，式彰洪济，少副哀鸣。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三尊，臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流宗祧先圣，社稷尊灵，控御晨霞，宴游霄极，旁敷德泽，蕃大本支。 皇帝圣寿延长，明齐二景； 仁风淳厚，德迈三宗。
chunks.translated_text:
「Not yet able to transcend the physical form and dwell beyond the material world,
to vanish within the forests and mountains,
to practice the Dao and ponder its mysteries,
to study and master its essential subtleties.

We merely follow human customs,
using incense and fire as our means of merit,
to rescue and deliver those trapped in the **Netherworld** (幽涂),
to elevate them to higher realms.
On the day we received the **Law** (法),
we solemnly pledged to uphold and practice it,
to save both humans and celestial beings,
to proclaim the **Great Dao** (洪道德).

How much more so when we now present our **petition** (词旨),
how dare we not humbly submit it?

We **solemnly present our petition** (宣词).
In accordance with the **petition’s intent** (词旨),
our hearts are filled with deep longing and reverence.

Thus, we **devoutly gather and lead** (携率),
strictly adhering to the **ritual ordinances** (典仪),
and **pay homage to the Ten Directions** (十方),
**secretly invoking the Three Treasures** (三宝),
**observing the fast and practicing the Dao** (修斋行道),
to **entreat the Mandate** (请命) and **implore mercy** (祈哀).

May the **Supreme Dao** (至道) extend its grace,
and **compassionately pardon all beings** (哀原群品),
both **dark offenses** (阴罪) and **bright transgressions** (阳过),
all imploring forgiveness and absolution.

Grant that we may ascend to the **Daoist Realms** (仙都),
elevate to the **Divine Upper Realms** (上境),
and **proclaim your boundless deliverance** (洪济),
though but slightly **assuaging our lamentations** (副哀鸣).

With this **clear morning** (清旦) as we practice the Dao,
we **entreat the Law Assembly** (法众) to **offer this first incense** (初捻上香).
May this incense smoke **soar directly to the heavens** (腾空径上),
to **venerate the Three Supreme Ones** (太上三尊),
as we **wholeheartedly devote our bodies, spirits, and lives** (至心皈身、皈神、皈命).

With these merits,
we **dedicate them to our ancestral Daoist lineage** (宗祧先圣),
to the **sacred spirits of the land and grain** (社稷尊灵),
to **command the morning mists** (控御晨霞),
to **feast in the celestial heights** (宴游霄极),
to **broadly spread your virtue and blessings** (旁敷德泽),
and to **multiply our roots and branches** (蕃大本支).

May the **Emperor’s sacred lifespan be prolonged** (皇帝圣寿延长),
and the **two luminaries** (二景) be **harmonized in brightness** (明齐);
May the **virtuous winds of benevolence be pure and deep** (仁风淳厚),
and the **Emperor’s virtue surpass the Three Dynasties** (德迈三宗).

Functionaries and Messenger Officials** (四界直符功曹使者),
**The Divine Clerks who Record and Present Memorials and Offerings** (誊奏表钱神吏),

and **all True Immortals** (一切真仙).

**With reverence and humility** (恭望洪慈),

We, **lowly and humble mortals** (微生贱质),
**erroneously partaking in the Dao’s flow** (谬预法流),
**early attuned to the divine promise** (早契神期),
**devotedly follow the profound mysteries** (奉遵玄秘).

chunks.original_text: 民俗阜安，兵戈偃戢。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养大道尊经。 臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流仙化某，洎三师玄祖，法俗先亡。 伏愿游神紫极，镈质广寒，逍遥碧落之庭，纵适三清之境，消除冢讼，庇佑门徒。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今清旦行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三师。 臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流弟子某。 伏愿道业日新，智灯无量，心开意解，体悟自然，学道成真，名题青箓，观宇肃静，大小咸宁。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，命魔，步虚，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微上帝，南极注生大帝，东极救苦青玄上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，上穷圆盖之高真，下极方舆之主宰，有灵有圣，今古师宗，醮筵主宰，合属真仙。 恭望洪慈，洞回昭格。 臣等育质三光，造形九炁，凡胎尸秽，漏质庸虚，宿庆弥纶，兹逢道运。 幸生圣代，蚤佩黄裳，沐大宥之垂休，睹真经之辅世，叨逢秘检，缪奉丹盟，不揆凡材，辄居法任，科文肄业，香火倾心，为己及人，祈恩请福。 今有弟子某，奉为仙化本师某，早从师范，宗奉仙真，香火虽严，形神未炼，灵根不固，天运有终，归身太阴，托形幽夜。 切恐平生举动，悮犯真科，抵触神明，冒干天地，违越禁忌，构此凶衰。 又恐六甲五行、九宫八卦，互为刑克，莫遂考终。 又恐先世流殃，恶人咒诅，宿冤往债，结衅所成，伏连传尸，新故延染。 考气注讼，侵逼魂神。 魍魉邪精，乘为夭害。 迁化以后，超度无由。 恐识滞鬼群，殃延见在。 是敢修斋行道，归命至真，仰乞大慈，特垂惠泽，开释幽对，超度先师，驭日紫霄，乘云丹殿，北辞长夜，南上绛宫，演三洞之灵文，为太平之教主，圆光附体，洞照太空，导引世人，永超长夜。 所冀边疆静息，风雨均调，圣祚延长，皇图永固。 弟子某等道念增进，心识光明，速登玄解之乡，永作人天之庇。 先师超度，冢宅镇安，境界龙神，宫庭土地，迁升阶品，佑护生灵，下穷幽漠之乡，俱被清升之泽。 上明天尊大慈之化，下副臣等祈向之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来清旦行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、东极救苦青玄上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
The customs of the people flourish in peace, and weapons rest in stillness.
Now, we burn incense to **wholeheartedly devote ourselves** (皈依) to the **Dao/Way’s Most Venerable Great Saints, the Most True Ones** (道尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the **Formless**, harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).

With this **pure morning Dao/Way practice** (清旦行道), we invite the **assembly of the Law** (法众) to offer this **second incense** (二捻上香).
May this incense smoke **soar directly to the heavens** (腾空径上) and **venerate the Dao/Way’s Most Venerable Scriptures** (供养大道尊经).
We **wholeheartedly devote our bodies, spirits, and lives** (至心皈身、皈神、皈命).
With these merits, we dedicate them to **the Dao/Way’s transformation of [name]** (仙化某), extending to the **Three Teachers and Mysterious Ancestors** (洎三师玄祖), and the **predeceased of both Law and俗** (法俗先亡).

May we **wander as spirits at the Purple Extremity** (游神紫极), **refine our essence at Broad Cold** (镈质广寒), **roam freely in the Celestial Courtyard of Azure Void** (逍遥碧落之庭), and **wander at will in the Three Pure Realms** (纵适三清之境).
May we **dispel lawsuits and disputes** (消除冢讼) and **shelter and protect our disciples** (庇佑门徒).

Now, we burn incense once more to **wholeheartedly devote ourselves** to the **Dao/Way’s Most Venerable Great Saints, the Most True Ones** (经尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the **Formless**, harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).

With this **pure morning Dao/Way practice** (清旦行道), we invite the **assembly of the Law** (法众) to offer this **third incense** (三捻上香).
May this incense smoke **soar directly to the heavens** (腾空径上) and **venerate the Three Most Venerable Teachers** (供养太上三师).
We **wholeheartedly devote our bodies, spirits, and lives** (至心皈身、皈神、皈命).
With these merits, we dedicate them to **disciple [name]** (弟子某).

May our **Dao/Way practice daily renew itself** (道业日新), our **wisdom-lamp be boundless** (智灯无量),
our **mind open and intent resolved** (心开意解), our **body comprehend Nature** (体悟自然),
our **Dao/Way practice achieve Truehood** (学道成真), and our **name be inscribed on the Celestial Register** (名题青箓).
May the **cosmos be serene and still** (观宇肃静), and all—great and small—be at peace (大小咸宁).

Now, we burn incense once more to **wholeheartedly devote ourselves** to the **Teacher’s Most Venerable Great Saints, the Most True Ones** (师尊大圣众至真之德).
After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the **Formless**, harmonizing with the **True Dao/Way** (和与道合真).
**Repentance, command the demons, tread the Void, and perform the Three Bowings** (忏方，命魔，步虚，三礼).
**Reaffirm the Law’s station** (重称法位).

We, **officer [name] of the prescribed rank**, along with the **assembled officials of the altar** (合坛官众等),
**solemnly and sincerely address** (谨重诚上启):
**The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Empty-Nothingness and Naturalness** (虚无自然元始天尊),
**The Most High Dao/Way Lord** (太上大道君),
**The Most High Laozi** (太上老君),
**The Jade Emperor of the Broad Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**The Heavenly Sovereign of the Gourd Cluster** (勾陈天皇大帝),
**The Supreme Sovereign of the Northern Pole** (北极紫微上帝),
**The Great Emperor Who Registers Life of the Southern Pole** (南极注生大帝),
**The Supreme Sovereign of the Eastern Pole, the Green Heavenly Worthy Who Saves from Suffering** (东极救苦青玄上帝),
**The Earthly Sovereign Who Follows Heaven’s Law** (承天效法后土皇地祇),
**the Highest Worthies of the Round Canopy above** (上穷圆盖之高真),
**and the Masters of the Square Compass below** (下极方舆之主宰),
**both the Spirited and the Sacred** (有灵有圣),
**the Teachers and Ancestral Lineages of past and present** (今古师宗),
**the Masters of the Ritual Feast** (醮筵主宰),
**all belonging to the True Worthies** (合属真仙).

**Reverently gazing upon your boundless mercy** (恭望洪慈), we **pray for your enlightened response** (洞回昭格).
We, born of the **three luminaries** (育质三光), shaped by the **nine breaths/qi** (造形九炁),
**mere mortal forms of filth and decay** (凡胎尸秽), **leaky and empty in essence** (漏质庸虚),
though **blessed with past merits** (宿庆弥纶), now **encounter the Dao/Way’s era** (兹逢道运).
Fortunate to be born in this **Sage’s age** (圣代), we **early donned the Yellow Robes** (蚤佩黄裳),
**bathed in the Great Pardon’s grace** (沐大宥之垂休), and **witnessed the True Scriptures’ aid to the world** (睹真经之辅世).
Though unworthy, we **presume to uphold the Sacred Pledge** (叨逢秘检，缪奉丹盟),
**dare to assume the Law’s duties** (不揆凡材，辄居法任),
**study the Classics and refine our arts** (科文肄业),
and **devote our incense and fire with sincerity** (香火倾心),
**for ourselves and others**, seeking **mercy and blessings** (祈恩请福).

Now, **disciple [name]**, having **reverently taken [name] as the Dao/Way’s transformative Teacher** (奉为仙化本师某),
**early followed the Teacher’s guidance** (早从师范) and **revered the True Worthies** (宗奉仙真),
though our **incense and fire were sincere**, our **form and spirit remain unrefined** (形神未炼),
our **spiritual roots unstable** (灵根不固), and our **heavenly fate limited** (天运有终).
We **fear that our lifetimes’ deeds** may **transgress the True Laws** (悮犯真科),
**offend the Divine** (抵触神明), **dare to provoke Heaven and Earth** (冒干天地),
**violate prohibitions** (违越禁忌), and thus **invite this calamity and decline** (构此凶衰).

We also **fear the mutual clashes of the Six Li and Five Phases** (六甲五行),
the **Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams** (九宫八卦),
**preventing our fate from being fulfilled** (莫遂考终).
We **fear ancestral curses** (先世流殃), **malevolent curses** (恶人咒诅),
**past grudges and debts** (宿冤往债), **provoked conflicts** (结衅所成),
**binding the deceased** (伏连传尸), and **spreading to the living** (新故延染).
We **fear the registration of vital forces in disputes** (考气注讼), **harassing our spirits** (侵逼魂神).
We **fear malevolent spirits and demonic essences** (魍魉邪精) **riding upon us to cause untimely death** (乘为夭害).
After **our transformation**, we **lack the means to be guided across** (超度无由).
We **fear being entangled with ghostly groups**, **bringing misfortune to the living** (殃延见在).

Thus, we **dare to perform this ritual fast and Dao/Way practice** (修斋行道),
**wholeheartedly devoting ourselves to the Most True** (归命至真),
**humbly beseeching your great compassion** (仰乞大慈),
**to specially bestow your blessings** (特垂惠泽),
**release the wronged spirits** (开释幽对),
**guide our departed Teacher** (超度先师),
**ride the sun to the Purple Mansion** (驭日紫霄),
**ascend on clouds to the Vermilion Palace** (乘云丹殿),
**depart the Northern Land of Eternal Night** (北辞长夜),
**and ascend to the Southern Glowing Palace** (南上绛宫).
May they **proclaim the sacred texts of the Three Caverns** (演三洞之灵文),
**become the Teachers of the Great Peace** (为太平之教主),
**with radiant light enveloping their bodies** (圆光附体),
**illuminating the boundless cosmos** (洞照太空),
**guiding and transforming all beings** (导引世人),
**eternally freed from the Long Night** (永超长夜).

Our hope is that **the borders may rest in tranquility** (边疆静息),
**winds and rains be balanced** (风雨均调),
**the Sage’s blessings endure** (圣祚延长),
and the **Imperial design be forever secure** (皇图永固).
May we, the disciples **[name]**, **advance in Dao/Way devotion** (道念增进),
**clarify our minds and perceptions** (心识光明),
**quickly attain the Realm of Mysterious Enlightenment** (速登玄解之乡),
and **forever be the shelter of both humans and heavens** (永作人天之庇).

May our **departed Teacher be guided across** (先师超度),
**their tombs and residences be secured** (冢宅镇安),
**the realms of dragons and spirits be pacified** (境界龙神),
**the palaces and courtyards of the land deities be protected** (宫庭土地),
**their ranks elevated** (迁升阶品),
**and all living beings be sheltered** (佑护生灵).
May they **descend even to the remote and desolate lands** (下穷幽漠之乡),
**all receiving the blessings of pure ascension** (俱被清升之泽).

Above, may we **manifest the Heavenly Worthy’s great compassionate transformation** (上明天尊大慈之化),
and below, may we **fulfill our disciples’ sincere petitions** (下副臣等祈向之诚).
**Thus, we humbly present our prayer** (谨启以闻).

**Twelve Vows** (十二愿).
**Reignite the censer** (复炉).

**We solemnly command the incense-official messengers** (摄香官使者),
**the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** (左右龙虎君),
**and the attendant spirit officials of incense** (侍香诸灵官),
that at the place where we have **performed the pure morning Dao/Way practice** (清旦行道之所),
**golden elixir and jade-green herbs** (金液丹碧), **and the hundred blessed spirits** (芝英百灵)
**may naturally arise**.
May the **ten-direction celestial youths and jade maidens** (十方仙童玉女)
**attend to the orchid incense smoke** (接侍兰烟),
**and swiftly convey our sincere petitions** (传臣向来所启之诚)
**directly to the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Supreme Dao/Way** (径御至真无极大道),
**the Jade Emperor of the Broad Heaven** (昊天玉皇上帝),
**and the Supreme Sovereign of the Eastern Pole, the Green Heavenly Worthy Who Saves from Suffering** (东极救苦青玄上帝).

**Exit the hall and recite** (出堂颂).
**Exit the door** (出户).

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之七十五竟 道门科范大全集卷之七十六 上清升化仙度迁神道场仪 临午行道 升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 谣歌空洞，帝君存坛。 五帝校录，受符三官。 备卫四门，束魔去奸。 流铃掷火，阴秽焚残。 身佩金书，炼液芝颜。 玄灵受合，心动三关。 骑狮跨鹤，控龙乘鸾。 万星守舍，千魔不干。 道炁长存，万仙悉安，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣等身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严庄显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今临午行道，谨奉为入意，其诸情悃，已录奏闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、束极救苦青玄上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微上帝，南极注生大帝，东极救苦青玄上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，十方太上灵宝天尊，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，上清日月星斗河汉群真，三官四圣，五师三省真君，九天天曹，诸位真君，历代传宗启教诸大师真，雷霆神虎天医诸司官将，太上诸阶经箓中仙官将吏，天下名山洞府得道神仙，地府酆都大帝，幽阴圣众，水府扶桑大帝，阆苑真仙，人元五岳五天圣帝，酆都地祇，合干元帅、太岁土火、温司圣众、州县城隍之神，当境庙社神祇，福庭土地真官，法坛诸司官将，三界提魂摄魄神吏，四界直符功曹使者，誊奏表钱神吏，醮筵主宰，一切真仙。 恭望洪慈，洞垂昭鉴。 臣等擢形中土，禀质常伦，宿福所锺，遭逢道运，得以凡贱，参奉正真，炼气凝神，动亏真寂，游心属想，未契玄虚。 今有弟子某师弟相依，皆资昔会，恩均覆载，分等生成，仙化升沉，自宜荐举，事存明诰，敢奉丹诚，沥恳玄津，冥祈景佑。 今奉词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，诚深追慕。 弟子某以仙化本师某，昔禀玄猷，栖神道域，而善功未着，仙扎无名，修短有期，奄从常数，追伤痛悼，弥切诚祈，虔备坛场，奉修斋直。 臣等谨为考诸仪训，广作津梁，俾兹灭度之魂，出彼轮回之域。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养大道三尊。 臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，上祝皇帝万寿，宗社隆昌，祚历遐长，寰区清晏。 三师九祖，天下人民，玄贶所覃，并登真道。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上尊经。 臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流仙化道士某，消释罪尤，解除过谪，出九幽之府，离五苦之庭，轮转受生，常承福果，终得仙道，长乐无为，遐及幽沉，溥该动植，九围之内，庶类之中，赖此鸿休，成臻道化。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三师。
chunks.translated_text:
**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Seventy-Six**
**Upper Clarity Ascension-Transformation Ritual for Crossing and Transmigrating Spirits**
**Midday Dao/Way Practice**

Ascend the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
Proclaim the **Spiritual Guardians’ Incantation** (卫灵咒).
Sing hymns of emptiness and voidness—**the Celestial Worthy abides on the platform**.
The Five Emperors record the registers; the Three Officials receive the talismans.
Prepare the Four Gate Guardians, bind demons, and dispel deceit.
Ring the bells and cast fire—burn away all yin impurities.
Wear the **golden script amulet**, refine the elixir, and cultivate the **herb of jade complexion**.
The **Mysterious Spirit** receives the union—**the mind moves through the Three Passes**.
Riding the lion, straddling the crane, controlling the dragon, mounting the *luán* (鸾).
Ten thousand stars guard the dwelling; ten thousand demons dare not interfere.
**Dao/Way qi** eternally endures; ten thousand immortals dwell in peace, harmonizing with the True.
Strike the **Law Drum** twenty-four times.

**The Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Beginning Three Qi, the Most High Dao/Way Lord, and the Most High Venerable Lord** summon forth from our bodies the **Three Five Functionaries**, the **Left and Right Official Messengers**, the **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**, the **Dragon-Courier Officials**, the **Golden Boy Attendants of Incense**, the **Jade Maiden Messengers of Speech and Scattered Flowers**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, and the **Direct-Sun Incense Officials**—**thirty-six in total**—to emerge.

Those who emerge must be solemn, dignified, and resplendent in their attire, with **headdresses and trailing ribbons**. Open the **Mysterious Platform’s Earth and Domain Spirits**.

Today, as I perform the midday Dao/Way practice, I sincerely offer this with utmost devotion. My sincerity has been recorded and reported. May the **Most High Ten-Direction True Dao/Way qi** and the **Numinous Treasure Auspicious Light** descend and flow into my body, so that my petitions may swiftly reach the presence of the **Most High Boundless Dao/Way, the Jade Emperor of the Broad Heaven, and the Eastern Pole Saving-Suffering Green Heavenly Emperor**.

**Invoke the Law Position**.

I, **Subject of Rank [X]**, along with the assembled officials of the platform, humbly and sincerely petition:
The **Void-Natural Primordial Beginning Heavenly Venerable One**, the **Most High Dao/Way Lord**, the **Most High Venerable Lord**, the **Jade Emperor of the Broad Heaven**, the **Hook-Array Heavenly Emperor**, the **Northern Pole Worthy of the Purple Micro**, the **Southern Pole Life-Granting Emperor**, the **Eastern Pole Saving-Suffering Green Heavenly Emperor**, the **Heaven-Supporting Earth-Modeling Sovereign of the Yellow Soil**, the **Ten-Direction Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Venerables**, the **Heavenly Venerables**, the **Heavenly Emperors**, the **Upper Clarity Sun-Moon-Stars-Constellations-River-Han Host of True Ones**, the **Three Officials and Four Saints**, the **Five Teachers and Three Provincial True Lords**, the **Nine Heavenly Celestial Bureaucrats**, the **True Lords of All Ranks**, the **Transmitted Lineage and Doctrine-Granting Great Masters**, the **Thunder-Peal Spirit-Tiger Heavenly Physicians and All Officials**, the **Most High Ranked Scriptures and Talismans’ Immortal Officials and Clerks**, the **Named-Mountain Cave-Dwellings’ Dao-Achieving Immortals**, the **Underworld Acid-Field Emperor**, the **Yin-Spirits’ Holy Assembly**, the **Water Realm’s Eastern-Soaring Emperor**, the **Lingyuan True Immortals**, the **Five Peaks and Five Heavens’ Holy Emperors**, the **Acid-Field Earth Spirits**, the **Grand Marshal of the Five Elements**, the **Yearly Stem-Branch Earth-Fire**, the **Temperate Official’s Holy Assembly**, the **Prefectural-County City Deities**, the **Local Temple and Shrine Spirits**, the **Blessed Court’s Earthly True Officials**, the **Law Platform’s All Officials**, the **Three Realms’ Soul-Extracting Spirit-Clerks**, the **Four Realms’ Direct-Talisman Functionaries**, the **Petition-Recording Money-Spirit Clerks**, the **Ritual Feast’s Sovereigns**, and **All True Immortals**.

With reverence, we gaze upon your boundless mercy and profound discernment.

We, born of mortal form in the Central Land, endowed with ordinary nature, by the fate of past virtues, encountering the Dao/Way’s auspicious age, though of lowly station, may partake in the True. Refining qi and congealing spirit, yet still deficient in True stillness, wandering in thought—we have not yet grasped the Mysterious Void.

Now, my disciple **X**, relying on my former teacher **Y**, all share the same past gathering. Our bonds are as vast as heaven’s cover and earth’s load, our ranks ordained since birth. Ascension and decline in transformation—it is only right to recommend and elevate them, as decreed by the Celestial Edict. With utmost sincerity, we humbly implore the Mysterious Ford, praying for auspicious aid.

Today, by the decree of the Word, we dare not fail to report it.

**Proclaim the Word**.

As the Word states, our devotion is profound and sincere.

Disciple **X**, with the transformation of my former teacher **Y**, once received the Mysterious Strategy, dwelling in the Dao/Way’s domain, yet his virtuous deeds were not manifest, his immortal name unrecorded, his lifespan measured—he passed away in the natural course. Grief-stricken and sorrowful, we earnestly pray, solemnly preparing the ritual platform to perform the fast and rectitude.

We have carefully examined the ritual precepts, broadly constructing this bridge, so that this departing soul may be extinguished from the wheel of rebirth.

Now, as we perform the midday Dao/Way practice, we request the assembled ritualists to light **the first incense strand**, wishing this incense smoke to ascend directly to the heavens and offer itself to the **Three Venerable Ones of the Great Dao/Way**. With utmost sincerity, we **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate**, dedicating these merits to pray for the Emperor’s eternal longevity, the prosperity of the ancestral temple, the enduring blessing of the imperial lineage, and the peace of the realm.

May the **Three Teachers and Nine Ancestors**, the people of the land, and all who receive the Mysterious Grace attain the Dao/Way.

Today, we light this incense and **take refuge in the Venerable Ones’ True and Most High Virtue**. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True.

Now, as we perform the midday Dao/Way practice, we request the assembled ritualists to light **the second incense strand**, wishing this incense smoke to ascend directly to the heavens and offer itself to the **Most High Venerable Scripture**. With utmost sincerity, we **take refuge in body, spirit, and fate**, dedicating these merits to **Disciple X**, dissolving his offenses, absolving his transgressions, freeing him from the Nine Yin Prisons and the Five Suffering Courts, so that he may no longer wander in the cycle of birth, eternally receiving blessings, ultimately attaining the Dao/Way, enduring blissful non-action, extending even to the submerged and forgotten, encompassing all sentient beings within the nine boundaries—all relying on this vast mercy to achieve the Dao/Way’s transformation.

Today, we light this incense and **take refuge in the Scripture-Venerable Ones’ True and Most High Virtue**. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True.

Now, as we perform the midday Dao/Way practice, we request the assembled ritualists to light **the third incense strand**, wishing this incense smoke to ascend directly to the heavens and offer itself to the **Most High Three Teachers**.

chunks.original_text: 臣等至心皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流弟子某等，真炁潜资，至人降接，内凝冲素，外却凶邪，北宫续易尽之年，南府注长生之籍，冤仇销解，债讼和平，九族亲姻，普天民庶，幽明动植，巨福均沾。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，命魔，步虚，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微大帝，南极注生大帝，东极救苦青玄上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，上穷圆盖之高真，下极方舆之王宰，有灵有圣，今古师宗，醮筵列班，一切真仙。 恭望洪慈，洞回渊鉴。 臣等幸以福缘，得参真化。 仙经秘篆，早遂禀修。 窃按真经，深明旨教，师恩至重，义等天亲，生化转轮，当严荐奉。 今有祈向，敢不誊闻。 弟子某伏为仙化本师某，往以善因，获参真品，佩奉高妙，宗仰正真。 而仙品未充，尘劳未静，遽缠疾厄，遂至沦亡。 虽常数之有终，由后人之贻衅，追悔莫及，荼毒难任，深忧积集之愆，尚累超升之便，欲求忏悔，以福幽明。 弟子某等伏自积劫以来，受生之后，上悖君父，不孝尊亲，就伪弃真，背师欺友。 或杀生残忍，笺害无辜，妬始贤良，轻浚亲属； 或啖食物命，咀嚼荤辛，窃弄宝经，评论仙圣，忽略四大，秽慢三光，咒诅神明，自欺形影； 或妄传经教，轻泄天书，不合典仪，犯干天宪； 或爱人信，施用不公，荣润己身，支赡亲党； 或破斋毁戒，有犯玄科，下负人伦，上违经箓，名书黑簿，功落青编，恶至灭身，祸延师表。 冥冥长夜，精爽何之。 非自首陈，何能升济。 以今修斋行道，悔过知非，存殁罪愆，咸希除荡。 伏愿至真大道，无上众尊，告下酆都岱宗二十七狱，阴阳水火百二十曹，削除七世以来生死罪对，得居宽纵，放赦形魂，托生中华，受气智慧，宗奉玄科，振扬法音，为人天师，证虚无道。 次愿帝王万寿，臣佐一心，四海同文，八弦共轨，三涂六趣，九夜重冥，睹见光明，免诸罪恼。 蝖飞蠢动，率土普天，同赖洪恩，咸升福岸。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等忏谢之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来临午行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、东极救苦青玄上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
We, Your humble servants, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in body, spirit, and life—devoting these merits to disciple [name] and all descendants. The True *qi* lies dormant as latent treasure, while the Perfected One descends to receive. Within, the *yuan* and *qi* congeal into purity; without, malevolent forces are repelled. The Northern Palace extends the year of boundless ease, while the Southern Bureau records the register of eternal life. Grievances dissolve, debts are reconciled, and harmony spreads through the nine clans, all peoples under heaven, both seen and unseen, and all living things—all sharing in this boundless blessing.

Now, we again light incense and take refuge in the Teacher-Venerable Ones’ Most High and True Virtue. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True.

**Repentance, command the demon, and step upon the void**—three rites performed. We humbly repeat the sacred ranks.

We, Your devoted servants [name] and the assembled ritual officials, with utmost sincerity and reverence, address:

The Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Natural Void,
The Most High Dao/Way Lord,
The Most High Venerable Lord Lao,
The Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven,
The Heavenly Sovereign of the Gourd Cluster,
The Grand Imperial Sovereign of the Northern Pole,
The Grand Imperial Sovereign of the Southern Pole,
The Supreme Saviour of the Eastern Pole,
The Earthly Sovereign who follows Heaven’s law,
The Highest Celestial Worthies of the Round Canopy,
The Royal Governors of the Four Quarters,
All Spirits and Saints, both past and present,
All True Celestials assembled at this ritual feast—

We humbly pray for Your boundless compassion and Your penetrating insight.

By fortune and merit, we have partaken in the True Transformation. The secrets of the Celestial Scriptures were early attained through practice. Examining the True Scriptures, we deeply understand their teachings. The Teacher’s grace is most profound, equal to that of a heavenly kin—one who turns the Wheel of Life and Death. Thus, we must solemnly offer this petition.

Now, we dare to submit our plea: Your disciple [name] humbly acknowledges that our revered Celestial Master [name]—through virtuous causes—once attained the True Rank, wore the lofty mysteries, and revered the True One. Yet, our Celestial Rank remains incomplete, worldly toil unsettled, and suddenly bound by sickness and calamity, we nearly perished. Though all things must end, the fault lies with later generations, whose recklessness we now regret too late. The suffering is unbearable, and we fear our accumulated sins may hinder the Master’s ascension. We seek repentance to benefit both the living and the dead.

Your disciples [name], from countless kalpas past, since taking birth, have:
- Betrayed sovereigns and parents, failing to honor our elders;
- Abandoned truth for falsehood, betraying teachers and deceiving friends;
- Committed murder and cruelty, harming the innocent, envying the virtuous, and slighting kin;
- Consumed life-bearing substances, violated purity, misused sacred scriptures, and blasphemed the Celestial Worthies, deceiving even our own forms;
- Misinterpreted sacred teachings, recklessly revealing Heaven’s secrets, violating rites, and defying celestial decrees;
- Practiced deceit, acted unjustly, enriched ourselves while neglecting kin;
- Broken vows, violated precepts, and transgressed the Mystic Arts—failing humanity below and the scriptures above. Our names are inscribed in the Black Register, our merits lost in the Blue Ledger. Our sins have led to annihilation, and our misdeeds have brought ruin upon our teachers.

In the endless night of darkness, where has our vital essence gone? Without confession, how could we hope for salvation?

Now, through fasting and Dao/Way practice, we repent our errors, seeking to purge both the living and the dead of their transgressions.

We humbly pray that the Most High Dao/Way and the Venerable Worthies command the Twenty-Seven Prisons of the Underworld and the One Hundred Twenty Departments of Yin-Yang Water-Fire to erase the karmic debts of seven lifetimes, granting us broad pardon, releasing our forms and spirits, and allowing us to be reborn in the Central Realm, receiving *qi* of wisdom. May we uphold the Mystic Arts, propagate the sacred teachings, become teachers for humanity and gods, and realize the Dao/Way of the Void.

Next, we pray for the longevity of the Emperor, the unity of ministers, the harmonization of all under heaven, and the alignment of the eight directions. May all realms of suffering and the nine layers of darkness witness the light, free from all torment. May all creatures, great and small, across the land, share in this boundless grace and ascend to the shores of blessing.

May this illuminate the Heavenly Worthy’s great compassion above and reflect our sincere repentance below. We humbly submit this petition.

**Twelve Wishes Completed. The Incense Altar is Rekindled.**

We solemnly command the incense officials, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the attendant spirit officials to gather at the place where we performed the midday Dao/Way practice. There, gold elixir and jade-green pills shall spontaneously arise, along with herbs and hundred-spirits’ blessings, as the Celestial Worthies converge before this incense altar.

We pray that the Celestial Maiden and Boy attendants of the Ten Directions receive the fragrant smoke and swiftly convey our sincere petition to the presence of:
- The Most High Dao/Way of the Boundless,
- The Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven,
- The Supreme Saviour of the Eastern Pole.

**The Assembly Recites the Praise. The Ritual Hall is Exited.**

**Daoist Rituals Comprehensive Collection, Volume Seventy-Six Complete**
**Daoist Rituals Comprehensive Collection, Volume Seventy-Seven**

**Ritual of the Upper Clarity Dao/Way’s Ascension and Transformation for the Departed Spirits**

**Evening Dao/Way Practice**

The ritual assembly ascends the platform as prescribed. Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao/Way’s teachings. The sacred incantations are proclaimed, and the divine light shines brightly, while auspicious *qi* swirls in abundance. The celestial tripod and dipper [箕斗] cast their radiance, and the sacred grove [芝宇] lies serene. The jade pupils [玉眸] hold the true essence, and the precious altar [宝坛] remains pure and dry. The night transforms into day, and the cycle returns to midday. The Great Summit [太华] flows with pearls, and the vermilion phoenix [丹凤] soars in the *Xuan* [玄].

The evil spirits are quelled, and the wicked are extinguished. With lofty steps, we ascend amid fragrant smoke. The Celestial Worthies gather in full, all arriving before the Emperor’s presence, merging with the Dao/Way’s true essence.

The sacred drum [法鼓] is struck twenty-four times.

We summon the Most High Dao/Way of the Boundless, the Three Primordial *Qi* [三炁] of the Heavenly Origin, the Supreme Dao/Way Lord, the Supreme Old Lord, and the following officials from within our bodies:
- The Three Five Functionaries [三五功曹],
- The Left and Right Officials,
- The Left and Right Incense Bearers,
- The Relay Dragons and Mounted Bridesmen [驿龙骑吏],
- The Golden Boy Attendants of Incense,
- The Jade Girl Scatterers of Flowers,
- The Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols,
- The Direct Day Incense Officials,
and all thirty-six in total.

Those who emerge are clad in solemn and dignified robes, their headgear and ribbons hanging in proper order. They open the gates of the Mystic Daoist Altars [玄坛] and the local deities [土地], as well as the regional spirit officials [方域神真].

Now, as the sun sets and we perform the Dao/Way practice, we humbly offer this as our heartfelt intention. All our earnest entreaties have already been recorded and presented. We pray that the Supreme Dao/Way’s true essence of the Ten Directions, the Sacred Treasure and Auspicious Light, descend and enter our bodies, so that our petitions may swiftly reach the presence of:
- The Most High Dao/Way of the Boundless,
- The Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven,
- The Eastern Pole’s Supreme Saviour of the Green *Xuan*.

We request the proclamation of the sacred ranks.

We, the undersigned [具位臣某] and all the assembled ritual officials, sincerely present this petition together. To the Heavenly Venerable of the Natural Void, the Supreme Dao/Way Lord, the Supreme Old Lord, the Jade Emperor of the Boundless Heaven, the Hook-and-Arrow Heavenly Sovereign, the Great Purple Emperor of the Northern Pole, the Southern Pole Emperor of the Vital Breath, the Eastern Pole’s Supreme Saviour of the Green *Xuan*, the Earthly Sovereign of the Posterior Soil who follows Heaven’s law, the Supreme Venerable of the Ten Directions’ Sacred Treasure, the Heavenly Venerables of all realms, the Heavenly Emperors of all realms, the Upper Clarity Worthies of the Sun, Moon, Stars, and Milky Way, the Three Officials and Four Saints, the Five Masters and Three Provincial Spirit Lords, the Nine Heavenly Celestial Functionaries, all the Spirit Lords, the Great Masters of successive generations who uphold the Dao/Way’s lineage and teachings, the Thunder and Lightning Spirit Tigers and Heavenly Physicians of all departments, the Daoist officials and officers from the Supreme Scriptures and Ordinances, the named mountain and cave deities who have attained the Dao/Way, the Great Emperor of the Underworld, the Holy Multitude of the Netherworld, the Great Emperor of the Eastern Pole’s Exalted Phoenix, the True Worthies of the Langyan Palace, the Five Sacred Emperors of the Five Peaks and Five Heavens, the Earthly Sovereign of the Netherworld, the General of the Ten Thousand *Gan*, the Grand Marshal of the Earthly Branches, the Sacred Multitude of the *Wen* Command, the deities of the prefectures and counties, the city gods, the local spirit officials of the auspicious courtyard, the ritual officers of all departments, the Three Realms’ deities who extract souls and seize spirits, the Four Realms’ direct symbols and functionaries, the scribes who record and present petitions, the deities presiding over the *Jiao* feast, and all the seated True Worthies.

With reverence, we gaze upon Your boundless compassion and profound discernment. We, Your devoted disciples, have long benefited from Your sacred grace, drawing upon the pure *qi* to return to the Dao/Way’s transformation and partake in the true winds. Through the hidden precepts and sacred texts, the profound rituals and wondrous doctrines, we have attained harmony and enlightenment. Heaven’s blessings are vast and deep.

Yet, this disciple [弟子某], through the Master’s personal bond, once by fate’s convergence, was held in high regard by the Dao/Way’s teachings and prioritized in the Master’s true instructions. Together, we have transcended life and death, ascending and descending, guiding one another toward the Dao/Way. Now, in obedience to Your sacred words, we dare not fail to present this petition. The words are proclaimed.

As per the words spoken, our devotion is profound and sincere. We fear that our former Master, having ascended to the Daoist transformation, may wonder where our spiritual awareness resides. Their radiant presence has fled, and their voice and form are distant. Previously, we dwelled in the turbid world, now taking refuge in the Mystic Daoist Gate. Our practice is incomplete, our cultivation often neglected, and we struggle to transcend the Dao’s realm, still hindered by the Netherworld’s path. Our body has passed beyond the Three Officials’ jurisdiction, and we suffer the torments of all spirits. In these dark nights, our sorrow is genuine and deep.

Thus, we adhere to the ritual precepts and solemnly proceed together, following the Daoist teachings and venerating the true essence. We rely on Your grace to open the path and pray to repay the force that gave us life. We prepare the incense with utmost reverence, hoping to express our earnest aspiration. We purify our thoughts and focus our minds, devoutly observing the *Jiao* feast and its strictures.

With this evening’s Dao/Way practice, we request the ritual assembly to take this first pinch of incense and offer it upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, paying homage to the Three Supreme Venerables. We surrender our body, spirit, and fate, dedicating these merits to the ancestral temples, the spirits of the earth, and the celestial Worthies. May our virtuous *qi* rise to the Nine Pure [九清] and our spirits ride the clouds to the Eight Extremes [八极]. May Your blessings descend upon us, protecting our nation and bringing peace to its people.

May the Emperor of the Northern Pole extend longevity, and the Southern Mountain Emperor bestow prosperity upon all. May the world be at peace and harmony prevail within and without. May the court be filled with virtuous ministers, and the countryside have no abandoned talents. May all under heaven follow the Dao/Way’s transformation, uniting in the harmony of non-action.

Now, through this act of burning incense, we have taken refuge in the Supreme Scriptures and the Great Saints’ true essence. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless and merge with the Dao’s true essence.

With this evening’s Dao/Way practice, we request the ritual assembly to take this second pinch of incense and offer it upward. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, paying homage to the Supreme Venerable Scriptures. We surrender our body, spirit, and fate, dedicating these merits to our former Master [先师某].

May the True Vehicle guide and protect us, and the Most Holy preserve and uphold us. May we bathe in the divine fire’s court and refine our spirits in the realm of penetrating *yang*. May we ascend to the jade gates of the True Worthies and receive the name in the Pearl Palace. May we praise the Dao/Way’s compassionate winds and open the path of wisdom for all beings.

Together with the Nine *Xuan* and Seven Ancestors, the Masters of scriptures and ordination, the upholders and monitors of the alliance, and the mountain-dwelling kindred spirits, may we all share in the blessings of victory and ascend to the true stages.

Now, through this act of burning incense, we have taken refuge in the Supreme Scriptures and the Great Saints’ true essence. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless and merge with the Dao’s true essence.

chunks.original_text: 以今落景，升坛行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太上三师。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流弟子某家，亿曾万祖，亲缘眷属，普及幽明，存者承福佑之资，殁者获升迁之泽。 洎乎周天八极，动植含灵，九夜三途，游魂滞魄，荷太上宣慈之贶，沐天真济拔之恩，克遂逍遥，永荷贞吉。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方。 东青西素南丹北冥三时通用。 臣等伏闻至道玄通，随机赴感。 天尊广济，应念垂慈。 悔谢则三业消清，忏除则九泉开泰。 臣等以今转经行道，归命十方无极太上灵宝天尊，三光五岳，三河四海，三十六部尊经。 奉为弟子某以先师某谢绝世尘，迁升真路。 仰虑前缘往劫，此世以来，行教立功，宣科济俗，违越禁戒，负犯幽明，传法修身，逾真忤圣。 后学爽金缯之信，师资罹轻泄之辜，功过相因，愆尤未解，因今忏悔，成乞荡除。 伏愿上圣弘慈，至真玄鉴，告盟三界，敕勒四司，五帝开恩，三官赦罪，地无报对，水绝盟言，永出轮回，克升长乐，刊功帝简，垂佑法门。 六道三涂，同臻胜善，祸沉九夜，福起十方。 率土普天，咸登寿域。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 步虚，三礼。 重称法位。 具位臣等与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，祖师三清玉帝，昊天玉皇上帝，十方三界，一切真灵。 恭望洪慈，普回昭鉴。 臣等夙荷玄休，早依道化，参修大法，佐国度人。 缅惟禀奉之初，实自师资之力。 而迹随尘染，身远林泉，乏栖神养素之功，亏利物济时之效，感通诚寡，忧惕常深。 弟子某窃惟先师某开济恩深，师尊义重，幽明有隔，亲奉无阶，惟罄斋诚，仰伸崇荐。 伏虑粤从曩劫，以洎此身，生化以来，功过参积。 或含慈拯物，演教度人，违负经科，冒犯禁戒； 或施行道法，抑徇人情，乘势爱憎，妄生嫌恨； 或兴修观宇，遏水穿山，惊骇龙神，损伐林木，彼成此废，功立过生； 或传法授经，不依年限，慈能累道，善必成非，五帝四司，未蒙原赦，三官九府，犹击罪名，拘闭幽关，无由迁拔。 以今修斋行道，谢过希恩，无量罪条，将希原宥。 伏愿三尊大圣，应感真灵，降罔极之恩，赦无涯之咎，事无巨细，咸乞荡除。 即使名度朱陵，衅消黑簿，太阴受炼，丹霍迁神，轮转福阶，登真证品，克臻道果，永出化机。 前代今生，亿曾万祖，存亡受福，动植沾荣，流向法门，垂休后学，大弘神化，常转法轮。 臣等所谢所祈，仰通玄鉴，殃消昔劫，福降今辰。 上愿国祚延长，帝王万寿，乾坤交泰，日月贞明，风雨顺常，星辰合度，干戈弭戢，谷稼丰登，岁有祯祥，时无疵疠，幽明开泰，蠢动安全，普及含生，俱契常道。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等归命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来落景行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、东极救苦青玄上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

As the sun now sets, ascending the platform to practice the Dao/Way, we humbly request the assembled Dharma assembly to kindle these three strands of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend the celestial path, offering reverence to the Most High Three Masters.

We, the disciples, take refuge with body, spirit, and life, and with these merits, dedicate them to the lineage of our teacher [Name], extending blessings to our countless ancestors and kindred spirits, both living and departed. May the living inherit the resources of fortune and protection, while the deceased attain the grace of ascension.

To all within the revolving heavens and the eight extremes, to all sentient beings of earth and plant, to the Nine Nights and Three Paths, to wandering souls and stagnant spirits—may they all receive the Most High’s proclaimed benevolence and be bathed in the True One’s salvific grace, achieving boundless ease and eternal auspiciousness.

Now, through this act of burning incense, we take refuge in the Teacher’s supreme virtue and the Great Saints’ true essence. After attaining the Dao/Way, we ascend to the formless and merge with the Dao’s true essence.

**Repentance completed.**
*East Azure, West White, South Vermilion, North Dark*—valid for all three watches.

We have heard that the Mysterious Dao responds to all circumstances and attends to every sentiment. The Celestial Sovereign’s boundless aid extends mercy in response to thought. Repentance clears the threefold karma, and atonement opens the Nine Abysses to prosperity.

Now, through this turning of the scriptures and practice of the Dao/Way, we bow in homage to the Ten Directions’ Limitless Supreme, the Soul-Treasury Celestial Worthy, the Three Lights and Five Peaks, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, and the Thirty-Six Departments of Venerable Scriptures. We, disciple [Name], with our teacher [Name], sever worldly dust and ascend the True Path.

Reflecting on past lifetimes and this very existence, from birth onward, we have accumulated merits and demerits—sometimes practicing compassion to save beings and teaching to guide people, yet violating scriptural precepts and transgressing prohibitions; sometimes applying Daoist methods while yielding to human emotions, favoring or resenting by circumstance, fostering grudges; sometimes constructing observatories, diverting waters, or tunneling mountains, disturbing dragon spirits and felling trees, leaving some harmed while others prospered, merits turning to faults. Or in transmitting the Dharma and teaching scriptures, disregarding proper timing, where kindness became a burden to the Dao and good intentions led to error. The Five Emperors and Four Officials have not granted pardon, and the Three Officials and Nine Departments still strike our offenses, confining us in dark prisons with no means of liberation.

Through this fasting and Daoist practice, we now confess our faults and seek mercy, hoping to purge countless transgressions. May the Three Venerable Saints respond to our sincere pleas, descend boundless grace, and forgive boundless guilt. Whether great or small, may all be cleansed.

Thus, may our names be erased from the Red Register, our sins expunged from the Black Ledger, the Dark Moon refined, and our souls ascend to the Vermilion Palace. May we traverse the Wheel of Fortune, attain True Rank, fulfill the Dao’s fruit, and forever escape the cycle of transformation.

To all ancestors, living and deceased, across countless generations, may they receive blessings, and all sentient beings share in honor. May the Dao’s light spread, benefiting future disciples, perpetually turning the Wheel of Teaching and magnifying divine transformation.

Our petitions and supplications are now presented to the Mysterious Insight. May past karmic calamities dissolve, and present blessings descend.

Above, may the Celestial Sovereign’s benevolent grace be manifest; below, may our sincere homage be fulfilled. We humbly submit this prayer.

**Twelve Vows completed.**
*Restoration of the incense burner.*

We solemnly command the incense officers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Officers, and the attendant spirit officials of incense: May they now cause gold elixirs and jade-green herbs, as well as all hundred spirits, to naturally arise at the place where we previously set the sun and practiced the Dao. May the Ten Directions’ immortal youths and jade maidens attend the fragrant smoke, swiftly conveying our sincere petitions to the Supreme Limitless Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Vault, and the Sovereign of the Eastern Pole, the Green Celestial Emperor Who Saves from Suffering, before the Celestial Throne.

**Exit the hall in praise.**
**Depart the door.**

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之七十七竟 道门科范大全集卷之七十八 上清升化仙度迁神道场仪 设醮行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘飙散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙公，与道合真。 呜法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣等身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今设醮延真，烧香行道，谨奉为入意，其诸情悃，已录奏闻，愿得太上十方至真道黑，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝、东极救苦青玄上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨同诚上启，虚无自然元始天尊，太上大道君，太上老君，昊天玉皇上帝，勾陈天皇大帝，北极紫微大帝，南极注生大帝，东极救苦青玄上帝，承天效法后土皇地祇，十方太上灵宝天尊，诸天天尊，诸天上帝，上清日月星斗河汉群真，三官四圣，五师三省真君，九天天曹，诸位真君，历代传宗启教诸大师真，雷霆神虎天医诸司官将，太上诸阶经箓中仙官将吏，天下名山得道神仙，地府酆都大帝，幽阴圣众，水府扶桑大帝，阆苑真仙，人元五岳五天圣帝，酆都地祇，合干元帅、太岁土火、瘟司圣众、州府城隍主者，当境庙社神祇，福庭土地真官，法坛诸司官将，三界提魂摄魄神兵，四界直符功曹使者，誊奏表钱神吏，醮筵主宰，一切真仙。 恭望洪慈，洞垂昭鉴。 臣等伏闻宝珠传道，难明喜庆之言； 玉局授经，大启流行之誓。 师资踵继，今古灯传。 自天上而达人间，法固分於精奥； 惟高真之与初学，势亦异於仙凡。 均称此道之有传，超出化机之能几。 弟子某奉为先师某忽惊处顺，恐未超升，仰托醮功，上干道化。 陈苾芬之嘉荐，敝圭洁之灵场，傒望真游，鉴观昭事。 琼轮羽盖，泛灏气於清空； 月帔星冠，介泬寥於午夜。 企百灵之交会，指九夜之仙津。 臣与众等不任瞻望激切延请之至，祇迎圣驭。 降圣，上茶，初献，散花。 再称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨重诚上启，九清上圣，三洞师尊，十方三界，一切真灵。 恭望洪慈，洞回渊鉴。 臣闻混元函谷，控白鹿以西升； 黄帝鼎湖，驾髯龙而高举。 莫不以长生为本，却死为先。 且斯道之高玄，系志人之参究。 然功难制锦，喻起系风，既不勤於用心，岂能专於抱一。 放怀欲境，任意尘缘，嗜好日深，衰败时积，气亡液漏，血灭骨枯。 既道运之渐凋，必生缘之加促。 弟子某奉为先师某生逢景运，名击玄门，经教虽参，气形未炼，忽随化而暂灭，恐积行之多违，仙品未克，生方尚阻。 仰惟天尊设教，太上垂科，有仙度升天之仪，有炼化生尸之法，使神升上界，魂超太阴，早入仙源，远辞冥谪。 是敢归凭至道，建立斋功，因清净之鹤袍，扣巍峨之虎阙。 风飘清呗，绕容曳之云旗； 露抱芳罇，莹辉华之兰席。 臣等存神天界，端简夜坛，誊报本之哀悰，格盖高之睿鉴。

**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Codes Complete Volume Seventy-Seventh Concluded**
**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Codes Complete Volume Seventy-Eighth**
*Upper Clarity Ascension-Transformation Ritual for Daoist Deities and Spirits*
*Establishing a Ritual Feast and Practicing the Dao*

The Ritual Platform is raised as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao/Way.

Proclaim the sacred incantations of protection.
The Five Stars align in radiance, illuminating the Five Directions.
The Water Star repels calamities, the Wood Star brings prosperity.
The Upholder Star (Yinghuò) dissipates misfortune, the Great White Star (Taibai) wards off soldiers.
The Settling Star (Zhenxing) secures fourfold blessings, benefiting family and state.

Names inscribed upon jade tablets, words recorded in the Imperial Registry.
Riding the gusts, scattering the radiance, soaring through the boundless heavens.
Entering and exiting the unseen realm, wandering and feasting in the Ten Directions.
The Five Clouds float as banners, summoning spirits and restraining winds.
Commanding ten thousand spirits, guarding the Daoist Sage, uniting with the Dao/Way and achieving true essence.

Sound the **Law** drum **twenty-four times**.
Light the incense burner.

We humbly invoke the Supreme Limitless Dao/Way of the **Highest Three Heavens**—the **Primordial Origin of the Three Qi (Trigrams)**, the **Supreme Dao Lord**, the **Supreme Old Lord**—to summon from our bodies the **Three Five Officials of Vitality**, the Left and Right Officers, the Left and Right Incense Bearers, the **Postal Dragon Cavalry**, the **Golden Boys Attending Incense**, the **Jade Maidens Scattering Flowers**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, the **Direct Day Incense Officers**, and the **Thirty-Six Combined Officials** to emerge.

Those who exit shall don **auspicious attire and ceremonial robes**, with **headgear and trailing plumes**, opening the **Mysterious Gate** for the **Land Deities** and **Domain Spirits**.

We now establish this Ritual Feast to prolong the **Daoist Deities’ presence**, burning incense and practicing the Dao/Way, offering this with utmost sincerity. Our heartfelt petitions have already been recorded and presented. May the **Supreme Daoist Truths of the Ten Directions** descend as **Black Light**, the **Numinous Treasure’s Auspicious Radiance**, flowing into our bodies, so that our prayers may swiftly reach the **Supreme Limitless Dao/Way**, the **Celestial Vault Jade Emperor**, and the **Eastern Pole Green Celestial Emperor Who Saves from Suffering**.

**First invocation of the Law position.**
The **named disciple** and the **assembled Ritual Platform officials**, with sincere devotion, present our petition to the **Virtuous and Limitless Dao Lord**, the **Supreme Dao Lord**, the **Supreme Old Lord**, the **Celestial Vault Jade Emperor**, the **Hooked-Heaven Emperor**, the **Northern Pole Purple Microstar Emperor**, the **Southern Pole Life-Nurturing Emperor**, the **Eastern Pole Green Celestial Emperor Who Saves from Suffering**, the **Land Deity of the Earthly Sovereign**, the **Supreme Numinous Treasure of the Ten Directions**, the **Heavenly Lords of All Heavens**, the **Heavenly Emperors of All Heavens**, the **Upper Clarity Deities of the Sun, Moon, Stars, and Milky Way**, the **Three Officials and Four Saints**, the **Five Teachers and Three Provinces’ True Lords**, the **Nine Heavenly Celestial Registrars**, the **True Lords of All Positions**, the **Great Masters of Traditioned Lineage and Teaching**, the **Thunderous Tiger Heavenly Physicians and All Officials**, the **Daoist Officials and Cavalry from the Supreme Stages of Scripture and Talismans**, the **Named Mountain Deities of the Dao/Way**, the **Underworld King of the Acropolis**, the **Holy Multitudes of the Dark Realm**, the **Heavenly Emperor of the Eastern Pillar**, the **True Deities of the Lingyan Gardens**, the **Five Sacred Mountains and Five Heavenly Emperors of Humanity**, the **Acropolis Land Deity**, the **Commander-in-Chief of the Ten Thousands**, the **Yearly Sovereign of Earth and Fire**, the **Plague Officials**, the **City Deities of Provinces and Districts**, the **Ritual Platform Officials**, the **Three Realms’ Spirits of Soul and Life**, the **Four Realms’ Direct Talismans and Vitality Officials**, the **Recorded and Delivered Petitions of the Talisman Clerks**, the **Feast Master**, and **All True Deities**.

With reverent gaze, we behold the **Great Compassion** and **Piercing Insight**.

We have heard that the **Numinous Treasure** transmits the Dao/Way, its teachings profound and joyous.
The **Jade Circle** bestows scriptures, its oath to spread them far and wide.
The lineage of **Masters and Disciples** follows in succession, like ancient and modern lamps.
From the heavens above to the realm of humanity, the Dao/Way is divided into **refined and profound** teachings.
Yet the **Highest True Ones** and the **novices** differ in their understanding and capacity.
All acknowledge that the Dao/Way has been transmitted, surpassing the **mechanisms of transformation and ascension**.

This disciple, serving as **Master** [name]’s successor, fears that though I have received the **auspicious Dao/Way**, I have not yet ascended.
I rely upon the **Ritual Feast’s power** to beseech the **Ascension-Transformation of the Dao/Way**.

With **fragrant incense and pure offerings**, I invite the **True Ones’ presence** to this **sacred field**.
I yearn for their **ascended wanderings**, hoping to witness the **radiant affairs** of the Dao/Way.

The **Jade Wheels and Feathered Canopies** drift through the **pure qi of the heavens**.
The **Moon Garments and Star Crowns** illuminate the **vast expanse of midnight**.

I await the **gathering of the Hundred Spirits**, pointing toward the **Nine-Night Celestial Ferry**.

We, the disciple and the assembled officials, cannot contain our **eager reverence** in inviting and prolonging their presence.
We humbly welcome the **Holy Procession**.

**Descent of the Holy Ones.**
Offer tea.
**First presentation.**
Scatter flowers.

**Second invocation of the Law position.**
The **named disciple** and the **assembled Ritual Platform officials**, with renewed sincerity, present our petition to the **Nine Clarities’ Supreme Saints**, the **Three Caverns’ Masterly Lords**, and the **True Spirits of the Ten Directions and Three Realms**.

With reverent gaze, we behold the **Great Compassion** and **Piercing Insight**.

We have heard that the **Primordial Origin** of the **Hun-Dun** (Mystic Cavern) ascended westward with the **White Deer**.
The **Yellow Emperor** of the **Cauldron Lake** soared aloft upon the **Bearded Dragon**.
All sought **longevity** as their foundation, **repelling death** as their priority.

The Dao/Way’s **lofty mysteries** are tied to the **aspirations of humanity**.
Yet **laborious efforts** are like **embroidered silks**—difficult to achieve.
The **analogy of the rising wind** reminds us: if one does not **diligently cultivate the heart**, how can one **specialize in embracing the One**?

To **abandon oneself to desires**, indulge in **worldly affairs**, deepen **attachment to pleasures**—these lead to **decline and decay**.
When **qi is lost** and **essence leaks**, when **blood fades** and **bones wither**,
The **Dao/Way’s vitality** gradually diminishes,
And the **fate of one’s karma** accelerates.

This disciple, serving as **Master** [name]’s successor, though born in an **auspicious era** and **striking the Mystic Gate** with my name,
Though I have **partially studied** the scriptures and teachings,
My **form and qi** remain unrefined.
Suddenly, I have **followed the transformation** and **temporarily perished**,
Fearing that my **accumulated practices** have **many transgressions**,
And that my **Daoist rank** has not yet been achieved,
For my **life’s path** still faces obstacles.

I humbly rely upon the **Heavenly Lords’ teachings**, the **Supreme Old Lord’s codes**,
For there are **rituals of ascension and transformation** to achieve **Daoist transcendence**,
And **methods of refining and purifying** to **revive the body**,
So that the **spirit may ascend to the Upper Realm**,
And the **soul may transcend the Great Darkness**,
Entering early the **Daoist Source**,
And forever departing the **Underworld Exile**.

Thus, I dare to **return and depend upon the Supreme Dao/Way**,
To **establish this Ritual Feast**,
Using the **pure and refined** **Crane Robes**,
And **knocking at the towering** **Tiger Gate**.

The **wind carries the pure chants**, enveloping the **dragging clouds and flags**.
The **dew embraces the fragrant incense**, shining upon the **lantern-lit jade mats**.

We **store our spirits in the heavens**, maintaining **serene simplicity** at the **midnight altar**.
We **report our original woes**, hoping to **reach the lofty discernment** of the **Heavenly Lords**.

chunks.original_text: 滥司关奏，职在升闻，设醮心词，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 按如词言，诚深追慕。 谅必尘於天听，愿加悯於幽途。 大施涣汗之恩，广作津梁之路。 伏念近化某自从历劫，洎于此身，住世以来，所犯之罪，六情染累，三业萦牵，是乃反非，功不补过。 或传经授道，乖越明科； 或怨法咎师，犯干天宪，违明真科典、三元品文，身没幽关，受诸报对，无边过咎，难以备陈。 以今归命诸天，投哀上圣，罪无巨细，咸乞荡除。 开度穷魂，出离幽苦，炼神丹霍，受化福堂，蜕骨成仙，餐霞吸景，累修不怠，积学成真，渐陟虚无，不沦生灭，分身散景，出有入无，与道合真，体玄接物。 三师玄祖，超证仙班； 九世先亡，升腾天路。 庶狱咸消於惨毒，三涂悉能於骗驰，六趣清升，四生均利。 臣与众等无任告真拔亡之至，酒陈亚献。 散花。 重称法位。 具位臣某与合坛官众等，谨虔诚上启，三清上圣，十极妙有高真，合坛应感，一切真灵。 伏以灭迹去世，虽人道之有终； 反胎藏形，由仙功之未满。 托质太阴之室，驰心浩劫之家。 伏闻太上垂科，有炼化生尸之法； 高真演教，有仙度升天之符。 使形神复返於霄途，俾体魄不拘於地府。 五帝卫护，三界司迎，历劫流通，仙家传授。 今有某追惟师匠，建立斋功，辄恃洪慈，求蠲往过。 恐先师某身参大法，崇奉多违，名系仙曹，修行中废，积集罪咎，坐致终亡，青简落名，冥官执过，天门障塞，地户淹留，蒿里幽祇，横生拘录。 仰希大宥，昭洗宿殃，敕下三官，告盟五帝，举善辍恶，起死回骸。 使翥景星衢，游神洞府，积功而超六欲，证道而化群迷，均善利於先曾，覃余休於后叶。 然后弟子某等安居楼观，克世冠裳，驱冢宅之凶邪，却他人之妬。 法灯相续，迈陶陵之清修； 眉寿无期，追松乔之久视。 世罗尽解，道念长新，无忌利物之心，上广好生之化。 臣与众等不任再三祈请之至，有酒盈樽，谨伸三献。 散花，祝真文，宣疏。 具位臣某，谨重诚上启，九清上圣，十极高真，三界应感，一切真灵。 臣等今财四弘誓满，六度功圆。 济济仙仪，俨鸾骖於空际； 诜诜法从，整鹤辔於离庭。 仙梵停音，清香罢祝。 天浮瑞气，映宝座之玲珑； 月散余辉，满花坛之皎洁。 企天光而依恋，悯泉路以倾虔。 愿赐优容，俾倍扈从，使先化本师某赍持玉简，骖侍丹舆，飘裾碧落之庭，飞步朱陵之府。 金书涤虑，挹道润於中衢； 玉，液疏神，契德流於上善。 均沐玄祖，覃福门人，惠泽所沾，群生咸遂。 臣等不任依恋之至，诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首再拜，奉辞圣驾。 十二愿。 复炉。

「Thus, the **Sacred Officials** of the **Daoist Canon** have been summoned,
And the **Minister’s duty** is to **ascend and report** their words.
The **ritual supplications** are now humbly presented for **propagation**.

**Supplication Declared.**
In truth, I deeply **revere and cherish** the **Heavenly Lords’ teachings**.
I pray that my **sins may be cleansed by the Celestial Hearers**,
And that **mercy may descend upon the souls in the Underworld Path**.

May the **Great Compassion** be **widely bestowed** like **sweat of benevolence**,
And the **Broad Way** be **established** as a **crossing for all beings**.

**Reflecting upon my own past transgressions**—
From countless **kalpas (eons)** since my **first embodiment**,
Until this very **lifetime in the mortal world**,
The **sins I have committed** are **deeply rooted**:
By the **Six Senses**, I have been **tainted and burdened**;
Through the **Three Karmas (body, speech, mind)**, I have been **entangled and dragged**.

These are **inversions of right conduct**, where **good deeds fail to offset wrongdoing**.
Sometimes, I **misinterpreted the scriptures** or **transgressed the clear teachings** of the **Dao/Way**,
Or **blamed the dharma and faulted the masters**, thus **offending the Heavenly Constitution**,
And **violated the true Daoist precepts** and **Three Elements’ sacred texts**,
So that my **body was consigned to the Underworld Gate**,
And I **suffered retribution** beyond measure—
**Boundless sins and offenses**, too numerous to recount.

Now, I **return in submission** to the **Heavenly Lords**,
And **offer my lamentations** to the **Sages above**.
For every **fault, great or small**, I **humbly beg for absolution**.

May **lost souls be redeemed** from **suffering in the Underworld**,
And **embodied spirits** **break free from torment**.
May the **Divine Elixir** **purify my spirit** in the **Hall of Transformation**,
And my **body attain Daoist transcendence**, nourished by **consuming clouds and breathing dews**,
As I **unceasingly cultivate**, **accumulate learning**, and **achieve true realization**,
Gradually **ascending to the Void** without **falling into rebirth**,
My **form dispersing like mist**, yet my **spirit ever-present**—
**Unbounded in existence, yet boundless in departure**,
In **harmony with the true Dao/Way**, my **essence aligning with the Mysterious Principle**.

The **Three Teachers and Primordial Ancestors** shall **transcend and verify** my **Daoist rank**,
And the **Nine Generations of departed forebears** shall **rise upon the Celestial Path**.

May **all sentient beings** be **freed from the suffering of the Three Realms of Torment**,
And **all souls** **cross the Six Realms of Existence** with **purity**,
As **four types of rebirth** are **equally benefited**.

The **Minister and all assembled** dare not **cease in their utmost sincerity** of **seeking truth and redeeming the departed**,
And **offering this humble supplication**.
**Scatter the flowers.**

**Reaffirming the sacred ranks**—
The **Minister and all officers** of the **ritual assembly**,
With **deep reverence and sincerity**, now **prostrate and address**:
The **Three Pure Ones**, the **Sages above**, and the **Ten Directions of Marvelous Existence**,
All **responsive to the ritual**, and the **true spirits of the Dao/Way**.

Though **my traces are extinguished** and **my life has ended**—
Even if **human fate** has **its natural conclusion**,
Yet **my body remains untransformed** due to **unfulfilled Daoist merits**.

I **entrust my essence to the Great Darkness**,
And **send my heart to the boundless Underworld**.
I **hear of the Supreme Dao/Way’s teachings**,
That there are **methods to refine and transform the mortal body**,
And **sacred talismans** for **ascending to Heaven** as a **Daoist Immortal**.

Thus, my **form and spirit may return to the Celestial Path**,
And my **body not be confined to the Underworld**.

The **Five Emperors guard and protect**,
And the **Three Realms’ officials welcome**—
Through **countless kalpas**, **transmission flows freely**,
And the **Daoist lineage** **passes down its teachings**.

Now, I **establish this Ritual Feast** in **memory of my departed master**,
And **rely on the Great Mercy** to **expiate my past sins**.

I fear that my **departed master**,
Who **embodied the Great Law** and **devotedly revered the Dao/Way**,
May have **his name recorded in the Daoist Register** yet **his cultivation interrupted**,
And **his accumulated sins** lead to **untimely death**—
His **green tablets (records of merit)** may **fall into obscurity**,
And the **Underworld officials** **hold his faults against him**,
As the **Heavenly Gate is barred** and the **Earthly Path is flooded**,
Leaving him **lost in the Ghostly Marshes**, **suffering imprisonment and accusations**.

I **humbly hope** for the **Great Pardon**,
That **past calamities may be washed away**,
And **the Three Officials (of the Underworld)** be **commanded**,
As the **Five Emperors** are **invoked**,
To **abandon evil and embrace goodness**,
And **revive the dead**, restoring their **corporeal remains**.

May **my departed master** **soar like a celestial bird**,
And **wander freely in the Divine Abodes**,
As his **cultivation transcends the Six Desires**,
And his **Dao/Way realization** **enlightens all lost souls**,
Bringing **equal benefit to ancestors and descendants**,
And **enduring blessings to future generations**.

Then, **this disciple** shall **reside peacefully in the Daoist Retreat**,
And **attain the worldly honors of Daoist robes**,
Driving away **malevolent spirits from tombs and dwellings**,
And **warding off the envy of others**.

May the **Daoist Lamp** **continue unbroken**,
And my **longevity surpass the purity of Tao Qing**,
As I **pursue the vision of longevity** like **Pine and Willow Immortals**.

May **all worldly attachments dissolve**,
And **Daoist aspirations renew eternally**,
With **no selfish thoughts**, only **benevolent transformation for all beings**.

The **Minister and all assembled**,
In **uttermost sincerity and trepidation**,
**Bow repeatedly with prostrations**,
And **offer this humble prayer to the Sacred Procession**.

**The Twelve Vows.**
**Reignite the furnace.**»

chunks.original_text: 霄壤相去八万里，在庶品难以周知； 境域肇有十二州，实鬼神司其封守。 察知作善而作恶，用是主死而主生。 苟怀畏惧之心，当尽皈投之志。 冒罪奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已对敷宣。 伏愿天齐仁圣帝，洪恩下沛，诚有感而遂通； 圣眷俯临，神无方而来应。 拥群司而雷监，同众圣以云临，暂离乔岳之居，降赴香筵之请。 悯见世衔哀之志，拔已亡负罪之魂，俾得脱於幽牢，庶获登於道岸。 今则坛场肇启，仪范初行，引领既切於瞻依，注想实深於如在，惟企仙游之至，克谐斋事之成。 臣等下情，无任启请之至以闻。 说戒。 科曰：道以斋为先。 盖古者祭祀必有斋，斋必有戒，先戒而后斋，所谓七日戒而三日斋也。 散斋七日谓之戒。 戒者，所以恭依准绳，不犯非僻，动遵戒律，无有愆违也。 致斋三日谓之斋。 斋者，所以斋洁心神，清涤思虑，专致其精，而求交神明也。 周官太宰之职，祀五帝则掌百官之誓戒。 前期十日，帅执事而卜日遂戒。 又以大司寇莅誓百官，戒于百族。 夫以太宰掌治之官戒之，所以重其事； 以大司寇掌刑之官莅之，所以致其严。 《礼记□郊特牲》亦言：卜郊之日，王立於泽，亲听誓命受教，谏之义也。 献命库门之内，戒百官也。 太庙之命，戒百姓也。 古人求交於神明，严其戒，重其斋，如此故祀圆丘而天神降，祭方泽而地祇出，格祖庙而鬼神享。 虽然为祭祀之斋，非心斋也。 昔颜回受祖於夫子，自谓不饮酒、不茹荤者数月，而夫子未许之以心斋，欲其无听之以耳而听之以心，无听之以心而听之以气。 气者，虚而待物，惟道集虚，虚者心斋。 《周易》有云：圣人以此洗心，退藏於密，斋戒以神其德。 盖贤人受道於圣人，而圣人与神明合德者，必心斋而得道。 故知祭杞之际，而后可以求心斋，则神明生与道合矣。 后世道家设醮而谓之斋，盖以五经所载祭祀之斋，异名而同归，其致一也。 今则东岳之斋，上请九品高真降临坛位，天齐仁圣帝省览斋功，感格冥司，拯拔罪魂，天神於此而降，地祇於此而出，人鬼於此而享。 今因斋而说戒，合坛之人，先受戒约，一历耳根，永为道种。 即当检束身心，屏绝外念，存想至真，使启奏得行，祈祷必应矣。 天尊所言，真科所传，今举七条，众当信受。 第一戒者，不得杀害，悯念有情，如己身命。 杀生之人，有六种报：一者短命，二者多病，三者丑陋，四者形残，五者地狱苦报，六者受六畜身、偿他骨肉。 今者不得於道场前后杀害众生。 第二戒者，不得嗜酒。 嗜酒之人，有四种罪：一者见世妨，失，二者善法不行，三者多生睡眠，四者颠狂昏乱。 今者不得於道场中，嗜酒淫逸，触忤高真。 第三戒者，不得生叛背心，言不忠直。 不忠之罪，有五种报：一者见被苦刑，二者破家灭族，三者处地狱报，四者得虎狼身，五者生在边地、心无自在。 今者於道场中，常行忠直，以俟藻鉴。 第四戒者，不得无孝顺心，违逆父母。 不孝之罪，有五种报：一者王法所加，二者有情弃薄，三者地狱受苦，四者受乌枭身、递相残害，五者既反人身、贫寒困苦。 今者闻戒之后，常持孝心，以俟天听。 第五戒者，常行慈心。 若见众生临命终时，为作功德。 昆虫草木，尤不可伤。
