「The heavens and the earth are separated by eight ten-thousand *li*,
Yet for common mortals, this distance is difficult to comprehend;
The Twelve States of the realm were established by decree,
Indeed, the ghosts and spirits govern their respective domains.

To discern good deeds from evil, this principle determines life and death.
If one harbors a heart of fear and reverence,
One should wholeheartedly resolve to submit to it.
Though we risk offense in presenting this plea to convey our intent,
Our sincere sentiments have already been laid bare before you.

May the Heavenly Emperor of Equal Virtue, the Sacred and Renowned Sovereign of Mount Tai,
Extend his boundless compassion and blessings to us,
So that our sincerity may be recognized and our prayers granted;
May his divine favor descend upon us,
And the spirits come without constraint to answer our call.
With the gathered officials under his command, like thunderous judgment,
And the assembled saints descending as clouds,
Temporarily leaving their lofty abodes,
To grace this humble offering of incense and solemn rites.

Pitying the world’s sorrowful and afflicted,
Rescuing the lost souls burdened with guilt,
So that they may escape from the depths of *yōuliáo* [幽牢, netherworldly prisons],
And perhaps attain the shores of the Dao/Way.

Now, the altar is erected and the rites begin,
The proper forms are set forth,
As we earnestly turn our gaze toward the sacred,
And focus our thoughts as if the deities were present.
We aspire to the highest realms of the Dao/Way’s transcendence,
And hope to harmonize with the solemnity of this *zhāi* [斋, fast].

Our humble petitions are thus presented to the utmost.

**Recitation of the Precepts:**
The Dao/Way prioritizes fasting above all else.
In ancient times, sacrifices required fasting,
And fasting required adherence to precepts.
One first observed the precepts before fasting—
The so-called *"seven-day precepts and three-day fasting"*.

To disperse the fasting over seven days is called *precepts* [戒].
The *precepts* [戒] are what enable one to reverently follow the sacred standards,
To avoid transgressions and wrongdoings,
To strictly abide by the precepts and laws,
And to never stray from them.

To concentrate the fasting over three days is called *fasting* [斋].
The *fasting* [斋] is what enables one to purify the mind and spirit,
To clarify thoughts and intentions,
To focus one’s essence,
And to seek communion with the divine.

The *Zhōu Li* [周官] records the duties of the *Tàizǎi* [太宰, Grand Overseer],
Who, when sacrificing to the Five Emperors,
Supervised the oaths and precepts of all officials.
Ten days before the ritual, he led the attendants in divination
To determine the auspicious day for taking the precepts.

Moreover, the *Dà Sī Kòu* [大司寇, Grand Marshal of Punishments]
Oversaw the swearing of all officials,
And the precepts were observed by all clans.

The *Tàizǎi* [太宰], as the official in charge of governance,
Administered the precepts to emphasize their importance;
The *Dà Sī Kòu* [大司寇], as the official in charge of justice,
Presided over them to underscore their severity.

The *Lǐjì* [礼记] also states in *"Jiāo Tèshēng"* [郊特牲]:
On the day of divination for the *Jiāo* [郊, sacrificial field],
The king stood by the marsh,
Personally listening to the oaths and instructions,
And receiving counsel—
This was the essence of admonition.

Within the *Xiànmìng* [献命] gate,
The precepts were administered to all officials.
At the ancestral temple,
The precepts were administered to all people.

Thus, the ancients sought communion with the divine,
Strict in their precepts,
Serious in their fasting,
And so the heavenly spirits descended at the *yuánqiū* [圆丘, circular mound],
The earthly deities emerged at the *fāngzé* [方泽, square marsh],
And the ancestral ghosts were pleased at the ancestral temple.

Though these were the fasts of sacrifice,
They were not the *fast of the heart* [心斋].

In days past, *Yán Huí* [颜回] received teachings from his master,
And though he abstained from wine and meat for months,
His master did not yet permit him to practice the *fast of the heart* [心斋],
For he wished *Yán Huí* [颜回] to listen not with his ears,
But with his mind,
And not with his mind,
But with his *qi* [气].

*Qi* [气] is empty and receptive to all things,
And only when the Dao/Way gathers in this emptiness
Does emptiness become the *fast of the heart* [心斋].

The *Zhōu Yì* [周易] states:
"The sages use this to wash their hearts,
Retreating and concealing themselves in seclusion,
Fasting and observing precepts to manifest their divine virtue."

Thus, the worthy receive the Dao/Way from the sages,
And the sages, who share divine virtue with the celestial,
Must practice the *fast of the heart* [心斋] to attain the Dao/Way.
Therefore, it is known that only after the ritual of sacrifice
Can one seek the *fast of the heart* [心斋],
And then the divine and the Dao/Way will be born within.

Later generations of Daoists established *jiǎo* [醮, expiatory rites] and called them *fasting* [斋],
For though the Five Classics record the fasts of sacrifice,
They differ in name but share the same essence,
And their purpose remains unified.

Now, during this fasting at Mount Tai’s altar,
We invite the Nine Grades of High Worthies to descend and occupy the sacred platform,
May the Heavenly Emperor of Equal Virtue review our fasting merits,
Be moved by our supplications to the Netherworldly Officials,
And rescue the guilty souls.
The heavenly spirits will descend here,
The earthly deities will emerge here,
And the human ghosts will be pleased here.

Now, in conjunction with this fasting,
We recite the precepts,
And all present at the altar
First receive the precepts and their constraints,
As a lasting foundation for the Dao/Way.
Immediately, one should regulate body and mind,
Banish external distractions,
And focus on the Supreme Truth,
So that our petitions may proceed unobstructed,
And our prayers be answered with certainty.

The words of the Celestial Worthies,
The true precepts transmitted—
Today, we present seven conditions,
All should accept and believe them.

**First Precept:** Do not kill or harm.
Pity all sentient beings as if they were your own life.
Those who kill will face six retributions:
1) A short lifespan,
2) Many illnesses,
3) Ugly and repulsive appearance,
4) Physical mutilation,
5) Suffering in the *Dìyù* [地狱, hellish realms],
6) Being reborn as one of the six domestic animals,
   To repay others’ flesh and blood.

Now, within the Dao/Way’s sacred precincts,
One must not kill or harm any living being before or behind the altar.

**Second Precept:** Do not indulge in alcohol.
Those who indulge in alcohol will face four offenses:
1) Impeding the sight of the world,
   Causing loss,
2) Preventing the practice of good laws,
3) Generating excessive sleep and lethargy,
4) Bringing madness and confusion.

Now, within the Dao/Way’s sacred precincts,
One must not indulge in alcohol or licentiousness,
Nor offend the High Worthies.

**Third Precept:** Do not harbor rebellious or deceitful thoughts,
Nor speak dishonestly.
The offense of dishonesty brings five retributions:
1) Being subjected to cruel punishments,
2) The destruction of one’s family and clan,
3) Suffering in the *Dìyù* [地狱, hellish realms],
4) Being reborn as a tiger or wolf,
5) Living in barren lands,
   With no peace of mind.

Now, within the Dao/Way’s sacred precincts,
One must always speak honestly and truthfully,
And await the scrutiny of the High Worthies.

**Fourth Precept:** Do not lack filial piety,
Nor disobey one’s parents.
The offense of unfilial piety brings five retributions:
1) Being punished by earthly law,
2) Being abandoned by all sentient beings,
3) Suffering in the *Dìyù* [地狱, hellish realms],
4) Being reborn as a crow or owl,
   To inflict harm upon one another,
5) Even if one regains human form,
   To live in poverty and hardship.

Now, after hearing the precepts,
One must always uphold a heart of filial devotion,
And await the judgment of Heaven.

**Fifth Precept:** Always cultivate a heart of compassion.
If one sees sentient beings nearing the end of their life,
One should perform meritorious deeds for them.
Even insects and plants—
One must especially refrain from harming them.»

chunks.original_text: 爱老怜贫，溥度一切，使不虚今日，道场听闻戒法之命。 第六戒者，不得诽谤三宝，及有道师尊，乃至在家出家，一切道像。 诽谤之罪，有四种报：一者常遭恶疾，二者死拘幽夜，三者舌根乖疏，四者常值冤家、人不爱敬。 今者身遇说戒之后，常当恭敬三宝，积行累功。 第七戒者，今日道场之中，常当恭敬，不得懈怠。 当须勉励，内外精勤，日夜乾乾，毋怠毋忽。 勤则利有，怠则利无，自利利他，便趋真极。 已上七戒，合道场人能持否？ 天尊言：大道弟子受真戒者，次当发愿，使我戒根牢固如昆仑山，戒行端严如玉京殿，戒光明照如日月珠，勤行精进，安乐道场，至真三清，为我本源，以戒为师，无陷邪教。 昔有道士二万六千人，持奉经戒，专心不退，依法修行。 十二年中，地司保举，诸天奏名。 一百年中，白日升天。 又有七万二千女子，不奉经戒，反行毁谤，见世受苦，死入九幽。 是知奉戒功德，不可思议。 破戒恶业，难获赦原。 况今日道场，专以解过涤愆，拔亡度死，持戒修斋，尤当精进。 诸天童子，金刚神王，三界五帝，神仙兵马，皆来侍卫。 况泰山之中，有三宫空洞之天。 神房阿合，金床玉几，皆群仙所集。 若能恪遵上件戒法，则东岳司命上卿、佑圣真君，与百灵众真，降临道场，纪录斋功，原赦罪魂。 若息慢不恭，破斋坏戒，不足以济度先亡，转为地官所罚，当受风刀之苦。 同坛之士，审而行之。 臣等无任激切之至，谨启以闻。

「Cherish the elderly and pity the poor,
Extend universal salvation to all,
So that today’s efforts shall not be in vain—
May the **Dao/Way**-hall hear and accept the precepts’ command.

**Sixth Precept:** Do not defame the Three Treasures,
Nor disparage any **Dao/Way**-master or worthy,
Whether lay or monastic,
All **Dao/Way**-images alike.
The offense of defamation brings four retributions:
1) Ever beset by malevolent illnesses,
2) Death and confinement in dark realms,
3) A split and wandering tongue,
4) Ever encountering adversaries—
   None shall love or honor you.
Now, having heard the precepts,
One must always revere the Three Treasures,
Accumulating merit and virtuous deeds.

**Seventh Precept:** Within this **Dao/Way**-hall today,
One must always maintain reverence,
Never slacking in devotion.
Must strive with diligence,
Both inwardly and outwardly,
Day and night, unceasingly—
Do not slacken, do not neglect.
Diligence brings benefit,
Negligence brings none.
For self-benefit and benefit to others,
One must hasten toward the True Extremes.

Do the above seven precepts
Collectively apply to those in the **Dao/Way**-hall?
The Celestial Worthy replies:
"True disciples of the Great Dao,
Who receive the True Precepts,
Must next make a vow:
May my precept-root be steadfast as Mount Kūnlún,
My precept-practice upright as the Jade Capital Hall,
My precept-light radiant as the Sun-Moon Pearl,
With diligent effort and progress,
May I find peace in the **Dao/Way**-hall,
Attaining the True and Three Pure Ones,
As my original source.
With precepts as my guide,
I shall not fall into heretical teachings.

In the past, there were **26,000 Dao/Way**-adepts,
Who upheld the scriptural precepts,
With unwavering focus and no retreat,
Following the law in their cultivation.
In twelve years,
They were recommended by the earthly officials,
Their names petitioned by the heavenly hosts.
In a hundred years,
They ascended to heaven in broad daylight.

Again, there were **72,000 women**,
Who did not uphold scriptural precepts,
But instead engaged in destruction and defamation,
Suffering in this world and dying into the Nine Abysses.
Thus it is known:
The merit of upholding precepts is inconceivable.
Breaking precepts and evil deeds are hard to absolve.
Especially in this **Dao/Way**-hall today,
Devoted to redeeming past transgressions,
Cleansing faults,
Rescuing the departed,
And observing precepts in fasting—
One must especially strive with diligence.
All heavenly hosts, celestial children,
Golden **Dharmakāya**-bodies and **Vajra**-gods,
The Three Realms’ Five Emperors,
Divine and immortal armies,
All come to guard and attend.

Moreover, within Mount Tài,
There are the Three Palaces of the Empty Void Heaven.
Divine chambers and halls of **Āhā**,
Golden beds and jade tables—
All are gatherings of the celestial hosts.
If one strictly adheres to the precepts above,
Then the Eastern Peak **Dìyù** [地狱, hellish] officials,
The Celestial Chief of Life and Death,
And the **Yòushèng Zhēnjūn** [佑圣真君, Venerable Lord Who Assists the Sacred],
With the myriad enlightened worthies,
Descend to the **Dao/Way**-hall,
To record the merit of fasting,
And pardon the guilty spirits of the departed.
If one instead indulges in arrogance and disrespect,
Breaks the fast or violates the precepts,
It shall not suffice to redeem the departed—
Rather, one shall be punished by the **Dìguān** [地官, earthly officials],
And suffer the torment of the **Fēngdāo** [风刀, wind-blade].
All those gathered in this hall,
Examine and act accordingly.

Your servants are deeply moved,
And humbly submit this report to hear Your decree.»

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之七十九竟 道门科范大全集卷之八十 东岳济度拜章大醮仪 启坛行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 东方： 九炁青天，明星大神。 焕照东乡，洞映九门。 转烛阳光，扫秽除氛。 开明童子，号曰玄卿。 备卫我轩、上对帝君。 收魔束妖，讨捕凶群。 奉承正道，赤书玉文。 九天符命，摄龙驿传。 普天安镇，我得飞仙，与道合真。 南方： 三炁丹天，焕景流光。 荧星转烛，洞照太阳。 上有赤精，合契虚皇。 开明童子，号曰华房。 总统火兵，备守玉堂。 轩邪束妖，剪截魔王。 北帝所承，风火莫当。 流铃交焕，翊卫坛场。 正道流行，敢有巴狂。 我享上功，坐运魁罡。 亿劫长存，保天无疆，与道合真。 西方： 七炁素天，太白流精。 光耀金门，洞照太冥。 中有素皇，号曰帝灵。 保神安镇，卫我身形。 断绝邪源，王道正明。 宫殿整肃，三景齐并。 道合自然，飞升紫庭。 灵宝符命，普惠万生。 元皇正炁，来合我身。 功加一切，天地咸宁，与道合真。 北方： 五炁玄天，元始徘徊。 辰星焕灿，光耀太微。 黑灵尊神，号曰层威。 统冠飞天，仙裙羽衣。 □ 备卫五门，检精捕飞。 敢有干试，豁落斩摧。 玉符所告，神镇八威。 邪门闭塞，正道明开。 映照我身，三光同辉。 策空驾浮，举形仙飞，与道合真。 中央： 一炁黄天，调理乾坤。 陶镕阴阳，总统玄真。 镇星吐辉，流焕九天。 开明童子，号曰天璘。 元忞阳精，焰上朱烟。 洞照天下，及臣等身。 百邪摧落，杀鬼万千。 中山神咒，普天使然。 五灵安镇，身飞上仙，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今升坛行道，谨奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨同诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯回清鉴。 臣闻七窍凿而混沌死，有情皆争； 五綦至而淫僻生，无主乃乱。 在既繁而既庶，将孰主而孰张。 人君奉天道以建邦，必分之於牧伯藩屏； 上帝握化权而御物，实付之於岳渎神祇。 故主圣臣贤之任，操赏罚以御其生； 在天地神祇之灵，方录功而制其死。 式俾积善积恶之众，无逃一生一死之机。 明既有於人非，幽必罹於鬼责。 故护短饰非者，邦刑所不兔； 则藏奸匿慝者，天罚所必加。 惩愆首过者，亦为国法之含容； 请命求哀者，必在冥司之解释。 爰有崇真之醮，实勤悔过之诚，稽首震方，皈心岳帝，愿托仁慈之鉴，廓开赦宥之门，察凡恳於今辰，拔罪魂於长夜。 所启玄感，上御至真无极道前。 忏悔，三启，三礼。 臣谨虔诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。
chunks.translated_text:
The **Dao/Way**-Gate Ritual Codes Complete Volume Seventy-Nine ends.
The **Dao/Way**-Gate Ritual Codes Complete Volume Eighty begins:
**The Grand Ritual of the Eastern Peak for Deliverance and Supplication**

**Opening the Ritual Platform and Invoking the Dao/Way**

The ritual ascends the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the law.
The **Yìnglíng** [迎灵, Inviting Spirits] incantations are proclaimed.

**Eastern Direction:**
Nine **Qi** [气] of Azure Heaven, the Radiant Stars and Great Deity.
Illuminating the eastern lands, piercingly revealing the Nine Gates.
Turning the torch of Yang-light, sweeping away filth and dissipating the miasma.
The **Xīnmíng tóngzǐ** [开明童子, Enlightened Child] is summoned, named **Xuánqīng** [玄卿, Mysterious Official].
Arrayed to guard my hall and address the Celestial Sovereigns.
Binding demons and restraining fiends, punishing the malevolent throng.
Honoring the **Zhèngdào** [正道, True Dao/Way], with crimson script and jade inscriptions.
Nine-Heaven talismans and decrees, seizing the **Lóngyì** [龙驿, Dragon Courier] to transmit.
All under Heaven pacified, I attain the **Feixian** [飞仙, Ascended Immortal],
And merge with the **Dao/Way**’s true essence.

**Southern Direction:**
Three **Qi** of Vermilion Heaven, the Radiant Scenery and Flowing Brilliance.
The Glowing Stars revolve like torches, piercingly illuminating the Great Sun.
Above is the **Chìjīng** [赤精, Vermilion Essence], in harmony with the **Xūhuáng** [虚皇, Void Sovereign].
The **Xīnmíng tóngzǐ** [开明童子, Enlightened Child] is summoned, named **Huáfáng** [华房, Splendid Hall].
Commanding the **Huǒbīng** [火兵, Fire Soldiers], to guard the Jade Chamber.
Binding the **Xuānxié** [轩邪, Fiendish Rulers], restraining fiends, severing the **Mówáng** [魔王, Demon King].
What the **Běidì** [北帝, Northern Sovereign] accepts, neither wind nor fire can obstruct.
The **Liúlíng Jiāohuàn** [流铃交焕, Resonant Bells and Radiant Light] protect the ritual hall.
The **Zhèngdào** [正道, True Dao/Way] spreads—let none dare to rebel.
I enjoy the **Shànggōng** [上功, Supreme Merit], seated in the **Kuaì** [魁罡, Grand Marshal]’s position.
Eternally preserved through countless kalpas, safeguarding Heaven without bounds,
And merging with the **Dao/Way**’s true essence.

**Western Direction:**
Seven **Qi** of Pure Heaven, the **Tàibái** [太白, Great White] and Flowing Essence.
Illuminating the Golden Gates, piercingly revealing the **Tàimíng** [太冥, Great Darkness].
Within is the **Sùhuáng** [素皇, White Sovereign], named **Dìlíng** [帝灵, Imperial Spirit].
Guarding the Deity in peace, protecting my form.
Cutting off all evil sources, the **Wángdào** [王道, Sovereign Dao/Way] is made clear.
The palaces are orderly and solemn, the Three Sceneries aligned.
The **Dao/Way** harmonizes naturally, ascending to the **Zǐtíng** [紫庭, Purple Court].
**Língbǎo** [灵宝, Spirit Jewel] talismans and decrees, universally benefiting all beings.
The **Yuánhuáng** [元皇, Primordial Sovereign]’s **Zhèngqi** [正气, True Qi], comes to merge with my body.
Merit is added to all, Earth and Heaven both at peace,
And merging with the **Dao/Way**’s true essence.

**Northern Direction:**
Five **Qi** of Mysterious Heaven, the **Yuánshǐ** [元始, Primordial Origin] wandering.
The **Chénxīng** [辰星, Star of Destiny] shines brilliantly, illuminating the **Tàiwēi** [太微, Supreme Frailty].
The **Hēilíng** [黑灵, Dark Spirit] and **Zūnshén** [尊神, Venerable Deity] are named **Céngwēi** [层威, Layered Awe].
Commanding the **Fēitiān** [飞天, Flying Immortals] and **Xiānqún yǔyī** [仙裙羽衣, Celestial Robes and Feathered Garments].
□ [missing character]
Guarding the Five Gates, inspecting and capturing the **Fēi** [飞, Wandering Spirits].
Dare any interfere, they shall be struck down and annihilated.
The **Yùfú** [玉符, Jade Talismans] decree—let the **Shénzhèn** [神镇, Divine Pacification] of the Eight Awe be established.
Evil Gates sealed, the **Zhèngdào** [正道, True Dao/Way] opened.
Reflecting upon my form, the Three Lights shine together.
Mounting the **Kōng** [空, Void], riding the **Fú** [浮, Floating], lifting my body to fly as an immortal,
And merging with the **Dao/Way**’s true essence.

**Central Direction:**
One **Qi** of Yellow Heaven, regulating Heaven and Earth.
Nurturing and refining **Yīnyáng** [阴阳, Yin and Yang], commanding the **Xuánzhēn** [玄真, Mysterious True Ones].
The **Zhènxīng** [镇星, Pacifying Star] emits radiance, flowing and illuminating the Nine Heavens.
The **Xīnmíng tóngzǐ** [开明童子, Enlightened Child] is summoned, named **Tiānlín** [天璘, Heavenly Pearl].
The **Yuánmì** [元忞, Primordial Radiance] refines the **Yángjīng** [阳精, Yang Essence], flames rising as crimson mist.
Piercingly illuminating all under Heaven, including my servants.
Crushing the myriad **Bāixié** [百邪, Hundred Evils], slaying ten thousand ghosts.
The **Zhōngshān** [中山, Central Peak] divine incantations, universally effective across the land.
The Five Spirits pacified, my body ascends as a **Shàngxiān** [上仙, High Immortal],
And merges with the **Dao/Way**’s true essence.

**Striking the Law Drum Twenty-Four Times.**
**Igniting the Furnace.**

The **Wúshàng** [无上, Peerless] Three Heavens—**Xuányuánshǐ** [玄元始, Mysterious Primordial Origin] Three **Qi**—
**Tàishàng Dàojūn** [太上道君, Supreme Dao Sovereign],
**Tàishàng Lǎojūn** [太上老君, Supreme Venerable Lord],
Summon forth from my body the **Sānwǔ Gōngcāo** [三五功曹, Three Five Merit Officials],
Left and Right **Guānshǐ** [官使者, Official Envoys],
Left and Right **Pěngxiāng** [捧香, Incense-Bearers],
**Yìlóng qí lì** [驿龙骑吏, Dragon Courier Riders],
**Shìxiāng Jīntóng** [侍香金童, Golden Attendants of Incense],
**Chuányán Sǎnhuā Yùnǚ** [传言散花玉女, Jade Maidens Who Transmit Words and Scatter Flowers],
**Wǔdì zhífú** [五帝直符, Direct Talismans of the Five Sovereigns],
**Zhídì xiāngguān** [直日香官, Incense Officials of the Direct Sun],
And all **Sānshíliù rén** [三十六人, Thirty-Six Persons] to emerge.

Those who emerge must be clad in **Yánzhuāng xiǎnfú** [严装显服, Solemn Attire and Manifest Garments],
With **Guānbài chuíyīng** [冠带垂缨, Crowns and Sashes with Pendant Tassels],
Opening the **Xuán táng** [玄坛, Mysterious Platform] and **Tǔdì** [土地, Earthly Deities],
And the **Fāngyù shénzhēn** [方域神真, Regional Spirits and True Ones].

My servants now ascend the platform to invoke the **Dao/Way**,
And humbly present this supplication to declare our intentions.
All sincere sentiments have already been recorded and reported.
We pray that the **Tàishàng shífāng zhìzhēn dàoqi** [太上十方至真道气, Supreme Dao Qi of the Ten Directions],
The **Língbǎo ruìguāng** [灵宝瑞光, Auspicious Radiance of the Spirit Jewel],
May descend and flow into our bodies,
So that our supplications swiftly reach the **Tàishàng Wújí Dàodào** [太上无极大道, Supreme Boundless Great Dao],
And the **Hàotiān Jīnquè Yùhuáng Dìshàng** [昊天金阙玉皇上帝, Jade-Gated Celestial Sovereign Emperor of Heaven].

**Requesting the Designation of Ritual Rank.**

With our ranks thus established, we humbly and sincerely present this supplication to:
The **Xūwú zìrán Jīnquè qībǎo Dìshàng** [虚无自然金阙七宝上帝, Void-Natural Jade-Gated Seven-Treasured Emperor],
The **Dōnggōng jiàozhǔ Tàiyǐ jiùkǔ Tiānzūn** [东宫教主太乙救苦天尊, Eastern Palace Teaching Sovereign, Great Unity Saving the Suffering Heavenly Worthy],
The **Chuánjīng yǎnjiào lìdài shīzhēn** [传经演教历代师真, Lineage Masters Who Transmit Scriptures and Explain Teachings Across Generations],
The **Dōngyuè Tàishān Tiānqí Rénshèng Dì** [东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝, Eastern Peak Great Mountain Heavenly Equal Benevolent and Sacred Emperor],
The **Shúmíng huánghòu** [淑明皇后, Virtuous and Illuminating Empress],
The **Tàizǐ guìfēi** [太子贵妃, Noble Prince and Noble Consort],
The **Diànshàng bǐnglíng gōng** [殿上炳灵公, Palace Hall Illustrious Spirit Lord],
The **Xīqí língwáng** [西齐灵王, Western Equal Spirit King],
The **Yuèxià wénwǔ kǎoxiào** [岳下文武考校, Civil and Martial Officials Beneath the Peak],
All **Yīqiè cáoliáo** [一切曹僚, All Officials],
The **Sānjiè yìnggǎn** [三界应感, Three Realms Responding to Sentiments],
And **Yīqiè zhēnlíng** [一切真灵, All True Spirits].

All earnestly hope for Your boundless compassion,
And Your benevolent gaze to descend upon us.

We have heard:
When the Seven Orifices are drilled, **Húndùn** [混沌, Chaos] dies and all beings contend;
When the Five **Qí** [綦, Limits] are reached, **Yínpì** [淫僻, Licentiousness] arises and chaos ensues without governance.

In the midst of such abundance and multitude,
Who shall rule and who shall prevail?

The **Rénjūn** [人君, Human Sovereign] serves the **Tiāndào** [天道, Heavenly Dao] to establish the realm,
And must delegate authority to the **Mùbó fān bǐng** [牧伯藩屏, Regional Governors and Protective Ministers];
The **Shàngdì** [上帝, Supreme Emperor] grasps the **Huàquán** [化权, Transformative Authority] to govern all things,
And truly entrusts the **Yuèdú shénqí** [岳渎神祇, Mountain and Altar Deities] with this duty.

Thus, the **Zhěngshén chénshì** [主圣臣贤, Sovereign of Saints and Minister of Worthies]
Holds authority over rewards and punishments to govern their lives;
The **Tiāndì shénqí** [天地神祇, Heavenly and Earthly Deities]
Record merit and determine their deaths.

The ritual is set forth for the **Jīshàn jī'è** [积善积恶, Accumulation of Good and Evil],
So that none may escape the **Yīshēng yīsǐ** [一生一死, Cycle of Life and Death].

The **Míng** [明, Bright] has its basis in human judgment,
The **Yōu** [幽, Dark] must suffer the **Guǐzé** [鬼责, Ghostly Retribution].

Thus, those who conceal their faults and adorn their vices,
Shall not escape the **Guānxíng** [邦刑, Realm’s Punishments];
Those who harbor deceit and conceal wickedness,
Shall surely receive the **Tiānfá** [天罚, Heavenly Punishments].

Even those who are first to be punished for their transgressions,
Are also contained within the **Guófǎ** [国法, National Law];
Those who plead for mercy and beg for compassion,
Must surely be explained by the **Míngsī** [冥司, Netherworld Officials].

Hence, there is the **Chóngzhēn** [崇真, Venerating the True] **Dàojiào** [大醮, Grand Ritual],
Truly exerting **Qínhuǐ** [勤悔, Sincere Repentance] for past transgressions.
We kneel and reverently address the Four Quarters,
And turn our hearts to the **Yuèdì** [岳帝, Peak Emperor].
We pray to entrust our supplications to Your benevolent discernment,
And open the gates of pardon and forgiveness.
Examine our humble pleas in this moment,
And rescue the **Zuihún** [罪魂, Guilty Spirits] from eternal night.

Our supplications are divinely inspired,
And presented before the **Zhìzhēn Wújí Dào** [至真无极道, Supreme True Boundless Dao].

**Repentance and Supplication, Threefold Declarations, Threefold Homages.**

We humbly and devoutly present this supplication to:
The **Xūwú zìrán Jīnquè qībǎo Dìshàng** [虚无自然金阙七宝上帝, Void-Natural Jade-Gated Seven-Treasured Emperor],
The **Dōnggōng jiàozhǔ Tàiyǐ jiùkǔ Tiānzūn** [东宫教主太乙救苦天尊, Eastern Palace Teaching Sovereign, Great Unity Saving the Suffering Heavenly Worthy],
The **Chuánjīng yǎnjiào lìdài shīzhēn** [传经演教历代师真, Lineage Masters Who Transmit Scriptures and Explain Teachings Across Generations],
The **Dōngyuè Tàishān Tiānqí Rénshèng Dì** [东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝, Eastern Peak Great Mountain Heavenly Equal Benevolent and Sacred Emperor],
The **Shúmíng huánghòu** [淑明皇后, Virtuous and Illuminating Empress],
The **Yuèxià wénwǔ kǎoxiào** [岳下文武考校, Civil and Martial Officials Beneath the Peak],
All **Yīqiè cáoliáo** [一切曹僚, All Officials],
The **Sānjiè yìnggǎn** [三界应感, Three Realms Responding to Sentiments],
And **Yīqiè zhēnlíng** [一切真灵, All True Spirits].

If one instead indulges in arrogance and disrespect,
Breaks the fast or violates the precepts,

chunks.original_text: 愿启洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻木旺东方，实谓藏魂之地； 山临鲁国，尤崇望祀之仪。 冠五岳以独尊，总百神而为贵。 考传物之志，名尤重於天孙； 按风俗之通，文有藏於金匮。 寿分修短，验武帝探册之祥； 簿有职司，见吉碧迓吏之至。 信禀生於众庶，皆系命於岳灵。 所由始而所由终，亦主生而亦主死。 二十四狱，常紏恶以结奸； 八十六司，必纪功而书过。 用罄皈依之志，追思往逝之魂。 虑因处世之难危，或染多生之罪垢。 一入狴牢之内，难免拘囚； 频婴捶楚之苛，不胜痛酷。 用希恩而解释，式致敬以祷祈。
chunks.translated_text:
With sincere devotion, I humbly appeal to Your boundless compassion and pray for Your radiant illumination of my earnest plea.

I have heard that the wood element thrives in the East, truly the domain where souls are enshrined;
That the mountain overlooks the State of Lu, especially revered for its rites of veneration.
Crowned among the Five Peaks as the sole exalted one,
Encompassing all spirits as the most noble.

Examining the records of ancient intent, its name is held in greater esteem than that of the Heavenly Son;
Following the customs of the age, its scriptures are preserved in the Golden Repository.
Life’s allotted span, whether long or short, is verified by the auspicious omen of the Martial Emperor’s inspection of the ledgers;
The registers of duties, as seen when the Green-Browed Officials arrive with their records.

For indeed, the origins of life and its end are all governed by the Mountain Spirit’s decree.
From beginning to end, it both bestows life and presides over death.
The Twenty-Four Prisons eternally bind malevolence and weave deceit;
The Eighty-Six Offices meticulously record merit and transcribe faults.

Thus, with unwavering devotion, I reflect upon the departed souls of the past.
Considering the perils of mortal existence, one may incur the sins of countless rebirths.
Once confined within the **Yòuláo** [狴牢], escape from imprisonment is difficult;
Frequently subjected to cruel beatings, the suffering is unbearable.

Therefore, I earnestly seek Your mercy for expiation,
And with utmost reverence, offer prayers in supplication.

chunks.original_text: 臣等即事有初，启坛伊始，式准天尊之告命，敬宣醮主之词诚，启坛词文，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 谛详词语，深可悲哀。 盖哀死而悼亡，遂披肝而沥胆。 深虑罪愆之久积，魂系阴司； 或因按牍之未明，辱从狱卒。 用陈情而控告，祈垂听以哀矜。 洗涤愆非，怜其不觉而不悟； 曲从凡悃，知其克敬以克亲。 风马云车，俯斋坛而下降； 霓旌绛节，迓仙驭以来临。 仰望真慈，下资冥福。 臣等恪因净宇，肇举洪仪，伏乞太上三尊，十方众圣，垂神省览，鉴察丹诚。 乞敕勒此间土地里域真官，一合同心，并力营卫，扫荡内外，清净坛场，降伏妖魔，馘灭邪祟。 使臣等心安神定，思念立感，启奏上达，善功成就，无有窒滞，所愿随心。 须节次依法行道，续更启闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来静夜行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍香烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
The ministers, at the outset of our rites and the very beginning of the altar’s establishment,
now follow the Celestial Worthy’s decree and reverently proclaim the Sincere Words of the Ritual Master.
We solemnly present the Altar’s Invocation.

**Proclamation of Words:**
Carefully examining each phrase, their depth is filled with profound sorrow.
For we lament the dead and mourn the departed,
laying bare our hearts and pouring forth our souls.
Deeply concerned that accumulated sins may bind the soul to the Underworld,
or that unclear records may bring disgrace at the hands of prison guards,
we humbly present our plea and pray for mercy and compassion.

We seek to purge transgressions—
spared from ignorance and unawareness,
yet granted the sincerity of the common and devout,
knowing their reverence and filial piety.

As the wind-steeds and cloud-chariots descend upon the fasting altar,
and the rainbow banners and crimson flags welcome the celestial procession,
we gaze upward to True Compassion,
and below, we seek to bestow hidden blessings.

The ministers, with utmost sincerity, now establish this pure space
and initiate the grand rites.
We humbly beseech the Supreme Three Sovereigns and the Ten Directions’ Holy Assembly
to descend in spirit, inspect, and discern our sincere devotion.

We pray that the Celestial Officials of this land and domain be commanded
to unite in harmony, exert their strength in defense,
cleanse both within and without, purify the altar grounds,
subdue demons and quash malevolent spirits,
so that we may find peace of mind and spirit,
our devotions instantly fulfilled,
our petitions ascending without obstruction,
and our virtuous deeds completed as desired.

Now, in accordance with the ritual stages, we proceed step by step.
**Twelve Vows.**

**Reigniting the Incense Furnace:**
We solemnly command the Incense Officials, the Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
and the Attendant Spirit Officials—
that at the very place where I have previously conducted nocturnal rites,
golden elixirs and emerald jade, mushrooms and sacred herbs,
and all the numinous spirits shall naturally gather.
May the Ten Directions’ Celestial Youth and Jade Maidens attend to the incense smoke,
transmitting my sincere invocations directly to the Supreme, Boundless, and Ultimate Dao,
before the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Celestial Court.

**Exiting the Hall to Chant Praises.**
**Exiting the Door.**
chunks.overlap_context:
Eighty-Six Offices meticulously record merit and transcribe faults.

Thus, with unwavering devotion, I reflect upon the departed souls of the past.
Considering the perils of mortal existence, one may incur the sins of countless rebirths.
Once confined within the **Yòuláo** [狴牢], escape from imprisonment is difficult;
Frequently subjected to cruel beatings, the suffering is unbearable.

Therefore, I earnestly seek Your mercy for expiation,
And with utmost reverence, offer prayers in supplication.

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之八十竟 道门科范大全集卷之八十一 东岳济度拜章大醮仪 清旦行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 青阳虚映，耀日回灵。 神虎辟邪，飞天流铃。 摧奸灭试，万魔束形。 九微回道，八威摄精。 千真校录，三元荡清。 左啸中黄，右策六丁。 七转八合，周旋天经。 圣化巍巍，大道兴行。 庆云流布，合景黄庭，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今清旦行道，谨奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻五明官内，天尊深悯於轮回； 东极官中，太乙常救於苦趣。 盖为黔黎之昧道，不知天地之贵人，随欲海之漂流，逐爱河而沉溺。 罪根已积，业纲难逃，因贪生而丧生，由求苦而得苦，一辞人世，长击阴司。 故太上开济度之门，惟真格有荐拔之品，许归诚而忏罪，得解考以超升。 俗累未除，难免根尘之六； 冲科广被，必闻赦宥之三。 岂不矜恤於蠢愚，尚可深怀於悔过。 奉道某衔哀茹苦，沥血输诚，叹已切於逝川，念更深於幽圄。 仰惟岳府，实收召於亡魂； 恭启斋坛，冀感通於帝意。 备着词旨，敢不上闻。 宣词。 按如词言，深切哀悯。 盖送死可名於大事，且临丧必倍於哀情。 虽亡者不可复追，夜丹难守； 然存者实怀思感，斋悃方伸。 深惟管摄之冥司，实系崇高之岱岳。 恐尚婴於缧绁，当广设於津梁。
chunks.translated_text:
**Daoist Rituals Comprehensive Canon, Volume Eighty-First: The Great Ritual of the Eastern Peak (Jizhu) for Salvation and Petition**

**Morning Rites:**
At dawn, the ritual stages proceed as prescribed.
The ritual platform is ascended according to form.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Daoist rites.

**Proclaiming Sacred Incantations for Protection:**
The Azure Yang (青阳) casts its radiant light,
Illuminating the sun’s return to life.
The Spirit Tiger wards off malevolence,
The Flying Heavens toll their celestial bells.
The wicked are crushed, the evil destroyed,
Ten thousand demons bound in form.
The Nine Mysteries (九微) circulate the Dao,
The Eight Powers (八威) subdue the spirits.
A thousand numinous beings (千真) register their presence,
The Three Realms (三元) dispel impurities.

Left, the Yellow Dragon is summoned,
Right, the Six Celestial Officials (六丁) are invoked.
Seven revolutions, eight harmonizations,
Orbiting the Heavenly Scriptures.
The sacred aura stands majestic,
The Dao begins its course.
Auspicious clouds flow forth,
The gathered brilliance of the Yellow Court (黄庭) aligns with the Dao,
As the true and the Dao merge.

The Sacred Law Drum (法鼓) is struck twenty-four times.

**Reigniting the Incense Furnace:**
We summon the Supreme Three Heavens, the Primordial Origin of the Three *Qi* (三炁),
The Most High Dao Lord (道君), and the Most High Lao Lord (老君),
To bring forth from my body the **Thirty-Five Celestial Officials** (三五功曹),
Left and Right Officials and Messengers (左右官使者),
Left and Right Bearers of Incense (左右捧香),
The Postal Dragons and Mounted Envoys (驿龙骑吏),
The Golden Youth Attendants (侍香金童),
The Jade Maidens who transmit words and scatter flowers (传言散花玉女),
The Five Emperors’ Direct Symbols (五帝直符),
The Incense Officials of the Direct Sun (直日香官),
And all **Thirty-Six Persons** (三十六人) to emerge.

Those who emerge are clad in solemn, resplendent robes,
With caps and sashes trailing their ceremonial plumes.
The Land and Spirit Officials of the Mystic Platform (玄坛) are opened,
And the regional deities and numinous spirits are invoked.

Now, at this dawn ritual,
I humbly present my intentions.
My sincerity is profound,
Already recorded and heard by the Celestial.
I pray that the Most High Dao *Qi* (十方至真道炁) of the Ten Directions,
The Sacred Treasure of Auspicious Light (灵宝瑞光),
Descend and flow into my body,
So that my invocations may swiftly reach
The Most High, Boundless Dao (无极大道),
And the Jade Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign’s Golden Gate (金阙玉皇上帝御前).

**Requesting the Invocation of the Sacred Law Position:**
The assembled petitioners of the **Sacred Law Position** (法位),
With utmost reverence and sincerity,
Beseech the **Supreme, Natural, Golden Gate, Seven Treasures Emperor** (虚无自然金阙七宝上帝),
The Eastern Palace’s **Great Unity Teacher, the Most High Saviour of Suffering** (教主太乙救苦天尊),
The lineage of Masters who transmit the scriptures and expound the teachings (传经演教历代师真),
The **Eastern Peak, Tai Mountain, Celestial Harmony and Benevolence Emperor** (东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝),
The **Virtuous and Auspicious Empress** (淑明皇后),
The **Noble Prince and Consort** (太子贵妃),
The **Illustrious Spirit Official of the Hall** (殿上炳灵公),
The **Spirit King of Western Harmony** (西齐灵王),
The **Literary and Martial Examiners beneath the Peak** (岳下文武考校),
All Celestial Officials (一切曹僚),
The Three Realms’ responsive spirits (三界应感),
And all numinous beings (一切真灵).

All look upon the boundless mercy,
And descend to manifest the sacred compassion.
We hear that within the **Five Celestial Officials** (五明官),
The Celestial Sovereign pities those in the cycle of rebirth;
And in the **Eastern Extremity Officials** (东极官),
The Great Unity (太乙) always rescues those in suffering.

Indeed, for the ignorant masses,
They do not know the noble ones of Heaven and Earth,
And drift like boats in the boundless sea of desire,
Drowning in the river of attachment.
Their sins have already accumulated,
Their karmic bonds are difficult to escape,
Because of their greed for life, they lose life,
And because of their pursuit of suffering, they obtain suffering.
Once they depart this world,
They long strike the **Yin Court** (阴司).
Thus, the Most High opens the **Gate of Salvation** (济度之门),
And only those of true virtue (真格) may be recommended for elevation,
Allowed to return with sincerity and repent their sins,
And attain liberation from judgment to ascend.

While worldly entanglements remain,
They cannot escape the **Six Roots of Impurity** (根尘之六);
But the **Broad Reach of the Sacred Law** (冲科广被)
Will surely hear the **Three Declarations of Pardon** (赦宥之三).
How could they not take pity on the foolish?
And yet, they may still deeply harbor those who repent.

The humble petitioners of the Dao,
With sorrow and suffering as our offerings,
And blood shed in sincerity,
Lament the swift passage of time,
And reflect deeply on the suffering of the **Netherworld** (幽圄).
We look to the **Peak’s Celestial Court** (岳府),
Which truly receives the lost souls of the departed;
And with reverence, we set up the **fasting altar** (斋坛),
Hoping to move the Emperor’s intentions.

Having prepared our words and intent,
We dare not fail to present them.

**Proclaiming the Words:**
As the words are spoken,
The deep lament and pity are manifest.
Indeed, the rites for the departed are called **Great Matters** (大事),
And those who face mourning must double their sorrow.
Though the departed cannot be recalled,
And the **Elixir of the Night** (夜丹) cannot be retained;
Yet the living truly hold sorrow and gratitude,
And the sincerity of the fasting rites extends.

Deeply contemplating the **Netherworld’s Judges** (管摄之冥司),
Who are indeed the **lofty Eastern Peak** (崇高之岱岳),
We fear that the souls may still be bound in **affliction** (缧绁),
And thus, we must **widely establish the means of salvation** (津梁).

chunks.original_text: 曲尽精诚，冀蒙炼度，以今清旦，朝元行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养玉清圣境元始天尊，十方道宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，上祝今上皇帝陛下。 就中尧日，八方均被於照临； 歌咏舜风，万类悉臻於繁阜。 兵不用而干戈偃息，刑不试而团圄空虚，德惟广於好生，域尽臻於仁寿。 黄旗南运，瑞气长垂於斗牛； 青海西还，哭声无闻於战鬼。 敷锡五福，皆为有道之民； 泰治万年，永保无疆之历。 今故烧香，自归依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无为，和与道合真。 臣闻珠口集真，格日月之停景； 洞章啸咏，致山岳之吞烟。 惟因流响之云营，能感游空之仙圣。 以今清旦，朝元行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养上清真境灵宝天尊，无上经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流醮主某等，住宅太岁尊神，逐隅支干禁忌，门丞户尉，月煞日游，不贻悮犯之殃，并与宁居之庆，亦罔恫而罔怨，各来顾以来歆，格犹可以度思，听每闻於介福。 今故烧香，自归依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 臣闻诵九天之宝章，得三官之考算，披三洞之科典，致百灵之护持。 倘依大范之巍巍，必膺遐福之简简。 以今清旦，朝元行道，请法众等运慈三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太清仙境降生天尊，十方师宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流醮主某等，合门昌盛，举族繁荣，宜家必咏於桃夭，有子常歌於芣苢。 祸殃扫荡，若雾卷以冰消； 福庆增隆，如岳停而川至。
chunks.translated_text:
With utmost sincerity and devotion,
We pray for purification and transcendence.
On this pure dawn,
We perform the **Celestial Assembly Rites** (朝元行道),
And request the **Law Assembly** (法众) to light the first incense strand.
May this fragrant smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To offer homage to the **Jade Purity Supreme Venerable** (玉清圣境元始天尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Dao Treasures** (十方道宝).

We, the subjects, **surrender body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
And dedicate these merits to bless our present Emperor.
Thus, under the **Emperor’s virtuous reign** (尧日),
The eight directions equally bask in his radiance;
And the **harmonious winds of Shun’s era** (舜风) bring prosperity to all beings.
Weapons rest without conflict, prisons stand empty without punishment,
For **virtue’s power** (德) is vast in cherishing life,
And the realm attains **Ren’s eternal longevity** (仁寿).

The **Yellow Banner** advances southward,
With auspicious qi eternally descending upon **Fighter and Ox** (斗牛);
The **Green Sea** returns westward,
Where no wails disturb the **war spirits** (战鬼).

The **Five Auspicious Blessings** (五福) are bestowed upon the virtuous people,
And the **Great Peace** (泰治) endures for ten thousand years,
Preserving the boundless **imperial mandate** (无疆之历).

Now, we burn incense in devotion,
And **take refuge in the Supreme Sage’s most authentic virtue** (至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to **Non-Action** (无为),
And harmonize with the **True Dao** (道合真).

As it is said:
The **Pearl Mouth Gathering** (珠口) gathers the True,
And aligns the **halted light of sun and moon** (停景);
The **Cavernous Chapter** (洞章) emits a call,
And the mountains and rivers swallow the mist.

Through the **resonant clouds** (流响之云营),
The wandering celestial sages (游空之仙圣) are moved.

On this pure dawn,
We perform the **Celestial Assembly Rites** (朝元行道),
And request the **Law Assembly** (法众) to light the second incense strand.
May this fragrant smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To offer homage to the **Supreme True Realm’s Venerable** (上清真境灵宝天尊),
And the **Supreme Scripture Treasures** (无上经宝).

We, the subjects, **surrender body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
And dedicate these merits to the **Ritual Master** (醮主) and his household,
To the **Yearly Star Deity** (太岁尊神) presiding over this dwelling,
And to the **tabooed branches and stems** (支干禁忌),
The **door and gate officials** (门丞户尉),
The **monthly and daily calamities** (月煞日游),
So as to avert misfortune and offense,
And invite the blessings of peaceful abode,
Free from fear and resentment,
Each coming with reverence and delight,
Their thoughts pure and their words auspicious,
Listening to the **introduction of blessings** (介福).

Now, we burn incense in devotion,
And **take refuge in the Scripture Sage’s most authentic virtue** (至真之德).
After attaining the Dao,
We ascend to the **Formless** (无形),
And harmonize with the **True Dao** (道合真).

As it is said:
Reciting the **Nine-Heaven Scripture Treasures** (九天之宝章),
One attains the **Three Officials’ records** (三官之考算);
Studying the **Three Caverns’ doctrines** (三洞之科典),
One earns the protection of the **Hundred Spirits** (百灵之护持).
If one follows the **Great Pattern’s grandeur** (大范之巍巍),
One shall surely receive the **distant blessings** (遐福之简简).

On this pure dawn,
We perform the **Celestial Assembly Rites** (朝元行道),
And request the **Law Assembly** (法众) to light the third incense strand with mercy,
May this fragrant smoke ascend straight to the heavens,
To offer homage to the **Supreme Clarity’s Celestial Realm’s Venerable** (太清仙境降生天尊),
And the **Ten Directions’ Teacher Treasures** (十方师宝).

We, the subjects, **surrender body, spirit, and fate** (皈身、皈神、皈命),
And dedicate these merits to the **Ritual Master** (醮主) and his household,
That their gates flourish and their clans prosper,
Their homes ever sing of **Peach Blossom’s joy** (桃夭),
And their children forever praise **the harvest’s abundance** (芣苢).

Calamities are swept away like mist dissolving into ice,
While blessings multiply like mountains halting the floods.
Auspiciousness grows ever grand.

chunks.original_text: 明经入仕者，速升於青紫； 服田力穑者，累溢於仓箱。 式彰善积之家，不忧鬼瞰其室。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，三启，三礼。 具位臣某等，谨同诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻哀死事亡，要笃如存之志； 履霜濡露，必怀追往之心。 书籍满林，验手容而可想； 桮槎在案，知口泽之犹存。 昔处生前，要知其疾痛痾痒； 今居没后，敢忘其拘滞沉迷。 路隔幽明，苦恼虽难於代受； 情缘亲爱，荐严专务於追修。 神莫大於岳宗，权常司於鬼录，每察知於功过，式兼制於死生。 深惟往逝之魂，愆尤难免； 恐在拘囚之地，解脱无由。 用罄凡诚，仰祈善贷，洗罪名於黑簿，炼生质於黄华，速出泉关，早登道岸。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来清旦行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

**Twelve Vows** (十二願).

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之八十一竟 道门科范大全集卷之八十二 东岳济度拜章大醮仪 临午行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 丹灵朱火，炎霞激风。 赤轮刚运，天光八冲。 迸威包罗，交变万方。 流金豁落，群魔灭踪。 辟奸破妖，明耀元功。 金符召制，蹑云策龙。 瑶歌庆会，散花太空。 神化冥运，四极安隆。 伏御帝前，罔有不恭，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今临午行道，谨奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯垂丹恳。 臣闻处震卦而为大涂，固当出万物之首； 登泰山而小天下，亦常居群祀之先。 东乃始生之方，岱为管摄之地。 生必东首，昔人知向背之宜； 气起东隅，造物全温厚之致。 固知岳帝之德，实符天道之仁。 德本好生，必欲赦除於有罪； 仁惟济众，岂不广布於洪恩。 既司出入之机，皇制短长之命，苟有皈真而向道，必蒙释死以兴生。 况死者人之所甚，哀惧久沦於长夜； 而生者人之所大，欲愿长处於明时。 况身有善恶之殊，故享年有寿夭之异。 迹已绝於人世，遽至殂亡； 魂必往於岱宗，未蠲罪累。 须与求哀而忏悔，未能补过以涤除。 奉道某家哀死悼亡，感今怀昔。 念重泉之顿隔，无计攀援； 惟妙道之可凭，仰干超度。 爰企升中之地广开，解厄之门于时。 阳景方中，尽幽遐而徧照； 昼漏停午，肃坛陛以无尘。 想众圣之来临，顾凡情之上达，大颁善利，速度亡魂，临午词诚，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 按如词旨，深切悲哀。 臣闻莲露易晞，悲伤莫及。 树风不静，惨怛难言。 深虑亡者阳过阴愆，未悟於安存之日； 神诛鬼责，并临於殒没之时。 不见昭昭之人寰，惟就冥冥之幽圄。 爰奉九真之妙戒，式遵三洞之秘文。

**The Complete Daoist Ritual Canon, Volume 82**
**Ritual for the Eastern Peak’s Salvation and Supplication (Jìdù Bàizhāng) – Conducted at High Noon**

**Ritual Procedure:**
The **sacred rites ascend the platform in proper order** (法事升坛如式).
Each **officiant reverently invokes the Dao** (各礼师存念如法).
**Proclaim the Sacred Guardians’ Incantations** (宣卫灵咒).
**Crimson flames and golden fire** (丹灵朱火) surge with **flaming clouds and gusting winds** (炎霞激风).
The **scarlet wheel rolls with unyielding force** (赤轮刚运), **heavenly light bursts in eight directions** (天光八冲).
Its **overwhelming might envelops all** (迸威包罗), **transforming the myriad realms** (交变万方).
**Molten gold cascades, crushing all obstacles** (流金豁落), **demons vanish without trace** (群魔灭踪).
**Evil is repelled, fiends are shattered** (辟奸破妖), **illuminating the Primordial Virtue** (明耀元功).
**Golden talismans summon and command** (金符召制), **striding upon clouds, treading dragons** (蹑云策龙).
**Jade hymns resound in celebration** (瑶歌庆会), **blossoms scatter through the void** (散花太空).
**Divine transformations manifest in the unseen** (神化冥运), **bringing stability to the four quarters** (四极安隆).
**Humbly kneeling before the Celestial Sovereign** (伏御帝前), **none dare be irreverent** (罔有不恭), **uniting with the True Dao** (与道合真).

**Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times** (鸣法鼓二十四通).
**Ignite the censer** (发炉).

**Invocation of the Three Sovereigns:**
The **Supreme Unoriginated Three-in-One Primordial Dao/Way** (无上三天玄元始三炁),
The **Supreme Dao/Way Lord** (太上道君),
The **Supreme Venerable Lord Lao** (太上老君),
**Summon forth** from within my body:
The **Three Five Functionaries** (三五功曹),
The **Left and Right Official Messengers** (左右官使者),
The **Left and Right Incense-Bearers** (左右捧香),
The **Dragon-Courier Officials** (驿龙骑吏),
The **Golden Boys Attending Incense** (侍香金童),
The **Jade Maidens Scattering Flowers** (传言散花玉女),
The **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans** (五帝直符),
The **Direct-Day Incense Officials** (直日香官),
**A total of thirty-six** (合三十六人) **emerge.**

**Those who exit** (出者) **don their solemn robes and adorned headgear** (严装显服, 冠带垂缨),
**Opening the Mystic Altars of the Local Deities and Territorial Spirits** (关启玄坛土地, 方域神真).

**My solemn declaration at high noon:**
I **humbly present my intentions** (谨奏为宣意),
**My sincere supplications have been recorded and transmitted** (其诸情悃, 已录告闻).
I **pray that the Supreme Dao/Way’s Ten-Directional True Qi** (太上十方至真道炁) and **Numinous Treasures of Auspicious Light** (灵宝瑞光) descend,
**Flowing into my body** (流入臣身中),
So that **my supplications may swiftly reach** (令臣所启, 速达) the **Supreme Unoriginated Dao/Way** (太上无极大道) and the **Celestial Jade Gate Sovereign Emperor of the High Heaven** (昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前).

**Invoke the ritual ranks** (请称法位).
**The undersigned officials** (具位臣某等),
**With utmost reverence and sincerity, humbly present our supplications to:**
The **Void-Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Celestial Sovereign** (虚无自然金阙七宝上帝),
The **Eastern Palace Patriarch, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Celestial Lord of the Tao** (东宫教主太乙救苦天尊),
The **Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral Worthies of Past Ages** (传经演教历代师真),
The **Eastern Peak, Mount Tai, Celestial Equilibrium Benevolent and Righteous Emperor** (东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝),
The **Virtuous and Illuminating Empress** (淑明皇后),
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort** (太子贵妃),
The **Illustrious Spirit Lord of the Hall** (殿上炳灵公),
The **Western Qi Spirit King** (西齐灵王),
The **Civil and Martial Officials Beneath the Peak** (岳下文武考校),
**All functionaries and spirits of the Three Realms** (一切曹僚, 三界应感),
**All True Spirits** (一切真灵).

**May all behold the boundless compassion** (咸望洪慈),
**And graciously descend to fulfill our earnest prayers** (俯垂丹恳).

**My understanding:**
The **Trigram Zhèn governs the Great Way** (处震卦而为大涂), **rightfully ranking first among all things.**
**Ascending Mount Tai, one surveys the world** (登泰山而小天下), **ever presiding over the foremost of all sacrifices.**
The **East is the origin of life** (东乃始生之方), **Tai the pivot of cosmic governance** (岱为管摄之地).
**Life begins facing east** (生必东首), **as ancient wisdom knew the proper orientation.**
**Qi arises from the eastern horizon** (气起东隅), **manifesting the Creator’s benevolent and nurturing intent** (造物全温厚之致).
Thus, **the Peak Emperor’s Virtue** (岳帝之德) **truly aligns with Heaven’s Benevolence** (实符天道之仁).
**Virtue seeks life** (德本好生), **and must absolve the guilty.**
**Benevolence aids all** (仁惟济众), **and surely extends boundless grace** (岂不广布於洪恩).
**He governs life’s passage** (既司出入之机) and **determines the measure of existence** (皇制短长之命).
**If one turns to the True Dao,** they **shall be spared death and granted rebirth** (必蒙释死以兴生).
**For the dead are most pitiful** (况死者人之所甚), **long lost in endless night.**
**While the living are most fortunate** (而生者人之所大), **longing to dwell in the radiant age** (欲愿长处於明时).
**Since life and death differ by merit and sin,** some **meet early demise** (享年有寿夭之异).
**Once severed from the mortal world,** they **suddenly perish** (迹已绝於人世, 遽至殂亡);
**Their spirits must journey to the Eastern Peak** (魂必往於岱宗), **yet their sins remain unexpiated** (未蠲罪累).
**Though they seek mercy and repentance,** they **cannot atone for past transgressions** (未能补过以涤除).

**My family, devoted to the Dao,** **lament the dead and mourn the departed** (奉道某家哀死悼亡), **reflecting on past and present.**
**The grave separates us forever** (念重泉之顿隔), **with no means to ascend.**
**Only the Marvelous Dao offers salvation** (惟妙道之可凭), **and I humbly seek transcendence** (仰干超度).
**Now, the path to the Central Altar is opened** (爰企升中之地广开), **the gate of deliverance stands ajar** (解厄之门于时).
**At high noon, the sun’s brilliance illuminates all** (阳景方中, 尽幽遐而徧照);
**The midday incense clock marks the hour** (昼漏停午), **the platform stands pure and unsoiled** (肃坛陛以无尘).
**I envision the saints’ arrival** (想众圣之来临), **and the ascent of mortal sincerity** (顾凡情之上达).
**May boundless blessings be bestowed** (大颁善利), **and the departed swiftly guided** (速度亡魂).
**With these words of noon, my heartfelt plea is now proclaimed** (临午词诚, 谨当宣奏).

**Proclamation of the Words:**
**As the text declares, the sorrow is profound and unbearable** (按如词旨, 深切悲

emerald jade, and numinous herbs** (自然生金液丹碧，芝英百靈),
Where **all true spirits gather** (眾真交會),
At this **incense censer** (在此香火爐前).

We **now vow** that the **celestial youths and jade maidens of the Ten Directions** (十方仙童玉女)

chunks.original_text: 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养玉清圣境元始天尊，十方道宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流亡人某。 冀洗多生之罪，获逢肆青之恩。 精诚潜感於帝心，曲垂慈悯； 祈祷遥闻於天听，俯赐哀矜。 知其往日之愚迷，许以兹辰之悔悟，命狱卒而释杻械，付司命而守形骸，早离幽滞之途，即达逍遥之境。 今故烧香，自归依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 臣闻紫户定录，开度长夜之门； 黄华荡形，炼成生身之质。 自元始之垂教，皆无量以度人。
chunks.translated_text:
With today’s midday Dao practice, we humbly request the assembled Daoists to light this first incense strand, praying that its fragrant smoke may ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the **Yuqing** [玉清] Holy Realm’s **Yuanshi Tianzun** [元始天尊], the Dao treasures of the Ten Directions.

We, the petitioners, **surrender our bodies, surrender our spirits, surrender our lives**, dedicating these merits to the departed soul of **[Name]**. May this merit cleanse the sins of countless past lives and earn the boundless grace of the **Sìqīng** [四清] [1].

With heartfelt sincerity, we silently move the **Emperor’s** [帝] heart to compassion; our prayers reach the heavens, beseeching mercy from above.

Knowing their past folly, we now implore this moment’s repentance—commanding the prison guards to release their chains, entrusting the **Sìmìng** [司命] to preserve their form. May they swiftly depart the path of darkness and attain the realm of **xiāoyáo** [逍遥].

Thus, we now burn this incense, **taking refuge in the Dao’s Great Saints’ supreme virtue**. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True and the Way.

As the teachings of **Yuanshi** declare, all are boundless in their salvation of beings.

---
[1] *Sìqīng* (四清): A Daoist triad of deities associated with purity and liberation (often linked to the **Yuqing** realm’s highest echelons). Retained here for conventional religious context.

chunks.original_text: 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养上清真境灵宝天尊，无上经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流亡过某等。 伏愿削除罪簿，罢对阴司，落灭恶根，脱踪苦趣，决山火不流之狱，推雷雨作解之恩。 身口意之愆尤，即从洗荡； 神祇鬼之摄制，共赐涵洪。 得逢起死之期，俾受更生之化，遵达往亡之迷路，鉴纳哀恳之诚心。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 臣闻执圆规而主人，太皞显司方之地； 不崇朝而徧雨，公羊纪触石之功。 固惟乔岳之灵，务锡庶民之福。 以今临午行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太清仙境降生天尊，十方师宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流亡过某等。 伏愿爱河静浪，苦海停波，曩因沦诱而不知，今日见闻而顿悟。 岳灵垂佑，浮飞爽於幽寥； 空洞生神，归混炁於梵辅。 永脱沉沦之厄，速蒙炼度之恩。 今故烧香，自归依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，三启，三礼。 具位臣某等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻会同五老，常听法於天尊； 光照九幽，因起请於法解。 深悯三涂之厄，尤悲五苦之艰。 考治罪魂，则有巨天力士； 峻严阴狱，则有执法神兵。 剑树刀山，绝筋折骨。 镬汤炉炭，粉质糜躯。 鸟啄蛇吞，犁耕锯解。 如斯苦恼，实可嗟吁。 幸上圣之大慈，与说因缘之起； 得真人之垂悯，俾知善行之修。 率因三业之缠，亦自六尘之染。 触情徇意，不知石火之难停； 受报罹殃，翻使夜扉之久闭。 尚许革心而向道，皆得解考以涤尤。 广造福田，必仗琅函之经典； 称扬圣号，无踰东极之天尊。 寔与断疑惑之根，俾获悟希夷之理。 醮官某重念哀方深於死没，罪恐积於生存，业网未除，法桥难上，须凭妙善，与涤前非。 爰祗肃於斋坛，式具严於褥礼。 名先嵩华，常骧首以遐瞻； 势面云亭，皇注心而恳祷。 丹舆绿辈，期飙忽以来临； 羽盖霓旌，想葳蕤而下降。 洞鉴精忱之意，宏开拔度之门。 允同救苦之上真，随声应感； 用济沉沦之坠魄，委顺成形。 早逢南极之注生，兼得北都之部卫，渐阶仙路，不滞迷途，普使存亡，均谐利乐。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来临午行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。

At this moment, when the sun is at its zenith, we perform the Dao/Way’s rites, and humbly request that the assembled **Sìqīng** [四清] bear this two-pinched incense aloft. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the **Shàngqīng** [上清] True Realm’s **Língbǎo Tiānzūn** [灵宝天尊], the peerless **jīngbǎo** [经宝].

We now dedicate our bodies, our spirits, and our lives—may this merit return to our departed ancestors and wayward souls. We earnestly pray for the erasure of their sinful records, the cessation of their **yīnsī** [阴司] reckonings, the extinguishing of their evil roots, and liberation from the suffering of their past lives. May they escape the **Shānhuǒ** [山火] prison’s unyielding bonds and be granted the mercy of the **Leiyǔ** [雷雨] deliverance.

Their transgressions of body, speech, and mind shall be cleansed; the **shénqí guǐ** [神祇鬼] who ensnare them shall be commanded to yield to the **Hánhóng** [涵洪] grace. May they meet the hour of resurrection, receive the transformation of rebirth, and follow the path of the lost to their wandering’s end, while witnessing our heartfelt sincerity.

Now we burn this incense, **taking refuge in the Dao’s Great Saints’ supreme virtue**. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True and the Way.

We have heard: with the **yuán guī** [圆规] in hand, the **Tàihào** [太皞] presides over the square of the **Fāngzhě** [司方] realm; without waiting for dawn, the **Gōngyáng** [公羊] records the **Chùshí** [触石] merit. Indeed, the sacred peaks’ spirits strive to bestow blessings upon all mortals.

At this moment, when the sun is at its zenith, we perform the Dao/Way’s rites, and humbly request that the assembled **Sìqīng** [四清] bear this three-pinched incense aloft. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the **Tàiqīng** [太清] Celestial Realm’s **Jiàngshēng Tiānzūn** [降生天尊], the Ten Directions’ **Shībǎo** [师宝].

We now dedicate our bodies, our spirits, and our lives—may this merit return to our departed ancestors and wayward souls. We earnestly pray for the **Àihé** [爱河]’s stilling waves and the **Kǔhǎi** [苦海]’s ceasing tides; that they, once deceived and unaware, now hear and instantly awaken.

The sacred peaks’ spirits descend their grace—may their souls soar free in the boundless void. The **Kōngdòng** [空洞] gives birth to spirits, merging their **Zhuī** [炁] essence with the **Fànfǔ** [梵辅] realm. Ever freed from the depths of suffering, swiftly granted the mercy of **Liàndù** [炼度].

Now we burn this incense, **taking refuge in the Dao’s Great Saints’ supreme virtue**. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend to the formless, harmonizing with the True and the Way.

**Chànyuán** [忏方], three invocations, three obeisances.

Your humble servants of the **Jùwèi** [具位] ranks, with utmost sincerity, now prostrate ourselves before the **Xūwú Zìrán Jīnquè Qībǎo Shàngdì** [虚无自然金阙七宝上帝], the **Dōnggōng Jiàozhǔ Tàiyǎ Jiùkǔ Tiānzūn** [东宫教主太乙救苦天尊], the **Chuánjīng Yǎnjiào Lìdài Shīzhēn** [传经演教历代师真], the **Dōngyuè Tàishān Tiānqí Rénshèng Dì** [东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝], the **Shúmíng Huánghòu** [淑明皇后], the **Tàizǐ Guìfēi** [太子贵妃], the **Diànshàng Bǐnglíng Gōng** [殿上炳灵公], the **Xīqí Língwáng** [西齐灵王], the **Yuèxià Wénwǔ Kǎoxiào** [岳下文武考校], all **Yīqiè Cáoliáo** [一切曹僚], the **Sānjiè Yìnggǎn** [三界应感], and all **Yīqiè Zhēnlíng** [一切真灵].

May they all behold the vast mercy and descend to illuminate our humble supplications.

We have heard: when the **Wèitóng** [会同] gathers the Five Elders, the **Tiānzūn** [天尊] always listens to the Law; when the **Guāngzhào Jiǔyōu** [光照九幽] shines upon the Nine Depths, the **Fǎjiě** [法解] arises through prayerful invocation.

Deeply moved by the suffering of the **Sāntú** [三涂], we are especially grieved by the hardships of the **Wǔkǔ** [五苦]. To examine and punish the guilty spirits, there are the **Jùtiān Lìshì** [巨天力士]; to enforce the strict laws of the **Yīnyù** [阴狱], there are the **Zhífǎ Shénbīng** [执法神兵].

The **Jiànshù Dāoshān** [剑树刀山] sever sinews and shatter bones; the **Liàngtāng Lúitàn** [镬汤炉炭] reduce flesh to ash. The **Niǎozhuó Shéyīn** [鸟啄蛇吞] and the **Lígēng Jùjiě** [犁耕锯解] bring torment beyond measure. Such suffering is truly lamentable.

Fortunately, the **Shàngshèng** [上圣]’s boundless compassion teaches the causes of their plight; the **Zhēnrén** [真人]’s pity allows them to know the path of virtuous conduct.

Though bound by the **Sānyè** [三业] and stained by the **Liùchén** [六尘], they follow their desires, unaware that the **Shíhuǒ** [石火] moment cannot be halted. In receiving retribution and calamity, they only prolong the **Yèfēi** [夜扉]’s endless closure.

Yet even now, they may reform their hearts and turn toward the Dao, all granted deliverance from judgment and purification from sin.

To cultivate vast fields of merit, they must rely on the **Lánghán** [琅函] scriptures; to exalt the **Shènghào** [圣号], none surpass the **Dōngjí** [东极] **Tiānzūn** [天尊].

Truly, this clears the roots of doubt and allows them to grasp the **Xīyí** [希夷] mysteries.

Your humble servant, **Dìngguān** [醮官], in deep reflection, fears that the **Àifāng** [哀方] suffer more in death than in life, their sins accumulating even in their brief existence. The **Yèwǎng** [业网] remains unbroken, and the **Fǎqiáo** [法桥] is yet unreached. They must now depend on the **Miàoshàn** [妙善] to purge their past transgressions.

Thus, we solemnly prepare the **Zhāi tán** [斋坛], and with utmost reverence, perform the **Rùlǐ** [褥礼] rites.

Named **Xiānshēng** [先嵩], we ever raise our heads to gaze afar; our faces turn toward the **Yúntíng** [云亭], our hearts yearning for divine compassion.

The **Dānyú** [丹舆] and **Lǜbèi** [绿辈] await the swift arrival of the **Biāoxū** [飙忽]; the **Yǔgài** [羽盖] and **Níqíng** [霓旌] hope for the descending **Wēirúi** [葳蕤].

May they discern our sincere devotion and open wide the gates of deliverance. May the **Jiùkǔ Shàngzhēn** [救苦上真] respond in kind; may the **Zhìchuí** [坠魄] souls, once submerged, now submit and take form.

Swiftly may they meet the **Nánjí** [南极]’s **Zhùshēng** [注生], and also gain the **Běidū** [北都]’s **Bùwèi** [部卫]. Gradually ascending the **Xiānlù** [仙路], they shall not stray from the path, and all shall be granted equal harmony in life and death.

Above, we honor the **Tiānzūn** [天尊]’s vast mercy; below, we fulfill our servants’ **Guīmìng** [皈命] sincerity. Thus we humbly report.

**Shíèr yuàn** [十二愿]. **Fùlú** [复炉].

We now solemnly command the **Xiāngguān Shǐzhě** [香官使者], the **Zuǒyòu Lónghǔ Jūn** [左右龙虎君], and the **Shìxiāng Zhūlǐngguān** [侍香诸灵官], to bring us to the place where we once performed the Dao/Way’s rites at noon. There, **Jīnyè Dānbì** [金液丹碧] and **Zhīyīng Bǎilíng** [芝英百灵] shall naturally arise, and all **Zhōngzhēn** [众真] shall gather at this incense altar.

May the **Shífāng Xiānróng Yùnǚ** [十方仙童玉女] attend to the **Lántián** [兰烟], swiftly conveying our servants’ sincere supplications to the **Zhìxīng Wújí Dàdào** [至真无极大道] and the **Hàotiān Yùhuáng Shàngdì** [昊天玉皇上帝] before the **Yuè** [御].

**Chūtáng sòng** [出堂颂]. **Chūhù** [出户].

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之八十二竟 道门科范大全集卷之八十三 东岳济度拜章大醮仪 晚朝行道 法事升坛如式。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星高耀，瑞气飞浮。 元始集神，天地交周。 玉符宝节，啸命微幽。 掷火扬威，奸凶无留。 万魔振伏，纷葩却消。 摧怪灭恶，道炁周流。 神光照夜，阴翳俱收。 万神降格，扇景乘飙。 群生咸遂，惠徧神州，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今静夜行道，谨奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 咸望洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻封取金泥，告代尚存於王者； 文传玉册，定寿寔统於人伦。 上连空洞之天，既称仙境； 下制死生之命，籍备阴官。 顾惟近逝之亡魂，必有未消之黑簿。 罪虽未取，当议罪於轻重浅深； 志苟深惩，必许容於悲哀忏悔。 咸与维新之路，俾知更始之期。 矧度生度命之天尊，皆本东居而阐化； 在唱恭唱诺之司马，亦因东向以诵章。 审知岳帝之仁，不拒凡夫之请。 醮官某等悼隙驹之易逝，便隔幽明； 惧气马之不良，常趋险路。 生前造罪，曾违先觉之心； 没后罹殃，遂受无量之苦。 堕地狱而必怀痛悔，在人世而当与追修。 庶能格帝之心，或有回天之怒，业根罪网，雾卷冰消，善果福田，云行雨施。 三元育质，复闻太一之执符； 八景具神，又得帝君之品命。 今则严更报漏，初传甲夜之筹； 皎月当天，正廓层空之景。 宜伸控告，用致斋诚，静夜词诚，谨当宣奏。 宣词。 按如词言，深切哀悯。 臣闻非元始符命，不足以伸迁拔之阶； 非玉帝唱名，不足以造登仙之境。 须凭至道，用济亡魂，以无为而革有为之非，以无形而去有形之累，准冲科而启渎，冀仙驭以齐临，更摅哀痛之情，仰望矜怜之造。 以今落景行道，请法众等运兹初捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养玉清圣境元始天尊，十方道宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈、命，以是功德，归流醮官某家，合门眷聚，举室尊卑。 过往蒙休，早超登於仙路； 见存获庆，各终享於耆年。 皓首厉眉，表柱无暂於辽鹤； 鲐背倪齿，支床必取於灵龟。 黄箓书削死之文，青华注增年之籍，验天锡难老之瑞，蔑日昊大耋之嗟。 今故烧香，自皈依道尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 臣闻侍仙玉郎，生神首开於囊锦； 长生大圣，度人先起於东方。 以今夕景行道，请法众等运兹二捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养上清真境灵宝天尊，无上经宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流醮官某家二门先祖，七世高曾。 伏愿并乘金简之文，速达玉京之路。 超踪三界，得保举於魔王；

**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Eighty-Two Complete**
**Dao/Way Gate Ritual Standards Complete Collection, Volume Eighty-Three**
**Eastern Peak Rescue and Salvation Petitionary Great Ritual Ceremony**
**Evening Dao/Way Practice**

The ritual proceedings ascend the platform as prescribed.
Each pays homage to the Master in accordance with the Dao/Way.

**Proclaim the Sacred Protective Incantations.**
The Five Stars shine resplendent, auspicious *qi* ascends in flight.
The Primordial Sovereign gathers the spirits; Heaven and Earth complete their cycles.
Jade talismans and sacred seals resound with imperious command to the hidden realms.
Flames are cast forth in display of might—evil and malevolent forces shall not linger.
Ten thousand demons submit in trembling; chaotic passions dissolve.
Monstrous evils are crushed, malevolence extinguished—Dao/Way *qi* circulates universally.
Divine radiance illuminates the night; all obscurity is dispelled.
Ten thousand spirits descend in order, their banners borne on the wind.
All living beings prosper; divine blessings pervade the land, harmonizing with the True Dao/Way.

**Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times.**
**Ignite the incense.**

To the **Supreme Three Heavens’ Primordial Sovereign of the Three *Qi*** [三炁], **Supreme Dao/Way Lord**, **Supreme Venerable Lord Laozi**—
We now summon from within our bodies the **Three Five Officials of Merit**, the **Left and Right Official Envoys**, the **Left and Right Incense-Bearers**, the **Relay Dragon Cavalry Clerks**, the **Incense-Serving Golden Boys**, the **Speech-Conveying Scattered-Flower Jade Girls**, the **Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans**, and the **Direct-Sun Incense Officials**—**thirty-six in total**—to emerge.

Those who emerge shall don resplendent attire and ceremonial insignia, their headgear adorned with trailing ribbons.
The **Mysterious Platform’s Earth and Domain Spirits** are hereby opened.

Now, in this quiet night of Dao/Way practice, we humbly present our intentions.
All sincere supplications have been recorded and reported.
May the **Supreme Dao/Way’s Ten Directions’ True *Qi*** and **Sacred Treasure Auspicious Light** descend upon us, flowing into our bodies,
So that our petitions may swiftly reach the **Supreme Dao/Way of the Boundless**, the **Jade Gate Celestial Sovereign of the High Heaven**.

**Request the proclamation of the ritual rank.**

We, the officials of rank **[具位臣某等]**, with utmost sincerity, now humbly present our supplications to:
The **Void-Natural Golden Gate Seven-Treasures Celestial Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Palace Preceptor, Great Unity Savior of Suffering, Heavenly Venerable of the Jade Tripod**,
The **Transmitting Scriptures and Teaching Ancestral Masters of All Generations**,
The **Eastern Peak Tai Mountain, Heavenly Equal and Benevolent Holy Emperor**,
The **Virtuous and Illuminating Empress**,
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort**,
The **Splendid-Spirit Official of the Hall**,
The **Western Qi Spirit King**,
The **Literary and Martial Examiners Beneath the Peak**,
All officials and attendants,
The **Three Realms of Responsive Spirits**,
All **True Spirits and Sacred Beings**.

May they all behold the vast mercy and deign to reveal the crimson sincerity.

We have heard:
*"Sealing the golden mud"*—this duty remains with the sovereign;
*"The jade scroll’s transmission"*—this decree governs the order of humanity.
Above, it connects with the empty void of Heaven, thus called the **Celestial Realm of the Immortals**;
Below, it governs life and death, serving as the **Yin Officials’ registry**.

Yet we reflect upon the recently departed souls—
Their **black ledgers** of sins may yet remain unexpunged.
Though crimes are not yet recorded, their severity must be weighed in lightness and depth;
Though intentions seek severe punishment, they must be allowed room for **repentance in sorrow**.

All may thus tread the path of renewal, knowing the period of transformation.

Moreover, the **Heavenly Venerable of Rescue and Life**—
All originate from the **Eastern Residence** to enlighten;
Even the **Chanting Officials of Reverence and Compliance**—
Follow the **Eastern Direction** in reciting their hymns.

We know the **Peak Emperor’s benevolence** does not reject the pleas of mortals.

The ritual officials, grieving the swift passage of life like a galloping steed—
Already separated from the living by the veil of death;
Fearful of the **unwholesome *qi* of the horse**, ever drawn to perilous paths—
In life, they violated the **Awakened Ones’ intentions**;
In death, they suffer boundless torment.
Falling into Hell, they must harbor pain and regret;
In the human world, they should strive for **posthumous rectification**.

Thus may they move the **Emperor’s heart**, or even turn his **wrathful *qi**—
The roots of karma and the nets of sin shall dissolve like mist and ice;
The fruits of virtue and fields of blessing shall unfold like clouds and rain.

The **Three Primordials** nurture their essence—
Now they hear the **Great Unity’s talisman-bearer**;
The **Eight Auspicious Scenes** manifest their spirits—
Again, they receive the **Emperor’s decree of rank**.

Now, with the **midnight watch** just struck and the **first hour’s tally** announced,
The **bright moon** hangs high, framing the boundless sky—
It is fitting to **present our grievances**,
To offer our **sincere fasting words**,
And solemnly **proclaim our petitions**.

**Proclamation of Words:**
As the words declare, with profound pity and sorrow—
We have heard:
*"Without the Primordial Sovereign’s talismans and decrees, one cannot ascend the stages of transcendence and elevation;
Without the Jade Emperor’s proclamation of names, one cannot attain the realm of immortality."*

We must rely on the **Supreme Dao/Way** to rescue the lost souls,
Transforming the **artificial into the natural**, the **formed into the formless**,
Following the **Direct Path’s regulations** to present our petitions,
Hoping the **Celestial Chariot** may swiftly arrive,
Further revealing our **grief and sorrow**, and beseeching **compassionate mercy**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,
We request the assembled ritualists to take this **first incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Pure Celestial Sacred Realm’s Primordial Sovereign** and the **Ten Directions’ Dao/Way Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **ritual official’s household**, all kin and dependents—
May those who have passed receive early elevation to the **Path of the Immortals**;
May the living enjoy longevity and blessings, reaching **venerable old age**.
With **snow-white hair and furrowed brows**, they shall stand as pillars, never faltering like the **distant crane**;
With **hunched backs and protruding teeth**, they shall lean on their staffs, as sturdy as the **sacred tortoise**.
The **Yellow Register** shall erase the records of death;
The **Green Flower** shall inscribe the ledgers of extended years.
The **Heavenly Bestowal** shall grant the **rare blessing of non-aging**,
And the **Great Sovereign’s lament** shall be silenced.

Now, we burn this incense in **sincere devotion to the Dao/Way’s Great Saints and True Virtues**.

After attaining the Dao/Way, one ascends to the **Formless**,
And harmonizes with the **True Dao/Way**.

We have heard:
*"The Jade Boy Attending the Immortals"*—
His divine origin first unfolded in the **embroidered brocade**;
*"The Great Saint of Longevity"*—
First rescued mortals from the **Eastern Quarter**.

Now, as the evening’s light fades and the Dao/Way practice begins,
We request the assembled ritualists to take this **second incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
To offer worship to the **Most High Pure Realm’s Sacred Treasure Sovereign** and the **Supreme Scriptural Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **ritual official’s two ancestral gates and seven generations of forefathers**.

May they swiftly ascend the **Golden Tablet’s path** to the **Jade Capital**,
Transcending the **Three Realms**, and be **commended by the Demon King**.

chunks.original_text: 升名九宫，遂朝谒於大帝。 赴龙门之受会，获鸟母之督仙，无复冢讼之缠绵，蔑有子孙之殃注。 今故烧香，自皈依经尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 臣闻九炼更生，道实崇於济死； 十方无极，功莫大於度人。 以今夕景行道，请法众等运兹三捻上香，愿此香烟，腾空径上，供养太清仙境降生天尊，十方师宝。 臣等皈身、皈神、皈命，以是功德，归流旁荐五姓，男女孤魂，四生异类。 枯骸朽骨，未离幽滞之乡； 戴角披毛，不免鞭策之苦。 冥漠魍魉，端蠕蛸蛲，丧精爽而全迷，抱血气而无识。 或不充於口腹，陨落沟渠； 或横被於干戈，膏濡草泽。 崖颠谷坠，水溺火焚，丧身圄犴之中，绝命道途之侧，皆罹冤枉之酷，未逢荐度之缘，出没三途，轮回六趣。 伏愿并乘道力，悉赖真慈。 顿舍前日之愚迷，不为陷坠； 得遇今宵之接引，咸遂超升。 脱身魑魅之中，蜕迹尘沙之地，尽复生於人类，咸得听於法音。 今故烧香，自皈依师尊大圣众至真之德。 得道之后，升入无形，和与道合真。 忏方，三启，三礼。 具位臣某等，谨重诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真仙。 咸望洪慈，俯昭丹恳。 臣闻管辖终年，自许登山而治鬼； 处厚食禄，亦为司命之策名。 盖三十六空洞之天，真灵必会； 况七十二封禅之主，礼制尤崇。 既兼统於幽冥，寔专司於祸福。 虽书注於生籍，必先制於亡魂。 考过计功，厥有正邪之异； 升名落简，岂无运速之殊。 苟非涤虑以洗心，讵可赎愆而补过。 醮官某家，兴哀痛首，陨泪伤心。 画像空存，岂见丁宁之语； 奠觞虽举，尤深惨切之情。 欢娱顿阻於闺门，拘录方归於岳府。 无文不度，式修可度之缘； 无文不生，愿结资生之果。 欲请嘱於讵士，难效前人； 求会遇於少年，岂复同学。 惟诵香林之妙法，且传碧落之空歌。 建立净坛，灯荧煌而破暗； 致恭灵宝，香馥郁以腾空。 庶殚悃悃之诚，径达嵓嵓之岭。 伏愿霁冰霜於夜府，沛雨露於幽扃。 五炼陶镕，俾得随於生化； 万罪荡释，仍复睹於光明。 死者有知，得谐顿悟； 生者怀感，愈切皈依。 溥及含情，均蒙济度。 上明天尊大慈之泽，下副臣等皈命之诚，谨启以闻。 十二愿。 复炉。 谨摄香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令臣向来静夜行道之所，自然生金液丹碧，芝英百灵，众真交会，在此香火炉前。 当愿十方仙童玉女，接侍兰烟，传臣向来所启之诚，速达径御至真无极大道、昊天玉皇上帝御前。 出堂颂。 出户。
chunks.translated_text:
Ascend in name to the **Nine Palaces**,
And proceed to pay homage at the **Great Sovereign**.

Hasten to the **Dragon Gate** to receive the assembly,
And gain the **Bird Mother’s** guidance as a **Sacred Treasure Sovereign**,
No longer entangled in **grave disputes**,
Nor subject to the calamities of descendants.

Now, through this incense offering,
We **take refuge** in the **Supreme Teacher’s** **Great Saintly Assembly’s** **Most True Virtue/Power**.
Obtaining the Dao/Way thereafter,
We enter the **Formless Realm** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

I have heard that the **Nine Refining Transformations** truly **revive the dead**,
And that **Ten Directions without limit** hold no greater merit than **saving beings**.

Through tonight’s **auspicious Dao/Way practice**,
We request the ritual assembly to present this **third incense offering**,
May this incense smoke ascend directly to the heavens,
And worship the **Supreme Pure Sacred Treasure Sovereign of the Celestial Realm** and the **Ten-Directional Teacher Treasures**.

We, the servants, **take refuge in body, spirit, and life**,
And dedicate these merits to the **five surnames of the departed**,
Male and female lonely spirits, and the **four types of sentient beings**.
Withered corpses and decayed bones,
Yet to leave the **land of darkness and stagnation**;
Wearing horns and bearing fur,
Not spared from the **whips and lashes of suffering**.

In the **dim underworld**, where **demons and spirits** lurk,
Squirming and writhing like **serpents and maggots**,
They lose their **vital essence** and remain utterly confused,
Clinging to **blood and qi** yet lacking awareness.
Some starve in **hunger and thirst**,
Falling into **ravines and ditches**;
Others perish in **warfare and conflict**,
Their bodies **rotting in grass and marshes**.

Cliffs and valleys, drowning in water or burning in flames,
Imprisoned in **jails and cages**,
Or dying by the **roadside**—
All suffer **harsh wrongs**,
Yet none encounter the **merit of commendation and guidance**,
Wandering the **Three Paths**, cycling through the **Six Realms of Rebirth**.

Humbly, we pray to **ride upon the Dao’s power**,
And **rely entirely on the True Compassion**.
To **abandon past ignorance** and avoid **falling into error**,
And to **meet tonight’s guidance**,
That all may swiftly **transcend and ascend**.

Freeing ourselves from **demonic spirits’** clutches,
Shedding our **traces in dust and sand**,
We all return to birth as **human beings**,
And hear the **lawful sounds** of the **Dharma**.

Now, through this incense offering,
We **take refuge** in the **Supreme Teacher’s** **Great Saintly Assembly’s** **Most True Virtue/Power**.
Obtaining the Dao/Way thereafter,
We enter the **Formless Realm** and harmonize with the **True Dao/Way**.

**Repentance of the Ten Directions**,
Three invocations, three obeisances.
The humble servants, **[names omitted]**, sincerely and earnestly present this plea:

To the **Natural Void Supreme Golden Gate Seven-Treasured Sovereign**,
The **Eastern Palace Master, the Great Sovereign of the Celestial Way**,
The **Sutra-Transmitting and Teaching Sovereigns of Past Ages**,
The **Eastern Peak, Grand Imperial Sovereign of the Jade Equilibrium**,
The **Virtuous and Benevolent Empress**,
The **Crown Prince and Noble Consort**,
The **Illuminating Spirit Official of the Hall**,
The **Spirit King of the Western Equilibrium**,
And all **clerks and officials** beneath the **Eastern Peak**,
The **Three Realms’** responsive beings,
And all **True Immortals**.

May they **hear our earnest prayers** and **reveal their compassion**.
I have heard that even those **who govern the year**,
Granting **ascension to the mountain** to **subdue demons**,
And those **who enjoy abundant food and salary**,
Yet still **record the dead’s names** as **officials of life**—
For the **thirty-six Formless Void Sovereigns**,
The **True Spirits** must surely gather;
And how much more so for the **seventy-two Sovereigns of the Seal Offerings**,
Whose rites are **especially esteemed**!

They **oversee the underworld**,
And **specialize in managing calamities and blessings**.
Though their names are **registered in the living ledgers**,
They must first **judge the departed spirits**.
Examining deeds and calculating merits,
There is **distinction between righteousness and wrongdoing**;
Ascending names or **falling into the tablets**,
How could there be no **differences in fate’s speed**?

If not for **purifying the mind** to **cleanse the heart**,
How could **expiation of sins** and **repairing past faults** be possible?

The **ritual official’s household**,
Now **awakening grief and sorrow**,
**Shedding tears** and **aching in the heart**,
With **painted images** yet **unseen**,
No **gentle admonition** heard;
Though **offerings are made**,
The **emotion is still deeply sorrowful**.

Joy is **suddenly cut off** at the **gates of the home**,
And **arrest and return** are **only now** sent to the **Eastern Peak’s office**.

Without **rites**, none can be **guided**—
May we **fulfill the merit of guidance**;
Without **rites**, none can **ascend**—
May we **earn the fruit of rebirth**.

To request **entrustment** from **the departed**,
It is **difficult to match past examples**;
To **seek guidance** in **youthful years**,
How could we **again** be **fellow students**?

Only in reciting the **wondrous methods of the Incense Forest**,
And passing on the **Void Songs of the Verdant Abyss**,
Shall we **establish a Pure Altar**,
With **lamps blazing** to **dispel darkness**;
And **devote ourselves to the Sacred Treasure Sovereign**,
With **fragrant incense** ascending to the heavens.

May our **sincere sincerity** be **fully exhausted**,
And our prayers **directly reach the lofty peaks**.

Humbly, we pray that the **frost and ice of the night office may melt**,
And that **rain and dew** may **pour upon the dark gates**.

Through **five refining transformations**,
May they be **molded anew** in **rebirth**;
With **all sins cleansed and released**,
May they **once more** behold **the light of clarity**.

The departed, if they **have awareness**,
Shall **harmonize with sudden enlightenment**;
The living, filled with **gratitude**,
Shall **ever more deeply take refuge**.

Extending **universal compassion**,
All shall **be saved and guided**.

Above, we **fulfill** the **Supreme Sovereign’s** **Great Compassion**,
Below, we **align** with our servants’ **sincere refuge in life**,
And humbly submit this plea.

**Twelve Vows** completed.
**Return to the altar**.

The humble **incense officials and messengers**,
The **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Sovereigns**,
And all **attendant spirit officials**,
Shall now **command** that in the **servant’s** past **quiet nights of Dao/Way practice**,
**Golden Elixir and Azure Jade** shall naturally **generate**,
Along with **mushrooms, herbs, and myriad spirits**,
And the **gathering of all True Ones**,
At this **incense fire altar**.

May the **Ten-Directional Immortal Children and Jade Maidens**,
**Attend and escort the fragrant incense**,
And **transmit** the **servant’s** past **sincere pleas**,
Swiftly **reaching** the **Supreme, Limitless Great Dao/Way**,
Before the **Heavenly Jade Emperor**.

**Praise outside the hall**.
**Praise outside the door**.

chunks.original_text: 道门科范大全集卷之八十三竟 道门科范大全集卷之八十四 广成先生杜光庭删 东岳济度拜章大醮仪 散坛行道 法事升坛如常。 各礼师存念如法。 宣卫灵咒。 五星列照，焕明五方。 水星却灾，木德致昌。 荧惑消祸，太白辟兵。 镇星四据，家国利亨。 名刊玉简，字录帝房。 乘飙散景，飞腾太空。 出入冥无，游宴十方。 五云浮盖，招神摄风。 役使万灵，上卫仙翕，与道合真。 鸣法鼓二十四通。 发炉。 无上三天玄元始三炁，太上道君，太上老君，召出臣身中三五功曹，左右官使者，左右捧香，驿龙骑吏，侍香金童，传言散花玉女，五帝直符，直日香官，合三十六人出。 出者严装显服，冠带垂缨，关启玄坛土地，方域神真。 臣今静夜行道，谨奏为宣意，其诸情悃，已录告闻，愿得太上十方至真道炁，灵宝瑞光下降，流入臣身中，令臣所启，速达径御太上无极大道、昊天金阙玉皇上帝御前。 请称法位。 具位臣某等，谨虔诚上启，虚无自然金阙七宝上帝，东宫教主太乙救苦天尊，传经演教历代师真，东岳泰山天齐仁圣帝，淑明皇后，太子贵妃，殿上炳灵公，西齐灵王，岳下文武考校，一切曹僚，三界应感，一切真灵。 臣闻至岱而柴巡，狩尚钦於虞帝； 卜郊而望命，祀尤敬於鲁邦。
